title: European Researchers' Night and Researchers at Schools 2026-2027
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing public engagement with research through the organization of the European Researchers' Night and the Researchers at Schools initiative. Key research topics include promoting science communication, increasing accessibility to STEAM fields for young audiences, and fostering interactions between researchers and students to address societal challenges. The initiative aims to improve outreach, visibility, and inclusiveness in science, particularly targeting underrepresented groups in research activities.

title: EIC Accelerator 2025 - Short application
summary_text: The EIC Accelerator focuses on supporting high-impact innovations, particularly in 'deep tech' that stem from scientific discoveries or technological breakthroughs. It aims to assist companies, especially SMEs and start-ups, in scaling up these innovations, which often require significant funding and have longer timeframes for returns. The program encourages proposals across various fields of technology, including predefined areas of emerging and strategic technologies.

title: ERC PROOF OF CONCEPT GRANTS
summary_text: The ERC Proof of Concept Grants focus on exploring the commercial and social innovation potential of research funded by the European Research Council (ERC). The grants are intended for Principal Investigators to develop and implement projects that leverage their ERC-funded research, facilitating the transition from academic findings to practical applications.

title: EIC STEP Scale Up
summary_text: The EIC STEP Scale Up call focuses on supporting ambitious scale-up companies, particularly in critical technology areas such as semiconductor and quantum technologies. It aims to provide significant equity investments ranging from EUR 10 to EUR 30 million to accelerate the development and market launch of innovative solutions, thereby enhancing Europe's technological capabilities and value chains. The initiative is part of the Strategic Technologies for Europe Platform (STEP) and seeks to catalyze larger funding rounds to foster disruptive innovations across Europe.

title: Digital flight rules
summary_text: The research focuses on the development of "digital flight rules" to enhance the integration of both crewed and uncrewed aircraft within controlled airspace, building on previous SESAR research. Key areas include the evolution of ICAO Annex II to incorporate cooperative surveillance systems for collision avoidance, the adaptation of air traffic management frameworks to support highly automated environments, and the assessment of human performance implications for pilots and air traffic controllers in this new operational context.

title: ATM impact on climate change
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing research related to the impact of aviation on climate change, specifically addressing non-CO2 emissions and their environmental effects. Key research topics include the assessment of noise and air quality pollutants from air traffic management (ATM), the physics of the atmosphere concerning extreme weather events, the development of multi-scale air quality systems for evaluating aircraft emissions, and the creation of environmental performance-monitoring tools for new aircraft technologies. Additionally, the call emphasizes the need for innovative metrics for environmental impact assessment, integrated platforms for forecasting atmospheric hazards, and enhanced methodologies for detecting and analyzing aviation-induced contrails.

title: Investigate quantum sensing and computing applied to ATM
summary_text: The research topics focus on the application of quantum computing and sensing in air traffic management (ATM), emphasizing trajectory and traffic flow optimization, emergency management, separation management, and climate modeling. Additionally, the call addresses the need for post-quantum cryptography to secure ATM communications against potential quantum threats, as well as exploring quantum sensing technologies for enhanced navigation and timing solutions in aviation. Overall, the aim is to leverage quantum technologies to improve efficiency, safety, and security in ATM operations.

title: Fundamental research for other topics
summary_text: The grant call focuses on fundamental research in air traffic management (ATM) and U-space, emphasizing innovative ideas and emerging technologies at the initial stages of development (TRL0). Key research topics include trajectory optimization, data volume management, automation through human-machine teaming, dynamic airspace configuration, and the evolving role of human operators in both civil and military contexts. Proposals should align with the ATM Master Plan's vision and contribute to its five transformation levers, enhancing the efficiency and safety of future air traffic systems.

title: Integration of the next generation aircraft for zero/low emission aviation
summary_text: The key research topics focus on the integration of next-generation aircraft for zero/low emission aviation, specifically hydrogen, battery-electric, and hybrid-electric powered aircraft. This includes assessing the impact of these aircraft on air traffic management (ATM) systems, airport operations, and traffic demand, as well as developing trajectory-based operations and new ATM concepts that support sustainability. Additionally, the research aims to evaluate the environmental impacts, regulatory adaptations, and necessary safety standards to accommodate the evolving fleet and ensure efficient airspace management by 2035 and beyond.

title: Research to help shape the future regulatory framework for a DES
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing research in several key areas related to the future regulatory framework for a Digital European Sky. Key topics include the evolution of human operator roles in air traffic management (ATM) amidst increasing automation, the assessment of human operator fatigue and its impact on performance, the development of harmonized airspace classification across Europe, and the certification of novel ATM systems, both AI-based and non-AI-based. Additionally, the call emphasizes the need for methodologies to enhance safety, security, and resilience in ATM, as well as the application of data analytics for safety management and the exploration of climate-driven route charging mechanisms.

title: Transition towards high performance of air-ground connectivity (multilink)
summary_text: The key research topics focus on advancing hyper-connected air traffic management (ATM) through the development of L-band digital aeronautical communications systems (LDACS) and integrating non-safety-approved commercial communication networks for safety-critical aviation data. Additionally, the research aims to enhance aircraft as sensors by utilizing onboard meteorological data to improve flight safety and efficiency, while also addressing the development of digital voice communication capabilities to replace traditional VHF radio systems. Other areas of focus include the integration of advanced sensing technologies for weather and obstacle detection, as well as the fusion of aircraft data with ground-based systems for improved environmental predictions and operational safety.

title: Transformation to trajectory-based operations
summary_text: The key research topics focus on the development and integration of advanced flight management systems (FMS), electronic flight bags (EFB), and flight operations center (FOC) functionalities to optimize trajectory management in air traffic control. This includes enhancing trajectory-based operations (TBO), improving network trajectory synchronization, and creating dynamic route availability documents. Additionally, the research aims to facilitate real-time impact assessments of air traffic clearances, support unconstrained desired trajectories, and enhance civil-military collaboration in flight planning.

title: Next generation ATS platform for airport operations
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing next-generation airport platforms through several key research topics, including the integration of artificial intelligence (AI) for operational efficiency, enhancing cyber-resilience and cybersecurity measures, and developing sustainable airport solutions to minimize environmental impacts. Additional areas of interest include optimizing runway throughput, improving human-machine collaboration, and implementing integrated air/ground trajectory management systems to enhance safety and efficiency in airport operations. The research aims to leverage innovative technologies and data-sharing models to support both civil and military aviation needs while ensuring a high level of automation and environmental sustainability.

title: Next generation ATS platforms for en-route and TMA operations
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing the next generation of Air Traffic Control (ATC) platforms, emphasizing the integration of artificial intelligence, cyber-resilience, and automation to enhance air traffic management. Key research topics include the development of eco-efficient operational practices, dynamic airspace management, and advanced trajectory optimization to reduce aviation's environmental impact, alongside improving human-machine collaboration and automated clearance processes. Additionally, the call addresses the need for enhanced cybersecurity measures and the integration of sustainable aviation technologies within the ATC framework.

title: Airborne capabilities for supporting reducing ATM environmental footprint
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing environmentally sustainable aviation through several key research areas. These include the development of airborne capabilities for reducing the environmental footprint of air traffic management (ATM), such as wake energy retrieval (WER) and environmentally driven trajectory optimization that considers CO2 and non-CO2 emissions. Additionally, the call emphasizes the exploration of geometric altimetry to enhance flight safety and efficiency, as well as the integration of advanced flight management systems to optimize aircraft operations in terminal maneuvering areas while minimizing noise and environmental impact.

title: Increased automation assistance for the pilot for ATM tasks
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing single pilot operations (SiPO) and enhancing automation in air traffic management (ATM) tasks. Key research topics include the development of new sensors and avionics to support SiPO, improving flight-deck human-machine interfaces (HMI), and integrating artificial intelligence (AI) to assist pilots in high-workload situations. Additionally, the call emphasizes the need for advanced on-board systems and procedures to facilitate highly automated ATM operations, including the automation of QNH transmission between ground systems and aircraft.

title: Highly automated ATM for all airspace users
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing highly automated air traffic management (ATM) systems for all airspace users, emphasizing the development of performance-based communication, navigation, and surveillance (CNS) technologies. Key research topics include the creation of non-cooperative sensors for detect and avoid (DAA) capabilities in crewed and uncrewed aircraft, enhanced automation for space-launch management, and the integration of IFR remotely piloted aircraft systems (RPAS) in various airspace classes. Additionally, the call addresses the development of dual-frequency multi-constellation global navigation satellite systems (GNSS) and alternative positioning, navigation, and timing (A-PNT) solutions to improve navigation resilience and performance in challenging environments.

title: Fast-track Extending U-space eco-system
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing communication, navigation, and surveillance (CNS) capabilities for U-space, particularly for unmanned aerial systems (UAS) and their integration with crewed aircraft. Key research topics include the use of public LTE/4G/5G networks for low-altitude operations, development of low-cost CNS solutions for vertiports and regional airports, and enhancing navigation and surveillance for drones in urban environments. Additionally, the call emphasizes the integration of drones and crewed aircraft in shared airspace, the exploration of U-space services for certified aircraft, and the development of operational procedures to manage service degradation.

title: Fast-track Enabling innovative air mobility (IAM) / Vertical take-off and landing capable aircraft (VCA) (crewed and uncrewed) operations
summary_text: The research topics focus on enabling operations for crewed and uncrewed Vertical Take-Off and Landing (VTOL) aircraft in complex environments, including vertiport management, automation of cockpit functions, and advanced air traffic management (ATM) processes. Key areas include the development of operational procedures for safe landing options, integration of vertiport management with flight planning, automation support for VFR and IFR operations, and the implementation of automatic take-off and landing systems. Additionally, the research aims to enhance traffic management in U-space airspace and improve the handling of VFR aircraft to reduce ATS workload.

title: Fast-track U3 U-space advanced services and CNS capabilities
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing U-space services and air traffic management (ATM) integration for unmanned aerial systems (UAS). Key research topics include dynamic airspace reconfiguration for safe UAS operations in controlled airspace, enhanced flight authorization processes, tactical separation management for drones, and improved ground risk assessment methodologies. Additionally, the call emphasizes the development of geofencing services, altimetry solutions for drones, and counter-UAS systems to ensure safety and efficiency in airspace shared by crewed and uncrewed aircraft.

title: Support to programme execution framework on performance
summary_text: The key research topics and scientific focus areas for the SESAR 3 JU grant call include the maintenance and enhancement of performance frameworks related to air traffic management (ATM), such as methodologies for human performance, safety, security, and environmental impact assessments. Additionally, the call emphasizes the consolidation and assessment of performance contributions from SESAR solutions, integrated simulation of network impacts, and the monitoring of progress in areas like environmental sustainability and digitalization within the ATM context.

title: Smart airports, airports as multimodal nodes and passenger experience
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing research in several key areas related to airport operations and management. These include the development of smart airports that enhance passenger experience through improved connectivity and integration with air traffic management (ATM) networks, the establishment of centralized collaborative management systems for regional airports, and the integration of user-driven prioritization processes to manage disruptions effectively. Additionally, the call emphasizes the importance of environmental performance management in airport operations, the integration of remotely piloted aircraft systems (RPAS) into existing air traffic control procedures, and the adoption of innovative technologies to optimize airport efficiency and sustainability.

title: Enhanced CNS capabilities
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing next-generation Air Traffic Control (ATC) platforms and Communication, Navigation, and Surveillance (CNS) capabilities to enhance the robustness of Air Traffic Management (ATM) systems. Key research topics include the development of CNS as a service (CNSaaS), integration of high-altitude pseudo-satellites and hypersonic vehicles into ATM, satellite-based multilateration for resilient surveillance, and collaborative cybersecurity frameworks for CNS. Additionally, the call emphasizes the need for alternative Position, Navigation, and Timing (A-PNT) solutions to mitigate GNSS vulnerabilities and the development of dual-frequency multi-constellation ground-based augmentation systems.

title: Support to programme execution on SESAR architecture and on Strategic deployment planning and monitoring
summary_text: The key research topics and scientific focus areas include the development and maintenance of a consistent SESAR architecture design, support for the deployment of strategic deployment objectives (SDOs) at a European level, and the involvement of the ATM workforce in deployment planning and training. Additionally, the focus is on monitoring and reporting on the progress of the SESAR architecture and its alignment with the European ATM Master Plan, as well as facilitating market uptake of SESAR solutions through guidance and impact assessments.

title: EIC Transition Open
summary_text: The EIC Transition funds focus on advancing novel technologies from laboratory proof of principle to practical applications through prototyping, user testing, and validation. Key research topics include technology maturation, user-centric methodologies, market and business development, and the creation of sustainable business models aimed at commercialization. Projects should enhance technology readiness levels and address market readiness, including aspects like market research, business case development, and regulatory considerations.

title: MSCA Staff Exchanges 2025
summary_text: The MSCA Staff Exchanges focus on enhancing research and innovation (R&I) through international, inter-sectoral, and interdisciplinary mobility of staff between academic and non-academic organizations. Key research topics include knowledge transfer, development of innovative products and services, and fostering entrepreneurial mindsets. The initiative aims to strengthen collaborative networks, improve employability through skills development, and facilitate the sharing of innovative approaches across diverse scientific disciplines.

title: MSCA Postdoctoral Fellowships 2025
summary_text: The grant call focuses on supporting postdoctoral fellowships that enhance research and transferable skills through international mobility, fostering interdisciplinary and inter-sectoral collaboration. Key research topics include innovation and entrepreneurship, nuclear research expertise under the Euratom framework, and the promotion of Open Science practices. Additionally, the initiative emphasizes the importance of career development plans that integrate training in transferable skills and public engagement to improve employability in both academic and non-academic sectors.

title: ERA Fellowships
summary_text: The grant call focuses on supporting excellent researchers through ERA Fellowships in Widening Countries, emphasizing cross-border mobility and collaboration between academic and non-academic sectors. Key research topics include enhancing transferable skills, fostering innovation and entrepreneurship, promoting research integrity, and implementing Open Science practices. The initiative aims to improve the employability and career prospects of researchers while strengthening the research and innovation capacity of host organizations in Widening Countries.

title: Women Tech.EU initiative
summary_text: The Women TechEU initiative focuses on supporting early-stage, women-led deep-tech startups in Europe to address the gender gap in the tech industry and foster a more diverse startup ecosystem. Key research topics include enhancing the competitiveness of women-led companies, promoting cooperation and networking among women entrepreneurs, and ensuring geographical and technological diversity in participation. The initiative also emphasizes the importance of mentorship, coaching, and the evaluation of proposals to facilitate access to further funding opportunities within the EIC framework.

title: Biotech for Climate Resilient Crops and Plant-Based Biomanufacturing
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing climate-resilient agricultural practices by developing innovative strategies to improve plant growth, yield, and nutritional value under various abiotic stress conditions. Key research topics include increasing tolerance to combined stresses (such as heat, drought, and salinity), improving water and nutrient use efficiency, and enhancing plant-microbiome interactions. Additionally, projects should employ multi-omics approaches and advanced technologies to create novel defense mechanisms and assess the nutritional enhancement of crops through both native and non-native ingredients.

title: Towards autonomous robot collectives delivering collaborative tasks in dynamic unstructured construction environments
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing robotic automation in on-site construction through the development of autonomous collaborative robots capable of performing complex assembly tasks in dynamic environments. Key research topics include the creation of a simplified structural building system for modular construction, the design of a multi-robotic collaborative platform for assembly tasks, and the demonstration of these technologies in controlled environments. The initiative aims to enhance productivity, safety, and sustainability in the construction sector by integrating digitalized production with on-site assembly processes.

title: Generative-AI based Agents to Revolutionize Medical Diagnosis and Treatment of Cancer
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing cancer diagnosis and treatment through the integration of Generative AI (GenAI) with multimodal medical imaging and health data. Key research topics include the development of GenAI algorithms for combining diverse data sources, creating synthetic medical data for model training, and enhancing predictive diagnosis and personalized treatment selection for specific cancers. The initiative aims to improve patient care by fostering collaboration among various experts to create autonomous agents that provide comprehensive insights throughout the clinical pathway.

title: Waste-to-value devices - circular production of renewable fuels, chemicals and materials
summary_text: The grant call focuses on developing next-generation technologies for converting problematic waste streams into valuable feedstocks for a circular economy. Key research topics include the creation of fully integrated waste-to-value devices that utilize renewable energy for the conversion of synthetic polymers, flue gases, and wastewater, as well as advancements in computational material science and AI to understand underlying processes. Additionally, the call emphasizes breakthroughs in bottom-up synthetic biology for engineered microbial systems that can degrade waste and produce sustainable fuels and materials.

title: Bio-based and biodegradable delivery systems for fertilising products to reduce microplastics pollution & promote soil health
summary_text: The key research topics focus on developing bio-based biodegradable delivery systems for fertilizing products to reduce soil and water pollution, particularly from microplastics. Proposals should aim to create sustainable production processes, validate the effectiveness of these systems in agricultural applications, and assess their long-term biodegradability in various environments. Additionally, projects are expected to engage with farmers and incorporate the safe-and-sustainable-by-design framework to enhance the environmental and agronomic performance of these delivery systems.

title: Valorisation of untapped forest biomass
summary_text: The key research topics focus on enhancing the sustainable management and valorisation of unused and underutilised forest biomass to support climate change mitigation, biodiversity, and rural development. Proposals should explore innovative technologies and business models for converting low-value biomass into bio-based products, optimize logistics and value chains, and engage local stakeholders in sustainable practices. Additionally, the research should address environmental sustainability, soil health, and the development of carbon farming certification methodologies.

title: Circular-by-design fibre-based packaging with improved properties
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing the sustainable large-scale production of fibre-based packaging materials, addressing challenges in material supply, sustainability, and market dynamics. Key research topics include the development and scaling of innovative production technologies for fibre-based packaging, ensuring circularity and sustainability in design and end-of-life processes, and enhancing the properties of these materials through bio-based additives. Proposals should also consider consumer perceptions and regulatory compliance while contributing to the EU's broader environmental and industrial strategies.

title: SSbD bio-based polymers/copolymers unlocking new market applications
summary_text: The key research topics focus on the development and scaling of safe, sustainable, and cost-competitive bio-based (co-)polymers and their applications in various market sectors. Proposals should aim to demonstrate the production of these materials with improved properties compared to fossil-based counterparts, enhance resource efficiency, and ensure compatibility with end-of-life frameworks while adhering to the safe-and-sustainable-by-design (SSbD) principles. Additionally, projects should address social acceptance and contribute to the broader EU Bioeconomy Strategy and sustainability goals.

title: Scaling-up nutritional proteins from alternative sources
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing research and innovation in the production of sustainably sourced alternative proteins for human and animal nutrition. Key topics include the development of innovative extraction and production processes from diverse sources such as plants, microorganisms, and aquatic biomass, as well as ensuring nutritional adequacy, safety, and consumer acceptance of these proteins. Additionally, the call emphasizes resource efficiency, circularity, and addressing regulatory challenges to enhance the sustainability and resilience of food systems.

title: Bio-based drop-ins/smart drop-in platform chemicals, via cost-effective, sustainable and resource-efficient conversion of biomass
summary_text: The key research topics focus on the sustainable large-scale production of bio-based drop-in platform chemicals, emphasizing the development of cost-effective and robust production processes that minimize waste and enhance resource efficiency. Proposals should also address the integration of these chemicals into market-relevant products, ensure compliance with regulatory frameworks, and involve key stakeholders in the sustainable circular bio-based system. Additionally, projects are expected to apply the safe-and-sustainable-by-design (SSbD) framework to assess production processes and final products, contributing to the EU's bioeconomy and zero pollution ambitions.

title: Sustainable macroalgae systems for innovative, added-value applications: cultivation and optimised production systems
summary_text: The key research topics focus on the sustainable cultivation, processing, and valorization of macroalgae to support the EU's bioeconomy and environmental goals. Proposals should aim to develop scalable cultivation systems, optimize biomass yield, and create bio-based products while ensuring environmental sustainability and biodiversity protection. Additionally, projects should assess socio-economic impacts, public perception, and integrate with existing research initiatives and stakeholder platforms.

title: Alternative biomanufacturing routes for natural and synthetic rubber
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing sustainable sources and production methods for natural and synthetic rubber to enhance European industrial competitiveness and strategic autonomy. Key research topics include the identification and optimization of rubber-bearing genetic sources, development of bio-based solutions for high-yield elastomer production, and the advancement of environmentally sustainable extraction and processing methods. Proposals should also address the environmental impacts of rubber production and contribute to global discussions on sustainability in the rubber industry.

title: SSbD bio-based solutions to replace hazardous conventional chemicals for textiles production
summary_text: The grant call focuses on developing safe and sustainable bio-based alternatives to hazardous chemicals used in the textile industry, aiming to enhance sustainability, circularity, and safety throughout the textile value chain. Key research topics include the demonstration of bio-based solutions that replace harmful substances, the assessment of their technical performance and environmental impact, and the application of the safe-and-sustainable-by-design (SSbD) framework. Additionally, projects should involve a multi-actor approach to ensure collaboration among stakeholders in the textile sector and contribute to reducing pollution and improving socio-economic outcomes.

title: Cost-effective and robust continuous biotech bio-based processes
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing continuous biotech processes for the sustainable production of bio-based chemicals, materials, and ingredients, aiming to enhance productivity, reduce costs, and improve purity in compliance with application requirements. Key research topics include identifying and overcoming bottlenecks in transitioning from batch to continuous processes, integrating efficient downstream processing systems, and applying resource and energy efficiency measures. Additionally, proposals should incorporate online monitoring and control systems, utilize the safe-and-sustainable-by-design framework, and ensure alignment with previous research initiatives.

title: Retrofitting of (bio)refineries industrial plants towards higher-value bio-based products
summary_text: The grant call focuses on retrofitting existing industrial facilities into biorefineries to produce higher-value bio-based products, enhancing sustainability and circularity. Key research topics include innovative biomass conversion processes, the establishment of bio-based value chains, and the development of local ecosystems around biorefineries. Additionally, proposals should address workforce upskilling, apply the safe-and-sustainable-by-design framework, and ensure alignment with previous research initiatives in the field.

title: Urban-industrial symbiosis for bio-waste valorisation
summary_text: The grant call focuses on the sustainable valorization of separately collected urban bio-waste into high-value bio-based products through the development of full-scale biorefinery models. Key research topics include innovative conversion routes for bio-waste, urban-industrial symbiosis, and the application of the safe-and-sustainable-by-design (SSbD) framework. Proposals should also address logistics, regulatory frameworks, social involvement, and the economic viability of bio-waste management systems, aiming to reduce landfill and incineration while enhancing local employment and community engagement.

title: Develop and deploy new curricula and knowledge exchange practices relevant to bio-based systems
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing education and training in the circular bio-based economy through collaboration between universities and industry. Key research topics include the development of curricula for sustainable bio-based systems, skills in biotechnology and biomanufacturing, environmental sustainability, and circularity, as well as soft skills and cross-sectoral competencies. The initiative aims to support the upskilling and reskilling of professionals, ensuring alignment with EU strategies on bioeconomy and pollution reduction, while fostering synergies with existing educational and industrial initiatives.

title: Advanced IoT and Device Technologies
summary_text:
The grant call focuses on three key research areas related to IoT technologies in the context of 6G: 

1. Development of sensing and connectivity technologies for (close to) zero-energy devices, particularly for long-term, unattended IoT operations.
2. Communication technologies and architectures that facilitate 6G unlicensed operations for IoT, with applications in industrial, healthcare, and campus environments.
3. Creation of IoT applications that leverage 6G capabilities to deliver improved performance over 5G, including the design of innovative connected devices that support new services and applications.

title: Smart Security / Security Services
summary_text: The key research topics focus on the development of secure 6G architectures that integrate security services and attributes, emphasizing user-centric security and advanced security schemes. Additionally, the scope includes frameworks for the full life cycle integration of services across multiple stakeholders, continuous security evaluation, and the establishment of standardized metrics and certification frameworks for security quality. The aim is to ensure the availability, accessibility, and affordability of technologies that support resilience, transparency, and dependability in complex human-centric multimodal communications.

title: 6G NTN-TN Unification/Integration
summary_text: The grant call focuses on the development of core technologies and architectures for seamless integration of terrestrial (TN) and non-terrestrial networks (NTN), emphasizing unified control planes for optimized service provision. Key research topics include dynamic routing in multi-dimensional networks, independent reconfiguration for performance and security, and innovative models for resource management and multi-tenancy. Additionally, the call addresses adaptability to various use cases, including public safety and non-satellite 3D nodes, while exploring spectrum management and the feasibility of multi-orbit constellation systems.

title: 6G Telco Cloud and Service Provision Enablers
summary_text: The grant call focuses on developing an evolvable 6G telco cloud infrastructure that supports multi-provider and multi-technology systems, emphasizing key features such as deterministic networking, AI as a service, and advanced network orchestration. It aims to validate and demonstrate 6G technologies through an open, disaggregated platform that integrates various services and supports innovative research in areas like Radio Access Network (RAN) architectures, Massive MIMO, and edge computing. Additionally, the initiative seeks to address societal requirements such as sustainability, security, and accessibility while fostering collaboration with European projects and open-source developments.

title: Microelectronic – Front-End Module (FEM)
summary_text: The research topics focus on the design of a comprehensive Front End Module (FEM) for the FR3 frequency range (7 to 15 GHz), with potential extensions up to 24 GHz, aimed at supporting both cellular and Fixed Wireless Access (FWA) scenarios. Key areas include the integration of diverse technologies for high-performance transceivers, energy-efficient transmission systems, and the development of secure communication and sensing applications, while ensuring compatibility with existing services and addressing interference management. Additionally, the use of machine learning and AI for enhancing 6G performance and the implementation of System on Chip (SoC) architectures are emphasized.

title: Higher Speed Optical Access Networks and future end-to-end Packet Optical Network Architecture in 6G
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing higher speed optical access networks and developing end-to-end packet optical network architectures that integrate with 6G systems. Key research topics include the integration of passive optical networks and adaptive multiband optical transmission, the combination of photonics and wireless systems, AI-enhanced optical network automation, and the exploration of quantum networking for secure applications. Additionally, the initiative emphasizes energy-efficient data transport, sustainability, and the impact of photonic systems on overall energy consumption in 6G networks.

title: Advanced Architectures Systems and Technologies
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing 6G network architectures and technologies, emphasizing the simplification of user and control plane operations, the development of deep learning models with predefined constraints for network optimization, and the implementation of real-time serverless computing for efficient function deployment. Additionally, it seeks innovative solutions for autonomous cognitive agents that enhance decentralized operations and goal-oriented communication protocols that optimize information exchange among AI-equipped devices.

title: Wireless Communication Technologies and Signal Processing – Standardisation and Follow-up/PoCs
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing physical layer technologies for 6G, emphasizing enhanced spectral efficiency through innovative waveform designs, modulation and coding strategies, and advanced MIMO systems. Key research areas include the development of AI/ML frameworks for RAN networks, spectrum sharing mechanisms, and automation in RAN architectures. Additionally, the call encourages contributions to international standardization and sustainable design practices that extend system lifetimes and adapt to evolving service requirements.

title: Reliable Services Operation
summary_text: The key research topics focus on developing efficient service operation methodologies that integrate multiple stakeholders to deliver complex, dynamic services while addressing societal needs such as sustainability and privacy. Specific areas of interest include automation and intelligence in security operations for 6G networks, service development methodologies that support non-trustable providers, novel instantiation methods for dynamic service provision, and the creation of interfaces and protocols for cooperative remediation of failures. Additionally, the emphasis is on algorithms and technologies that enhance energy efficiency, reliability, and user choice in service selection, along with mechanisms for multistakeholder service auditing.

title: MSCA Doctoral Networks 2025
summary_text: The MSCA Doctoral Networks focus on enhancing doctoral training through partnerships among universities, research institutions, and businesses, aiming to develop new scientific knowledge and transferable skills relevant for innovation and employability. Key research topics include inter-sectoral collaboration, the commercialization of research results, and the integration of training in various research and innovation areas, with an emphasis on fostering entrepreneurship, Open Science, and digital competencies. The initiative also encourages the establishment of Industrial and Joint Doctorates to promote skills development in both academic and non-academic settings.

title: Preparatory action for setting up joint programmes among innovation ecosystems actors
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing collaboration among Member States and regions to create a more dynamic and inclusive innovation ecosystem, aligned with the New European Innovation Agenda. Key research topics include fostering synergies in innovation policies, addressing "burning challenges" such as the Green Deal and digital transformation, and ensuring gender diversity in innovation activities. Proposals should aim to develop joint long-term action plans that enhance the performance of innovation ecosystems and involve diverse stakeholders from the quadruple helix.

title: Implementing co-funded action plans for connected regional innovation valleys
summary_text: The grant call focuses on fostering interconnected and efficient European innovation ecosystems, particularly in regions with lower innovation performance, by leveraging regional strengths and smart specialization strategies. Key research topics include enhancing cooperation among innovation actors, developing deep tech capabilities, addressing challenges related to the green and digital transitions, and promoting sustainable practices in sectors like healthcare, food security, and circular economy. The initiative aims to create "regional innovation valleys" that facilitate knowledge sharing, innovation co-investments, and the scaling of innovative solutions across the EU.

title: Improving ecodesign of products and development of testing methods for products prioritised under the Ecodesign for Sustainable Products Regulation
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing the implementation of the European Green Deal through the Ecodesign for Sustainable Products Regulation (ESPR) by promoting sustainable product design and circular economy principles. Key research topics include the development of ecodesign requirements for specific product groups (such as detergents, paints, and textiles), assessment of product parameters related to circularity (e.g., durability, reparability, and resource efficiency), and the creation of testing methods for verifying product performance. Additionally, the call emphasizes the need for innovative business models, consumer education, and the mapping of material flows to enhance sustainability across value chains.

title: Understanding the perceptions of and improving communication on the biodiversity crisis and nature restoration benefits to sustain citizen engagement and democratic governance
summary_text: The key research topics focus on understanding public perceptions of the biodiversity crisis and its intersection with climate change, including the identification of stakeholder groups and their varying perspectives. Proposals should explore innovative citizen engagement strategies for ecosystem protection and restoration, assess the societal implications of biodiversity policies, and develop communication approaches to enhance awareness and empower communities. Additionally, a multi-disciplinary approach involving social sciences is emphasized to ensure meaningful societal impact.

title: Integrated and coordinated approaches for coral reefs and associated ecosystems (mangroves and seagrass beds) conservation, restoration, and climate mitigation and adaptation
summary_text: The research topics focus on the protection, restoration, and resilience of coral reefs, mangroves, and seagrass beds, emphasizing their interconnectedness and the need for integrated land-sea management approaches. Key areas of investigation include understanding the functional ecology and connectivity of these ecosystems, assessing the impacts of their loss on food webs and socio-economic factors, and developing management and restoration guidelines that incorporate indigenous knowledge and scientific insights. Proposals should also address climate change adaptation and mitigation strategies, promote nature-based solutions, and enhance capacity building for local communities and stakeholders involved in ecosystem management.

title: Strengthening the capacity of citizen science in biodiversity observation
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing citizen engagement in biodiversity observation to support the European Green Deal and related biodiversity strategies. Key research topics include the promotion and coordination of citizen science initiatives, the integration of citizen science into taxonomic networks, and the establishment of systematic biodiversity observation methods. The proposal aims to develop strategies for data collection, validation, and sharing, while addressing ecological challenges such as climate change impacts on species distribution and the management of invasive species.

title: Supporting the implementation of nature restoration measures for sustainable farming systems
summary_text: The key research topics focus on developing and implementing biodiversity-friendly agricultural practices that align with the EU's environmental and food security goals. Proposals should assess the socio-economic impacts of nature restoration measures on farming, identify effective strategies for enhancing agrobiodiversity, and demonstrate the benefits of these practices for farmers and ecosystems. Additionally, the research should foster collaboration among farmers, researchers, and policymakers to create integrated policies that support sustainable agriculture while restoring natural capital.

title: EU-India cooperation on cumulative impacts of marine pollution on marine organisms and ecosystems
summary_text: The key research topics focus on understanding the effects of various marine pollutants, including persistent organic pollutants, pharmaceuticals, heavy metals, and microplastics, on marine ecosystems and human health. Proposals should aim to develop new analytical tools for detecting these pollutants, assess their cumulative impacts and risks, and explore their interactions with climate change. Additionally, the research should enhance cooperation between EU and Indian research communities to address marine litter and its broader environmental implications.

title: Innovative and advanced monitoring and modelling systems for revised air quality policies
summary_text: The key research topics focus on enhancing scientific capacity and innovative solutions for detecting and characterizing air pollution, in alignment with the European Green Deal and the zero pollution action plan. Proposals should aim to develop cost-effective monitoring and modeling tools for both regulated and emerging air pollutants, improve air quality data accessibility for informed decision-making, and design optimal monitoring networks that incorporate advanced technologies like AI and low-cost sensors. Additionally, there is an emphasis on integrating various observational methods and building on existing research initiatives to strengthen air quality management and policy development.

title: Environmental impacts from the production of agricultural crops for bio-based industrial systems
summary_text: The key research topics focus on the environmental sustainability of bio-based industrial systems, particularly the production of primary agricultural crops for non-food uses. Proposals should assess the environmental impacts of these crops, including greenhouse gas emissions, land use changes, and effects on biodiversity, while also identifying best practices for sustainable production. Additionally, there is an emphasis on data collection regarding crop distribution and cultivation practices, as well as collaboration with international partners to enhance knowledge sharing and methodologies.

title: Demonstration of reduced energy use and optimised flexible energy supply for industrial bio-based systems
summary_text: The key research topics focus on enhancing energy efficiency and resource optimization in industrial bio-based processes to support a clean and circular bioeconomy. Proposals should explore innovative low-energy technologies, the integration of renewable energy, and the water-energy nexus, while also addressing energy consumption flexibility and the rebound effects of energy-saving measures. Demonstration of these solutions in selected case studies is essential, with an emphasis on achieving climate neutrality and minimizing waste.

title: Harmonizing and optimising composting plants performances in Europe
summary_text: The key research topics focus on enhancing the performance and environmental sustainability of industrial composting plants in the EU, particularly regarding the treatment of compostable packaging compliant with EN 13432 standards. Proposals should analyze the technical and environmental impacts of these facilities, develop best practices for ensuring full biodegradation of compostable materials, and recommend strategies for harmonizing composting processes across the EU. Additionally, the research should explore innovative solutions, such as microbial bioaugmentation, to improve compost quality and address common pollutants like microplastics.

title: Novel circular business models to enable the just transition to a sustainable and circular economy
summary_text: The grant call focuses on developing and implementing innovative circular business models that promote sustainable consumption and reduce environmental impacts in line with the European Green Deal. Key research topics include the design of products for durability, reusability, and reparability, as well as the exploration of product-as-a-service models and strategies for consumer behavior change towards sustainable practices. Proposals should also assess the social, economic, and environmental impacts of these models, while addressing issues of equity, job creation in the circular economy, and the integration of social innovation.

title: Provide digital solutions tailored to small and medium-sized farms to monitor and sustainably manage agricultural inputs and natural resources
summary_text: The key research topics focus on enhancing the capacity of small- and medium-sized farms to manage agricultural inputs and natural resources through the adoption of digital tools and data technologies, including generative AI. The aim is to empower farmers with innovative, tailored solutions that promote sustainable practices, reduce pollution, and improve resource efficiency while addressing barriers to technology adoption. Additionally, the initiative emphasizes the importance of collaboration among scientists, industry partners, and farmers to develop and disseminate effective agricultural innovations that consider diverse socio-economic and environmental contexts.

title: Demonstration, deployment and upscaling of circular systemic solutions in cities and regions (Circular Cities and Regions Initiative)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on developing and implementing innovative circular systemic solutions to enhance the circular economy in cities and regions, aiming to increase circularity, reduce greenhouse gas emissions, and improve local resource valorization. Proposals should stimulate social innovation through new technologies and governance models, engage multiple stakeholders across various sectors, and facilitate knowledge transfer for replication and scalability of successful practices. Key areas of interest include collaboration among local authorities, academia, and the private sector, as well as addressing socio-economic and environmental needs through a multi-actor approach.

title: Additional activities for the European Biodiversity Partnership: Biodiversa+
summary_text: The grant call focuses on supporting the European Biodiversity Partnership Biodiversa+ to enhance biodiversity and ecosystem restoration efforts in alignment with the EU Nature Restoration Regulation and the European Climate Law. Key research topics include the development of innovative solutions for ecosystem restoration, nature-based solutions, and ecosystem-based adaptation measures, as well as biodiversity and ecosystem monitoring, and science-based policy advisory activities. The partnership aims to leverage data from European Research Infrastructures and collaborate with EU space programs to improve policy development through emerging technologies.

title: Reducing pollution from the food and drink industries
summary_text: The grant call focuses on research and innovation aimed at reducing pollution from food systems, aligning with the European Green Deal and related environmental strategies. Key topics include understanding and measuring pollutants from the food and drink industries, developing methods to reduce these pollutants, and addressing emerging contaminants and their effects on health and ecosystems. The initiative emphasizes multi-disciplinary collaboration, consumer empowerment, and the integration of diverse stakeholders to transform food systems for enhanced sustainability, climate resilience, and biodiversity.

title: Indicators for the transition to sustainable and circular economy
summary_text: The key research topics focus on developing and testing indicators for measuring circularity at the microeconomic level, specifically for cities, regions, households, and companies. Proposals should aim to create simple, meaningful, and harmonized indicators that facilitate monitoring progress towards a circular economy, support decision-making for public authorities and financial institutions, and highlight the benefits of using these indicators. Additionally, projects are encouraged to adopt a lifecycle perspective and collaborate with existing initiatives like the Circular Cities and Regions Initiative (CCRI).

title: Unleashing the potential and advancing the impact of the digitalization/Artificial Intelligence of the climate-neutral bio-based value chains
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing a clean, competitive, and circular bioeconomy through the integration of digital solutions and artificial intelligence (AI) in the bio-based sector. Key research topics include the development of innovative bio-based materials and processes, enhancing resource efficiency, and improving sustainability and resilience in the European bio-based industry. Proposals should explore the use of big data, AI, and digital tools to optimize bio-based value chains, automate processes, and assess risks and benefits, while also promoting social innovation and stakeholder engagement.

title: Strengthening pathways to alternative socio-economic models for continuous improvement of biodiversity
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing understanding and implementation of alternative socio-economic models that support biodiversity restoration and protection, in alignment with the EU biodiversity strategy and the Kunming-Montréal Global Biodiversity Framework. Key research topics include evaluating existing models for biodiversity protection, identifying barriers to their implementation, developing innovative valuation methods for ecosystem services, and co-designing strategies with stakeholders to enhance community resilience and climate adaptation. The integration of Generative AI and a multidisciplinary approach involving social sciences and humanities are emphasized to facilitate transformative change towards a nature-positive society.

title: Environmental biotechnology applications in service of remediation of polluted ecosystems
summary_text: The key research topics focus on the remediation of polluted ecosystems through bio-based and nature-based solutions, particularly addressing contaminated soil, sediment, and water affected by hazardous chemicals, pharmaceuticals, and plastics. Proposals should emphasize the integration of innovative digital tools, including AI, for optimizing remediation strategies, while also assessing the environmental, economic, and social impacts of these solutions. Additionally, the research should engage public authorities and incorporate citizen science to enhance ecosystem restoration efforts and resilience to climate change.

title: Bioprospecting and optimized production of the terrestrial natural products: new opportunities for bio-based sectors
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing sustainable bioeconomy through bioprospecting, biotechnology, and biomanufacturing, emphasizing the development of innovative, circular, and climate-neutral bio-based materials and processes. Key research topics include the discovery and optimization of bioactive natural compounds from terrestrial ecosystems, the integration of digital tools and AI in the biodiscovery pipeline, and the promotion of biodiversity preservation through sustainable bioproduction methods. Proposals should aim to enhance the market value of natural products while ensuring environmental sustainability and compliance with international biodiversity regulations.

title: Large-scale in situ biodiversity observations for better understanding of biodiversity state, drivers of its decline and impacts of policies
summary_text: The key research topics focus on enhancing the understanding of biodiversity and ecosystem health in the EU, particularly through large-scale in situ observations of species and habitats across various ecosystems. Proposals should aim to generate high-quality data to assess biodiversity trends, evaluate the effectiveness of policies, and support the implementation of the EU Nature Restoration Regulation and the European Climate Law. Additionally, there is an emphasis on developing standardized frameworks for data collection, ensuring data is FAIR (Findable, Accessible, Interoperable, and Re-usable), and utilizing advanced methodologies, including AI, to fill existing data gaps and improve biodiversity monitoring.

title: Consumption patterns and environmental awareness as enablers of transition to circular economy
summary_text: The key research topics focus on promoting sustainable consumption and production within the framework of the European Green Deal, particularly through the development of circular economy practices. Proposals should address consumer awareness and behavior regarding sustainable choices, analyze barriers to adopting circular products, and explore pathways for behavioral change among various economic actors. Additionally, the research should consider the socio-economic dimensions of consumption, including fairness and inclusion, while leveraging ecodesign principles and digital tools to enhance consumer engagement and support the transition to a circular economy.

title: Development and testing of Extended Producer Responsibility schemes (EPR) within the priority Circular Economy Action Plan value chains
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing circularity in product value chains through the implementation of Extended Producer Responsibility (EPR) schemes, particularly in sectors such as construction, ICT, furniture, mattresses, and carpets. Key research topics include developing innovative solutions for EPR implementation, assessing the economic and environmental impacts of these schemes, and exploring novel circular business models. Additionally, the call emphasizes the importance of digital technologies for tracking and information exchange, as well as the need for cross-border cooperation and stakeholder engagement to improve waste management and sustainability practices.

title: Assessing and modelling socio-economic impacts of nature restoration
summary_text: The key research topics focus on assessing the socio-economic impacts of nature restoration, including the benefits and costs associated with ecosystem services and their distribution across different social and territorial contexts. Proposals should employ a multidisciplinary approach, integrating economics, ecology, social sciences, and environmental science to develop and validate models that analyze these impacts, while also addressing the non-market benefits of ecosystem services. Additionally, the research aims to enhance understanding of the incremental progress in nature restoration towards the EU's 2030 and 2050 targets, ensuring that the generated data is FAIR-compliant and fostering collaboration with related projects.

title: European partnership: Forests and Forestry for a Sustainable Future
summary_text: The partnership aims to advance research and innovation in sustainable forest bioeconomy, focusing on enhancing forest sector value, biodiversity, and climate resilience in alignment with the European Green Deal and related strategies. Key research topics include the development of innovative forestry practices, understanding forest ecosystem resilience, and promoting multifunctional forest management that balances social, environmental, and economic dimensions. Additionally, the partnership seeks to improve monitoring of forest conditions and biodiversity, support transitions to sustainable forestry business models, and foster international cooperation to address global forestry challenges.

title: Assessing and modelling ecosystems’ dynamic processes to guide restoration activities and to improve models used for climate
summary_text: The grant call focuses on developing modeling tools and improving knowledge to guide the restoration of degraded ecosystems, with an emphasis on enhancing ecosystem services and supporting biodiversity and climate policies. Key research topics include the restoration of terrestrial and marine ecosystems, the establishment of ecological reference values, and the analysis of restoration pathways to meet EU biodiversity targets. Proposals should also address data gaps, promote citizen science, and ensure that generated data is FAIR (Findable, Accessible, Interoperable, and Re-usable).

title: Strengthening taxonomic approaches for biodiversity
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing taxonomic expertise and capacity in biodiversity research to support the European Green Deal and biodiversity strategies. Key research topics include the development of innovative taxonomic methods for biodiversity identification and monitoring, the establishment of a comprehensive online taxonomic database, and the creation of a network of experts in taxonomy and genomics. Additionally, the call emphasizes the importance of genomic data accessibility, training, and the integration of citizen science in biodiversity observation and management.

title: Product Environmental Footprint (PEF) of policy and market-relevant product groups
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing the circular economy through the development of sustainable products, emphasizing the reduction of environmental impacts on air, soil, and water, as well as biodiversity. Key research topics include the application of Life Cycle Assessment (LCA) and the Product Environmental Footprint (PEF) methodology to evaluate and improve the environmental performance of various product groups, such as textiles, metals, plastics, and chemicals. Proposals should aim to create tools, datasets, and guidance for stakeholders to enhance the implementation of ecodesign requirements and promote the use of sustainability metrics across sectors.

title: Support to the EU Biotechnology and Biomanufacturing Initiative: scoping action
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing biotechnology and biomanufacturing to foster a sustainable, circular bioeconomy within the EU. Key research topics include the development of innovative bio-based materials, the application of CRISPR-Cas gene editing and synthetic biology, and the assessment of environmental impacts and benefits of biotechnologies. Additionally, the initiative emphasizes stakeholder engagement, consumer trust, and the integration of social sciences to inform policy-making and enhance the uptake of biotechnological solutions.

title: Towards a comprehensive European strategy to assess and monitor aquatic litter including plastic and microplastic pollution
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing the monitoring and assessment of litter, particularly plastic and microplastic pollution, in Europe's freshwater and marine environments. Key research topics include developing harmonized methodologies for detecting and quantifying litter, improving data acquisition and quality control, and fostering cooperation between scientific institutions and environmental authorities. The initiative aims to address knowledge gaps regarding litter sources, pathways, and impacts on aquatic biodiversity, while supporting the implementation of relevant EU policies and contributing to global efforts to combat plastic pollution.

title: Reconstructing areas affected by conflicts: the role of the bio-based solutions
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing bio-based and nature-based solutions to support reconstruction efforts in conflict-affected areas, particularly in the context of the EU's climate adaptation and biodiversity commitments. Key research topics include the development of innovative bio-based solutions for environmental restoration, the assessment of local needs and synergies for sustainable practices, and the promotion of circular economy principles in rebuilding efforts. Additionally, the call emphasizes the importance of community engagement, social innovation, and the integration of scientific excellence in policy recommendations for humanitarian relief and climate resilience.

title: Bioprospecting and optimised production of marine/aquatic natural products in the omics & artificial intelligence era
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing the sustainable use of marine and freshwater biological resources through blue biotechnology, emphasizing the biodiscovery of high-value natural products. Key research topics include the development of computational tools for biodiscovery, promoting biodiversity conservation, and integrating digital technologies with biotechnological methods to optimize the identification and production of bioactive compounds. Proposals should also address environmental impacts, ensure compliance with biodiversity regulations, and demonstrate the techno-economic viability of proposed solutions.

title: Diversifying aquaculture production with emphasis on low-trophic species
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing sustainable aquaculture and fisheries in the EU, emphasizing the diversification of edible aquatic species, particularly low-trophic and non-fed species, as well as the development of integrated multi-trophic aquaculture (IMTA) and organic practices. Key research areas include improving production methods, enhancing consumer awareness of nutritional and environmental benefits, addressing sustainability and circular economy practices, and exploring regulatory challenges related to novel feed ingredients and aquaculture licensing. Collaboration with social sciences and international partners is encouraged to foster economic growth and job creation in coastal and rural areas.

title: Enhancing plant protein production to bolster the resilience of agricultural systems and EU self-sufficiency in plant protein used as feed
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing the production and utilization of plant protein crops for animal feed in the EU to reduce import dependency and improve food security. Key research topics include sustainable cultivation practices, the development of regional value chains, and the assessment of environmental impacts associated with protein crop integration in farming systems. Proposals should emphasize knowledge sharing among stakeholders, innovative processing methods, and the promotion of biodiversity-friendly practices to foster resilience in agricultural systems.

title: Additional activities for the European partnership on animal health and welfare
summary_text: The key research topics and scientific focus areas of this grant call include the continuation and enhancement of the European partnership on animal health and welfare, with an emphasis on supporting research projects, integrative activities, and networking. The proposal should aim to develop ready-to-use tools and solutions for stakeholders such as farmers and veterinarians, while also fostering collaborations with additional partners from Member States and Associated countries. Additionally, the partnership is expected to align with a strategic research and innovation agenda, facilitating joint calls for transnational proposals and enhancing international collaborations.

title: Developing a joint AU-EU Agricultural Knowledge and Innovation System (AKIS) supporting the Food and Nutrition Security and Sustainable Agriculture (FNSSA) partnership
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing the resilience and sustainability of agriculture and food systems in Africa and Europe through the development of an effective Agricultural Knowledge and Innovation System (AKIS). Key research topics include the adaptation to climate change, agroecological transitions, and the integration of diverse actors within the AKIS framework to improve food and nutrition security. Proposals should emphasize collaboration between AU and EU stakeholders, knowledge sharing, and the co-creation of innovative solutions to address challenges such as water scarcity, biodiversity loss, and sustainable agricultural practices.

title: The ocean-climate-biodiversity-people nexus: uncovering safe operating space for safeguarding the integrity and health of the global ocean
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing scientific understanding of ocean health and integrity in relation to climate change and anthropogenic threats. Key research topics include the impacts of different greenhouse gas emission scenarios on ocean tipping points, the identification and assessment of emerging threats to ocean health, and the effects of ocean acidification in the context of multiple stressors. Proposals should aim to develop integrated prediction systems, improve monitoring and modeling capabilities, and inform policy-making to support ocean sustainability and biodiversity.

title: Nutrients produced by microorganisms utilising primarily CO2 from the air, with the support of biotechnology
summary_text: The grant call focuses on the application of precision fermentation using genetically engineered microorganisms to enhance food safety and promote innovation in food production through biotechnology. Key research topics include the development of sustainable and efficient biotechnological processes for nutrient production, the establishment of business models for precision fermentation, and the scaling up of production in existing pilot plants. Additionally, the initiative emphasizes collaboration among SMEs, start-ups, and existing private companies to foster EU leadership in biomanufacturing and address climate-related impacts.

title: Creating urban co-creation spaces for driving sustainable food system transformation
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing sustainable food systems through research and innovation in urban areas, emphasizing the interconnectedness of nutrition, environmental, and economic outcomes. Key topics include enhancing local governance for social inclusion, promoting community engagement in sustainable practices like urban agriculture, and developing effective communication strategies to encourage sustainable dietary choices. Proposals should also address the participation of vulnerable groups and integrate social sciences to foster inclusive and resilient food systems.

title: Fostering animal breeding and genetics for climate change adaptation and mitigation, improved robustness and resilience
summary_text: The key research topics focus on enhancing sustainable livestock production systems through breeding and genetic improvements aimed at reducing greenhouse gas emissions and adapting to climate change. Proposals should explore the identification and validation of traits that promote lower emissions, develop tools for measuring genotype-environment interactions, and demonstrate effective breeding programs that balance production efficiency with animal health and welfare. Additionally, the research should involve collaboration with stakeholders in the livestock sector and align with EU policies for sustainable agriculture.

title: Additional activities of the European partnership on sustainable food systems for people, planet and climate
summary_text: The key research topics and scientific focus areas of this grant call center on the continuation of the European partnership aimed at developing sustainable food systems that benefit people, the planet, and climate. The partnership seeks to implement a strategic research and innovation agenda over the next seven to ten years, emphasizing collaboration with additional partners and synergies with other relevant initiatives within Horizon Europe. The focus includes organizing annual joint calls for research projects and addressing new priorities in sustainable food systems.

title: Nutrition and Mental Health
summary_text: The grant call focuses on the relationship between nutrition and mental health, particularly how dietary patterns impact mental well-being across different age groups, including children, adults, and the elderly. Key research topics include identifying essential food groups and nutrients that prevent mental health disorders, exploring the gut microbiome's role in mental health, and developing effective communication strategies for policymakers and health professionals to promote healthy diets. The call emphasizes a multi-actor approach involving various stakeholders to enhance understanding and address nutritional deficiencies related to mental health.

title: Adapting to and mitigating demographic trends in rural areas through evidence-based planning and innovative solutions
summary_text: The grant call focuses on understanding and addressing the social, economic, and environmental impacts of demographic trends in rural areas, particularly in the context of an aging population and declining working-age demographics. It emphasizes the need for evidence-based strategies to empower rural communities, promote sustainable development, and foster innovative solutions that enhance community well-being and resilience. Proposals should adopt a multi-actor approach, incorporating social sciences and humanities, to develop comprehensive strategies that are sustainable, replicable, and responsive to the unique challenges faced by rural populations.

title: Strengthening the EU crop breeding research and innovation ecosystem for competitive, resilient, and sustainable agriculture
summary_text: The key research topics focus on enhancing crop resilience, sustainability, and adaptability in the context of climate change and environmental challenges. Proposals should aim to improve plant breeding practices through innovative solutions, collaboration among stakeholders, and the integration of cutting-edge technologies, while also addressing market access for new varieties. Additionally, there is an emphasis on supporting diverse agricultural systems, including organic farming, and ensuring that research aligns with the needs of farmers and the broader agri-food sector across the EU.

title: Monitoring, reporting, verification and mitigation of non-CO2 greenhouse gas emissions and related air pollutants from agriculture
summary_text: The key research topics focus on reducing non-CO2 greenhouse gas emissions, particularly methane (CH4) and nitrous oxide (N2O), from the agricultural sector through improved monitoring, reporting, and verification (MRV) practices. Proposals should explore agricultural practices related to manure management, livestock feeding, soil tillage, and fertiliser use, while also assessing the impacts of climate change on these emissions. Additionally, the research aims to enhance knowledge on mitigation measures, develop user-friendly MRV tools, and promote capacity building among farmers and stakeholders for effective implementation of these practices.

title: Innovative solutions for resilient and climate-adapted coastal communities in the Atlantic
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing the resilience of Atlantic coastal communities to climate change and environmental challenges through innovative solutions and community engagement. Key research topics include the development of a comprehensive toolbox of scientific and traditional knowledge for coastal resilience, the establishment of living labs for community-driven testing and adaptation, and the creation of digital platforms to facilitate access to tailored resilience solutions. Proposals should emphasize collaboration among researchers, policymakers, and local stakeholders, integrating social sciences and addressing diverse community needs, including gender and vulnerability considerations.

title: Understanding and managing medium and longer-term challenges and opportunities for agriculture stemming from shifting climatic zones and changing agroecological environments
summary_text: The grant call focuses on understanding and managing the impacts of climate change on agriculture, particularly in relation to shifting climatic zones and changing agroecological environments. Key research topics include developing dynamic models to assess climate change impacts on agricultural productivity and sustainability, characterizing the geo-distribution of cropping systems, and providing decision-making tools for farmers to adapt to these changes. The integration of social sciences and advanced AI techniques, as well as collaboration with related projects, is also emphasized.

title: Nutrition in emergency situations - Ready-to-use Supplementary Food (RUSF) and Ready-to-use Therapeutic Food (RUTF)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing the local production of Ready-to-use Supplementary Food (RUSF) and Ready-to-use Therapeutic Food (RUTF) in Africa by utilizing locally available ingredients, such as plant and marine sources, to improve nutritional outcomes for children. It emphasizes the need for innovative, sustainable food systems that align with Codex guidelines and address climate change, biodiversity, and local health needs. The initiative aims to foster collaboration between European and African stakeholders to develop effective, context-specific nutritional solutions while promoting social innovation and supporting local food entrepreneurs.

title: Exploring and improving access to housing in rural areas and developing the houses and villages of the future
summary_text: The key research topics focus on analyzing the real estate and rental markets in rural areas, including the impacts of demographic trends, migration, and teleworking on housing quality and affordability. Proposals should aim to develop sustainable, climate-resilient housing solutions, enhance data availability through digital technologies, and provide policy recommendations to improve access to affordable housing while considering social equity factors. Additionally, participatory processes involving rural stakeholders are essential for designing innovative and replicable housing solutions that address climate change and promote community resilience.

title: Additional activities for the European Partnership Water Security for the Planet (Water4All)
summary_text: The key research topics for the European Partnership Water Security for the Planet (Water4All) include the development and implementation of joint research projects, fostering the uptake of research and innovation results, and establishing living labs and demonstration sites to showcase innovative water solutions. The partnership aims to enhance international collaboration, support the achievement of water-related UN Sustainable Development Goals, and align with the Nature Restoration Regulation and European water resilience strategy. Additionally, it focuses on coordinating efforts with related missions and partnerships to strengthen the research-policy interface and address water security challenges.

title: The ocean-climate-biodiversity nexus and marine carbon dioxide removal (mCDR)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing scientific understanding and monitoring of marine carbon dioxide removal (mCDR) techniques, particularly Ocean Alkalinity Enhancement (OAE), and their impacts on marine ecosystems and human health.
