Key research topics include the efficacy and environmental effects of OAE, development of advanced monitoring and modeling capabilities for mCDR, and the integration of socio-political and governance considerations in decision-making processes. The call emphasizes a precautionary, interdisciplinary approach to ensure the sustainability and safety of ocean-based climate interventions.

title: Additional activities for the European partnership on accelerating farming systems transition - agroecology living labs and research infrastructures
summary_text: The key research topics and scientific focus areas of this grant call include the acceleration of farming systems transition through agroecology living labs and research infrastructures. The proposal aims to support the development of tools, metrics, and indicators for monitoring agroecological transitions, promote evidence-based policy-making, and enhance collaboration among diverse agricultural systems, including both conventional and organic farming. Additionally, the initiative seeks to establish a comprehensive EU-wide network of agroecology living labs that represent various pedo-climatic conditions and bio-geographical regions, facilitating the widespread adoption of sustainable agroecological practices across Europe.

title: Improving grassland management in European livestock farming systems
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing the sustainability and multifunctionality of grassland farming systems in the EU, addressing key areas such as ecosystem service delivery, biodiversity restoration, and climate resilience. Proposals should develop methodologies for measuring and assessing grassland performance, create innovative management strategies, and promote knowledge sharing among stakeholders. Additionally, the call emphasizes the importance of policy coherence and economic analysis to support sustainable grassland management and the involvement of diverse actors in the agricultural sector.

title: Towards modern, integrated, and effective fisheries monitoring, control and surveillance (MCS) systems
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing data collection and monitoring technologies for sustainable fisheries and aquaculture, particularly targeting small-scale, recreational, and long-distance fisheries. Key research topics include improving data collection methods, developing innovative monitoring and surveillance technologies to combat illegal fishing, and integrating digital tools for real-time data analysis and compliance verification. Additionally, projects should emphasize the standardization of data collection processes and the involvement of stakeholders, including fishers, to support effective fisheries management and contribute to biodiversity goals.

title: Raising citizen awareness on alternative proteins derived from biotechnology
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing public understanding and acceptance of alternative protein sources derived from biotechnology, emphasizing their sustainability and health impacts. Key research topics include improving scientific knowledge on biotechnology applications in food, addressing social and economic aspects of alternative proteins, and developing educational and communication strategies to counter misinformation. The proposal aims to engage various stakeholders through a collaborative approach, ensuring effective dissemination of information and fostering informed dietary shifts towards biotechnologically produced proteins.

title: Exploring the potential of controlled environment agriculture (CEA)
summary_text: The key research topics focus on advancing Controlled Environment Agriculture (CEA) to enhance global food security and sustainability. This includes assessing state-of-the-art technologies, evaluating the economic and environmental sustainability of CEA systems, identifying novel crop varieties suitable for CEA, and exploring technological innovations such as IoT and AI. The aim is to optimize resource efficiency, reduce greenhouse gas emissions, and promote the adoption of best practices in CEA to support resilient and sustainable agri-food systems.

title: Overcoming the barriers for scaling up circular water management in agriculture
summary_text: The key research topics focus on enhancing agricultural resilience to water scarcity through the development and implementation of alternative water sources and circular water management systems. Proposals should explore innovative irrigation strategies, evaluate the long-term impacts of alternative water use on soil health and crop productivity, and address societal and regulatory challenges to increase adoption among farmers. Additionally, the integration of social sciences and a multi-actor approach is emphasized to co-create knowledge and solutions, while promoting awareness and dissemination of best practices in sustainable water management.

title: Developing innovative phytosanitary measures for plant health - focus on systems approach for pest risk management
summary_text: The key research topics focus on developing innovative, climate-friendly pest risk management measures within the agricultural value chain to enhance plant health and sustainability. Proposals should emphasize a systems approach that integrates multiple pest management strategies, evaluates their effectiveness, and supports capacity building among stakeholders. Additionally, the research should address the impacts of climate change on pest management, promote international cooperation, and involve diverse farming systems, including both conventional and organic practices.

title: Research and innovation for food waste prevention and reduction at household level through measurement, monitoring and new technologies
summary_text: The key research topics focus on developing and validating tools and methods for measuring food waste at the household level, including distinguishing between avoidable and non-avoidable waste. Proposals should investigate the drivers of food waste, particularly consumer behaviors, and explore technological solutions to prevent food degradation. Additionally, a multi-actor approach involving diverse stakeholders and citizen science is encouraged to address inequalities and enhance the effectiveness of interventions aimed at reducing food waste in line with EU climate and resource efficiency goals.

title: Making food systems more resilient to food safety risks through the deployment of technological solutions
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing food safety and combating food fraud through innovative technological solutions, particularly utilizing molecular methods, biotechnology, and digital tools. Proposals should aim to enhance the resilience and competitiveness of food systems, align with the European Green Deal and Food 2030 pathways, and achieve higher technology readiness levels (TRLs) while addressing consumer needs and regulatory frameworks. Collaboration with stakeholders, including regulatory authorities and research infrastructures, is emphasized to ensure effective implementation and commercialization of the developed solutions.

title: Strengthening the resilience of water systems and water sector to climate and global socio-economic change impacts
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing water resilience in the context of climate change, biodiversity protection, and sustainable water management. Key research topics include assessing and managing the hydrological cycle, improving water use efficiency across sectors, developing innovative tools for water resource forecasting, and fostering cross-sectoral cooperation. Additionally, the call emphasizes the need for integrated water management strategies that address the interconnections between water, energy, food, and ecosystems, while also considering socio-economic factors and stakeholder engagement.

title: Developing agroecology living labs and lighthouses for climate action under the Food and Nutrition Security and Sustainable Agriculture (FNSSA) partnership
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing agricultural productivity and sustainability in Africa through agroecological approaches that optimize ecological processes and address climate challenges. Key research topics include the establishment of living labs and lighthouses for testing and demonstrating agroecological practices, participatory research involving various stakeholders, and the integration of local knowledge with innovative technologies. Proposals should also aim to strengthen collaboration among agricultural actors and contribute to the broader goals of the European Green Deal and the African Union's climate objectives.

title: Emerging and future risks to plant health
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing plant health to support sustainable agri-food systems in the EU, addressing challenges posed by climate change, biodiversity loss, and globalization. Key research topics include understanding the drivers of plant pest emergence, developing cost-effective pest management solutions, and assessing the socio-economic and environmental impacts of pests on agriculture and forestry. Proposals should adopt a multidisciplinary approach, including the One Health framework, and involve collaboration among various stakeholders to promote resilient and sustainable farming practices.

title: Open topic: Innovating for on-farm post-harvest operations, storage and transformation of crops into food and non-food products
summary_text: The key research topics focus on developing and piloting innovative solutions to enhance the post-harvest handling, processing, and storage of agricultural products, thereby improving farmers' positions in value chains and increasing competitiveness. Proposals should aim to foster sustainable business models for farmers and SMEs, improve environmental and climate performance, and assess the overall sustainability of agricultural activities. Additionally, the projects should emphasize practical applicability, involve relevant stakeholders through a multi-actor approach, and ensure compliance with EU regulatory frameworks.

title: Increasing environmental resilience through a better knowledge and management of the soil-water nexus
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing understanding of soil-water interactions and their role in mitigating risks from extreme events such as droughts, wildfires, and floods. Key research topics include the assessment of soil biodiversity's impact on soil properties relevant to water dynamics, the development of indicators for soil water holding capacity, and the creation of models that integrate soil biodiversity into risk assessments. Additionally, the call emphasizes the importance of restoration and management practices to improve the soil-water nexus across various pedoclimatic areas and land uses in the EU.

title: EU global footprint on soils
summary_text: The key research topics focus on assessing and mitigating the global impact of the EU's demand for bio-based products on soil health. This includes developing an EU Global Soil Footprint framework to measure soil degradation, exploring the social and environmental consequences of production systems, and enhancing understanding of the carbon and contamination footprints associated with EU imports. Additionally, the initiative aims to promote policy recommendations, raise awareness, and foster international collaboration, particularly with Latin American and Caribbean partners, to address soil conservation and restoration.

title: Improved land suitability for soil health and sustainable biomass production
summary_text: The key research topics focus on improving soil health and land suitability for sustainable biomass production across various land types, including agricultural, forest, and peatlands. The scientific focus areas include understanding the relationships between biomass production, soil biodiversity, and ecosystem health, as well as developing process-based models to assess land suitability and soil properties. Additionally, the initiative emphasizes the importance of engaging with land managers, conducting comprehensive literature reviews, and ensuring the interoperability and accessibility of data related to soil and biomass management.

title: Living Labs for soil remediation and green redevelopment of brownfields
summary_text: The grant call focuses on establishing living labs and lighthouses to address soil health challenges, particularly in the context of brownfield redevelopment and remediation. Key research topics include participatory and interdisciplinary approaches to co-create solutions for soil health, the development of innovative remediation practices, and the assessment of soil health indicators. The initiative aims to enhance collaboration among various stakeholders, including researchers, land managers, and policymakers, to promote sustainable urban regeneration and contribute to broader environmental goals such as the European Green Deal and Sustainable Development Goals.

title: Citizen engagement for sustainable land management through local and regional authorities
summary_text: The key research topics focus on enhancing soil literacy and awareness among citizens and local authorities regarding soil health challenges and sustainable land management practices. The initiative aims to establish participatory processes that lead to the creation of Territorial Management Agreements, fostering collaboration between local authorities and communities for soil protection and restoration. Additionally, it emphasizes capacity building for local and regional authorities, integrating environmental sciences with social sciences to promote inclusive engagement and effective governance in soil health initiatives.

title: Social, economic and cultural drivers, and costs of land degradation
summary_text: The key research topics focus on understanding the social, economic, cultural, political, and regulatory factors influencing soil management and degradation, as well as quantifying the costs associated with land degradation. The aim is to develop evidence-based strategies and policies for sustainable land management that enhance soil health and mitigate degradation, while also evaluating the socio-economic impacts of EU Green Deal policies. Proposed activities include interdisciplinary assessments, cost-benefit analyses, and the creation of policy toolboxes to promote sustainable practices across various land uses in the EU and Associated Countries.

title: Quantifying the impact of farming practices on soil health in arable lands
summary_text: The key research topics focus on enhancing soil health through sustainable farming practices, specifically addressing soil organic matter conservation, erosion prevention, and improving soil structure for biodiversity and crop quality. The initiative aims to quantify the impacts of various farming practices on soil health across different EU pedo-climatic regions, develop a comprehensive inventory of practices that support soil health, and establish clear indicators for measuring these impacts. Additionally, the research will emphasize the integration of scientific knowledge into policy measures and promote soil literacy among stakeholders.

title: Network on carbon farming and emissions reductions for agricultural and forest lands
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing carbon farming practices in Europe to enhance soil health and conserve soil organic carbon stocks, aligning with the EU's climate goals and biodiversity targets. Key research topics include the development of standardized methodologies for monitoring and verifying carbon sequestration and greenhouse gas emissions reductions in agriculture, forestry, and livestock management, as well as the establishment of networks for data collection and knowledge sharing among stakeholders. Additionally, the call emphasizes the need for innovative practices that integrate ecosystem monitoring and promote sustainable agricultural systems, while ensuring stakeholder engagement and co-creation of project outputs.

title: Developing transfer functions for the Soil Monitoring Law
summary_text: The key research topics focus on developing a harmonized soil monitoring framework across the EU, specifically through the integration of various soil monitoring systems and methodologies. This includes creating validated transfer functions for soil health descriptors, enhancing interoperability of soil data, and improving statistical methods for combining diverse soil data. The aim is to support the EU's Soil Monitoring Law and facilitate effective carbon farming practices by ensuring reliable and comparable soil health assessments.

title: Soil Salinity in Europe: Drivers, indicators, current levels and temporal changes
summary_text: The key research topics focus on addressing soil salinization in Europe, including its impact on ecosystem services, soil fertility, and biodiversity. Proposed activities aim to develop improved indicators and quantitative models for monitoring soil salinity, assess the relationship between salinity and vegetation, and formulate innovative land management strategies to mitigate and adapt to salinization. Additionally, the research emphasizes the integration of remote sensing data and collaboration with stakeholders to enhance sustainable land management practices.

title: Support to the operation and further development of soil-health science-policy interfaces and national soil-health hubs
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing science-based policies for soil health, particularly in relation to the EU Directive on Soil Monitoring and the EU Mission "A Soil Deal for Europe." Key research topics include assessing and improving existing science-policy interfaces for soil health, facilitating knowledge transfer between scientific research and policy-making, and establishing national soil-health hubs to coordinate efforts across various governance levels. The aim is to strengthen decision-making processes by providing timely access to relevant scientific knowledge on soil degradation and sustainable management practices.

title: Broadening the living labs approach for soil health in Africa and Latin America and the Caribbean (LAC)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing soil health and sustainable land management in Africa and Latin America and the Caribbean (LAC) through participatory initiatives. Key research topics include the co-creation of context-specific solutions for soil health, the establishment of living labs for real-life experimentation, and the development of mechanisms for knowledge exchange among stakeholders. The aim is to empower local communities and land managers with tools and practices that address soil degradation, promote biodiversity, and support food and nutrition security while aligning with global sustainability goals.

title: Living labs to enhance soil health in Continental, Boreal and Alpine biogeographical regions
summary_text: The grant call focuses on establishing living labs to enhance soil health across Europe, aiming to create 100 such labs by 2030 as part of the Mission 'A Soil Deal for Europe.' Key research topics include participatory and interdisciplinary approaches to co-develop soil health solutions, improved soil health monitoring, and the establishment of effective policies based on local needs. The initiative emphasizes collaboration among diverse stakeholders to address soil health challenges in various land uses, while also contributing to broader environmental goals such as the EU Biodiversity Strategy and Sustainable Development Goals.

title: Breeding for resilience: enhancing multi-stress tolerance in crops
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing agricultural resilience to climate change by improving crop tolerance to multiple abiotic and biotic stresses, promoting biodiversity-friendly practices, and developing low-input agricultural systems. Key research topics include the characterization of traits for stress tolerance, identification of local crop varieties with high adaptability, and the integration of advanced technologies for evaluating genotype-environment-management interactions. Proposals should also aim to develop location-specific breeding strategies and agroecological practices that support sustainability and food security while considering the impacts of climate change.

title: Substances of concern and emerging pollutants from bio-based industries and products: mapping and replacement
summary_text: The key research topics focus on the development and deployment of safe and sustainable bio-based industries and products to reduce hazardous emissions and support the EU's climate neutrality goals. Proposals should address the tracking and risk assessment of hazardous substances, including emerging pollutants, in bio-based materials throughout their lifecycle, and identify bio-based alternatives that enhance resource efficiency. Additionally, the integration of citizen science and social sciences, including gender analysis, is encouraged to foster stakeholder engagement and improve public awareness of bio-based value chains.

title: Open Topic: Innovative solutions for the sustainable and circular transformation of SMEs
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing the green transition of small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) through innovative circular and bio-based materials, products, and processes. Key research topics include the development of sustainable business models, collaborative governance approaches, and digital solutions such as digital product passports and AI tools. Proposals should address barriers to sustainability, demonstrate the feasibility and environmental performance of solutions, and ensure their transferability across different contexts while aligning with EU policies on climate change, pollution reduction, and biodiversity protection.

title: Living labs co-creating innovative solutions for forests and freshwater ecosystems restoration
summary_text: The key research topics focus on ecosystem restoration, particularly in forest and freshwater ecosystems, with an emphasis on developing innovative solutions and tools for effective restoration and non-deterioration. Proposals should establish living labs for co-creating and testing these solutions, addressing biodiversity loss drivers such as climate change and invasive species, while considering socio-economic and cultural contexts. Additionally, the research aims to enhance collaboration among stakeholders, assess the effectiveness of restoration practices, and promote nature-based solutions that provide multiple ecosystem services.

title: Delivering Earth Intelligence to accelerate the green and digital transition
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing the accessibility and interoperability of environmental observations to support the green and digital transition in various economic sectors. Key research topics include the development of end-user applications and decision support systems for sustainable agriculture, water resilience, ecosystems and biodiversity, carbon management, and disaster resilience, utilizing advanced digital technologies such as Artificial Intelligence. The initiative aims to integrate European Earth observation services, promote collaboration among stakeholders, and ensure the operational uptake of developed solutions in alignment with EU climate and biodiversity policies.

title: Improving analytical capacity and understanding of the bargaining power and interactions of farmers with the operators of the value chains
summary_text: The key research topics focus on enhancing the understanding and analysis of EU agricultural and food value chains, particularly regarding the dynamics of market structures, cost and price transmission, and farmers' bargaining power. Proposals should develop analytical frameworks and tools to model production costs, price formation, and market failures, while also exploring policy solutions to reinforce farmers' positions within these value chains. Additionally, the research should consider socio-economic factors affecting farmers' decision-making and promote transparency and fairness in agricultural markets.

title: Boosting the attractiveness of agriculture and the connection between the farming community and society
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing the attractiveness of the farming sector to new entrants and young farmers by addressing socio-economic factors, perceptions, and communication about agriculture. Key research topics include the development of innovative governance models, the exploration of factors influencing the decision to enter or leave farming, and the role of cultural and creative industries in improving societal perceptions of agriculture. Proposals should emphasize interdisciplinary collaboration, particularly involving social sciences and humanities, to create effective policies and strategies that support generational renewal and social inclusion in farming.

title: Strengthening the European Research Area by enhancing the bioeconomy research and innovation ecosystem in BIOEAST countries
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing research and innovation capacities in the bioeconomy, particularly in soil and water resilience, food systems security, and sustainable biomass valorisation. It aims to improve collaboration among stakeholders in the BIOEAST region, Ukraine, Moldova, and the Western Balkans, fostering a sustainable and circular bioeconomy while addressing regional challenges and promoting climate neutrality. The initiative seeks to integrate public and private sectors to strengthen the research ecosystem and reduce biodiversity loss through a multidisciplinary approach.

title: Improving and integrating polar observation systems in response to user requirements at local, regional, and international level
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing environmental observation systems in polar regions, specifically addressing the Arctic Ocean and Antarctic shelves. Key research topics include the optimization and integration of marine and cryospheric observing systems, the development of standardized and interoperable polar data systems, and the incorporation of community-based monitoring and indigenous knowledge. Proposals should also aim to improve understanding of the carbon cycle, biogeochemistry, and the impacts of climate change on biodiversity and ecosystem dynamics in these regions.

title: Increasing knowledge flows to practice within Agricultural Knowledge and Innovation Systems (AKIS) via thematic networks
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing knowledge flows among Agricultural Knowledge and Innovation Systems (AKIS) actors, particularly targeting end-users in agriculture, forestry, and rural areas. Key research topics include the collection and dissemination of practice-oriented research findings, innovative solutions, and best practices to foster competitive, sustainable, and resilient practices. The initiative aims to improve the effectiveness of AKIS at various levels by promoting thematic collaboration, tailored knowledge sharing, and the development of accessible educational materials across diverse local contexts.

title: Upscaling innovative payments to support farmers in the delivery of agri-environment-climate public goods
summary_text: The grant call focuses on developing and implementing innovative payment mechanisms for environmental services in agriculture, emphasizing result-based, collective, and spatially coordinated approaches. Key research topics include enhancing understanding and participation in these payment schemes among stakeholders, mobilizing private funding, assessing social and economic implications, and identifying barriers to implementation. The aim is to support sustainable farming practices that contribute to climate action, biodiversity, and community empowerment while ensuring long-term financial viability and effective governance.

title: Strengthening and connecting bioeconomy networks
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing the understanding and deployment of the bioeconomy across Europe, aiming to facilitate a sustainable transition through effective policy mixes and multi-level governance. Key research topics include the establishment of a Europe-wide networking platform for bioeconomy stakeholders, the development of communication strategies to promote successful bioeconomy initiatives, and the stimulation of dialogue and knowledge exchange among diverse sectors and communities. Additionally, the call emphasizes the importance of engaging underrepresented groups and fostering collaboration to achieve the EU's bioeconomy strategy objectives related to social, economic, and environmental sustainability.

title: Effective environmental observing systems and associated governance
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing the accessibility and interoperability of environmental observation systems to support climate and environmental monitoring policies. Key research topics include the development of cost-effective and user-friendly observing systems utilizing advanced digital technologies, addressing barriers to usability and accessibility, and fostering international cooperation. Proposals should target specific use cases such as monitoring greenhouse gas emissions and ozone-depleting substances, while also considering the integration of social sciences to inform decision-making and governance.

title: Preparing farmers, their workforce and advisors to the future of agriculture by providing the relevant knowledge, skills and competences at the right time and place
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing the knowledge, skills, and competences of farmers, their workforce, and advisors to support the transition to competitive, sustainable, and resilient agriculture. Key research topics include developing innovative lifelong learning (LLL) methodologies, assessing current and future educational needs, exploring effective dissemination of agricultural knowledge, and co-creating interactive tools to facilitate learning. Additionally, the call emphasizes the importance of mapping and comparing agricultural education systems across the EU, integrating social sciences, and fostering collaboration among diverse stakeholders within the Agricultural Knowledge and Innovation Systems (AKIS).

title: Strengthening knowledge and skills of advisors and integrating them within Agricultural Knowledge and Innovation Systems (AKIS) via an EU advisory network
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing the role of impartial advisors within the Agricultural Knowledge and Innovation Systems (AKIS) across EU Member States. Key research topics include improving the organization and integration of advisors, equipping them with up-to-date knowledge and tools for sustainable farming practices, and fostering collaboration among advisors to share best practices and innovations. The initiative aims to support the transition towards more competitive, sustainable, and resilient agricultural systems by facilitating effective advisory services that address economic, environmental, and social dimensions of sustainability.

title: Operationalisation of bioeconomy sustainability principles
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing the sustainability principles of the bioeconomy, particularly in food and bio-based value chains, by operationalizing these principles in various environmental, social, and economic contexts. Key research topics include assessing the impact of the bioeconomy on ecosystems, enhancing social sustainability through justice frameworks, and improving transparency in biomass availability and demand. Proposals should also explore the deployment of bioeconomies across Europe, develop sustainability assessments, and provide policy recommendations to address challenges in implementing these principles.

title: Enhancing sustainability and resilience of agriculture, forestry and rural development through digital twins
summary_text: The grant call focuses on the development and application of digital twins technology to enhance sustainability and resilience in rural areas, particularly in agriculture and forestry. Key research topics include the design and testing of digital twins for rural development, the creation of 3D village maps for monitoring and planning, and the establishment of a web-based platform for immersive exploration of village heritage. Additionally, the call emphasizes the importance of collaborative governance, capacity building for local actors, and the integration of social sciences to ensure inclusive and effective implementation of these technologies.

title: Exploring options to resolve land and sea use competition
summary_text: The grant call focuses on developing tools and methodologies for integrated bioeconomy land and sea assessments to support sustainable biomass use while preserving biodiversity and ecosystem health. It aims to identify trade-offs between environmental, social, and economic objectives in various regional contexts and enhance policy-making processes through context-specific deliberation tools. The initiative seeks to address the sustainable biomass gap in Europe by promoting just and effective land and sea management practices aligned with the European Green Deal and related policies.

title: Humanitarian demining / Unexploded Ordnance Disposal (UXO) of civil areas and unexploded ordnance risk education
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing humanitarian demining and unexploded ordnance (UXO) risk education in post-conflict areas, particularly in Ukraine. Key research topics include the development of modern tools, methodologies, and training curricula for practitioners, as well as improved risk education initiatives aimed at reducing civilian injuries from anti-personnel mines and UXOs. The call emphasizes the need for innovative solutions, collaboration with NGOs, and evidence-based support for policymakers to effectively address the challenges of mine contamination and promote safety and recovery in affected regions.

title: Open topic on secured and facilitated crossing of external borders
summary_text: The key research topics focus on enhancing the border crossing experience for travelers and border authorities while ensuring security and monitoring at EU external borders. Proposals should address innovative solutions for secure and efficient border checks, including the integration of digitalized travel credentials, automation, and advanced technologies such as biometrics and data communication. Additionally, projects must consider human rights, cybersecurity, environmental impact, and engage with civil society for broader input and support.

title: Open topic on testing / validating tools, technologies and data used in cross-border prevention, preparedness and responses to climate extreme and geological events and chemical, biological or radiological emergency threats
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing interoperability and capacity in disaster response through the development and validation of artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning (ML) tools, miniaturized sensors for threat detection, and secure communication systems among first responders. Key research topics include the integration of AI/ML in decision-making processes, the deployment of autonomous sensors for identifying threats and victims, and improving cross-border emergency communication systems. Proposals should aim to demonstrate the effectiveness and interoperability of these technologies in real-world scenarios, while also considering environmental impact and engaging with disaster management authorities and practitioners.

title: National Contact Points (NCPs) in the field of security and cybersecurity fostering the links with National Community building for Safe, Secure and Resilient Societies
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing the role of National Contact Points (NCPs) in facilitating access to Horizon Europe funding for civil security research and innovation. Key research topics include improving transnational cooperation among NCPs, assessing stakeholder needs in security research, and increasing awareness of EU funding opportunities and successful innovation uptake. The initiative aims to reduce geographical fragmentation in the security research community and promote collaboration between national and EU initiatives, particularly through the Community for European Research and Innovation for Security (CERIS).

title: Demand-led innovation for civil security through Pre-Commercial Procurement (PCP)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on pre-commercial procurement (PCP) aimed at developing innovative civil security technology solutions through collaborative research and development efforts. Key research topics include the strategic use of PCP to address societal challenges, the validation and pilot deployment of prototypes in real operational environments, and the establishment of a community of EU civil security practitioners to facilitate the commercialization of these solutions. Proposals should emphasize sustainability, stakeholder engagement, and the potential for market uptake, while also considering the integration of gender dimensions where relevant.

title: Open topic on modern information and forensic evidence analysis and on frontline policing
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing modern information and forensic evidence analysis, as well as the modernization of frontline policing, particularly through the use of advanced technologies and innovative methodologies. Key research topics include the development of validated tools and training for security practitioners, improved cross-border information exchange mechanisms, and evidence-based policy support related to crime and terrorism. Proposals should address new challenges in these areas, ensuring collaboration with relevant stakeholders and considering previous research to avoid duplication.

title: Open topic for role of the human factor for the resilience of critical infrastructures
summary_text: The key research topics focus on enhancing the resilience of critical infrastructure against natural hazards and human threats, including cyber attacks. Proposals should address the human factors influencing infrastructure resilience, improve risk assessment and post-incident investigation capabilities, and develop training curricula for operators and first responders. Emphasis is placed on innovative solutions that balance technological and societal dimensions, incorporating social sciences to enhance the societal impact of research and innovation activities.

title: Accelerating uptake through open proposals for advanced SME innovation
summary_text: The grant call focuses on developing mature digital technological solutions that address EU security policy priorities, particularly in combating crime and terrorism, enhancing disaster resilience, and improving border management and infrastructure security. It aims to foster collaboration among small and medium enterprises (SMEs) and research organizations to facilitate innovation in civil security, enhance market access, and reduce dependency on non-EU suppliers. Key activities include aligning innovations with market needs, supporting technology transfer, and involving security end-users as validators and potential adopters of new technologies.

title: Advancing autonomous systems and robotics for high-risk disaster response, strengthening disaster resilience in conflict-afflicted crisis zones
summary_text: The key research topics focus on the development and adaptation of Multi-Function Autonomous Systems for high-risk scenarios, particularly in conflict-driven disasters. This includes enhancing remote sensing and situational awareness for first responders, improving autonomous navigation and search capabilities in hazardous environments, and conducting user-centered testing in conditions that mimic urban disasters. Additionally, the initiative emphasizes capacity building and training for effective deployment of these systems, addressing the urgent need for advanced tools to support responders in complex crises exacerbated by geopolitical conflicts.

title: Open grounds for pre-commercial procurement of innovative security technologies
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing border security, combating crime and terrorism, protecting infrastructure and public spaces, and increasing societal resilience against disasters through innovative security technologies. It aims to consolidate demand among EU public procurers for R&D services that develop these technologies, while ensuring alignment with industry needs and compliance with EU regulations. Key areas of interest include the maturation of technologies, joint procurement strategies, and the integration of societal and gender considerations in the development of security solutions.

title: Open topic on prevention, detection and deterrence of various forms of crime and terrorism through an enhanced understanding of the related societal issues
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing the prevention, detection, and deterrence of crime and terrorism/radicalisation through improved tools, methodologies, and training for security practitioners in Europe. Key research topics include understanding societal issues related to crime and radicalisation, developing innovative solutions, and ensuring the involvement of social sciences to enhance societal impact. Proposals should also emphasize collaboration with relevant authorities and practitioners to validate outcomes and facilitate future implementation.

title: Open topic on efficient border surveillance and maritime security
summary_text: The key research topics focus on enhancing the security of EU external borders and maritime environments against various threats, including illegal trafficking, irregular migration, and potential terrorist attacks. Proposals should aim to develop innovative solutions for border surveillance, real-time situational awareness, and decision-making capabilities, particularly in response to geopolitical instabilities and hybrid threats. Additionally, the integration of human rights perspectives, cybersecurity measures, and environmentally sustainable practices in the proposed technologies and solutions is emphasized.

title: Uptake Acceleration Services
summary_text: The key research topics focus on enhancing the uptake of innovation in the security sector, particularly through the development of advanced advisory and support services for SMEs, start-ups, and security practitioners. The initiative aims to strengthen technology transfer from research to market, improve cooperation among various stakeholders, and provide tailored services such as market research, funding guidance, and technology validation to facilitate the adoption of innovative security solutions. Additionally, the project emphasizes the importance of sustainability and the integration of gender considerations in research and innovation efforts.

title: Open topic on Improving disaster risk management and governance to ensure self-sufficiency and sustainability of operations in support of enhanced resilience
summary_text: The key research topics focus on enhancing understanding and management of disaster impacts, improving early warning systems, and fostering resilience in emergency systems against both natural and human-made threats, including CBRN risks. Proposals should aim to develop innovative risk governance strategies that engage authorities and communities, promote inclusive participation, and adapt to multi-risk environments. Additionally, projects are encouraged to validate and demonstrate tools for disaster prevention and preparedness, while ensuring collaboration with relevant stakeholders and integrating social sciences to enhance societal impacts.

title: Open topic on improved intelligence picture and enhanced prevention, detection and deterrence of various forms of organised crime
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing tools, methodologies, and training for European Police Authorities to combat organized crime, emphasizing the prevention, detection, and investigation of criminal networks. It seeks innovative solutions to emerging challenges in cross-border organized crime, promoting secure information exchange and evidence-based policy support. Proposals should also consider the integration of gender dimensions and ensure collaboration with relevant law enforcement agencies and stakeholders for effective implementation and validation of outcomes.

title: Open topic on citizen and regional and/or local authorities' engagement in enhanced disaster risk awareness, including education, and preparedness
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing disaster preparedness and risk awareness among citizens and local authorities through improved communication and knowledge sharing. It emphasizes the need for inclusive engagement strategies that consider diverse societal characteristics and aims to foster collaboration between scientific communities, policymakers, and practitioners in disaster risk reduction. Proposals should explore innovative tools and mechanisms, including the use of AI, to address current challenges and improve the uptake of research findings in disaster management.

title: Open topic for improved preparedness for, response to and recovery from large-scale disruptions of critical infrastructures
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing the resilience of critical infrastructure against natural hazards, cyberattacks, and other harmful actions. Key research topics include developing innovative solutions for better risk assessment, monitoring, and crisis management, as well as creating effective digital tools for stress testing and training curricula for operators and first responders. Proposals should address uncharted interdependencies and challenges, ensuring active involvement from security practitioners and planning for future scalability of solutions.

title: Data repository for security research and innovation
summary_text: The grant call focuses on the development of a comprehensive research data repository for security and disaster risk management, emphasizing the need for accurate, up-to-date, and accessible data that can be reused and shared among researchers and practitioners. Key research topics include enhancing interoperability of data formats, ensuring compliance with privacy and data protection regulations, and fostering collaboration within the security research community. The initiative aims to create a sustainable system that supports the storage, management, and sharing of diverse security-related data, ultimately contributing to improved research outcomes and innovation in areas such as crime prevention, infrastructure resilience, and disaster management.

title: Open topic on better customs and supply chain security
summary_text: The key research topics focus on enhancing customs and supply chain security through innovative solutions for prevention, detection, and deterrence of illegal activities involving goods across EU borders. Proposals should address emerging challenges related to geopolitical instabilities and environmental impacts, while also improving surveillance and reaction capabilities. Additionally, the integration of human rights perspectives, cybersecurity measures, and environmentally sustainable practices is encouraged, alongside collaboration with relevant security practitioners for effective implementation and validation of proposed technologies.

title: Support for the functioning of the Global Research Collaboration for Infectious Disease Preparedness (GloPID-R)
summary_text: This grant call focuses on enhancing global collaboration and coordination in infectious disease research, particularly in response to pandemics and severe epidemics. Key research topics include improving research preparedness and response frameworks, facilitating data sharing, and strengthening clinical trial networks. The initiative aims to support the Global Research Collaboration for Infectious Disease Preparedness (GloPID-R) by providing administrative and scientific support, fostering communication among stakeholders, and promoting regional research priorities.

title: Development of antibodies and antibody-derived proteins for the prevention and treatment of infectious diseases with epidemic potential
summary_text: This grant call focuses on advancing research and development of antiviral prophylactics and therapeutics, particularly through the use of antibodies and antibody-derived proteins, to combat emerging and re-emerging viral infections. Key research topics include the characterization and testing of these candidates against specific priority viruses, conducting preclinical and first-in-human clinical studies, and ensuring production scalability and affordability for potential pandemic responses. The initiative aims to enhance the EU's role in global health security by diversifying therapeutic options and improving preparedness for future infectious disease outbreaks.

title: Boosting the translation of biotech research into innovative health therapies
summary_text: This grant call focuses on advancing the development of innovative biotechnology-based therapies by supporting early clinical research phases. Key research topics include the transition from preclinical to clinical development of therapies such as monoclonal antibodies, vaccines, and RNA therapies, with an emphasis on collaboration among SMEs, academics, and clinicians. The aim is to enhance access to innovative treatments, increase the number of clinical trials in the EU, and strengthen the competitiveness of SMEs in the health biotech sector.

title: Tackling high-burden for patients and under-researched medical conditions
summary_text: This grant call focuses on addressing under-researched medical conditions that are often misdiagnosed or inadequately treated, such as myalgic encephalomyelitis/chronic fatigue syndrome, autism, and gynaecological diseases. Key research topics include identifying pathophysiological mechanisms, developing diagnostics and therapeutics, and improving clinical guidelines, while emphasizing the importance of multidisciplinary approaches, patient engagement, and the integration of social sciences. Proposals should also leverage existing data and infrastructures to enhance understanding and treatment of these high-burden conditions.

title: Leveraging multimodal data to advance Generative Artificial Intelligence applicability in biomedical research (GenAI4EU)
summary_text: This grant call focuses on advancing biomedical research through the development and application of robust and ethical Generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) models. Key research topics include creating new or repurposed AI models for predictive and personalized medicine, assessing the validity and performance of these models, and addressing ethical, legal, and societal implications associated with their use. The initiative emphasizes the integration of large-scale multimodal health data and the involvement of diverse stakeholders to enhance the usability and trustworthiness of AI in healthcare.

title: Digitalisation of conformity assessment procedures of medical devices and in vitro diagnostic medical devices
summary_text: This grant call focuses on enhancing the digitalisation of conformity assessment procedures for medical devices and in vitro diagnostic medical devices under the MDR and IVDR regulations. Key research topics include the development of efficient, streamlined digital processes for manufacturers and Notified Bodies, addressing the challenges faced by small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs), and creating a roadmap for implementing these digital solutions. The aim is to improve communication, reduce administrative burdens, and ultimately facilitate faster market access for innovative health technologies in the EU.

title: Testing safety and efficacy of phage therapy for the treatment of antibiotic-resistant bacterial infections
summary_text: This grant call focuses on the development of phage-based therapies as alternatives to antibiotics for treating difficult-to-treat bacterial infections, particularly those caused by antimicrobial-resistant (AMR) pathogens. Key research topics include conducting multicenter, multinational randomized controlled trials to establish the safety and efficacy of phage therapies, exploring innovative study designs, and engaging with social sciences to ensure public acceptance and address patient needs. The call encourages the use of computational modeling and AI tools to optimize trial design and emphasizes the importance of regulatory compliance and data sharing practices.

title: Leveraging artificial intelligence for pandemic preparedness and response
summary_text: This grant call focuses on leveraging Artificial Intelligence (AI) to enhance pandemic preparedness and response, emphasizing the development of trustworthy and ethical AI-based tools for public health. Key research topics include the integration and analysis of diverse data sources to improve disease surveillance, diagnosis, and intervention strategies, as well as addressing technical and social limitations in data access and AI implementation. Additionally, the call encourages collaboration with social sciences to ensure the development of fair and unbiased AI models that benefit all populations.

title: End user-driven application of Generative Artificial Intelligence models in healthcare (GenAI4EU)
summary_text: This grant call focuses on the development and application of Generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) solutions in healthcare to enhance patient outcomes, improve efficiency, and ensure personalized care. Key research topics include creating trustworthy and ethical virtual assistant tools for healthcare professionals, addressing biases in AI models, and establishing methodologies for continuous assessment of these solutions. The initiative emphasizes multidisciplinary collaboration among stakeholders, including healthcare professionals and patients, to foster innovation and ensure the solutions meet regulatory and ethical standards.

title: Advancing cell secretome-based therapies
summary_text: This grant call focuses on advancing secretome-based therapies as innovative alternatives to traditional cell-based treatments in regenerative medicine. Key research topics include the elucidation of the mechanisms of action of secretomes, the establishment of standardized manufacturing processes, and the development of quality assurance assays to ensure safety and efficacy. Proposals should also address regulatory compliance and aim to conduct clinical trials to demonstrate the therapeutic benefits of these therapies for various health conditions.

title: Enhancing cell therapies with genomic techniques
summary_text: This grant call focuses on advancing cell-based therapies through the engineering of human cells, including stem and somatic cells, to enhance their therapeutic features for various health conditions. Key research topics include the development of genome and epigenome editing tools, synthetic genetic circuits, and innovative therapeutic approaches targeting specific areas such as cancer, cardiovascular diseases, and autoimmune disorders. Proposals should emphasize the safety, efficacy, and regulatory compliance of engineered cells, with a strong emphasis on pre-clinical and clinical validation.

title: Optimising the manufacturing of Advanced Therapy Medicinal Products (ATMPs)
summary_text: This grant call focuses on advancing the development and manufacturing of Advanced Therapy Medicinal Products (ATMPs), including cell and gene therapies. Key research topics include optimizing manufacturing processes through innovative technologies such as AI and automation, enhancing scalability and quality control, and promoting sustainable production methods. The aim is to improve access to ATMPs for patients while addressing regulatory challenges and fostering collaboration among stakeholders in the healthcare sector.

title: Implementation research addressing strategies to strengthen health systems for equitable high-quality care and health outcomes in the context of non-communicable diseases (GACD)
summary_text: This grant call focuses on strategies to strengthen health systems in low- and middle-income countries (LMICs) and disadvantaged populations in high-income countries (HICs) to address non-communicable diseases (NCDs). Key research topics include the integration of care across the continuum of NCD management, the implementation of evidence-based interventions to promote health equity, and the engagement of communities and stakeholders in health system transformation. Proposals should emphasize the adaptation of interventions to local contexts, the measurement of health equity outcomes, and the involvement of early career researchers and social sciences expertise.

title: Advancing knowledge on the impacts of micro- and nanoplastics on human health
summary_text: This grant call focuses on research related to the health impacts of micro- and nanoplastics (MNPs) in living and working environments. Key topics include understanding the exposure routes and biological effects of MNPs, developing standardized methods for detection and risk assessment, and addressing knowledge gaps regarding their toxicity and long-term health effects. Proposals should also emphasize public awareness, policy support, and the development of mitigation strategies to reduce MNP exposure.

title: The impact of pollution on the development and progression of brain diseases and disorders
summary_text: This grant call focuses on research addressing the health impacts of pollution, particularly its effects on brain health and the development of neurological, neurodegenerative, and neurodevelopmental diseases. Key topics include exploring the causal links between environmental pollutants and brain health, understanding the biological mechanisms involved, and assessing the vulnerability of specific populations, such as children and older adults. Proposals should also aim to generate evidence for effective public health policies and interventions, utilizing innovative research methods and promoting data sharing in line with FAIR principles.

title: Advancing innovative interventions for mental, behavioural and neurodevelopmental disorders
summary_text: This grant call focuses on advancing research and innovative interventions for mental, behavioral, and neurodevelopmental disorders, such as severe depression, anxiety, schizophrenia, and PTSD. Key areas of interest include the development of safer and more effective therapeutic solutions, the integration of multidisciplinary approaches (e.g., neurostimulation, digital therapies), and the use of advanced technologies for monitoring and managing these disorders. Proposals should emphasize rigorous clinical studies, stakeholder engagement, and the application of FAIR data principles to enhance collaboration and knowledge exchange within the scientific and clinical communities.

title: Improving the quality of life of persons with intellectual disabilities and their families
summary_text: This grant call focuses on improving the quality of life for individuals with intellectual disabilities and their families through innovative research and solutions. Key research topics include early diagnosis and treatment of intellectual disabilities, development of medical and technological interventions to reduce severity and improve autonomy, and strategies for empowering caregivers and enhancing support services. Additionally, the call emphasizes the importance of addressing comorbidities, promoting inclusive care, and involving stakeholders in the research process to ensure effective outcomes.

title: Facilitating the conduct of multinational clinical studies of orphan devices and/or of highly innovative (“breakthrough”) devices
summary_text: This grant call focuses on supporting multinational clinical studies for orphan devices and highly innovative ("breakthrough") devices, particularly those aimed at treating rare diseases or conditions. Key research topics include the generation of clinical data to demonstrate the safety and performance of these devices, the involvement of social sciences and humanities in study design, and the engagement of patients and healthcare professionals in the research process. The aim is to enhance the clinical use of these devices, improve market positioning for EU companies, and address unmet medical needs through effective regulatory strategies and patient-centered outcomes.

title: Digital solutions for autonomy for space transportation systems, design and simulation tools - Digital enablers and building blocks
summary_text: The research topics focus on enhancing satellite communication, Earth observation, and new commercial space transportation solutions, particularly at low to mid Technology Readiness Levels (TRL). Key areas include the development of health monitoring systems, real-time data processing, smart avionics, and AI algorithms for improved space transportation systems, sustainability, and autonomy. The initiative aims to foster collaboration among industry, SMEs, and research institutions to leverage existing European technologies and promote eco-design and digitalization in space systems.

title: Copernicus Marine Environment Monitoring Service (CMEMS) evolution: new and innovative ocean data assimilation techniques
summary_text: The key research topics focus on advancing ocean monitoring and prediction through improved data assimilation techniques, including coupled data assimilation across various ocean components and the integration of high-resolution observations. Emphasis is placed on developing methods that leverage artificial intelligence for uncertainty estimation and model optimization, as well as enhancing the impact assessment of observing systems. The initiative also aims to foster international collaboration and contribute to initiatives like the European Digital Twin Ocean and GEO Blue Planet, while ensuring the transfer of research outcomes to operational applications.

title: Digital solutions for autonomy for space transportation systems, design and simulation tools – targeting demonstration
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing technologies in satellite communication, Earth observation, and new commercial space transportation solutions, particularly emphasizing the development of modular and reusable systems to enhance competitiveness in the space sector. Key research areas include health monitoring systems, autonomous thermo-mechanical monitoring, and the integration of digital solutions and smart sensors for damage detection and predictive maintenance in transportation systems. Proposals should promote collaboration among industry, SMEs, and research institutions, aiming for on-ground or in-orbit demonstrations that leverage existing European technologies to strengthen the EU's space capabilities and reduce dependencies on external sources.

title: Copernicus Anthropogenic CO₂ Emissions Monitoring & Verification Support (CO2MVS) capacity: new and innovative methods to estimate the impact of fires on vegetation and related carbon fluxes
summary_text: The key research topics focus on understanding the interactions between droughts, wildfires, and vegetation, particularly in relation to the carbon cycle and anthropogenic emissions. The aim is to enhance fire modeling for better estimation of fire emissions and air quality products, improve fire risk forecasting, and refine the integration of observation-based data into global monitoring systems like CO2MVS. Additionally, the research seeks to advance process-based vegetation models to support climate projections and operational applications within the Copernicus services.

title: Innovative Earth observation services in support of maritime litter detection and ship source pollution policies
summary_text: The project focuses on the development and demonstration of advanced space sensors for the detection and identification of various pollutants in marine environments, including oil spills, sewage, and garbage, as well as monitoring emissions from vessels. Key research topics include the estimation of oil spill characteristics, detection in challenging conditions like sea ice, and the application of artificial intelligence to enhance detection accuracy and reduce false alerts. The initiative aims to improve compliance with the Ship Sourced Pollution Directive and support environmental protection efforts in maritime contexts.

title: ISOS Pilot Mission Detailed Design – Servicing component
summary_text: The key research topics focus on the development of a pilot mission for the In-Space Operations Services (ISOS) initiative, emphasizing the design and implementation of robotic servicing capabilities for satellites. This includes technologies for inspection, repair, life extension, and payload management, aimed at fostering a sustainable and economically viable space infrastructure. The mission seeks to enhance the EU's autonomy in space, promote a new in-space economy, and ensure interoperability among various mission components while advancing digital capabilities and critical technologies within the European space sector.

title: Space Critical EEE Components for EU non-dependence – RISC-V Microprocessor on 7nm
summary_text: The key research topics focus on the development and maturation of critical space electronic, electrical, and electromechanical (EEE) components and technologies to enhance the EU's strategic autonomy in space. This includes establishing resilient and trustable supply chains within the EU, reducing dependencies on non-EU technologies, and ensuring compliance with export control regulations. Specific areas of interest include the development of RISC-V microprocessors on a 7nm technology node and the creation of high-performance space EEE components that meet the needs of EU space missions.

title: Preparing demonstration missions for collaborative Earth Observation and Satellite telecommunication for Space solutions
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing key technologies in satellite communication (SatCom) and Earth Observation (EO) to enhance the competitiveness of the European space industry. Key research topics include the development of End-to-End SatCom mission capabilities, on-board processing for EO missions, and synergetic technologies applicable across both domains, emphasizing digitalization, data optimization, and integration with terrestrial networks. Proposals should promote collaboration among industry, SMEs, and research institutions, aiming for rapid commercialization of innovations and addressing European non-dependence in space technologies.

title: ISOS Pilot Mission Detailed Design – satAPPs component
summary_text: The key research topics focus on the development of the ISOS pilot mission, which aims to enhance the European in-space economy through innovative satellite applications (satAPPs) that allow for modular and flexible satellite functionalities. This includes the design and maturation of technologies for satellite upgrades, the creation of a European catalogue of satAPPs, and the promotion of in-orbit demonstration and validation experiments. The mission emphasizes collaboration among industry, SMEs, and research institutions to ensure technological advancements contribute to the resilience and competitiveness of the European space sector.

title: ISOS Pilot Mission Detailed Design – HOST component
summary_text: The key research topics focus on the development of the Hub for Operational Services and on-orbit Testing (HOST) as part of the ISOS pilot mission, which aims to create a sustainable and flexible space infrastructure. This includes the design and maturation of technologies for a modular platform capable of hosting multiple spacecraft and experiments, incorporating robotic manipulation and refueling capabilities. Additionally, the initiative emphasizes collaboration among industry, SMEs, and research institutions to enhance the European space sector's competitiveness and ensure the integration of innovative solutions into commercial applications.

title: Digital enablers and building blocks for Earth Observation and Satellite telecommunication for Space solutions
summary_text: The research topics focus on enhancing satellite communication (SatCom) and Earth Observation (EO) systems through digitalization and innovative technologies. Key areas include the development of End-to-End SatCom mission capabilities, interoperability among EO missions, and the maturation of technologies for improved system security and resource optimization. Proposals should promote collaboration among industry, SMEs, and research institutions to accelerate the commercialization of technological innovations in space.

title: Copernicus Climate Change Service (C3S) evolution: new and innovative processing and methods for future Sentinels and other satellites for reanalyses
summary_text: The key research topics focus on enhancing Earth-system reanalysis datasets through innovative methods for data preparation and assimilation, particularly utilizing satellite observations from the Copernicus Sentinel missions. The scientific focus areas include improving data assimilation techniques for climate sub-components, employing AI/ML for data rescue and error analysis, and expanding reanalysis products to support climate monitoring and extreme event attribution. Additionally, the initiative emphasizes international collaboration and the operationalization of research results to improve climate data services and applications.

title: EU-Japan cooperation on the exploitation of Quantum Space Gravimetry data
summary_text: The key research topics focus on the development and exploitation of Quantum Space Gravimetry (QSG) technology, emphasizing the enhancement of sensor performance and data processing algorithms. The initiative aims to foster collaboration between EU and Japan in quantum sensing from space, preparing the scientific community to utilize QSG mission data effectively and identify relevant Earth science fields for mutual interest. Additionally, the proposal should highlight innovative algorithmic solutions that demonstrate the benefits of space-borne gravity field data.

title: CSA on access to European spaceports
summary_text: The key research topics focus on assessing and proposing common regulatory practices and guidelines for European spaceports to enhance their accessibility and attractiveness for launch operations. This includes evaluating technical challenges, identifying best practices from global experiences, and fostering stakeholder involvement to improve safety and interoperability of spaceport technologies. Additionally, the integration of gender analysis in research and innovation is encouraged where relevant.

title: ISOS Pilot Mission Detailed Design – Logistics component
summary_text: The key research topics focus on the development of a logistics component for the ISOS pilot mission, which aims to enhance the European in-space economy and ensure EU's autonomy in space operations. This includes the design and maturation of technologies for transporting cargo, docking, and propellant management, as well as the integration of innovative systems and operational concepts. Proposals should emphasize collaboration among industry, SMEs, and research institutions to advance critical space technologies and promote sustainability and competitiveness within the European space sector.

title: Space Critical EEE Components for EU non-dependence – Advanced Packages and Memories
summary_text: The grant call focuses on developing critical space electronic, electrical, and electromechanical (EEE) components and technologies to enhance the EU's strategic autonomy in space. Key research topics include establishing resilient and trustable supply chains for space EEE components, maturing advanced technologies such as MRAM memories and organic substrates, and ensuring compliance with export control regulations. The aim is to reduce dependency on non-EU sources, improve competitiveness, and support the EU space industry's capacity to operate independently.

title: Space Critical Equipment and Related Technologies for EU non-dependence – Chip Scale Atomic Clocks and Solar Cells
summary_text: The grant call focuses on developing critical space equipment and technologies to enhance the EU's strategic autonomy and reduce dependencies on non-EU sources. Key research topics include the maturation of Chip Scale Atomic Clocks and Solar Cells, establishing resilient supply chains within the EU, and ensuring compliance with export control regulations. The aim is to achieve high-performance standards in space technology while fostering competitiveness and innovation in the EU space industry.

title: Copernicus Atmosphere Monitoring Service (CAMS) evolution: improved soil-vegetation-atmosphere modelling and data assimilation of atmospheric constituents
summary_text: The key research topics focus on enhancing the simulation and monitoring of biogenic fluxes of Volatile Organic Compounds (VOCs) and other atmospheric constituents, particularly in relation to soil-vegetation-atmosphere interactions. This includes advancing numerical models, data assimilation techniques, and methodologies for estimating deposition fluxes, as well as developing accurate pollen source models for allergenic species in Europe. The project aims to improve operational atmospheric composition analyses and forecasts, addressing critical environmental issues such as eutrophication and public health impacts from pollen and VOCs.

title: Space Critical EEE Components for EU non-dependence - Connectors
summary_text: The grant call focuses on developing critical space electronic, electrical, and electromechanical (EEE) components and related technologies to enhance the EU's strategic autonomy in the space sector. Key research topics include establishing resilient and trustable supply chains for space EEE components, reducing dependency on non-EU technologies, and ensuring compliance with export control regulations. The aim is to achieve high-performance standards for space missions while fostering competitiveness and innovation within the EU space industry.

title: Supporting the AI/ML digital transition of Copernicus Services
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing the integration of artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning (ML) within the Copernicus Services to enhance data quality, operational workflows, and user experience. Key research topics include the development of AI-supported algorithms for data retrieval and processing, multi-source AI models for segmentation, and techniques for data fusion, compression, and mining. Additionally, the call emphasizes the importance of explainable AI, robust quality assurance, and the operational deployment of innovative solutions to improve Earth system analysis and prediction capabilities.

title: Pragmatic clinical trials to enhance the quality of life of older cancer patients (65 years and older) through nutrition
summary_text: The grant call focuses on improving nutritional care for older cancer patients (65 years and older) through tailored interventions integrated into routine treatment. Key research topics include conducting pragmatic clinical trials to validate these interventions, addressing malnutrition and its adverse effects, and ensuring that care is culturally and regionally adapted. The proposals should emphasize patient-reported outcomes, quality of life, and involve a diverse range of stakeholders, while also incorporating social sciences to enhance societal impact.

title: Sustained collaboration of national and regional cancer funders to support the Cancer Mission through translational research
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing transnational cooperation in translational cancer research across Europe, aiming to issue at least four joint calls for proposals that align with the Cancer Mission and Europe’s Beating Cancer Plan. Key research topics include the pooling of resources from national, regional, and philanthropic funding programs, the development of novel funding schemes, and the promotion of open science principles to ensure that research data is accessible and reusable. The initiative seeks to improve collaboration among funding organizations to address common challenges in cancer research and innovation effectively.

title: Understanding the effects of environmental exposure on the risk of paediatric, adolescent and young adult cancers
summary_text: The key research topics focus on understanding the interactions between environmental, genetic, and epigenetic factors in the onset and progression of cancers in children, adolescents, and young adults. The initiative aims to identify biomarkers for cumulative environmental exposure, develop innovative data analysis methods, and create large cohorts by integrating existing studies and new data collection. Additionally, it emphasizes the importance of considering sex and gender differences, as well as the use of advanced technologies like artificial intelligence for managing complex datasets.

title: Innovative surgery as the cornerstone of affordable multi-modal therapeutic interventions benefitting cancer patients with locally advanced or metastatic disease
summary_text: The grant call focuses on developing and validating innovative, surgery-centered, multi-modal treatment interventions for cancer patients with locally advanced or metastatic disease. Key research topics include the integration of minimally-invasive surgical techniques with other treatment modalities, the adaptation of interventions to diverse healthcare settings, and the assessment of clinical outcomes such as overall survival and quality of life. Additionally, proposals should emphasize cost-effectiveness, stakeholder engagement across various sectors, and the incorporation of social sciences to enhance the societal impact of the research.

title: Investigator-initiated multinational early-stage innovative clinical trials for paediatric cancer
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing research and innovation in pediatric oncology, specifically targeting the development of innovative, effective, and less toxic cancer treatments for children and adolescents. Key areas of interest include conducting multinational early-stage clinical trials for high-risk cancers, creating tailored clinical tools for assessing treatment outcomes, and ensuring the accessibility and affordability of these treatments within healthcare systems. The initiative emphasizes collaboration among diverse stakeholders, including researchers, healthcare providers, and social scientists, to enhance the societal impact of the research and improve patient care.

title: Support to the network of National Cancer Mission Hubs (NCMHs)
summary_text: The key research topics focus on the establishment and enhancement of National Cancer Mission Hubs (NCMHs) across Member States and Associated Countries, aimed at integrating cancer-related activities at various levels.
