Proposals should emphasize capacity building, stakeholder engagement, citizen involvement in policy dialogues, and the development of sustainable strategies for NCMHs, while fostering collaboration with national and regional actors to align with broader EU cancer initiatives. Additionally, the initiative seeks to promote knowledge exchange, awareness-raising, and the dissemination of best practices in cancer research and policy.

title: European Excellence Initiative (EEI)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing research excellence and knowledge valorization in European higher education institutions, particularly in Widening countries. Key research topics include fostering strategic cooperation among universities, improving global competitiveness in areas such as digital technology, artificial intelligence, and life sciences, and promoting modern research assessment practices. Additionally, the initiative aims to strengthen research careers, enhance digital skills, and facilitate collaboration with local and regional innovation ecosystems.

title: Hop-on facility
summary_text: The Hop-on Facility focuses on enhancing research and innovation (R&I) participation from low-performing countries by integrating additional beneficiaries into existing Horizon Europe projects. Key research topics include improving research excellence, fostering new partnerships, and enhancing knowledge circulation within specific thematic domains. The initiative aims to build competencies in transnational project management and broaden the outreach of R&I actions in Widening countries.

title: Implementing co-funded action plans for connected regional innovation valleys in widening countries
summary_text: The grant call focuses on fostering interconnected and efficient European innovation ecosystems, particularly in regions with lower innovation performance, by leveraging regional strengths and smart specialization strategies. Key research topics include enhancing cooperation among innovation actors, developing deep tech capabilities, and addressing challenges related to the green and digital transitions, such as food security, healthcare improvement, and circular economy initiatives. The initiative aims to create common knowledge assets, promote interregional innovation projects, and strengthen links between diverse innovation ecosystems across the EU.

title: Accelerate the uptake of life-cycle assessment (LCA) for Safe and Sustainable by Design (SSbD) chemicals and materials and resulting products (RIA)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing life cycle assessment (LCA) tools and methodologies to enhance the environmental sustainability of chemicals and materials throughout their entire life cycle, from raw material extraction to end-of-life disposal. Key research topics include developing user-friendly LCA datasets, addressing data gaps, and integrating advanced technologies like machine learning to improve predictive models. Additionally, the call emphasizes the importance of aligning with EU sustainability regulations and frameworks, promoting circularity, and engaging with stakeholders, particularly SMEs, to facilitate the adoption of these tools in industry.

title: EU Co-funded Partnership on raw materials for the green and digital transition (Co-funded partnership Raw Materials for the Green and Digital Transition)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing the security and sustainability of the supply of critical and strategic raw materials for EU industrial value chains. Key research topics include improving exploration, extraction, processing technologies, and recycling within the raw materials value chain, as well as promoting responsible sourcing and environmental sustainability in line with EU principles. The initiative aims to foster collaboration among EU member states and strategic partner countries to align research and innovation efforts with the objectives of the EU Critical Raw Materials Act.

title: Solving issues in carbon-neutral iron and steel making processes with diverse input materials of varying quality (Clean Steel Partnership) (RIA)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing carbon-neutral iron and steel production through a system-level approach that addresses the complexities of input materials, processes, and product quality. Key research topics include the validation of innovative low-CO2 production methods, the characterization of material interactions, and the optimization of production processes to enhance energy efficiency and sustainability. Additionally, projects should explore the use of diverse raw materials, improve the reliability of steel quality, and develop strategies for effective resource management and environmental impact assessment.

title: System innovation experimentation for Industry 5.0 (IA)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing Industry 5.0 through systemic transformation in industrial ecosystems, emphasizing human-centric technologies, skills upgrading, and organizational learning. Key research topics include developing methodologies for organizational transformation, addressing the skills gap, and fostering innovation through collaboration among diverse stakeholders. Proposals should explore new approaches to enhance resilience and competitiveness in EU industries while promoting sustainable practices and effective learning environments.

title: Assessment of Technology Infrastructure needs in Ukraine (CSA)
summary_text: The key research topics focus on assessing the current landscape and capacity of Technology Infrastructures in Ukraine, particularly in light of damages caused by the ongoing conflict. The project aims to analyze the needs of industrial users, including both large companies and SMEs, and develop an investment agenda to address capacity gaps and foster innovation in the post-war reconstruction of the Ukrainian economy. Additionally, it seeks to identify Technology Centres that can pilot integrated networks for providing technology services, enhancing collaboration between research and industry.

title: AI Foundation models in science (GenAI4EU) (RIA)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing research in four key scientific domains: materials science, climate change science, environmental pollution science (including PFAS), and agricultural science. It emphasizes the development of AI foundation models tailored for these fields to enhance scientific discovery, address societal challenges, and promote interdisciplinary collaboration. Proposals should demonstrate the utility of these models in specific tasks within the chosen domain and ensure accessibility and transparency for the scientific community.

title: From heat-driven processes to the use of mechanical and electric forces (Processes4Planet partnership) (IA)
summary_text: The research topics focus on the development of innovative electrically driven industrial processes that replace traditional heat-driven methods, particularly in separation and drying processes, to significantly reduce greenhouse gas emissions and enhance energy efficiency. Key areas include the integration of advanced technologies such as membrane technology, power ultrasound, and electrochemical processes, with an emphasis on demonstrating energy savings, GHG emission reductions, and the economic viability of these electrified processes. Proposals should also consider process safety, scalability, and the potential for commercialization within the European industrial decarbonization landscape.

title: Physical and cognitive augmentation in advanced manufacturing (Made in Europe Partnership) (RIA)
summary_text: The key research topics focus on developing breakthrough augmentation technologies to enhance human-machine interactions in the manufacturing industry, emphasizing a human-centric approach. This includes creating innovative perception technologies for improved worker safety and well-being, utilizing AI for better communication and efficiency, and assessing the diverse needs of workers and managers throughout the design and implementation process. Additionally, the proposals should address social sciences and humanities aspects, such as ergonomics and inclusivity, to ensure the successful adoption of these technologies across various demographic groups.

title: Innovative Advanced Materials Innovation Procurement (CSA)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on leveraging advanced materials to enhance public procurement processes, aiming to stimulate innovation and align with broader policy objectives such as sustainability and circularity. Key research topics include the development of innovative solutions using advanced materials in sectors like construction, mobility, electronics, and energy, as well as addressing standardization needs and barriers to market uptake. The initiative seeks to establish a consortium of public procurers to identify unmet needs and prepare for future procurement topics that utilize advanced materials to improve product performance and contribute to EU policy goals.

title: Pilot initiatives on Technology Infrastructures (CSA)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing the European landscape of Technology Infrastructures by identifying specific technology areas or industrial ecosystems for pilot initiatives. Key research topics include understanding user needs for these infrastructures, improving service availability and accessibility, and addressing gaps in service provision, particularly for SMEs and start-ups. Proposals should aim to develop strategies and roadmaps to strengthen the innovation capacity of European industries and facilitate collaboration among stakeholders to enhance the overall effectiveness of Technology Infrastructures across the EU.

title: Value creation pilots for scaling up innovative solutions (CSA)
summary_text: The key research topics focus on enhancing innovation capacity through transdisciplinary research and cross-sectoral collaboration, specifically by developing and testing at least 10 valorisation pilots aimed at scaling up research results. The scientific focus areas include knowledge valorisation to boost industrial competitiveness, fostering collaboration among diverse stakeholders, and addressing complex societal challenges through innovative solutions. Additionally, the initiative emphasizes the importance of training and methodological tools to support cross-disciplinary projects and maximize value creation in Europe.

title: Smart integration of net zero technologies into Energy Intensive industries (Processes4Planet and Made in Europe partnerships) (IA)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on accelerating the deployment of net-zero technologies in energy-intensive industries through collaboration between technology manufacturers and industrial sectors. Key research topics include optimizing and adapting net-zero technologies for specific industrial processes, developing standardized yet flexible solutions for efficient integration, and enhancing skills for technology adoption. The aim is to foster innovation that supports decarbonization, improves competitiveness, and creates new market opportunities within the EU's energy-intensive sectors.

title: Standardisation landscape analyses tool (CSA)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on the development of an information tool to enhance the accessibility and understanding of the standardisation landscape for research and innovation (R&I) actors. Key research topics include the role of standards in ensuring safety, functionality, and interoperability of EU products, as well as their importance in facilitating access to global markets and supporting EU policy initiatives like the European Green Deal and Digital Decade. The project aims to create a centralized database that streamlines access to existing standards, promotes alignment with international standards, and improves the valorisation of R&I results by integrating standardisation into project planning.

title: Green and resilient flexible production processes (Processes4Planet partnership) (IA)
summary_text: The key research topics focus on enhancing the flexibility and efficiency of energy-intensive industrial processes to adapt to variations in renewable energy supply. This includes redesigning existing processes and equipment to improve response rates, integrating multiple renewable energy sources, and optimizing energy and resource efficiency. Proposals should also demonstrate economic benefits, scalability, and the potential for industrial decarbonization, while considering societal and environmental impacts.

title: Synergies and mutual learning with national and regional initiatives in Europe on Industrial decarbonisation (CSA)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing cooperation among Member States and Associated Countries to accelerate the decarbonisation of energy-intensive industries. Key research topics include the development and updating of national and regional decarbonisation roadmaps, strategies, and action plans, as well as the promotion of best practices and knowledge exchange in industrial decarbonisation. The initiative aims to align with European policies and frameworks, such as the Clean Industrial Deal and the SET-Plan, while fostering networking and collaboration among public authorities and stakeholders involved in this transition.

title: Innovative solutions for the sustainable production for Semiconductor raw materials (IA)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing the sustainable production and refining of critical raw materials for semiconductors within the EU, aiming to reduce dependency on imports and improve supply chain resilience. Key research topics include increasing recovery rates from low-grade ores and waste, developing cost-effective and environmentally friendly processing methods, and fostering collaboration among industry stakeholders to promote sustainable practices. Additionally, the call emphasizes the importance of raising public awareness about the significance of raw materials and their sustainable production in supporting the green and digital transitions.

title: Safe and clean processing technologies and products (Processes4Planet partnership) (RIA)
summary_text: The key research topics focus on reducing hazardous substances in industrial production processes to enhance human and environmental health, developing novel processing technologies that minimize health and safety impacts, and improving knowledge on emerging pollutants not currently regulated. Proposals should also address the monitoring of these pollutants, assess the life-cycle impacts of new technologies, and involve relevant stakeholders to mitigate occupational health risks. Additionally, there is an emphasis on standardization and data interoperability in pollution monitoring and management.

title: Facilitated cooperation for AI in Science (CSA)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on leveraging artificial intelligence (AI) to enhance scientific research and innovation in Europe. Key research topics include identifying long-term challenges where AI can drive breakthroughs across various scientific disciplines, improving research workflows through AI tools, and developing human-centric and trustworthy AI models. The initiative aims to optimize data access, infrastructure, and talent integration for AI in science, while promoting collaboration among researchers, industry, and civil society to foster a robust AI-enabled research ecosystem.

title: Digitally enabled local-for-local textile and apparel production (Textiles for the Future Partnership) (IA)
summary_text: The key research topics focus on the economic viability of local on-demand production in the textile and fashion industries, emphasizing the integration of advanced digital technologies throughout the product life cycle. Proposals should explore innovative manufacturing processes, seamless data flows for waste minimization, and the use of renewable or recycled materials, as well as the development of service-driven business models that enhance consumer value and sustainability. Additionally, projects should aim to increase local production capabilities and reduce reliance on offshoring, contributing to environmental goals and compliance with emerging regulations on sustainable textiles.

title: Advanced manufacturing technologies for leadership of EU manufacturers in products for the net-zero industry (Made in Europe Partnership) (IA)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing manufacturing technologies for the net-zero industry, emphasizing the development of strategic, high-value-added products and clean technologies. Key research topics include advanced discrete manufacturing processes, automation, innovative materials, and technologies such as additive manufacturing, advanced joining, and high-precision machining. Proposals should also integrate innovative metrology, flexible automation, digital twins, and circular manufacturing approaches, while minimizing environmental impacts and enhancing productivity.

title: Technologies for critical raw materials and strategic raw materials from end-of-life products (IA)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing the recovery and recycling of critical and strategic raw materials from end-of-life products, such as waste electrical and electronic equipment, batteries, and vehicles. Key research topics include improving the efficiency of recycling technologies, promoting functional re-use, and developing sustainable practices that minimize environmental impact. Additionally, projects should aim to facilitate market uptake of innovative solutions and consider financial strategies for the circular economy.

title: Towards human-centric, sustainable and resilient energy-intensive industries (Processes4Planet and Clean Steel partnerships) (CSA)
summary_text: The key research topics focus on advancing Industry 5.0 by enhancing human-machine interactions and promoting human-centric, sustainable, and resilient production processes. Proposals should explore innovative technologies, such as industrial wearables and digital twins, that improve workplace design and automation while considering gender, age, and disability factors. Additionally, the research aims to develop frameworks for integrating these technologies in energy-intensive industries, fostering stakeholder engagement, and disseminating knowledge to enhance competitiveness and worker well-being.

title: Integrated approaches for remanufacturing (Made in Europe Partnership) (IA)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing remanufacturing technologies and processes to enhance industrial circularity in Europe. Key research topics include the development of innovative remanufacturing approaches, mass de-manufacturing techniques, and methodologies for end-of-life decision-making, all aimed at reducing resource consumption and carbon footprints. Proposals should also address the integration of traditional manufacturing with digital technologies, the establishment of international remanufacturing standards, and the creation of new skills necessary for implementing these technologies in a sustainable manner.

title: Strategic Partnerships for Raw Materials: Innovative Approaches for sustainable production of Critical Raw Materials (IA)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on developing and demonstrating innovative extraction, processing, and refining technologies for critical raw materials, particularly minerals and metals, to enhance recovery and reduce environmental and social impacts. It emphasizes collaboration with countries that have strategic partnerships with the EU, aiming to improve the sustainability and security of raw material supply chains. Additionally, proposals should include strategies for market uptake and exploitation of developed solutions, while considering the integration of gender dimensions where relevant.

title: Materials Commons for Europe (IA)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on developing a federated digital infrastructure for advanced materials research, aiming to enhance collaboration between academia and industry. Key research topics include the creation of interoperable data sources and computational tools, the establishment of self-driving labs utilizing AI and predictive modeling, and the promotion of FAIR data principles to foster trust and data sharing among stakeholders. The initiative seeks to accelerate the design, development, and testing of advanced materials while ensuring long-term sustainability and integration with existing national and EU initiatives.

title: Integrated use of renewable energy carriers in industrial sites (Processes4Planet partnership) (RIA)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing the integration of various renewable energy carriers in energy-intensive industries to enhance energy efficiency and reduce CO2 emissions. Key research topics include the development of efficient technologies for integrated industrial systems, the implementation of energy storage solutions, and the promotion of industrial symbiosis. Proposals should also address digital technologies for process optimization, energy efficiency assessments, and strategies for workforce skills development in managing these integrated systems.

title: Horizon Standardisation Booster (CSA)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing the integration of research and innovation (R&I) with standardisation activities, particularly in critical technology areas identified by the EU. Key research topics include the development and adaptation of standards to meet industrial needs, increasing participation in standardisation processes, and promoting the uptake of new technologies through effective standardisation. The initiative aims to establish a mentoring scheme to support European projects in contributing to the creation or revision of standards, thereby aligning innovations with policy goals and enhancing market competitiveness.

title: Artificial Intelligence for knowledge valorisation (CSA)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on leveraging artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning to enhance the valorisation of research results in Europe, addressing the innovation paradox by facilitating the market uptake of innovative solutions that tackle societal challenges. Key research topics include the development of AI-powered valorisation roadmaps, business plans, and tools to support researchers and innovators in identifying valorisation opportunities, as well as fostering multistakeholder collaboration to optimize outreach and engagement. The initiative aims to create a comprehensive AI-powered toolbox that aligns with EU policies and ethical considerations, while also generating insights and best practices from at least 100 tested use cases.

title: Advanced sensor technologies and multimodal sensor integration for multiple application domains (IA) (Photonics Partnership)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing photonic sensor technologies and their integration into multimodal systems to enhance diagnostics, monitoring, and sensing across various domains. Key research topics include the development of efficient, compact, and reliable photonic sensors for applications in healthcare, transportation safety, industrial efficiency, agriculture, environmental monitoring, and security. Proposals should explore sensor fusion, machine learning for data analysis, and aim for significant improvements in measurement accuracy and operational capabilities, while also addressing standards and interoperability for data sharing.

title: Empowering AI/generative AI along the Cognitive Computing continuum (RIA) (AI/Data/Robotics Partnership)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on developing novel AI-enabled solutions for managing workloads across the cloud, edge, and IoT continuum, emphasizing seamless integration and interoperability of diverse computing environments. Key research areas include efficient deployment of AI workflows across heterogeneous infrastructures, decentralized computing tools for distributed AI architectures, and techniques to optimize AI processing power and emissions. The aim is to enhance AI applications in various sectors, including manufacturing, healthcare, and smart cities, while ensuring security, privacy, and energy efficiency.

title: Soft Robotics for Advanced physical capabilities (IA) (AI/Data/Robotics Partnership)
summary_text: The key research topics focus on the development and application of soft robotics, emphasizing the use of novel materials, design methods, and control techniques to create safe and adaptable robotic systems. Proposals should explore the exploitation of advanced materials for non-rigid structures, innovative design approaches for compliant systems, and control methods that enhance the functionality of soft robots in various sectors such as healthcare, manufacturing, and transportation. Additionally, the integration of soft electronics and the demonstration of these technologies through diverse application scenarios are essential components of the research focus.

title: Enhanced Learning Strategies for General Purpose AI: Advancing GenAI4EU (RIA) (AI/Data/Robotics Partnership)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing General Purpose AI (GPAI) through the development of innovative models and architectures that enhance capabilities in reasoning, problem-solving, and adaptability to dynamic environments. Key research topics include hybrid learning architectures that integrate self-supervised and symbolic reasoning, continual and evolutionary learning for dynamic adaptation, reinforcement learning integration, and the incorporation of explainable AI methodologies to ensure transparency and accountability. The aim is to create robust GPAI systems that can effectively tackle complex real-world challenges while aligning with European values and principles.

title: Software Engineering for AI and generative AI (RIA) (AI/Data/Robotics Partnership)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing methods and tools for developing bias-free AI algorithms and generative AI applications, emphasizing the need for improved data pipeline management, novel testing methods, and optimized deployment strategies. Key research topics include enhancing the explainability of AI models, protecting against dataset poisoning, and developing efficient architectures for large language and foundational models. Additionally, the call encourages collaboration with industry applications across various sectors, such as automotive and healthcare, to foster synergies with existing European initiatives and enhance the overall AI ecosystem.

title: Assessment methodologies for General Purpose AI capabilities and risks (RIA) (AI/Data/Robotics Partnership)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on developing innovative assessment methodologies and tools for evaluating General Purpose AI (GPAI) models, including multimodal systems, to ensure their reliability, fairness, and alignment with human values. Key research topics include identifying and forecasting emergent capabilities in GPAI, assessing economic impacts and potential risks associated with these capabilities, and enhancing interpretability and explainability of AI systems. The call emphasizes interdisciplinary collaboration and the involvement of social sciences and humanities to address societal impacts and ensure comprehensive evaluations that meet the needs of various stakeholders.

title: GenAI for Africa
summary_text: The grant call focuses on leveraging Generative AI (GenAI) to address key societal challenges in Africa, particularly in agriculture optimization, healthcare enhancement, infrastructure and urban planning, and digital skills development. Proposals should aim to develop and adapt GenAI solutions that cater to the specific needs of rural communities and underrepresented groups, especially women, while fostering local technological capacity and collaboration among startups and networks in Africa. Emphasis is placed on evidence-based analysis, co-creation methodologies, and ensuring compliance with data protection regulations.

title: Innovative Advanced Materials (IAMs) for robust, fast curing sealants and coatings for manufacturing and final assembly (IA) (Innovative Advanced Materials for Europe partnership)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on the development of innovative advanced materials (IAMs) aimed at enhancing the lifespan, performance, and recyclability of industrial components through advanced coatings, functionalized surfaces, and sealants. Key research topics include the creation of multifunctional coatings that improve durability against environmental stressors, the acceleration of performance evaluation processes, and the integration of digital technologies for enhanced material design and production. Additionally, projects should address safety, sustainability, and circularity throughout the entire lifecycle of materials, promoting industrial scalability and the adoption of IAMs across various sectors such as automotive, energy, and construction.

title: Developing and embedding upcycling technologies into viable business (Processes4Planet partnership) (IA)
summary_text: The key research topics focus on the upcycling of end-of-life waste materials within energy-intensive industries, emphasizing the development of integrated circular schemes that enhance resource and energy efficiency while reducing environmental impact. Proposals should address novel technologies for separation, sorting, and processing, as well as the integration of digital tools and logistics into business models. Additionally, the research should evaluate the economic viability and environmental footprint of these upcycling processes, promote collaboration across the value chain, and consider skills development strategies.

title: Enhanced logistics and operations of construction sites (IA)
summary_text: The key research topics focus on enhancing the efficiency and safety of construction and demolition site operations through technology-driven innovations. This includes developing interoperable technologies that improve operational efficiency, integrating circular economy approaches for waste management, and addressing human-centric aspects to reduce errors and accidents. Proposals should also consider traceability of construction products and explore social innovation mechanisms to facilitate market uptake of new tools.

title: Demonstrators for clusters of social circular enterprises (IA)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing the capacity and competitiveness of Social Circular Enterprises (SCEs) within the circular economy by promoting research and innovation in technology solutions for waste management, particularly in textiles, waste electrical and electronic equipment (WEEE), and construction materials. Key research topics include the development of replicable tech-oriented demonstrators, the optimization of waste processing efficiency, and the integration of assistive technologies to support vulnerable workers. Additionally, the call emphasizes the importance of market research to position SCEs as attractive partners in B2B waste management and the establishment of collaborative clusters to share resources and expertise.

title: Development of safe and sustainable by design alternatives to Perfluoroalkyl and Polyfluoroalkyl Substances (PFAS) (IA)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on developing safer and sustainable alternatives to per- and poly-fluoroalkyl substances (PFAS) across various industrial applications, including electronics, construction technologies, technical textiles, and automotive parts. Key research topics include the application of the 'Safe and Sustainable by Design' (SSbD) framework, the assessment of new PFAS-free materials, and the identification of substitution barriers and production adaptation challenges. Proposals should also incorporate socio-economic analyses and engage with stakeholders to evaluate the societal impacts of these alternatives.

title: Innovative Advanced Materials (IAMs) for product monitoring, smart maintenance and repair strategies in the construction sector (RIA) (Innovative Advanced Materials for Europe partnership)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on the development and implementation of innovative advanced materials (IAMs) for the construction sector, emphasizing enhanced durability, recyclability, and sustainability. Key research topics include the creation of self-repairing and self-healing materials, integration of smart monitoring technologies, and the application of digital tools like AI and digital twins for lifecycle management. Additionally, the call encourages multidisciplinary approaches to improve material performance, reduce environmental impact, and facilitate the acceptance of these materials in industrial applications.

title: Intergenerational fairness in the context of demographic change in the EU
summary_text: The key research topics focus on enhancing understanding and engagement regarding intergenerational fairness in the EU, particularly through quantitative and qualitative analyses of demographic trends and their implications. Proposals should investigate drivers of intergenerational inequalities, such as education, wealth distribution, and health, while considering intersectional factors like gender and socioeconomic status. Additionally, the development of actionable policy frameworks and indicators for intergenerational fairness, along with promoting democratic participation and social innovation, are central to the scientific focus areas.

title: Fighting against disinformation while ensuring the right to freedom of expression
summary_text: The research topics focus on combating mis- and disinformation and information manipulation while safeguarding freedom of expression and academic freedom. Key areas include understanding the role of digital media in shaping public opinion, the impact of market incentives on media practices, the phenomenon of astroturfing, and the importance of independent media and professional mediators in disseminating accurate information. Proposals should also explore regulatory frameworks that protect citizens' rights while addressing disinformation, and develop methodologies to enhance media literacy and trust in information sources, particularly for youth.

title: Evaluation and use of evidence in education policy and practice
summary_text: The key research topics focus on the empirical evaluation of education policies and practices, particularly in relation to improving educational quality and closing achievement gaps among students from varying socio-economic backgrounds. The call emphasizes the need for interdisciplinary collaboration among researchers in social sciences, arts, and humanities, as well as the involvement of policymakers and practitioners. Additionally, it encourages the use of mixed methods, including experimental designs and participatory research approaches, to analyze and evaluate educational policies, with a strong emphasis on data accessibility and the FAIR principles.

title: Evolution of culture in a virtualising world
summary_text: The research topics focus on understanding the long-term cultural impacts of increased citizen engagement in virtual worlds, including the benefits and risks related to human wellbeing, social cohesion, and cultural diversity. Projects should explore the evolution of culture in virtual environments, identify key opportunities and threats, and develop measures to enhance positive outcomes while mitigating negative effects. Additionally, the aim is to position Europe as a leader in the development of virtual worlds that foster creativity, cultural production, and engagement with diverse audiences.

title: Fostering the consolidation of European science diplomacy
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing European science diplomacy by mapping the relevant stakeholders and ecosystems, including academia, policymaking, and civil society. It aims to establish a European Science Diplomacy Platform to facilitate collaboration and knowledge sharing among key players, while also developing training and capacity-building mechanisms for science diplomats. The initiative seeks to strengthen the EU's foreign and security policies through evidence-based science diplomacy, addressing global challenges and fostering international cooperation.

title: Preparing the EU for future enlargement: challenges and opportunities
summary_text: The research topics focus on understanding the implications of EU enlargement, particularly regarding democracy, rule of law, and governance in candidate and potential candidate countries. Key areas include socio-historical and legal-economic analyses of past enlargements, public engagement strategies, and the use of digital tools to enhance societal awareness and participation in the enlargement process. Additionally, the proposals should explore effective communication methods and educational initiatives to foster a better understanding of EU integration among citizens and civil society.

title: Open strategic autonomy, economic and research security in EU foreign policy
summary_text: The key research topics focus on enhancing the EU's open strategic autonomy and economic security, particularly in the domains of research, innovation, and production. Proposals should analyze the drivers and implications of these concepts across various sectors, assess the balance between openness and necessary restrictions, and explore the impact on developing countries and global cooperation. Additionally, the integration of ethical and gender-responsive approaches in foreign policy and the involvement of diverse stakeholders in research activities are emphasized.

title: Tackling gender-based violence in different social and economic spheres
summary_text: The key research topics focus on the prevalence and impact of gender-based violence (GBV) across various socio-economic contexts, particularly in the workplace, sports, and online platforms. Proposals should investigate both online and offline forms of GBV, including tech-facilitated violence, and consider intersecting factors such as age, socio-economic status, and gender identity. Additionally, the research should assess the effectiveness of victim support services and the role of bystanders and authorities in addressing GBV, while utilizing data collection methods like surveys and administrative data.

title: A European Collaborative Cloud for Cultural Heritage – Innovative use cases
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing the European Collaborative Cloud for Cultural Heritage (ECCCH) through real use case implementations and rigorous end-to-end testing. Key research topics include the development and testing of user tools, advanced digital twins, and features for large-scale cooperation and co-creation, aimed at improving user engagement and knowledge generation among cultural heritage professionals and researchers. Additionally, the call emphasizes the importance of interoperability with related platforms and the promotion of innovative use cases to expand the ECCCH user base.

title: Independence of the judiciary as an aspect of rule of law compliance
summary_text: The key research topics focus on the independence, impartiality, and integrity of judicial institutions across the EU, emphasizing the need for comparative analysis of national frameworks and practices related to judicial independence. Proposals should explore the implementation of international and EU standards at the national level, assess the impact on judicial independence, and identify good practices to strengthen judicial cooperation among Member States. A multidisciplinary approach is encouraged to enhance understanding of the safeguards for judicial independence and to develop policy recommendations that support the EU's promotion of the rule of law and fundamental rights.

title: Historical and regional analyses of industrial transitions and their lessons for ensuring a fair green transition
summary_text: Key research topics include the analysis of past and present industrial transformations, focusing on successful policies to mitigate negative externalities and improve regional responses to the European Green Deal. The research should explore mechanisms of labor mobility, firm adaptation strategies to prevent factory closures, and the political feasibility of green transitions, while considering the impacts of gender, social dialogue, and demographic changes. Additionally, proposals should adopt a multidisciplinary approach to understand local job creation, upskilling, and the role of social conflicts in shaping transitions.

title: Working time reduction: barriers, challenges, benefits and policy implications
summary_text: The key research topics focus on the impacts and implementation of working time reduction across various sectors and occupations, emphasizing its social, economic, and environmental implications. Specific areas of interest include the effects on worker well-being, productivity, employment levels, and inclusion of underrepresented groups, as well as environmental outcomes related to energy consumption and sustainability. The research aims to identify enablers and barriers to successful implementation, providing insights and recommendations for policymakers and stakeholders.

title: Migration and climate change: building resilience and enhancing sustainability
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing the understanding of the relationship between climate change and migration through the development of a strategic roadmap and a dynamic knowledge exchange platform. Key research topics include the integration of environmental and climate change considerations into migration policies, the analysis of vulnerabilities related to climate-induced migration, and the exploration of environmental immobility. Proposals should adopt an interdisciplinary approach, leveraging existing research and data to inform policy recommendations that align with EU values and frameworks.

title: Impact of the learning environment and the use of digital tools in everyday life on key skills and competence development
summary_text: The grant call focuses on researching the impact of digital tools on children's wellbeing and learning, particularly during their formative years. It emphasizes the need for evidence-based analyses of how digital technologies, including generative AI, affect cognitive, emotional, and social development, as well as educational outcomes in primary and secondary education. Proposals should explore the influence of various intersecting factors such as age, gender, disabilities, and socio-economic status, while also considering the design of learning environments and the importance of student participation in the research process.

title: Countering and preventing radicalisation, extremism, hate speech and polarisation
summary_text: The grant call focuses on research addressing radicalisation, extremism, hate speech, and polarisation, particularly their connections to social and economic inequality. Key topics include understanding the mechanisms of hate ecosystems, the impact of disinformation on social divisions, and the role of media in shaping public perception and discourse. Proposals should also explore the influence of new technologies, social cohesion, and historical contexts in combating these phenomena, while engaging a diverse range of stakeholders for effective implementation of research findings.

title: Improving mental health outcomes for people in education, training and work
summary_text: The grant call focuses on developing scalable, integrated, person-centered interventions for mental health, particularly targeting youth and vulnerable populations to enhance their educational and employment outcomes. It emphasizes the need for evidence-based tools and data to inform policy decisions, improve mental health interventions' effectiveness, and ensure their replicability across various contexts. Additionally, the call highlights the importance of involving communities and stakeholders in the intervention process and addressing the cost-effectiveness of mental health strategies within socio-economic frameworks.

title: The role of civic and citizenship education for strengthening civic and democratic participation and support for common European values
summary_text: The key research topics focus on enhancing citizenship education through innovative methodologies that promote civic knowledge, democratic engagement, and critical thinking among young people aged 15-29, particularly from disadvantaged backgrounds. The research aims to assess the effectiveness of both formal and non-formal educational settings in fostering active participation in democratic processes, while also addressing gender-specific barriers and opportunities. Additionally, proposals should explore collaborative mechanisms between education sectors and develop guidelines and tools for educators to implement effective citizenship education practices.

title: Economic inequalities and their impact on democracy
summary_text: The key research topics focus on the relationship between economic inequalities and democratic attitudes, emphasizing the need for an intersectional approach that considers various demographic factors such as age, gender, race, and social class. Proposals should explore how perceived economic disparities influence public participation, trust in democratic institutions, and policy preferences across different geographic contexts. Additionally, the research should investigate the impact of intergenerational wealth transfers on democracy and civic engagement, while leveraging existing data and innovative methodologies to inform evidence-based policy recommendations.

title: Advisory support and network to counter disinformation and foreign information manipulation and interference (FIMI)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on addressing hybrid threats, particularly disinformation and foreign information manipulation and interference (FIMI), which pose risks to democracy and social cohesion. Key research topics include the development of frameworks and methodologies to counter disinformation, the impact of new technologies like AI and Big Data on disinformation dissemination, and enhancing collaboration among stakeholders across various sectors. Proposals should leverage existing EU-funded research and initiatives to create actionable tools and recommendations for practitioners and decision-makers to effectively combat these challenges.

title: Europe as a global powerhouse of design for sustainable competitiveness
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing the understanding of the European design sector and its professionals, emphasizing their role in driving innovation and sustainable competitiveness. Key research topics include the development of methods and applications that leverage design for environmental sustainability, the adaptation of products and services to meet human needs, and the exploration of innovative business models and policies that support the design sector's resilience amidst technological advancements and market changes. The aim is to position Europe as a leader in design while addressing cultural, economic, and environmental challenges.

title: Good practices for increased autonomy of persons with disabilities, including physical, mental, intellectual and sensory disabilities
summary_text: The research topics focus on developing evidence-based policies and practices to enhance the autonomy and inclusion of persons with disabilities across various life domains, including education, employment, and community participation. Key areas of interest include the integration of accessible and assistive technologies, the evaluation of person-centered support services, and the exploration of innovative solutions to reduce inequalities and improve quality of life for individuals with disabilities and their families. Additionally, the role of families and civil society in promoting inclusion and addressing the emotional well-being of both persons with disabilities and their caregivers is emphasized.

title: Cultural Strategies for Peace: culture and creativity as catalysts for conflict prevention and post-conflict reconciliation
summary_text: The grant call focuses on the integration of culture, including cultural heritage and the arts, into security frameworks and peacebuilding strategies to address contemporary geopolitical challenges. Key research topics include the role of cultural heritage in conflict prevention and reconciliation, the impact of cultural initiatives on community resilience and social cohesion, and the exploration of innovative approaches to leverage culture for sustainable peace. Additionally, the call emphasizes the need for interdisciplinary studies, empirical case analyses, and the development of policy guidelines to enhance the effectiveness of cultural strategies in addressing societal challenges and fostering dialogue.

title: Bridging historical past and future potential through conservation, preservation, and adaptive use of Europe’s contentious and dissonant heritage
summary_text: The grant call focuses on the preservation and adaptive reuse of contested cultural heritage, particularly those linked to colonial, totalitarian, and authoritarian regimes. It emphasizes the need for multidisciplinary collaboration among researchers, local authorities, and cultural industries to address challenges related to neglected heritage assets, promote historical understanding, and foster cultural dialogue. Key areas of research include participatory governance approaches, gender and intersectionality in heritage management, and the integration of innovative solutions for sustainable cultural tourism and education.

title: Improving fairness in the economy through a better understanding of undeclared and underdeclared work
summary_text: The key research topics focus on understanding the scope, characteristics, and drivers of un(der)declared work and the evasion of compulsory payments linked to workers' remuneration. This includes examining the impact of disruptive technologies, the gig economy, and socio-demographic factors on labor market practices, as well as assessing the effectiveness of policy measures aimed at reducing these issues. The research should adopt a multidisciplinary approach and consider the implications of these practices on social protection systems and economic inequality.

title: Leveraging artificial intelligence for creativity-driven innovation
summary_text: The grant call focuses on exploring the intersection of artificial intelligence (AI) and cultural and creative industries (CCI), emphasizing the impact of AI on artists, creative professionals, and the market for cultural goods. Key research topics include the development of evidence-based policy recommendations for fair and ethical AI applications, the integration of AI in enhancing creativity and competitiveness within CCI, and the establishment of frameworks for managing intellectual property rights in AI contexts. Additionally, the call encourages initiatives that foster collaboration among artists, AI developers, and cultural institutions to promote innovation and address challenges such as bias, employment shifts, and the preservation of cultural diversity.

title: Impacts of culture and the arts on health and well-being
summary_text: The grant call focuses on the intersection of arts, culture, and health, emphasizing their impact on well-being and social cohesion. Key research topics include the evaluation of arts and culture-based interventions for health promotion, mental health, and the well-being of specific populations such as children, the elderly, and forcibly displaced individuals. Additionally, the call seeks to identify research gaps, develop policy guidelines, and foster cross-sectoral cooperation among health, culture, social care, and education sectors to enhance the understanding and implementation of effective cultural practices in health contexts.

title: The autocratic appeal: nature, drivers and strategies
summary_text: The grant call focuses on researching the rise of autocratic tendencies within established democracies, including the mechanisms of digital authoritarianism and the erosion of human rights. Key topics include the analysis of factors contributing to authoritarianism, strategies for resistance against autocratisation, and the role of various societal actors, such as media and civil society, in combating these trends. Additionally, the call emphasizes the need for multidisciplinary approaches to understand and counteract the interplay between autocracy, public perception, and the digital landscape.

title: Community of democracy practitioners and researchers
summary_text: The key research topics focus on strengthening democracy through enhanced networking and collaboration among researchers, policymakers, and civil society organizations across Europe. The scientific focus areas include civic participation, deliberation, citizenship education, and the development of innovative methodologies and tools for democratic engagement. Additionally, the initiative aims to produce accessible policy recommendations, facilitate capacity-building activities, and promote inclusive participatory democracy at various governance levels.

title: Towards a European research hub on contemporary antisemitism and Jewish life and culture
summary_text: The grant call focuses on establishing a research hub dedicated to contemporary antisemitism and Jewish life in Europe, aiming to create a network of researchers and practitioners. Key research topics include identifying research gaps, developing methodological standards, and fostering connections between research and policymaking to enhance Jewish life in Europe. The initiative also emphasizes training opportunities for early career researchers and aims to stimulate interest and growth in the field through various programs and collaborations.

title: Gender differences in career trajectories of parents and their implications for gender equality and family well-being
summary_text: The research topics focus on understanding gender differences in parental career trajectories and their impact on gender inequalities in the labor market and family well-being. Key areas of investigation include the effects of childcare-related decisions, the division of unpaid labor, and the influence of socio-economic status, household composition, and cultural norms on these trajectories. Proposals should also explore the implications of early childhood education systems, workplace cultures, and the economic costs associated with motherhood penalties, particularly for diverse family structures and marginalized groups.

title: Innovative approaches to intangible cultural heritage for societal resilience
summary_text: The grant call focuses on the role of intangible cultural heritage (ICH) in addressing contemporary societal challenges, particularly in relation to climate change, community resilience, and cultural dynamics in Europe. Key research topics include the assessment of ICH's potential for societal resilience, innovative practices for safeguarding ICH, the use of digital technologies for documentation and transmission, and the promotion of community engagement, especially among youth. Additionally, the call emphasizes the need for sustainable practices that leverage ICH for economic development while ensuring cultural preservation and addressing gender dynamics.

title: Co-funded European partnership for Resilient Cultural Heritage
summary_text: This grant call focuses on enhancing the resilience of cultural heritage in the context of climate change, emphasizing interdisciplinary research that integrates cultural heritage with climate science. Key research topics include the impact of climate change on tangible and intangible cultural heritage, the development of innovative preservation techniques, and the creation of policy recommendations to improve climate adaptation and mitigation strategies. The initiative aims to foster collaboration among various stakeholders, including researchers, policymakers, and cultural heritage professionals, to address the challenges posed by climate change while promoting sustainable development and social cohesion.

title: Data stewards, skills and training for Open Science and FAIR practices
summary_text: The key research topics focus on the professionalization and skill enhancement of data stewards in Europe, promoting Open Science and FAIR principles across all research career stages. This includes the development of consistent core curricula for data stewardship, the establishment of competence networks, and the integration of Open Science practices into research assessment. Additionally, the initiative aims to foster collaboration among existing competence centers and support underrepresented countries and institutions in adopting these practices.

title: Using Generative AI (GenAI4EU ) for Scientific Research via EOSC
summary_text: The grant call focuses on leveraging Generative AI to enhance scientific research through the European Open Science Cloud (EOSC). Key research topics include the development of machine-readable datasets for AI applications, improving data quality and FAIRness across various scientific domains, and creating protocols for secure data sharing and automatic workflows. Additionally, the call emphasizes the need for community engagement and training to facilitate the integration of Generative AI in scientific workflows, as well as the exploration of real-life use cases in fields such as biology, healthcare, materials science, and environmental monitoring.

title: New technologies and solutions for reducing the environmental and climate footprint of research infrastructures
summary_text: The key research topics focus on developing innovative technologies and solutions aimed at significantly reducing the environmental and climate footprint of research infrastructures throughout their life cycle. Proposals should emphasize methodologies for assessing environmental impacts, enhancing resource efficiency, and implementing sustainable practices, including energy consumption reduction and improved data management. Additionally, the scope includes training for staff, action plans for wider deployment, and community engagement to ensure the effective integration of these solutions.

title: Advancing AI-readiness and Machine-Actionability in the EOSC Ecosystem
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing AI-readiness and machine-actionability within the European Open Science Cloud (EOSC) ecosystem. Key research topics include the development of tools for machine-actionable repositories, the integration of AI/ML solutions for data FAIRification, and the establishment of federated infrastructure services for AI model training and inference. Additionally, the call emphasizes the importance of open data and research software for transparency and reproducibility in AI/ML, as well as the creation of an EOSC AI/ML competency center to support researchers in utilizing these technologies effectively.

title: AI-powered impact simulations in support of the Destination Earth initiative
summary_text: The grant call focuses on the innovative application of AI to enhance impact assessments through digital twins and real-time data integration, aiming to improve decision-making for non-technical users and policymakers. It emphasizes the development of novel interfaces, best practices for AI-powered analysis, and the establishment of a robust framework for reliable and transparent AI use in Earth system science. Proposals should address diverse user needs, leverage existing research infrastructures, and foster collaboration with key European initiatives like Destination Earth.

title: Training and up-skilling of research infrastructures technical staff
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing the skills and career opportunities of technical staff in research infrastructures across Europe. Key research topics include the development of training programs tailored to specific needs within various research domains, promoting mobility through staff exchanges, and addressing common challenges such as digital skills, research data management, and artificial intelligence. Proposals should aim to create a cohesive training service that facilitates collaboration and optimizes training offerings across different research infrastructure domains.

title: Preparatory actions exploring future frameworks for research infrastructures investment plans and funding streams, for integrated and sustained scheme for access and for joint technology development.
summary_text: The grant call focuses on three key research areas related to enhancing European research infrastructures. Area 1 emphasizes strengthening investment plans and diversifying funding streams for research infrastructures, aiming to improve financial visibility and strategic planning. Area 2 seeks to develop a more integrated and sustainable access scheme for research infrastructures, promoting seamless access for diverse user communities, including those from Widening countries. Area 3 focuses on establishing a framework for joint technology developments across research infrastructures, fostering collaboration, standardization, and innovation to optimize resource use and enhance technological capabilities.

title: Research infrastructure services to enable R&I addressing main challenges and EU priorities
summary_text:
The grant call focuses on four key research areas: 

1. **Advanced Biotechnology and Biomanufacturing**: Enhancing research infrastructure services to support innovation in industrial biotechnology, improve access for researchers, and promote knowledge sharing and standardization to align with the European Green Deal objectives.

2. **Radionuclides and Facilities**: Facilitating access to novel radionuclides for medical research, supporting the development of new treatments, and ensuring the safe use of radiological technology in healthcare.

3. **Climate Change Understanding and Prediction**: Improving access to advanced Earth system models and high-performance computing resources to enhance the understanding of climate change impacts and support effective climate policies.

4. **New Aviation Fuels and Combustion Technologies**: Enabling research on sustainable aviation fuels and combustion technologies to enhance the competitiveness of the European aviation industry, including the development of testing capabilities for new fuels.

title: Research infrastructure services to enable R&I addressing main challenges and EU priorities related to the health domain
summary_text:
The grant call focuses on three key research areas within the health domain: 

1. **Epidemic Response**: Development of research infrastructure services to support the identification and mitigation of emerging pathogens, enhancing preparedness for infectious disease epidemics through improved access to data and intervention tools.
   
2. **Paediatric Research**: Advancement of clinical research infrastructure aimed at accelerating the development of tailored medicines and therapies for children, facilitating innovative trial designs and data sharing to meet regulatory requirements.

3. **Environmental Health**: Integration of research services to investigate the impact of environmental factors on human health, promoting the development of risk assessment tools and innovative methods to understand and prevent health issues linked to environmental exposure.

title: Implementing research infrastructure technology roadmaps
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing the technological capabilities and competitiveness of European research infrastructures through the co-development of advanced technologies in collaboration with industrial partners, including SMEs. Key research topics include the development of fundamental technologies and methodologies for efficient use of research infrastructures, prototyping of high-performance instruments, and addressing environmental impacts. Proposals should emphasize innovation through knowledge transfer, the establishment of partnerships with industry, and the implementation of existing technology roadmaps to meet the needs of diverse research communities.

title: Early phase implementation of ESFRI Projects that entered the ESFRI Roadmap in 2021
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing the implementation of ESFRI Projects that entered the ESFRI Roadmap in 2021, emphasizing their scientific excellence and strategic importance for the European Research Area. Key research topics include addressing critical bottlenecks in the early stages of research infrastructure development, such as governance structure establishment, funding security, ICT and data management solutions, and user access policies. Proposals should aim to foster collaboration among stakeholders to ensure successful project advancement and financial commitments.

title: Research infrastructure services advancing frontier knowledge (bottom-up)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing access to advanced research infrastructures for curiosity-driven research across various scientific domains, particularly those not covered by Horizon Europe. Key areas of emphasis include providing trans-national and virtual access to integrated research services, improving data management and interoperability, fostering cross-disciplinary collaboration, and training a new generation of researchers in utilizing these infrastructures effectively. Proposals should aim to optimize existing services, ensure sustainability, and promote the sharing of knowledge and technologies among researchers.

title: AI-generated digital twins for science
summary_text: The grant call focuses on the innovative application of generative artificial intelligence (AI) to create and manage digital twins of complex real-world systems, enhancing research infrastructures across various sectors such as healthcare, transportation, agriculture, and manufacturing. Key research topics include the development of best practices for model generation, simulation-observation data fusion, and the establishment of guidelines for non-technical decision-makers to utilize AI-driven simulations effectively. Proposals should demonstrate the ability to set up complex modeling scenarios, ensure data-driven approaches, and contribute to European AI initiatives while addressing socio-economic challenges and promoting sustainable practices.

title: Consolidation of the Research Infrastructure landscape – Individual support for evolution, long term sustainability and emerging needs of pan-European research infrastructures
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing the sustainability and effectiveness of European Research Infrastructures (RIs), particularly ESFRI Landmarks and ERICs. Key research topics include the expansion of membership, international cooperation, development of managerial skills, and the integration of remote access and FAIR data management. Additionally, the call emphasizes addressing new research and societal challenges, optimizing resource use, and fostering innovation within the context of environmental sustainability and collaboration with industry.

title: Support to the European Strategy Forum on Research Infrastructures
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing the efficiency and impact of the European Strategy Forum on Research Infrastructures (ESFRI) by supporting the development and implementation of the ESFRI Roadmap, improving evaluation and monitoring of research infrastructures, and fostering cooperation among stakeholders. Key research topics include the use of analytical tools for impact assessment, the development of communication strategies, and the promotion of best practices among research infrastructure managers. Additionally, the project emphasizes the importance of open-source software development and collaboration with the European Commission's Joint Research Centre.

title: Research infrastructure services advancing frontier knowledge
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing access to advanced research infrastructures for curiosity-driven research across various scientific domains, specifically in environmental studies (atmospheric chemistry and dynamics) and physical sciences (hadron physics). It aims to improve and harmonize research infrastructure services, foster cross-disciplinary collaboration, and train a new generation of researchers in data stewardship and the effective use of these infrastructures. Proposals should emphasize the provision of trans-national and virtual access to integrated services, ensuring sustainability and compliance with European research standards.

title: FAIR Integration for Enhanced Research Data in the EOSC ecosystem and beyond
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing the findability, accessibility, interoperability, and reusability (FAIRness) of research data within the European Open Science Cloud (EOSC). Key research topics include the development of FAIR-by-Design digital objects, automated standardization and data quality assessment tools, and operational data services that support the transformation of digital objects into FAIR entities. Additionally, the call emphasizes the importance of promoting open standards for metadata and interoperability, cross-sector data utilization, and collaboration with existing initiatives to ensure alignment and complementarity in advancing the EOSC framework.

title: EOSC Nodes with federating capabilities for the EOSC Federation
summary_text: The call focuses on the development and expansion of the European Open Science Cloud (EOSC) federation, emphasizing the establishment of a network of EOSC nodes that enhance collaboration and resilience within the system. Key research topics include the integration of federating capabilities such as authentication, research catalogues, and application workflows, as well as addressing technical, legal, and organizational gaps to ensure compliance with EOSC governance and sustainability. Proposals should also aim to refine best practices for onboarding and support community engagement around the EOSC ecosystem.

title: Quantum Computing – complementing the quantum computing FPAs with the development of a technology agnostic software stack (RIA)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on establishing a universal, interoperable quantum computing ecosystem that integrates quantum and classical computing systems, including high-performance computing (HPC) and cloud services. Key research topics include the development of a technology-agnostic software stack, standardized software architectures, and effective workflows that demonstrate quantum advantages in solving complex computational challenges. Additionally, the call emphasizes collaboration with existing initiatives, open-source software development, and training for quantum programming to enhance the overall quantum computing landscape in Europe.

title: Core technologies for virtual worlds (RIA) (Virtual Worlds and Photonics Partnerships)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing core technologies for Virtual Worlds, emphasizing two main research areas: Area A, which aims to enhance multimodal immersion through innovative interactions combining various sensory modalities (e.g., haptics, vision, and smell), and Area B, which targets the development of advanced optics and photonics technologies to improve the performance of display and sensing devices. Proposals should prioritize user experience, integration of technologies, and ethical considerations, while also involving social sciences to maximize societal impact.

title: Drive the evolution of the internet towards open and interoperable Web 4.0 and Virtual Worlds: building blocks in priority areas (RIA) (Virtual Worlds Partnership)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing the development of an open and interoperable Web 4.0, emphasizing key areas such as identity management, software supply chain security, open hardware, decentralized solutions, and virtual worlds. It aims to leverage Open Source technologies and digital commons to enhance user experience, security, and scalability while fostering new business models and sustainability. Proposals should demonstrate innovative applications and integration of these technologies to support the transition towards a more collaborative and user-centered internet ecosystem.

title: Alignment of stakeholders towards the supply-side large-scale pilot of end-to-end infrastructures integrating device, network computing and communication capabilities (CSA)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on the development of end-to-end infrastructures that integrate device, network computing, and communication capabilities, emphasizing collaboration among stakeholders from various sectors, including telecoms, software, and AI. Key research topics include the alignment of supply and demand strategies for infrastructure services, the creation of open-source Telco Edge Cloud building blocks, and the exploration of emerging paradigms in vertical domains such as virtual worlds and edge computing. Additionally, the call encourages the assessment of monetization strategies and interoperability within the telco-cloud-edge-IoT ecosystem.

title: Supporting Digital Partnerships in Quantum technologies (RIA)
summary_text: This grant call focuses on enhancing cooperation between the EU and the Republic of Korea in quantum technologies, specifically in quantum communication, computing, simulation, and sensing. Key research topics include the co-design of hardware and software for quantum applications, development of secure quantum communication protocols, and application-specific quantum sensor development, all aimed at addressing technological and societal challenges while fostering international collaboration and knowledge exchange. Proposals should emphasize mutual benefits and the integration of various disciplines, as well as contribute to the advancement of the quantum ecosystem in both regions.

title: Innovative Advanced Materials (IAMs) for conformable, flexible or stretchable electronics (RIA) (Innovative Advanced Materials for Europe partnership)
summary_text: The key research topics focus on the development of conformable, flexible, and stretchable electronic devices and circuits, emphasizing sustainable electronics made from low environmental impact materials. The scientific focus areas include the discovery of Innovative Advanced Materials (IAMs) for high-performance flexible electronics, addressing challenges such as user discomfort, environmental impact, and the limited performance of current materials. Additionally, the proposals should explore reparability and recyclability of electronic devices, compatibility with energy-efficient manufacturing processes, and the integration of these innovations into existing standards and collaborative initiatives.

title: Continuation of the Quantum Technologies Flagship (CSA)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing quantum technologies in Europe through the establishment of a global observatory that reports on advancements and competitive standing, supports Flagship projects, and fosters collaboration among researchers and innovators. Key areas include enhancing communication strategies to raise awareness of quantum technologies, promoting sustainable growth by exploring new applications, and coordinating efforts between the EU and Member States to align strategies and enhance international relations. Additionally, the initiative aims to compile and disseminate data on quantum technologies, support governance structures, and organize events like the European Quantum Technologies Conference.

title: Robust and trustworthy GenerativeAI for Robotics and industrial automation (RIA) (AI/Data/Robotics & Made in Europe Partnerships)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on two main research areas: Type A, which emphasizes the development of generative AI for robotics aimed at enhancing autonomy, adaptability, and real-time learning in industrial automation; and Type B, which targets the creation of trustworthy generative AI solutions to improve manufacturing processes, productivity, and sustainability. Both types seek to leverage advanced AI models to address complex industrial challenges, enhance operational efficiency, and ensure compliance with safety and cybersecurity standards in manufacturing environments.

title: Large-scale pilots for supply end-to-end infrastructures integrating device, network computing and communication capabilities for Telco Edge Cloud deployments, as a basis for Connected Collaborative Computing Networks (3C networks) (RIA)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing the integration of telco edge cloud infrastructures to enhance European industrial ecosystems, particularly in sectors like automotive, aerospace, and health. Key research topics include the development of open orchestration platforms, AI-enabled resource management, and the convergence of connectivity with edge and cloud computing to support innovative applications and services. The initiative aims to foster strategic cooperation among stakeholders, ensuring the integration of security, privacy, and sustainability in the deployment of next-generation digital infrastructures.

title: International cooperation in semiconductors (CSA)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing Europe's position in the global semiconductor value chain through evidence-based cooperation with leading semiconductor countries. Key research topics include mapping supply chains, identifying emerging technologies for collaboration, analyzing risks to technological competitiveness and economic security, and promoting standardization and researcher mobility in semiconductor and semiconductor-based photonics. The initiative aims to support the European Commission and Member States in defining strategic research areas and implementing effective international cooperation measures.

title: Strengthening the fabless Start-up and SME ecosystem in Europe (CSA)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing support for European fabless semiconductor startups, SMEs, and mid-caps, aiming to foster innovation and economic growth in the semiconductor sector. Key research topics include the development of a sustainable network for these companies, facilitating dialogue with stakeholders, providing access to funding and technological updates, and promoting advanced semiconductor technologies such as AI, low-power computing, and autonomous driving. The initiative seeks to strengthen the representation and influence of fabless SMEs within the European semiconductor ecosystem and improve their access to resources and collaborative opportunities.

title: Preparing the Advancement of the state of the art of submarine cable infrastructures (CSA)
summary_text: The key research topics focus on enhancing European leadership in submarine cable technology, including the construction, operation, maintenance, and repair of submarine cable infrastructures.
