Specific areas of interest include the development of multi-core fiber technology, digital signal processing, intelligent sensing, and underwater robotics, as well as ensuring resilience and sustainability in submarine cable networks. The initiative aims to create a comprehensive research and innovation roadmap that addresses critical components and technologies while promoting synergies with existing digital infrastructure projects.

title: Fostering Innovative and Compliant Data Ecosystems (IA) (AI, Data and Robotics Partnership)
summary_text:
The grant call focuses on three key research areas: 

1. Development of advanced compliance technologies that integrate AI, cybersecurity, and language technologies to streamline compliance processes and enhance understanding of complex legal texts.
2. Creation of automatic or semi-automatic tools for ensuring compliance in data transactions and data spaces, particularly within the framework of Common European Data Spaces.
3. Generation and management of synthetic data to improve data quality, availability, and representativeness, while addressing the limitations of real-world data and ensuring ethical use.

title: GenAI4EU central Hub (CSA) (AI/Data/Robotics Partnership)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on establishing the GenAI4EU HUB to foster a robust European ecosystem for generative AI (GenAI) by enhancing collaboration among developers, users, and stakeholders across various strategic application sectors. Key research topics include the development of high-impact GenAI applications, data sharing and interoperability mechanisms, and the promotion of trustworthy AI practices, particularly in sectors such as robotics, automotive, and healthcare. The initiative aims to support the European Commission's AI Office, facilitate knowledge exchange, and assess the uptake of GenAI solutions in industry while ensuring compliance with data privacy regulations.

title: GenAI4EU: Generative AI for Virtual Worlds:  Advanced technologies for better performance and hyper personalised and immersive experience (IA) (AI/Data/Robotics & Virtual Worlds Partnerships)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing Generative AI to create immersive and innovative Virtual Worlds, emphasizing the development of realistic environments and personalized user experiences. Key research topics include the creation of smart digital assistants and 3D chatbots to enhance navigation, accessibility, and communication within these virtual spaces, particularly for users with diverse backgrounds and abilities. Proposals should integrate Social Sciences and Humanities to maximize societal impact and foster collaboration with existing initiatives in AI, data, and robotics.

title: Roadmap for next generation computing technologies from IoT device level to edge to cloud to HPC (CSA)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on supporting the European computing ecosystem through the development of annually updated roadmaps that encompass a wide range of computing topics, from edge-IoT devices to high-performance computing (HPC). Key research areas include real-time computing, security, artificial intelligence, and the application of generative AI in computing system engineering. The initiative aims to foster collaboration among academic and industrial stakeholders while aligning with strategic research and innovation agendas across various computing domains.

title: Post-exascale HPC (CSA)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing research in post-exascale high-performance computing (HPC), artificial intelligence (AI), and quantum computing. Key topics include the development of a comprehensive roadmap for addressing challenges in applications, algorithms, software, hardware, and systems, with a strong emphasis on AI integration. Additionally, the initiative aims to foster collaboration among European and international stakeholders to create a competitive ecosystem that encompasses AI Factories and future AI Gigafactories, while analyzing critical technologies and research challenges in the converging fields of HPC, AI, and quantum computing.

title: Challenge-Driven GenAI4EU Booster (RIA) (AI/Data/Robotics Partnership)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing Generative AI (GenAI) applications in three key sectors: aerospace, pharmaceuticals/drug development, and telecommunications. It aims to foster innovation and competitiveness by organizing a multi-stage competition that encourages the development of GenAI solutions to address specific industry challenges, with an emphasis on collaboration among industry players and the integration of user feedback to enhance the impact of the proposed solutions. Proposals should detail methodologies for the competition, support for participants, and strategies for maximizing the adoption of successful GenAI applications within their respective sectors.

title: Open Internet Stack: development of technological commons/open-source 3C building blocks (RIA)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on developing an Open-Source framework that enhances internet technologies related to trust, transactions, connectivity, and decentralization, aligned with the European vision for next-generation digital infrastructures. Key research topics include trust technologies (such as privacy-enhancing technologies and AI-based agents), network and connectivity technologies tailored for large-scale pilots, and decentralized technologies that ensure interoperability across networks. The initiative aims to foster a European ecosystem of contributors to digital commons, emphasizing compliance with EU regulations and promoting user empowerment and sovereignty.

title: Innovative Advanced Materials (IAMs) for photonics, enabling low-power and ultra-broadband performance for telecommunication (RIA) (Innovative Advanced Materials for Europe partnership)
summary_text: The key research topics focus on the development and application of Innovative Advanced Materials (IAMs), particularly two-dimensional materials and electro-optical polymers, for integrated photonic devices aimed at enhancing telecommunications networks. The emphasis is on creating low-power, high-performance, and scalable photonic integrated technologies, including ultrafast circuits, modulators, and optical interconnects, while ensuring compatibility with existing manufacturing processes and electronic systems. Proposals should also explore innovative design and fabrication methods, aiming for market-ready prototypes that demonstrate the added value of these advanced materials.

title: Specific support for the Virtual Worlds Partnership and the Web 4.0 initiative (CSA) (Virtual Worlds Partnership)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing research and innovation in Virtual Worlds and Web 4.0, emphasizing the development of inclusive, trustworthy, and interoperable systems that align with European values. Key topics include the establishment of a European Virtual Worlds Partnership, the creation of Strategic Research and Innovation Agendas (SRIAs) for both Virtual Worlds and Web 4.0, and the promotion of collaboration among academia, industry, and public stakeholders to foster a competitive ecosystem. Additionally, the call highlights the importance of addressing ethical, legal, and societal issues, as well as standardization efforts to support the growth of the virtual worlds industry.

title: MSCA4Ukraine Fellowships 2025
summary_text: The grant call focuses on supporting displaced researchers from Ukraine to continue their research activities in EU Member States or Horizon Europe Associated Countries, with an emphasis on fostering scientific excellence, skills development, and inter-sectoral mobility. Key research topics include the development of new scientific knowledge through original research, innovation and entrepreneurship, and the enhancement of networking and communication capacities within the research community. The initiative aims to strengthen the integration of Ukrainian researchers into the EU research landscape while facilitating their eventual reintegration into Ukraine when conditions permit.

title: Critical elements for energy security of grid and storage technologies
summary_text: The grant call focuses on developing advanced solutions to enhance energy security in European energy networks and storage technologies. Key research topics include addressing cybersecurity risks in energy systems, promoting circular economy practices for critical materials in energy technologies, and improving the sustainability and public perception of energy networks and storage systems. Proposals should aim to create innovative solutions that bolster the resilience and performance of these systems while considering the broader value chain and workforce skills necessary for inclusivity and competitiveness.

title: Cost-effective next-generation batteries for long-duration stationary storage (Batt4EU Partnership)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on the development of advanced battery materials aimed at enhancing energy storage capabilities, specifically targeting storage durations from 10 hours to seasonal storage. Key research topics include minimizing the use of Critical Raw Materials (CRM), improving the longevity and efficiency of energy storage systems, and exploring alternative battery technologies that are safe, sustainable, and suitable for large-scale manufacturing. Additionally, projects are encouraged to utilize computational models and AI methods for materials discovery and cell design, while ensuring compliance with EU regulations on safety and sustainability.

title: Optimised/Alternative Silicon Growth Technologies (from either liquid or gaseous phase) for PV Applications (EUPI-PV Partnership)
summary_text: The key research topics focus on improving the efficiency and sustainability of crystalline silicon photovoltaic (PV) solar cells. This includes developing alternative, scalable processes for growing silicon ingots and wafers that reduce energy and material consumption, optimizing existing manufacturing methods to minimize defects and waste, and enhancing the overall lifecycle performance of PV products. Additionally, the research aims to support the scaling-up of solar PV manufacturing capacity in Europe to meet decarbonization targets and reduce reliance on critical raw materials.

title: European investment atlas of potential CO2 storage sites
summary_text: The key research topics focus on the development of a Carbon Capture and Storage (CCS) value chain in the EU, specifically addressing the identification and assessment of geological CO2 storage sites to meet the EU's storage targets. The project aims to create a digital atlas of investable underground storage space, evaluate injection and storage capacities, and rank potential storage sites based on their readiness and proximity to emitters, while considering environmental and security aspects. Collaboration with national and regional geological authorities is essential for data access and effective management of subsurface resources.

title: Support to the SET Plan community
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing research and innovation in various clean energy sectors, including geothermal energy, hydropower, ocean energy, photovoltaics, renewable fuels, wind energy, and energy efficiency. It aims to support the implementation of the Strategic Energy Technology Plan (SET Plan) in alignment with the European Green Deal and related policies, emphasizing the development of strategic research agendas, market analyses, and addressing challenges such as energy security, technological innovation, and societal transformation. Additionally, the call encourages stakeholder engagement across industry, research, and civil society to ensure comprehensive participation and address societal needs in the clean energy transition.

title: Building a Long-Term Africa Union (AU) and European Union (EU) Research and Innovation joint collaboration on Sustainable Renewable Energies
summary_text: The key research topics and scientific focus areas of this grant call include the development of a sustainable AU-EU Research and Innovation Partnership on Climate Change and Sustainable Energy, with an emphasis on green transition and energy access in Sub-Saharan Africa. The proposal aims to enhance collaboration among researchers, industries, and policymakers, while also focusing on capacity-building, community engagement, and the translation of innovations into practical applications. Additionally, it seeks to analyze the impact of existing EU-Africa projects in sustainable energy and promote synergies with ongoing initiatives to strengthen the overall partnership framework.

title: Novel inverter technologies and flexibility in PV systems (EUPI-PV Partnership)
summary_text: The key research topics focus on the development and integration of advanced smart inverter technologies for renewable energy systems, particularly photovoltaics (PV). This includes designing novel inverters with enhanced power density and reliability, creating robust control algorithms, ensuring electromagnetic compatibility, and facilitating communication between inverters and other energy components. Additionally, the research aims to improve energy efficiency, flexibility, and interoperability within electric distribution systems while addressing cybersecurity and system integration challenges.

title: Control and operation tools for a RES-based energy system
summary_text: The key research topics focus on the integration of renewable energy sources (RES) into electricity systems, emphasizing innovative technologies and control mechanisms for both transmission and distribution levels. Projects should address network constraints, enhance grid flexibility, and ensure effective coordination between different voltage levels to maintain grid stability. Additionally, there is a strong emphasis on collaboration among transmission and distribution system operators, energy suppliers, and service providers to develop best practices for achieving the EU's renewable energy targets for 2030.

title: Effects of CO2-stream impurities on CO2 transport and storage
summary_text: The grant call focuses on the design and safe operation of CO2 transport and storage systems, particularly addressing the challenges posed by impurities in CO2 streams. Key research topics include the effects of impure CO2 on thermophysical properties, corrosion risks in pipelines and storage sites, and the development of guidelines for public health and safety. Additionally, projects should explore transient flow modeling, geochemical interactions, and the impact of impurities on equipment and infrastructure integrity.

title: NZIA regulatory sandbox exchange forum support
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing Europe's net-zero technology manufacturing ecosystem through the establishment of net-zero regulatory sandboxes. Key research topics include regulatory learning to identify barriers and facilitators for innovative net-zero technologies, comparative analyses of national legislative frameworks, and the development of best practices for sandbox schemes. Additionally, the call emphasizes stakeholder engagement, particularly with SMEs and start-ups, to foster innovation and ensure effective dissemination of findings and data accessibility.

title: Support to the BRIDGE initiative
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing research and innovation policies in smart and integrated energy systems, particularly through the BRIDGE initiative, which consolidates projects from Horizon 2020 and Horizon Europe. Key research topics include Smart Grids, Energy Storage, Digitalisation, and the development of evidence-based energy policies. The initiative aims to facilitate knowledge exchange, provide policy support, and improve cooperation among European energy initiatives to foster innovation and address barriers in the energy sector.

title: Clean Energy Transition Co-Funded Partnership
summary_text: The key research topics and scientific focus areas of the Clean Energy Transition Co-fund Partnership include the development of innovative technologies and solutions for transitioning energy systems towards climate neutrality, enhancing energy independence, and fostering an innovation ecosystem that supports clean energy across various sectors such as transport, buildings, and industry. The initiative aims to align research and innovation efforts across Europe, adapt to regional energy needs, and engage consumers in the energy transition, ultimately contributing to the EU's goal of becoming the first climate-neutral continent by 2050.

title: Development of hydropower technologies and water management schemes allowing for win-win situation of flexible hydropower and biodiversity improvement – Societal Readiness Pilot
summary_text: The key research topics focus on enhancing the capacity and flexibility of hydropower systems to support renewable energy integration while promoting sustainability and positive impacts on river ecosystems and biodiversity. Proposals should explore innovative hydropower technology solutions and improved water management schemes that address issues such as hydropeaking, sediment transport, and river morphology restoration, while also considering climate change effects and community engagement. The aim is to develop solutions that optimize hydropower generation efficiency and environmental performance, ensuring a balance between energy production and ecological health.

title: Sustainable processing and refining of raw materials to produce battery grade Li-ion battery materials (Batt4EU Partnership)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing the European Union's autonomy in the battery raw materials sector by developing innovative business models and increasing processing capacities for battery-grade metals and active materials. Key research topics include the sustainable and efficient processing of primary and secondary raw materials, particularly lithium, cobalt, graphite, nickel, manganese, and phosphorus, as well as promoting circular battery value chains and improving societal acceptance of processing facilities. Projects should demonstrate advanced technologies for large-scale adoption and evaluate the social and environmental impacts of proposed solutions.

title: Cross-regional network and market model for optimisation of long duration storage
summary_text: The key research topics focus on the development and optimization of Long-Duration Energy Storage (LDES) systems in cross-regional energy networks, particularly in the context of integrating intermittent renewable energy sources. The project aims to create advanced models and tools for strategic LDES integration, assessing its impact on cost-benefit analysis, grid operation, and decarbonization pathways. Additionally, it will explore the combination of LDES with renewable energy production and other sectors, while identifying barriers and proposing policy recommendations to enhance LDES deployment and system reliability.

title: Using captured CO2 as a resource to replace fossil hydrocarbons in industrial production
summary_text: The key research topics focus on the economic potential of CO2 utilization, specifically in developing innovative solutions for recycling CO2 into advanced synthetic fuels, chemicals, and materials. Proposals should aim to reduce the capital and environmental footprint of CO2 conversion technologies, assess their economic feasibility for commercial scaling, and establish targets for energy efficiency and product competitiveness. Additionally, rigorous life-cycle analysis (LCA) is required to evaluate the sustainability impacts of proposed solutions, while ensuring compatibility with industrial CO2 capture processes.

title: Novel approaches to geothermal resources development
summary_text: The grant call focuses on innovative approaches to geothermal resource development, specifically in shallow and low/mid enthalpy (0-500 meters, below 150ºC) and deep and high enthalpy (beyond 500 meters, above 150ºC) geothermal systems. Key research topics include advancements in subsurface engineering, drilling techniques, reservoir characterization, and the integration of AI and robotics in geothermal projects, with an emphasis on reducing costs, risks, and environmental impacts while ensuring alignment with societal values and engagement. Proposals should also address the technological and operational challenges in geothermal energy deployment, including safety, efficiency, and responsiveness to local cultural contexts.

title: Innovative manufacturing of wind energy technologies
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing wind energy manufacturing technologies to enhance health and safety, reduce environmental impacts, and improve efficiency throughout the supply chain. Key research topics include the development of innovative manufacturing solutions that promote circularity, lower costs, and increase production throughput, as well as the automation of processes to ensure high-quality and reliable wind energy systems. Additionally, proposals should address the sustainability of these solutions and consider standardization efforts, with a particular emphasis on gender dimensions in health and safety improvements.

title: Coordinated call with India on waste to renewable hydrogen
summary_text: The grant call focuses on developing innovative technologies for producing renewable hydrogen from biogenic wastes, such as agricultural and industrial by-products, through biochemical and thermochemical pathways. Key research topics include enhancing resource efficiency, reducing greenhouse gas emissions, improving safety measures, and assessing the economic feasibility and sustainability of hydrogen production processes. Collaboration between EU and Indian researchers is emphasized to optimize production methods, develop new catalysts, and improve separation techniques, contributing to a sustainable hydrogen economy.

title: Fostering the European battery ecosystem by providing accurate and up-to-date information and stimulating excellence in the European battery R&I community (Batt4EU Partnership)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing the European battery value chain through research and innovation (R&I) by establishing a comprehensive information platform that tracks the state-of-the-art in battery technology, sets technical targets, and monitors progress. It aims to foster collaboration among stakeholders, including national and regional groups, and promote best practices in battery research across Europe. Key activities include organizing community events, analyzing global battery roadmaps, and supporting the industrial exploitation of research results in energy and transport applications.

title: Innovative approaches for sustainable, inclusive and beautiful social and affordable housing
summary_text: The key research topics focus on developing innovative construction and renovation approaches for social and affordable housing that enhance sustainability, reduce costs, and improve quality. This includes utilizing advanced building technologies, environmentally sustainable practices, and ensuring aesthetic integration with local contexts. Additionally, the proposals should emphasize participatory and transdisciplinary methods, involving various stakeholders to enhance societal impact and well-being for diverse and vulnerable populations.

title: Renovating the built environment through design for adaptability and disassembly.
summary_text: The research topics focus on the renovation of existing buildings, common spaces, and infrastructures through design for adaptability and disassembly, emphasizing circular economy principles. Key areas include developing innovative renovation processes and techniques that facilitate modular adaptation and repurposing, assessing barriers to market uptake, and quantifying the impacts of these methods across economic, environmental, social, and cultural dimensions. Proposals should adopt a participatory approach, integrating various stakeholders and disciplines to enhance societal impact.

title: Fostering and maintaining the social fabric for the green transition in neighbourhoods
summary_text: The research topics focus on the relationship between cultural participation, social connections, and civic engagement within neighborhoods, particularly in the context of supporting green transitions. Key areas of investigation include the conditions that enhance social fabric and civic engagement through cultural activities, the benefits of cultural participation for marginalized communities, and the development of evidence-based strategies to foster community engagement and belonging. Additionally, the proposals should emphasize a participatory approach involving various stakeholders and disciplines, particularly in social sciences and humanities, to ensure meaningful societal impact.

title: Network of neighbourhoods for innovative policies on gentrification
summary_text: The grant call focuses on research topics related to mitigating the negative impacts of gentrification while enhancing its positive effects, such as revitalization and sustainable economic growth. Key areas of interest include the development of innovative policies, strategies for neighborhood regeneration, and the empowerment of local communities in decision-making processes. Proposals should emphasize participatory approaches, the integration of social sciences, and the exchange of knowledge among diverse stakeholders to address the complexities of gentrification across urban, peri-urban, and rural contexts.

title: Bio-fabricated materials for sustainable and beautiful construction
summary_text: The grant call focuses on the development and testing of innovative, sustainable bio-fabricated construction materials that offer unique features such as self-repair capabilities, carbon storage, and adaptability to environmental changes. It emphasizes the need for research to overcome technical challenges, assess the materials' properties and applications, and analyze their environmental and social impacts through life cycle assessments. Proposals should adopt a participatory approach, integrating various stakeholders and disciplines to facilitate the widespread acceptance and integration of these materials in the construction ecosystem.

title: Sufficiency measures in the built environment
summary_text: The grant call focuses on exploring and validating sufficiency measures in the built environment to optimize the use of vacant and under-utilized spaces, thereby reducing the demand for energy, materials, and other resources. Key research topics include mapping and quantifying these spaces, testing sufficiency measures that enhance functionality, and addressing non-technical barriers to implementation. The approach emphasizes a participatory and transdisciplinary methodology, integrating various stakeholders and disciplines to enhance societal impact and sustainability within planetary boundaries.

title: Beautiful, sustainable and inclusive street furniture for the transformation of neighbourhoods
summary_text: The grant call focuses on the design and development of innovative street furniture that enhances public spaces in European neighborhoods, particularly addressing issues of accessibility, safety, and environmental sustainability. Key research topics include the integration of participatory design methods involving various stakeholders, the use of sustainable materials, and the incorporation of aesthetic and cultural elements to foster community identity and social interaction. Additionally, the call emphasizes the importance of co-creation and evidence-based approaches to inform procurement processes and improve the overall quality of urban environments.

title: Bottom-up social entrepreneurship for the co-creation of neighbourhoods in line with the New European Bauhaus
summary_text: The grant call focuses on researching the role of bottom-up social entrepreneurship in the co-creation of inclusive and sustainable neighborhoods, aligned with the values of the New European Bauhaus. Key topics include the analysis of local barriers and drivers affecting social enterprises, the assessment of their impact on community well-being and social cohesion, and the facilitation of knowledge exchange among inhabitants and civil society actors. Proposals should adopt a participatory and transdisciplinary approach, integrating various stakeholders and disciplines to enhance societal impact.

title: The impact of common space on neighbourhood communities
summary_text: The research topics focus on understanding the impact of common spaces on community dynamics, including social interactions, civic participation, health, and a sense of belonging. Key areas of investigation include the design and maintenance of these spaces, their effects on diverse groups, and how they can foster inclusivity and resilience in neighborhoods. Proposals should adopt a participatory approach, integrating insights from social sciences and humanities to inform policies for the regeneration of common spaces across various EU Member States.

title: Reverse local construction supply chains for the beautiful re-assembly of reclaimed construction products
summary_text: The grant call focuses on innovative methods for the safe and sustainable re-assembly of reclaimed construction products, emphasizing their aesthetic and cultural enhancement in line with the New European Bauhaus principles. Key research topics include the development of new business models for modularity and adaptability, the integration of digital tools for traceability and management, and the exploration of local reverse construction supply chains to maximize resource utilization and reduce environmental impact. Proposals should adopt a participatory approach, engaging various stakeholders and disciplines to validate new value and revenue streams from these practices.

title: Applying regenerative design to the built environment in neighbourhoods
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing regenerative design principles in the built environment, emphasizing the restoration and enhancement of ecosystems while promoting human health and well-being. Key research topics include the analysis of existing regenerative design examples, the development of innovative tools and technologies for construction and renovation, and the application of nature-based solutions to improve sustainability and energy efficiency. Proposals should adopt a participatory approach, engaging diverse stakeholders and disciplines to foster collaboration and knowledge exchange.

title: MSCA Choose Europe for Science 2025
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing career prospects and stability for researchers, particularly those holding doctoral degrees, by developing talent recruitment programs that provide excellent research and academic opportunities. It aims to address issues of brain drain and career precarity in Europe, promoting alignment with the European Charter for Researchers and the Agreement on Reforming Research Assessment. The programs should cover all research disciplines and emphasize career development, including transferable skills and job-specific training, to ensure long-term career pathways and improved human resources in research and innovation.

title: Investigating and addressing career barriers faced by underrepresented and marginalised researchers
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing gender equality and inclusiveness in the European Research Area by addressing the barriers faced by researchers from underrepresented and marginalized groups, such as racialized individuals, those with disabilities, and LGBTIQ researchers. Key research topics include investigating the specific challenges these groups encounter throughout their careers, developing tools and recommendations for inclusive policies and practices, and disseminating findings to relevant stakeholders to promote equitable career advancement and support systems in research and innovation.

title: Programme-level collaboration
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing collaboration among national and regional research and innovation (R&I) funding programs to address global challenges, particularly in alignment with the Sustainable Development Goals. Key research topics include the identification of common R&I priorities, implementation of joint funding calls for transnational projects, and the promotion of technology and regulatory policies that support societal and market uptake. Additionally, the initiative encourages international cooperation and aims to strengthen partnerships that advance shared values in research and innovation.

title: Strengthening of the European Science for Policy Ecosystem
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing the "Science for Policy" (S4P) ecosystem in Europe to support evidence-informed policymaking across various governance levels. Key research topics include the development and mainstreaming of S4P approaches, fostering collaboration among S4P actors, and creating a community of practice to share best practices and facilitate mutual learning. Additionally, the initiative aims to establish a comprehensive observatory of S4P practices and promote effective engagement between research and policy, particularly in thematic areas like sustainable food systems and energy transition.

title: Rolling out the ERA Policy Agenda results
summary_text:
The grant call focuses on enhancing the European Research Area (ERA) through six key research topics: 

1. **Reproducibility of Scientific Results** - Promoting practices and tools that improve the reproducibility of research findings.
2. **Research Assessment Reforms** - Advancing reforms in research assessment to recognize diverse research outputs and practices.
3. **Strengthening Research Careers** - Establishing communities of practice to improve working conditions and career development for researchers.
4. **Knowledge Valorisation Intermediaries** - Creating a network to enhance collaboration between academia, industry, and society for effective knowledge valorisation.
5. **Knowledge and Technology Transfer** - Upgrading the skills and services of technology transfer professionals to better facilitate the uptake of research innovations.
6. **Research Management Capacities** - Enhancing the professional recognition and skills of research managers to improve research management practices across Europe.

title: Research and innovation to provide evidence that support reforms of research assessment
summary_text: The grant call focuses on reforming research assessment practices to enhance the evaluation of researchers, projects, and institutions beyond traditional publication metrics. Key research topics include the development and evaluation of assessment tools and methods, addressing biases in research evaluation, and promoting diversity and inclusion in assessment practices. The initiative aims to gather evidence and implement reforms aligned with the Agreement on Reforming Research Assessment, emphasizing qualitative assessment, transparency in peer review, and the use of open indicators for new assessment frameworks.

title: Enable sustained coordination and guidance at the European level on institutional non-profit open access publishing
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing institutional non-profit open access publishing services in Europe, emphasizing the need for quality standards, governance, and coordination among these services. Key research topics include the development of equitable and transparent publishing models, capacity-building for publishers, and the establishment of a well-connected network to support open science practices. Proposals should address the provision of resources, training, and technological support to improve the quality and accessibility of non-profit publishing initiatives.

title: Science comes to town 2027
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing citizen engagement with research and innovation (R&I) through a year-long program titled "Science comes to town 2027," aimed at connecting local communities with scientific advancements. Key research topics include promoting science communication, fostering societal trust in science, and increasing awareness of career opportunities in R&I, particularly among youth and early-career researchers. The initiative encourages innovative approaches to citizen science and aims to strengthen collaboration among cities, researchers, and stakeholders to address societal challenges through science.

title: Fostering equity and justice in climate policies – Societal Readiness Pilot
summary_text: The key research topics focus on advancing climate justice and equity in climate policies, both within the EU and globally. This includes improving integrated assessment models to better represent justice aspects, analyzing the distributional impacts of climate policies on vulnerable populations, and exploring innovative policy instruments that prioritize equity. Additionally, the research aims to enhance collaboration between European and low or middle-income countries, ensuring diverse stakeholder involvement to address socio-economic disparities and promote inclusive climate action.

title: Implementing the climate action pillar of the EU-African Union Partnership on Climate Change and Sustainable Energy
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing climate change research collaboration between the African Union (AU) and the European Union (EU), specifically targeting climate risk reduction, adaptation strategies, and the development of climate services. Key research topics include improving access to climate-related data, strengthening the climate research community in Africa, and fostering the integration of indigenous knowledge into climate science. The initiative aims to build capacity, enhance climate literacy, and promote effective climate action planning while addressing the socio-economic challenges faced by African nations.

title: The attribution to climate change, and improved forecasting of extreme and slow-onset climate- and weather-related events and their impacts
summary_text: The key research topics focus on advancing the understanding of the relationship between anthropogenic climate change and extreme weather events, including their frequency, intensity, and impacts on human systems and ecosystems. This includes improving methodologies for attributing extreme events to climate change, enhancing databases for extreme events, and operationalizing attribution science for policy applications related to disaster preparedness and resilience. Additionally, the research aims to explore the interplay between natural variability and climate change, develop robust observation methodologies, and improve forecasting and planning for future climate-related challenges, particularly in vulnerable regions.

title: Modelling of mitigation pathways for F-gases
summary_text: The key research topics focus on improving knowledge and modeling of Ozone Depleting Substances (ODS) and fluorinated greenhouse gases (F-gases), particularly in the refrigeration, air conditioning, and heat pump sectors. The aim is to develop pathways for mitigating F-gas use and emissions, assess their interaction with energy systems, and support the implementation of the Kigali Agreement while considering alternatives to hydrofluorocarbons (HFCs) and the impact of these substances on climate change. Additionally, the project emphasizes the creation of national-level modeling tools to inform policy options and enhance energy efficiency in line with global climate goals.

title: Climate simulations data and knowledge for optimal support of IPCC Assessments and International Policy
summary_text: The key research topics focus on generating robust climate projections using advanced Earth System Models (ESMs) that incorporate the latest modeling technologies and socio-economic scenarios. The initiative aims to assess the impacts and risks associated with various greenhouse gas emission pathways, particularly those related to temperature overshoot, while enhancing coordination among international climate science communities. Additionally, it emphasizes the need for improved infrastructure and frameworks to support timely and accessible climate information for decision-makers, ensuring alignment with global climate policy objectives.

title: Advancing Earth System Models to increase understanding of Earth system change
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing Earth system modeling to improve predictions of climate change and its socio-economic and environmental impacts at various spatial and temporal scales. Key research topics include enhancing the simulation of climate variability, extreme weather events, and interactions between climate, carbon, and water cycles, as well as fostering collaboration across different modeling approaches and utilizing advanced digital technologies like machine learning. Additionally, the call emphasizes the importance of open access to data and results, international cooperation, and the integration of past project findings to strengthen the scientific foundation for climate policy.

title: Driving Urban Transitions to a sustainable future (DUT) Co-Funded Partnership
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing urban sustainability and climate neutrality transitions in European cities, aligning with the European Green Deal and various international frameworks. Key research topics include enhancing multi-level cooperation in sustainable urban development, integrating innovative governance and citizen engagement, fostering climate-neutral urban environments, and empowering local authorities and communities with the necessary skills and tools. The initiative also emphasizes collaboration with international networks and synergies with other EU missions to promote effective urban policy and practices.

title: Adaptation to Climate Change: Effectiveness and Limits
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing the understanding and assessment of climate change adaptation effectiveness and limits through a comprehensive, standardized methodology. Key research topics include evaluating adaptation strategies across various contexts (regional, sectoral), developing metrics for assessing effectiveness, and integrating social sciences to address vulnerabilities and promote equity. The aim is to provide actionable insights for policymakers and practitioners to improve adaptation policies and resilience against climate impacts.

title: Testing and demonstrating innovative solutions to improve resilience to extreme heat, including addressing health impacts
summary_text: The key research topics focus on enhancing the adaptive capacities of European regional and local authorities to combat extreme heat, particularly in relation to human health and well-being. This includes developing and evaluating systemic measures for heat stress management in public and private spaces, creating emergency response actions for extreme heat events, and exploring innovative funding schemes for implementing resilience solutions. Additionally, the research emphasizes the importance of addressing socio-economic vulnerabilities and integrating social sciences to ensure effective adaptation policies.

title: Pre-commercial procurement of breakthrough solutions for climate proofing of public buildings
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing climate adaptation strategies for public buildings, emphasizing the development of customized, innovative solutions that address climate risks and improve resilience. Key research topics include the integration of nature-based solutions, the reduction of fragmentation in demand for climate-proofing technologies through collaborative public procurement, and the promotion of sustainable practices that lead to economic growth and job creation in the building sector. Additionally, the call highlights the importance of utilizing climate data for informed decision-making in building renovations and the need for standards that enhance energy efficiency and climate resilience.

title: Supporting regions and local authorities in assessing climate risks
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing climate risk assessments at regional and local levels in Europe to support adaptation efforts in line with the European Green Deal and related strategies. Key research topics include the development and mainstreaming of a multi-risk assessment framework and toolbox, improving the robustness of climate risk assessments, and fostering collaboration between authorities, scientists, and communities to effectively communicate climate risks and combat disinformation. The initiative aims to provide direct support to regional and local authorities for conducting comprehensive climate risk assessments and developing community-based emergency and risk management plans.

title: Supporting regional and local authorities in developing their Action Plans towards climate resilience
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing climate adaptation efforts among regional and local authorities in alignment with the European Green Deal and the EU Mission on Adaptation to climate change. Key research topics include the development and implementation of tailored climate adaptation Action Plans, which should analyze future climate scenarios, identify concrete actions, and assess associated costs and funding strategies. The initiative emphasizes participatory approaches, stakeholder engagement, and the integration of innovative solutions to ensure equitable and effective climate resilience across diverse regions.

title: Demonstrating solutions to help hotspots in coastal regions to adapt to climate change
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing climate resilience in coastal regions identified as hotspots for climate change, particularly in Southern Europe and low-lying areas. Key research topics include the development and demonstration of innovative, nature-based, and digital solutions to address challenges such as sea level rise, coastal flooding, and ecosystem degradation. Proposals should emphasize stakeholder engagement, socio-economic impacts, and the potential for replicating successful adaptation strategies across different coastal authorities.

title: Better understanding incentives for private sector financing of adaptation solutions
summary_text: The grant call focuses on mobilizing private sector financing for climate adaptation solutions in support of the European Green Deal and the EU Mission on Adaptation to Climate Change. Key research topics include developing methodologies for calculating the economic rationale for adaptation investments, identifying innovative ways to overcome financing barriers, and testing these approaches through case studies across various climate hazards and community systems. The involvement of social sciences and humanities is emphasized to enhance societal impact, alongside collaboration with relevant private sector actors and knowledge platforms.

title: Restoring Ocean and Waters in waterfront Cities and their Ports
summary_text: The research topics focus on innovative solutions for restoring and protecting marine and freshwater ecosystems in waterfront cities and ports, aiming to achieve the objectives of the Mission "Restore our Ocean and Waters" by 2030. Key areas include preventing pollution, enhancing biodiversity, promoting a carbon-neutral and circular blue economy, and increasing the resilience of communities to climate change impacts. The projects should emphasize nature-based solutions, stakeholder engagement, and the integration of sustainable practices while assessing the socio-economic and ecological impacts of proposed measures.

title: Digital technologies and energy transition in fisheries and/or aquaculture
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing energy efficiency and reducing CO2 emissions in the fisheries and aquaculture sectors through the adoption of digital technologies, including artificial intelligence and data analytics. Key research topics include the development of innovative solutions for energy management, understanding barriers to digital solution uptake, and establishing best practices for sustainable fisheries and aquaculture management. Additionally, projects should address regional specificities, involve stakeholders, and promote skill development to support a sustainable energy transition in these industries.

title: Blue Parks - Towards a coherent European network of strictly protected areas for restoring healthy and productive marine ecosystems
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing knowledge of marine habitats and their ecosystem services, supporting the designation of strictly protected marine areas in line with the EU Biodiversity Strategy and the UN Convention on Biological Diversity. Key research topics include identifying and mapping critical habitats, assessing their conditions, and determining optimal networks of strictly protected areas that balance ecological needs with maritime activities such as fisheries and renewable energy. The initiative aims to promote interdisciplinary and transboundary collaboration to ensure effective conservation planning and implementation.

title: A toolbox for public authorities to address marine plastics and litter from river-to-ocean
summary_text: The grant call focuses on addressing marine plastic litter through a comprehensive land-to-river-to-sea approach, emphasizing the need for innovative solutions to prevent and remove plastic pollution in European water systems. Key research topics include the monitoring and data collection of marine litter sources and pathways, the development of sustainable removal solutions, and community engagement strategies to prevent litter from reaching the sea. Projects are expected to create a toolbox that provides evidence-based data and effective measures tailored to specific river basins, while fostering cross-border cooperation and knowledge sharing among stakeholders.

title: Restoring Ocean and Waters on Islands
summary_text: This grant call focuses on supporting islands in implementing innovative solutions to achieve the objectives of the Mission "Restore our Ocean and Waters" by 2030. Key research topics include the protection and restoration of marine and freshwater ecosystems, pollution prevention, and the transition to a sustainable, carbon-neutral blue economy. The initiative emphasizes place-based, people-centered actions, resilience to climate change, and the involvement of local authorities and communities in testing and deploying effective restoration strategies.

title: EU Digital Twin Ocean: Contribution to the EU DTO core infrastructure through applications for sustainable ocean management
summary_text: The grant call focuses on developing user-driven Digital Twin Ocean (DTO) applications that leverage the European Digital Twin of the Ocean (EDITO) infrastructure. Key research topics include the integration of marine observation data, advanced modeling (including bio-geochemical and ecosystem models), and the use of artificial intelligence for real-time simulations of oceanic systems. The aim is to enhance decision-making for sustainable marine and maritime operations, support policy implementation, and improve data interoperability and accessibility across various marine sectors.

title: Mission Lighthouses coordination and support activities
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing basin-specific activities to support the Mission Ocean and waters objectives, emphasizing the development and deployment of innovative solutions across major basins such as the Atlantic-Arctic, Mediterranean Sea, Baltic-North Sea, and Danube River-Black Sea. Key research topics include fostering basin-scale cooperation and governance, promoting sustainable socio-economic development, and facilitating knowledge transfer and stakeholder engagement to ensure effective implementation and scaling of innovative solutions. Additionally, the call encourages collaboration among public and private organizations to align policies and mobilize funding for transboundary water management and sustainable development initiatives.

title: Restoring Ocean and Waters in Regions
summary_text: The grant call focuses on supporting regional authorities in implementing restoration activities in coastal and riparian areas to achieve the objectives of the Mission "Restore our Ocean and Waters by 2030." Key research topics include the protection and restoration of marine and freshwater ecosystems, pollution prevention, and the promotion of a sustainable blue economy. The projects should emphasize nature-based solutions, community resilience to climate change, and the development of innovative funding approaches while fostering collaboration among regional authorities and leveraging existing EU programs.

title: De-risking wave energy technology development through transnational pre-commercial procurement of wave energy research and development
summary_text: The grant call focuses on the development and demonstration of cost-effective wave energy converters capable of operating in harsh marine environments. Key research topics include improving the efficiency, reliability, and commercial viability of wave energy technologies, as well as assessing their environmental and socio-economic impacts throughout their lifecycle. The initiative aims to advance wave energy solutions to higher technology readiness levels (TRL 7/8) through collaborative pre-commercial procurement, facilitating large-scale deployment and market uptake in Europe.

title: Innovative approaches for the deployment of Positive Energy Districts
summary_text: The key research topics focus on developing innovative approaches and solutions to enable positive energy districts (PEDs) that achieve a net positive energy balance and facilitate the export of excess renewable energy. This includes addressing technical, business, social, and organizational constraints related to climate mitigation, renewable energy integration, and community engagement. Proposals should emphasize the creation of supportive local planning frameworks, the demonstration of solutions in diverse districts, and the development of guidelines and training materials for professionals, ensuring active stakeholder involvement throughout the process.

title: On-site innovative robotic and automated solutions and techniques for more sustainable and less disruptive building renovation and construction
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing sustainable and resource-efficient building practices through innovative on-site robotic and automated solutions for construction and renovation. Key research topics include the development and validation of techniques such as 3D printing, enhancing resource efficiency, reducing pollution, and improving safety and human-robot collaboration. Proposals should aim to test prototypes applicable to various building types and compare their effectiveness against current best practices.

title: Next generation distribution substation for increasing the system resilience
summary_text: The key research topics focus on enhancing the observability, monitoring, and control of electricity distribution grids through the integration of power electronics, intelligent electronic devices, and software solutions. Projects should demonstrate real-time monitoring and analysis of grid conditions, develop a flexible and programmable electricity distribution grid, and establish best practices for building smart distribution substations. Collaboration with distribution system operators and technology suppliers is encouraged to create a resilient and intelligent grid capable of addressing disturbances and congestion.

title: Extending the lifetime of crystalline silicon PV modules (EUPI-PV Partnership)
summary_text: The key research topics focus on enhancing the durability and reliability of photovoltaic (PV) energy systems, particularly high-efficiency crystalline silicon modules. This includes identifying defects and failure modes, developing cost-effective defect detection techniques (potentially using AI), and proposing mitigation strategies to extend module lifetimes. Additionally, the research aims to assess degradation rates through outdoor field experiments across various European climates to improve resource efficiency and reduce the levelized cost of electricity (LCOE).

title: Towards commercialisation of Perovskite PV and development of dedicated manufacturing equipment (EUPI-PV Partnership)
summary_text: The key research topics focus on the development and commercialization of metal halide perovskite solar cells (PSCs), emphasizing strategies to enhance their optoelectronic properties, performance, and stability while minimizing environmental impact. Specific areas of interest include scaling up the deposition of high-quality perovskite films, developing robust encapsulation techniques to protect against environmental stressors, and ensuring recyclability while managing toxic lead leakage. Additionally, proposals should address the creation of suitable manufacturing processes and equipment tailored to perovskite and perovskite-silicon tandem technologies.

title: New CO2 capture technologies
summary_text: The grant call focuses on the development of innovative CO2 capture technologies, specifically targeting either point sources or direct air capture (DAC). Key research topics include enhancing absorption/adsorption processes, improving kinetics and energy efficiency, creating new materials with high CO2 selectivity, and addressing operational flexibility and scalability. Additionally, proposals must consider the minimization of health and environmental impacts, ensuring the captured CO2 meets transport and storage specifications, and maintaining performance under variable operating conditions.

title: Innovative pathways for low carbon and climate resilient building stock and built environment (Built4People Partnership)
summary_text: The key research topics focus on developing and validating innovative planning methods and procedures that enhance the decarbonization, climate resilience, and sustainability of buildings and the built environment. This includes addressing whole life carbon performance, circularity, resource efficiency, and adaptability of the building stock, while ensuring stakeholder involvement across the construction value chain. Proposals should also explore innovative tools for user adaptability and assess the effectiveness of these methods in various climatic conditions and building contexts.

title: Improved reliability and optimised operations and maintenance for wind energy systems
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing the reliability and efficiency of wind energy systems through various innovative approaches. Key research topics include developing solutions for operational and financial risk reduction, improving condition and health monitoring techniques, optimizing maintenance operations, and creating advanced digital tools for wind farm management. Emphasis is placed on ensuring the reliability of components, particularly in floating offshore wind systems, while promoting data accessibility and standardization in the development of these technologies.

title: Smarter buildings as part of the energy system for increased efficiency and flexibility – Societal Readiness Pilot
summary_text: The key research topics focus on enhancing the smartness of buildings through improved Building Management Systems (BMS/BEMS), integrating renewable energy sources (RES), and increasing grid flexibility while ensuring user satisfaction and comfort. Proposals should aim to demonstrate solutions across diverse building types and climatic zones, measure energy demand reduction and interoperability, and assess the cost-effectiveness and replicability of these innovations. Additionally, the research must incorporate social sciences and humanities (SSH) expertise to address societal needs and enhance the acceptance of smart building technologies.

title: Innovative tools and services to manage and empower energy communities
summary_text: The key research topics focus on the integration of home and building energy assets through IoT communication standards, facilitating local energy trading and enhancing the participation of energy communities in European energy grids. The project aims to develop innovative open-source tools for managing energy community assets, optimize energy consumption and production using AI, and create a cooperation platform for energy system services. Additionally, it emphasizes the importance of security solutions for IoT networks, the implementation of EU energy policies, and the involvement of social sciences and humanities to enhance societal impacts.

title: Innovative solutions for a generative AI-powered digital spine of the EU energy system
summary_text: The grant call focuses on the development and implementation of generative AI tools to enhance the digital and green transformation of the energy sector. Key research topics include local grid optimization, integration of renewable energy sources, and the creation of smarter demand-side management tools for industries and consumers. The initiative aims to improve the reliability, resilience, and efficiency of energy systems through advanced AI technologies, while promoting interoperability and data exchange across various sectors, including transport and residential heating.

title: Understand and minimise the environmental impacts of offshore wind energy
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing understanding of the cumulative environmental impacts of offshore wind energy deployment, particularly in relation to existing human activities. Key research topics include improving monitoring and assessment tools for environmental impacts, expanding field studies to larger areas, and developing models for Maritime Spatial Planning and environmental risk assessment. Additionally, the call emphasizes the need for strategies to mitigate and compensate for environmental impacts, ensuring sustainable offshore wind energy deployment with minimal negative effects on marine ecosystems.

title: Phase out fossil fuel in energy intensive industries through the efficient integration of renewable energy sources
summary_text: The grant call focuses on developing innovative solutions for integrating renewable energy sources into industrial processes with significant heating demands, aiming to improve energy efficiency and reduce fossil fuel consumption and greenhouse gas emissions. Key research topics include the local integration of renewable thermal, electrical, and bioenergy sources, process flexibility, energy storage, and optimizing energy reuse, all while ensuring high reliability, safety, and security. Proposals should also address scalability, adaptability to various industrial needs, and include a robust business model for future deployment in the EU and Associated Countries.

title: Competitiveness, energy security and integration aspects of advanced biofuels and renewable fuels of non-biological origin value chains
summary_text: The key research topics focus on enhancing energy security and industrial competitiveness in the EU through advanced biofuels and renewable fuels of non-biological origin. Projects should assess and optimize value chains, evaluate their contributions to energy security, and identify necessary research and innovation actions. Additionally, multidisciplinary issues such as carbon removals, sustainable farming practices, and the integration of various stakeholders in the value chain are to be addressed, alongside sustainability assessments using life cycle analysis.

title: Development of innovative solutions strengthening the security of renewable energy value chains
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing the energy security of Europe through research and innovation in renewable energy technology value chains. Key research topics include sustainability and social awareness in hydropower or bioenergy, skills development for innovation in renewable energy, and addressing complexity in grid-based renewable fuels and direct solar fuels. Proposals should aim to develop solutions that improve these critical aspects, ultimately contributing to a more resilient and competitive European clean energy system.

title: Optimal combination of low embodied carbon construction products, technical building systems and circularity principles for climate neutral buildings (Built4People Partnership)
summary_text: The key research topics focus on reducing whole life carbon emissions in buildings and enhancing carbon removals through innovative construction and renovation practices. This includes developing optimal combinations of construction products and systems that minimize lifecycle environmental impacts, promoting adaptive reuse of existing structures, and validating these solutions across diverse climatic conditions. Additionally, the proposals should address the integration of circular economy principles, cost-effectiveness, and contribute to European standards and benchmarking efforts related to whole life carbon emissions.

title: Underground Thermal Energy Storage in dense urban areas
summary_text: The key research topics focus on the development and optimization of Underground Thermal Energy Storage (UTES) systems, including Aquifer Thermal Energy Storage (ATES), Closed-Loop Thermal Energy Storage (CTES), and Borehole Thermal Energy Storage (BTES) in urban environments. Emphasis is placed on integrating these technologies with existing energy grids, addressing seasonal energy demand uncertainties, and enhancing the thermal efficiency of urban energy systems. Additionally, the research aims to engage local communities, assess regulatory frameworks, and utilize advanced monitoring techniques to ensure sustainable and effective implementation of thermal storage solutions in densely populated areas.

title: Demonstration of thermal energy storage solutions for solar thermal plants and systems
summary_text: The grant call focuses on the demonstration of innovative thermal energy storage solutions, specifically in concentrated solar power (CSP) and solar thermal heat and cold. Key research topics include improving performance, cost-effectiveness, and lifespan of these technologies, as well as assessing their sustainability in environmental and socio-economic terms. The initiative aims to enhance the dispatchability of solar thermal systems, support the Strategic Energy Technology Plan, and facilitate better financing and commercialization pathways for technology providers.

title: Large-scale production of liquid advanced biofuels and renewable fuels of non-biological origin
summary_text: The grant call focuses on the large-scale production and demonstration of advanced biofuels and renewable fuels of non-biological origin, particularly for sectors like aviation, shipping, and energy-intensive industries. Key research topics include the utilization of sustainable biomass feedstocks, the development of innovative production technologies, and the assessment of economic viability and environmental impact through life-cycle analysis. Projects should aim to establish full-scale plants, optimize feedstock processing, and create robust business cases for commercialization and scalability.

title: Support for R&I policy making in the EU enlargement countries
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing research and innovation (R&I) capacities in the enlargement countries of the Western Balkans and Ukraine, aiming to align their R&I policies with European standards. Key topics include fostering regional integration into the European Research Area, promoting sustainable economic growth through innovation, improving technology transfer processes, and supporting institutional reforms in R&I ecosystems. Additionally, the call emphasizes the importance of human capital development, gender equality in research, and the establishment of collaborative networks among higher education institutions and industries.

title: SNS Trials and Pilots (T&Ps) with Verticals
summary_text: The key research topics for Stream D projects focus on the evaluation, measurement, and validation of advanced 5G/6G technologies and their impact on specific vertical sectors such as Industry/Manufacturing, Media, Transportation, Emergency Services, and Health. Projects should demonstrate the integration of innovative 6G smart networks and services, addressing scalability, security, and performance improvements, while targeting tangible environmental, societal, and economic outcomes. Additionally, there is an emphasis on developing viable business models, engaging SMEs, and contributing to standardization efforts for 6G technologies.

title: Increasing walking and cycling: to reap health benefits, emission reductions and integrate active mobility and micro-mobility devices, with smart technologies and infrastructure
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing urban mobility through increased walking, cycling, and micro-mobility to achieve climate neutrality and reduce greenhouse gas emissions. Key research topics include improving the quality and integration of active mobility infrastructure, utilizing smart technologies for traffic management, and exploring the health benefits of physical activity, particularly in relation to cancer prevention. Proposals should aim for a significant increase in the modal share of active transport modes and foster collaboration among cities to implement innovative solutions and best practices.

title: Accelerating the circular transformation of the EU automotive industry
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing circular economy principles within the European automotive sector, emphasizing end-of-life strategies and the full life-cycle value chain. Key research topics include stakeholder engagement, analysis of existing remanufacturing processes, the implementation of AI tools for enhancing recyclability and reuse, and the assessment of economic and environmental impacts of a circular automotive industry. Additionally, it aims to conceptualize pilot projects for innovative recycling solutions and develop frameworks for product passports and digital twins.

title: Knowledge sharing and dissemination to support road transport R&I in EU and around the world increasing global EU competitiveness
summary_text: The grant call focuses on promoting research and innovation (R&I) for sustainable road transport in Europe and internationally, emphasizing the need for increased stakeholder participation and collaboration. Key research topics include urban zero-emission mobility, improved air quality, future road safety, zero-emission long-haul logistics, and the digitalization of road transport, particularly in relation to artificial intelligence and big data. Additionally, the initiative aims to assess and develop research infrastructure ecosystems, support education and training in the sector, and enhance international cooperation aligned with the UN Sustainable Development Goals.

title: Innovative solutions for energy conversion and safety of low and zero-carbon fuels in waterborne transport (ZEWT Partnership)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing the integration and development of low and zero-carbon fuel power conversion systems for vessels over 5,000 Gross Tonnage, aiming for energy efficiencies of at least 55% in shaft propulsion. Key research topics include the demonstration of fuel cell and internal combustion engine solutions, reduction of greenhouse gas and other harmful emissions, development of innovative storage and handling solutions, and the establishment of safety protocols for bunkering operations. Additionally, the call emphasizes the need for training and upskilling of personnel, standardization efforts, and the use of data science technologies to enhance the competitiveness and sustainability of the EU waterborne industry.

title: Flexible and mobile solutions for Onshore Power Supply (ZEWT Partnership)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on developing innovative and flexible Onshore Power Supply (OPS) solutions for port authorities and ship operators, specifically targeting the provision of OPS at terminals and anchorage areas. Key research topics include enhancing the modularity and adaptability of OPS systems to accommodate diverse vessel types and operational conditions, improving safety standards, and addressing gaps in standardization for fast battery charging and OPS integration. Additionally, the call emphasizes the need for solutions that ensure continuous operation, resilience to climate conditions, and effective training for crew and port staff.

title: Support of the new EU renewable and low carbon fuel ecosystem for waterborne transport
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing the production and deployment of renewable and low carbon fuels for waterborne transport, emphasizing the development of business models and technological solutions to reduce greenhouse gas emissions. Key research topics include the creation of financial tools for project viability, support for project development within the renewable fuel ecosystem, and collaboration with stakeholders to enhance market uptake and access to capital for innovative fuel solutions. Additionally, the initiative aims to align with EU climate targets and promote synergies between renewable fuels and advanced biofuels technologies.

title: Safe Human-Technology Interaction (HTI) in the vehicle systems of the coming decade – Societal Readiness Pilot
summary_text: The research topics focus on enhancing Human-Technology Interaction (HTI) in automated driving systems, particularly at lower automation levels, to improve road safety and driver engagement. Key areas include developing adaptive systems that monitor driver states, creating standardized assessment tools for HTI, and designing innovative training methods for drivers to navigate evolving technologies and avoid mode confusion. Additionally, the research aims to address the needs of diverse driver populations, ensuring trust and transparency in automated systems through effective communication and user-responsive strategies.

title: Real-time, adaptative and innovative energy management solutions to optimise fuel consumption and lower emissions pollutants in waterborne transport (ZEWT Partnership)
summary_text: The key research topics focus on the integration of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML) to optimize ship operations, enhance energy management systems, and reduce harmful emissions. This includes the development of real-time monitoring solutions for energy flows and emissions, innovative energy storage and power conversion systems, and adaptable optimization strategies for various operational conditions. Additionally, the research aims to improve ship design concepts and operational measures through case studies in different shipping contexts, contributing to the goals of the Zero Emission Waterborne Transport initiative.

title: Next generation testing capabilities in strategic EU wind tunnels
summary_text: The key research topics focus on advancing testing capabilities for next-generation climate-neutral aviation, specifically in areas such as airframe transformative technologies, airframe-propulsion integration, distributed hybrid/electric propulsion, and aeroacoustics. The emphasis is on developing high aspect ratio and flexible unfueled wings, enhancing experimental simulation capabilities, and improving strategic EU testing infrastructures like wind tunnels to support low-emission aircraft development. Projects should align with the EU's climate-neutral aviation goals and promote collaboration among various testing facilities.

title: Support to the organisation and dissemination of the Transport Research Arena (TRA) conference
summary_text: The grant call focuses on organizing the Transport Research Arena (TRA) conference in 2028, emphasizing the integration of technological and industrial developments across various transport modes, including road, rail, waterborne, and aviation. It aims to enhance collaboration among research, industry, and policy stakeholders, promote innovative transport solutions, and increase participation from diverse groups, including students and young researchers. Additionally, the call includes the organization of two competitions for transport research and innovation awards, aimed at fostering interest and recognition in the field while aligning with EU climate and mobility objectives.

title: Demonstration of battery energy storage systems in existing and new vessels via novel energy storage and ship design concepts (ZEWT Partnership)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing the autonomy and efficiency of fully electric maritime vessels and inland river vessels through innovative battery technologies and energy management solutions. Key research topics include achieving a 40% increase in operating range for vessels over 400 Gross Tonnage and 86 meters in length, developing advanced energy storage systems, improving battery lifetime and safety, and facilitating rapid in-route charging. Additionally, the call emphasizes the importance of replicating successful solutions across various waterborne applications and ensuring the competitiveness of the EU waterborne sector through strategic innovation and training initiatives.

title: Extended lifetime of road Battery Electric Vehicles (BEV) (2ZERO Partnership)
summary_text: The research topics focus on the ageing and degradation of critical electric drive components in light-duty battery electric vehicles (BEVs), emphasizing system integration, functionality, safety, and economic considerations. Key areas include the development of tools and methods for assessing and predicting component degradation, the creation of extended lifetime concepts to enhance residual values, and the implementation of digital product passports for traceability. The aim is to support circular economy strategies through improved maintenance, repair, and design practices that minimize resource use and environmental impact.

title: Optimal integrated onboard renewable energy solutions, by considering Wind-Assisted Propulsion Systems (ZEWT Partnership)
summary_text: The key research topics focus on the development and standardization of methodologies for monitoring and verifying the energy contribution of Wind Assisted Propulsion (WAP) systems in maritime applications. This includes creating a framework for design optimization, assessing environmental benefits, and addressing safety and operational challenges associated with WAP technologies. Additionally, the research aims to facilitate the market uptake of WAP systems by establishing uniform rules and exploring business cases to enhance confidence in these solutions within the maritime industry.

title: Road Battery Electric Vehicles (BEV) optimised user-centric solutions for energy efficiency design and consistent range throughout weather conditions (2ZERO Partnership)
