summary_text: The key research topics focus on developing innovative energy management solutions for Light Duty Vehicles (LDV) and Light Commercial Vehicles (LCV) that address user-specific thermal comfort and energy efficiency under extreme weather conditions. This includes analyzing user requirements, optimizing thermal management systems, and integrating smart technologies to minimize range loss while maintaining affordability and compliance with automotive standards. The project aims to create a holistic approach that balances user needs, system complexity, and cost-effectiveness, ultimately contributing to zero-emission road transport initiatives.

title: Cybersecure and resilient road e-mobility ecosystem (2ZERO Partnership)
summary_text: The key research topics focus on developing a secure architecture for e-mobility systems that integrates cyber-resilient hardware and software, including advanced cryptographic solutions like Post-Quantum Cryptography. Proposals should address threat analysis, risk assessment, and the establishment of a comprehensive testing framework for cybersecurity in electric vehicles and charging infrastructure. Additionally, the research aims to enhance the resilience of e-mobility systems against cyber-attacks and physical intrusions, while ensuring compliance with existing security standards and governance models.

title: Innovative air mobility and services for sustainable and smart urban, peri-urban transport – Societal Readiness pilot
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing Innovative Air Mobility (IAM) for sustainable urban logistics, emphasizing the integration of drone technology into urban planning and multimodal transport networks. Key research topics include developing guidelines for drone infrastructure, assessing the environmental impacts of IAM, creating viable business models for logistics, and enhancing public acceptance through stakeholder engagement. The initiative aims to foster a resilient ecosystem for urban air mobility while addressing societal needs and concerns through interdisciplinary collaboration.

title: Safe post-crash management of road Light Duty Battery Electric Vehicles (BEVs) (2ZERO Partnership)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing the safety and design of Light Duty Battery Electric Vehicles (BEVs) through improved vehicle designs that reduce fire hazards, advanced condition assessment methods for batteries, and best practices for fire handling and rescue procedures. Key research topics include the development of standardized protocols for battery health assessment post-crash, innovative firefighting techniques specific to BEVs, and the re-purposing and recycling of batteries from crashed vehicles. Additionally, the project aims to address safety concerns through science-based communication and statistical analysis of BEV fire safety impacts.

title: Novel holistic intelligent tools for variable retrofit and decarbonised scenarios (ZEWT Partnership)
summary_text: The key research topics focus on the development of novel holistic intelligent design tools for retrofitting ships to achieve zero-emission waterborne transport. This includes integrating various decarbonization solutions, such as alternative fuel propulsion systems and renewable energy sources, while considering the interdependencies among retrofit systems. Additionally, the research aims to address operational changes, life-cycle perspectives, and the validation of these tools through virtual demonstrations across different ship types, ultimately enhancing the competitiveness of European maritime industries in the green technology sector.

title: Strategies, tools and concepts for optimised road Battery Electric Vehicles (BEV) long-haul logistics use cases (2ZERO Partnership)
summary_text: The key research topics focus on the accelerated adoption of Heavy Duty Battery Electric Vehicles (HD-BEV) in logistics across the EU, emphasizing innovative logistics models, battery optimization, and charging strategies. The scientific focus areas include the development of software tools for decision-making in freight systems, real-life operational demonstrations of HD-BEVs, and the integration of digital tools to enhance logistics operations and cross-border services. Additionally, the research aims to derive insights from existing transport missions to propose scalable, cost-effective logistics models that address vehicle range and total cost of ownership challenges.

title: Preparing for large-scale CCAM demonstrations (CCAM Partnership) – Societal Readiness Pilot
summary_text: The key research topics focus on the large-scale demonstration and deployment of Connected, Cooperative, and Automated Mobility (CCAM) vehicles across Europe. This includes addressing technical functionality, user behavior, and societal readiness for vehicle automation in public and private transport, as well as logistics. The initiative emphasizes stakeholder engagement, interoperability of systems, and the establishment of methodologies and frameworks for effective testing and implementation of CCAM technologies.

title: Efficient wireless stationary bidirectional charging solutions for road Light Duty Vehicles (2ZERO Partnership) – Societal Readiness Pilot
summary_text: The key research topics focus on the development and demonstration of bidirectional, interoperable low-power wireless charging solutions for light-duty vehicles, emphasizing efficiency, robustness, and integration with electricity grids. The project aims to enhance electromagnetic compatibility, social acceptance, and user-centric services while addressing environmental impacts through life cycle assessments. Additionally, it seeks to incorporate advanced V2X technologies and engage with societal needs to ensure the successful uptake of these innovations in urban environments.

title: Advancing remote operations to enable the sustainable and smart mobility of people and goods based on operational and societal needs (CCAM Partnership) – Societal Readiness Pilot
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing remote operations in Connected, Cooperative, and Automated Mobility (CCAM) systems, emphasizing the development of principles and guidelines for safety, security, and interoperability. Key research topics include the establishment of infrastructure prerequisites for remote operations, safety validation methodologies, human factors in remote operation, and the exploration of economically viable use cases for transporting people and goods. Additionally, the call highlights the importance of stakeholder engagement, societal readiness, and the integration of social sciences to address the implications of remote operations on diverse communities and the environment.

title: Next generation aircraft autonomy technologies for cockpit / pilot assistance applications
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing next-generation aircraft cockpit technologies, emphasizing crew assistance, automation, and autonomy. Key research topics include enhancing cockpit safety through new systems and functionalities, contributing to cockpit digitalization and autonomy, and improving cockpit performance efficiency by reducing size, weight, and power consumption. The projects should also explore the development of simulation tools, artificial intelligence models, and human factors analysis, while ensuring alignment with safety regulations and future aircraft operational needs.

title: Innovative, AI-based solutions for urban planning and management
summary_text: The grant call focuses on the development and integration of Digital Twin models utilizing Artificial Intelligence (AI) for urban planning and management. Key research topics include the creation of AI-based applications that enhance decision-making for climate-neutral cities, the incorporation of diverse urban data (both physical and intangible), and the promotion of participatory planning through visualization tools. Additionally, the call emphasizes capacity building, collaboration among multidisciplinary communities, and the exploration of synergies with existing digital infrastructures and data spaces to support sustainable urban development.

title: Coupling circularity and climate mitigation in industrial sites and their cities and regions
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing climate mitigation and resource circularity within industrial ecosystems, particularly at urban and peri-urban scales. Key research topics include the development of innovative governance and business models for climate action and circularity, assessment of environmental and economic benefits from these initiatives, and the establishment of multi-stakeholder partnerships to facilitate sustainable industrial practices. Proposals should also address the integration of circular economy principles into local climate strategies and promote synergies with existing EU initiatives aimed at achieving climate neutrality and reducing pollution.

title: ERC ADVANCED GRANTS
summary_text: The ERC Advanced Grants focus on supporting established research leaders with innovative and ambitious research proposals across all scientific disciplines. Key research topics include groundbreaking studies that demonstrate feasibility and significant contributions to knowledge, as well as projects that may require substantial equipment, access to large facilities, or major experimental and fieldwork costs.

title: AI Factory Antennas
summary_text: The grant call focuses on establishing AI Factory Antennas that will enhance the EuroHPC AI Factory network by providing support services, algorithmic assistance, and training to national AI ecosystems. These antennas will facilitate access to AI-optimized supercomputing resources and contribute to the development and deployment of general-purpose AI models and applications. Additionally, they may acquire small-scale AI compute resources for testing and validation purposes, thereby strengthening the capabilities of their associated established AI Factories.

title: Generative AI for Cybersecurity applications
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing cybersecurity through the development and application of Generative AI technologies. Key research topics include advanced threat detection and anomaly analysis, adaptive security measures, and improved authentication and access control systems. Additionally, proposals should address compliance with EU regulations and the dynamic nature of cybersecurity environments, while ensuring adherence to Trustworthy and Responsible AI principles.

title: Integration of Post-Quantum Cryptography (PQC) algorithms into high-level protocols
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing cybersecurity through research and innovation, particularly in the development of post-quantum cryptography (PQC) protocols. Key areas of interest include the design and implementation of high-level PQC protocols, ensuring compatibility with existing systems, and addressing the unique challenges posed by various application domains such as IoT and cloud computing. The initiative aims to strengthen the EU's technological capabilities, protect critical infrastructures, and promote security and privacy by design, especially for small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs).

title: Privacy Enhancing Technologies
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing cybersecurity through the development of privacy-preserving technologies (PETs) and robust digital infrastructures. Key research topics include the creation of scalable technologies for secure data sharing, integration of privacy-by-design principles in software development, and the advancement of GDPR-compliant data spaces. Additionally, the call emphasizes the importance of addressing the usability and effectiveness of PETs, particularly in the context of quantum security and the involvement of small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) in the cybersecurity ecosystem.

title: Security evaluations of Post-Quantum Cryptography (PQC) primitives
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing cybersecurity through research and innovation in post-quantum cryptography (PQC) and the development of robust digital infrastructures. Key research topics include assessing the security of PQC algorithms against quantum and AI-based attacks, developing quantum algorithms with significant speed-ups, and identifying vulnerabilities in current cryptographic systems. The initiative aims to strengthen the EU's technological capabilities, promote strategic autonomy, and support the cybersecurity ecosystem, particularly for SMEs.

title: Security of implementations of Post-Quantum Cryptography algorithms
summary_text: The key research topics focus on enhancing cybersecurity through the development and implementation of Post-Quantum Cryptography (PQC) algorithms that are resilient to various implementation attacks, including side-channel and fault attacks. The initiative aims to optimize countermeasures that balance security, performance, and cost, while also encouraging the creation of automated security evaluation methodologies for both software and hardware implementations. Additionally, there is an emphasis on fostering the European Cybersecurity Competence Community, particularly supporting SMEs in integrating security and privacy by design in emerging technologies.

title: New advanced tools and processes for Operational Cybersecurity
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing cybersecurity within the EU by developing advanced frameworks, tools, and services to improve resilience against cyber and hybrid threats. Key research topics include the creation of Cyber Threat Intelligence frameworks, preparedness mechanisms for ICT and operational technology, and the establishment of cross-border cyber crisis management tools. Additionally, there is an emphasis on fostering collaboration among public sector entities and supporting the role of SMEs in the cybersecurity ecosystem.

title: Scaling up deep tech ecosystems
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing deep tech ecosystems through pan-European research infrastructures to foster the development, scaling, and deployment of breakthrough technologies with significant market and societal value. Key research topics include increasing industry involvement, particularly from SMEs and start-ups, in collaboration with research infrastructures, and improving the socio-economic impact of past investments. The initiative aims to identify and assess deep tech innovations, facilitate their industrial implementation, and support pilot projects across various technological areas to strengthen innovation ecosystems.

title: European network of national competence centers for innovation procurement
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing the capacity of public procurers in Europe to implement pre-commercial procurement (PCP) and public procurement of innovative solutions (PPI). Key research topics include the establishment and expansion of national competence centers for innovation procurement, fostering cooperation among public procurers, and promoting awareness of innovation procurement opportunities among startups and SMEs. The initiative aims to create a European network that facilitates experience sharing, supports policy development, and encourages the uptake of innovative solutions across EU Member States and Associated Countries.

title: Expanding Investment Ecosystems
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing venture capital investments in less developed innovation ecosystems ('emerging' and 'moderate' regions) by facilitating connections with foreign investors from more developed regions ('strong' innovators and innovation leaders). Key research topics include improving awareness and access to local deals for foreign investors, enhancing knowledge of regulatory frameworks, and supporting local startups in navigating market entry challenges. The initiative aims to address critical challenges outlined in the New European Innovation Agenda, such as reducing reliance on fossil fuels and improving healthcare, through structured programs that foster cross-border investment and collaboration.

title: Boosting the transformation towards climate-neutral cities, the net-zero economy and open strategic autonomy through Pre-Commercial Procurement (PCP)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on stimulating the development and market readiness of innovative solutions aimed at reducing greenhouse gas emissions, particularly in urban settings. Key research topics include enhancing energy efficiency in buildings, promoting renewable energy use, advancing sustainable mobility, and leveraging digitalization for climate change mitigation. The initiative emphasizes the role of public procurers in driving innovation through pre-commercial procurement (PCP), fostering collaboration among cities, and ensuring the adoption of successful solutions to achieve climate neutrality by 2030 and 2050.

title: Breakthrough innovations for future mobility
Innovative in-space servicing, operations, space-based robotics and technologies for resilient EU space infrastructure
Biotechnology driven low emission food production systems
EIC Accelerator Open 2025
GenAI4EU: Creating European Champions in Generative AI
Acceleration of advanced materials development and upscaling along the value chain
Integrating inland waterway transport in smart shipping and multimodal logistics chains
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing the integration of inland waterway transport (IWT) into multimodal logistics chains to improve operational efficiency and environmental impact. Key research topics include the development of smart vessels and infrastructure, digital interconnectivity for data sharing, and the testing of innovative solutions in demonstration pilots. Additionally, the call emphasizes the need for stakeholder collaboration, regulatory recommendations for smart shipping, and the assessment of economic, environmental, and social benefits associated with increased IWT usage.

title: Innovative construction and maintenance, with the use of new materials and techniques, for resilient and sustainable transport infrastructure
summary_text: The research topics focus on developing sustainable and resilient transport infrastructure solutions that utilize at least 50% recycled materials, reduce life cycle emissions by 30%, and enhance biodiversity. Key areas include innovative construction methods, life cycle assessments, cost-benefit analyses, and the application of eco-friendly materials. Additionally, the projects aim to establish new EU standards for construction and procurement that prioritize sustainability and climate resilience, while also incorporating nature-based solutions to minimize environmental impacts.

title: Development of sustainable and design-to-cost batteries with (energy-)efficient manufacturing processes and based on advanced and safer materials (Batt4EU Partnership)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on the development of next-generation low-cost batteries aimed at enhancing electric mobility and reducing reliance on critical raw materials. Key research topics include the design and production of lithium-ion batteries (specifically using LMFP and HLM chemistries) and sodium-ion batteries, with targets for energy density, cycle life, and charging times. Additionally, projects should address sustainable production processes, design-for-circularity strategies, and compatibility with advanced manufacturing techniques, while ensuring safety and sustainability in materials used.

title: Safety of Cyclists, Pedestrians and Users of Micromobility Devices
summary_text: The key research topics focus on enhancing road safety for pedestrians, cyclists, and users of micromobility devices, particularly in the context of increasing use of electrically assisted vehicles like e-bikes and e-scooters. The research aims to analyze safety risks, develop tailored safety measures, assess the impact of road infrastructure, and explore the effectiveness of smart technologies in reducing conflicts between different road users. Additionally, the proposals should address the integration of micromobility into urban mobility plans and support vulnerable user groups, while contributing to broader road safety strategies and policies.

title: Accelerated multi-physical and virtual testing for battery aging, reliability, and safety evaluation (Batt4EU Partnership)
summary_text: The research topics focus on accelerating the development and testing of battery systems, particularly for electric vehicles, by minimizing experimental efforts through advanced multi-physical and virtual testing strategies. Key areas include understanding the impact of operational loads and failure modes on battery reliability and safety, developing novel testing methodologies, and integrating AI to enhance testing efficiency. Additionally, the proposals should aim to establish standards for battery safety classification and explore synergies across different battery chemistries and applications.

title: Reliable data and practices to measure and calculate transport emissions in multimodal transport chains
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing methodologies for measuring, calculating, and reporting greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions in the transport sector, particularly in relation to new EU regulations such as CountEmissions EU, FuelEU Maritime, and ReFuelEU Aviation. Key research topics include the quantification of various transport-related emissions, including black carbon, radiative forcing, and emissions from vehicle manufacturing and infrastructure, as well as the development of a comprehensive dataset for GHG emissions intensity. The initiative aims to enhance the scientific framework for emissions accounting, improve transparency, and support the integration of low-emission technologies in transport services.

title: Real time monitoring of regulated and non-regulated emissions from all types of vessels and other port activities in order to enforce emission limits in waterfront cities
summary_text: The grant call focuses on developing and demonstrating advanced monitoring techniques for real-time measurement of various pollutants from maritime activities, particularly in port and coastal environments. Key research topics include the creation of harmonized methods for measuring real sailing emissions, the identification of harmful substances from both vessels and port operations, and the establishment of automatic reporting systems to ensure compliance with environmental regulations. Additionally, the call emphasizes the need to assess the impact of new alternative fuels on emissions and to develop methodologies for evaluating pollution sources and their effects on air quality in urban areas near ports.

title: Approaches, verification and training for Edge-AI building blocks for CCAM Systems (CCAM Partnership)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing Connected, Cooperative, and Automated Mobility (CCAM) through the development of optimized hardware and software solutions that enhance power efficiency, speed, accuracy, and safety. Key research topics include the integration of edge-AI applications for real-time data processing and decision-making, the optimization of AI algorithms for deployment on resource-constrained edge devices, and the establishment of robust monitoring tools to ensure the reliability and security of these systems. Additionally, the call emphasizes the importance of ethical standards, data protection, and international collaboration in the development of these technologies.

title: Icing in the context of sustainable aviation
summary_text: The research topics focus on aircraft icing, particularly in relation to safety and efficiency in the context of climate change and the development of low carbon aviation technologies. Key areas include the development of certification compliance means for icing systems, assessment of climate change impacts on icing environments, and innovation in ice detection and protection technologies. Specific interests involve creating reliable numerical tools, enhancing testing capabilities for supercooled large droplets, and improving ice protection systems through smart monitoring and alternative air data measurement methods.

title: Predicting and avoiding road crashes based on Artificial Intelligence (AI) and big data
summary_text: The grant call focuses on proactive road safety management through the development of an AI-enabled digital twin of traffic and infrastructure, integrating diverse data sources to predict safety-critical situations and optimize traffic flow. Key research topics include the acquisition and analysis of big data from multiple sensors, the creation of bias-free predictive models for crash risk, and the exploration of ethical and legal challenges related to data sharing. Additionally, the call emphasizes the need for real-time interventions and stakeholder collaboration to enhance road safety and establish interoperability standards for data sharing.

title: Next-generation environment perception for real world CCAM operations: Error-free and secure technologies to improve energy-efficiency, cost-effectiveness, and circularity (CCAM Partnership)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing next-generation vehicle and infrastructure-based environment perception technologies for Connected, Cooperative, and Automated Mobility (CCAM). Key research topics include enhancing the safety and reliability of automated systems in complex environments, improving energy efficiency and sustainability of perception systems, and developing modular, reusable software and hardware platforms. Additionally, the call emphasizes the importance of integrating digital technologies, addressing societal and ethical considerations, and fostering international collaboration to enhance the deployment and public trust in automated vehicle services.

title: Monitoring and Evaluation of the Societal Readiness Pilot
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing Societal Readiness (SR) in research and innovation (R&I) projects, particularly within the domains of Climate, Energy, and Mobility. Key research topics include analyzing the integration of SR in pilot projects, fostering interdisciplinary collaboration between STEM and SSH partners, and developing effective methodologies for stakeholder engagement. The initiative aims to create a public web platform for sharing best practices and recommendations, ultimately improving the implementation of SR in future EU-funded projects.

title: Accelerating freight transport and logistics digital innovation
summary_text: The key research topics focus on enhancing the functionalities of electronic Freight Transport Information (eFTI) platforms to support both business-to-business (B2B) and business-to-authority (B2A) information sharing in multimodal logistics. Proposals should aim to develop technical solutions for new use cases, improve digital connectivity and interoperability, facilitate the adoption of eFTI by SMEs, and address data privacy and cybersecurity concerns while promoting sustainability in freight transport operations. Additionally, the research should explore best practices and frameworks for effective data sharing and compliance with relevant EU regulations.

title: Integration of human driving behaviour in the validation of CCAM systems (CCAM Partnership)
summary_text: The key research topics focus on developing validated human behavioral models that accurately represent diverse driving behaviors in safety-critical scenarios for Connected, Cooperative, and Automated Mobility (CCAM) systems. This includes creating models for both explicit and implicit human interactions with CCAM systems, ensuring these systems exhibit safe, human-like behavior that can be anticipated by all road users. Additionally, the research aims to enhance the calibration and validation of these models through real-world data collection and simulations, while considering regional variations and the influence of social factors on driving behavior.

title: Integrating advanced materials, cell design and manufacturing development for high-performance batteries aimed at mobility (Batt4EU Partnership)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing the transition from liquid electrolyte lithium-ion batteries to high-performance solid-state batteries, emphasizing the development of quasi-solid and all-solid-state technologies. Key research topics include optimizing manufacturing processes for enhanced production yield, quality, and sustainability, as well as integrating advanced materials and cell designs to maximize efficiency. Additionally, projects are encouraged to implement digital technologies and data analytics to improve process control and decision-making in battery production.

title: Federated CCAM data exchange platform (CCAM Partnership)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing data sharing and integration for Connected, Cooperative, and Automated Mobility (CCAM) through the establishment of a Federated CCAM Data Exchange Platform. Key research topics include identifying limitations in current data exchange solutions, mapping information needs for key performance indicators (KPIs), and developing harmonized ontologies and standards for data formats. The initiative aims to facilitate the sharing of mobility and research data, support the development of digital twins, and ensure compliance with regulatory frameworks, while promoting interoperability with existing European data spaces.

title: EIC pre-accelerator - Widening
summary_text: This grant call focuses on enhancing the innovation potential of early-stage deep-tech startups in widening countries, specifically those with high-impact technologies that can disrupt markets. Key research topics include the maturation and validation of deep-tech innovations from TRL 4 to TRL 6, addressing investor and market readiness, and developing business models that attract private investments. The aim is to prepare these startups for successful applications to the EIC Accelerator and other funding sources, while fostering transformative solutions rooted in advanced scientific and technological research.

title: Community Centres of Excellence
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing high-performance computing (HPC) and artificial intelligence (AI) applications by developing and optimizing software codes for exascale and post-exascale performance. Key research topics include identifying targeted applications and user communities, enhancing energy efficiency, addressing technical challenges in HPC/AI, and fostering collaboration among various stakeholders to maximize impact. Additionally, the call emphasizes the importance of training and capacity building to bridge the skills gap and support diverse user communities in leveraging advanced computing capabilities.

title: Transversal Centres of Excellence
summary_text: The grant call focuses on establishing Transversal Centres of Excellence (CoEs) to enhance the European high-performance computing (HPC) and artificial intelligence (AI) ecosystem. Key research topics include application profiling and performance optimization, application deployment and delivery, data processing and interoperability, resilience and fault tolerance, and energy-efficient computing. The initiative aims to provide technical support, training, and collaboration opportunities for HPC application developers, fostering the integration of AI technologies and improving the overall efficiency and sustainability of HPC applications across various scientific and industrial domains.

title: Lighthouse Codes for HPC Applications
summary_text: The grant call focuses on the development and optimization of "Lighthouse Codes" for high-performance computing (HPC) applications, aiming to enhance Europe's competitiveness in scientific and industrial domains. Key research topics include code development and optimization, feature enhancement, architecture adaptation for new HPC platforms, and readiness for exascale and AI capabilities. The initiative emphasizes collaboration among researchers, industry, and HPC experts to create sustainable, high-quality software that addresses significant scientific challenges and drives innovation across various sectors.

title: Women Leadership Category
summary_text: The key research topics focus on enhancing public awareness of women's contributions to the EU innovation ecosystem and promoting gender diversity in innovation. The initiative aims to create role models that inspire more women to engage in innovative activities.

title: Rising Innovators category
summary_text: The European Prize for Women Innovators focuses on recognizing and celebrating women entrepreneurs who have developed transformative innovations that contribute to societal and environmental benefits. It aims to inspire future generations of women and girls to pursue careers in science, technology, and innovation, fostering a supportive culture within research and innovation sectors. The prize includes categories for established women innovators and emerging leaders, highlighting their roles in the EU innovation ecosystem.

title: Women Innovators category
summary_text: The European Prize for Women Innovators focuses on recognizing and celebrating women entrepreneurs who have developed transformative innovations that contribute to societal and environmental benefits. It aims to inspire future generations of women and girls to pursue careers in science, technology, and innovation, fostering a supportive culture within research and innovation sectors. The prize includes categories for established women innovators and emerging talent, highlighting their roles in the EU innovation ecosystem.

title: Leveraging Europe's Expertise to accelerate Cell Therapy for Type 1 Diabetes
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing beta-cell therapy for type 1 diabetes (T1D) through several key research areas, including the development of standardized manufacturing protocols, immune-modulating strategies to enhance graft survival, and the integration of AI-driven predictive tools for personalized treatment. It aims to establish robust preclinical models, define patient-centered clinical endpoints, and explore sustainable reimbursement models to facilitate the adoption of innovative therapies. Additionally, the initiative seeks to foster collaboration among academia, industry, and healthcare providers to strengthen Europe's leadership in regenerative medicine and improve treatment outcomes for patients with T1D.

title: Understanding how infections foster and induce non-communicable diseases
summary_text: The grant call focuses on the interplay between infectious agents (IAs) and non-communicable diseases (NCDs), particularly neurodegenerative and cardiometabolic diseases. Key research topics include identifying causal links and biomarkers for early intervention strategies, developing vaccine strategies to prevent chronic diseases, and utilizing innovative approaches such as multi-omics and artificial intelligence to enhance diagnostic and therapeutic methods. The aim is to improve patient outcomes and quality of life by understanding the mechanisms through which infections contribute to chronic disease progression.

title: AI-Powered Signal Detection in Pharmacovigilance
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing drug safety through the use of artificial intelligence (AI) for signal detection and risk prediction in pharmacovigilance. Key research topics include the development of AI-powered algorithms for faster and more accurate identification of adverse drug reactions, the evaluation of diverse data sources for effective signal detection, and the creation of predictive models to foresee potential risks. Additionally, the initiative aims to establish practical guidelines and recommendations for implementing AI systems in real-world scenarios, ensuring ethical and legal compliance throughout the process.

title: Establishing Ortho and Cardiology Ambulatory Surgical Centres in Europe
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing the establishment and operation of ambulatory surgical centers (ASCs) in orthopaedics and cardiology, aiming to enhance healthcare efficiency and patient access. Key research topics include the development of infrastructure and training programs for healthcare providers, the implementation of interoperable digital solutions for patient management, and the establishment of reimbursement models that support ASC services. Additionally, the initiative seeks to generate evidence on the safety and effectiveness of procedures performed in ASCs compared to traditional hospital settings, while addressing challenges such as stakeholder acceptance and resource readiness.

title: Towards precision medicine: platform for transdiagnostic stratification of brain dysfunction
summary_text: The grant call focuses on developing a sustainable data platform for precision medicine that links behaviors and symptoms to biological markers, particularly for Central Nervous System (CNS)-driven disorders such as Alzheimer's disease, major depressive disorder, and obesity. Key research topics include advancing the mechanistic understanding of transdiagnostic symptoms related to reward/motivation and impulsivity, identifying novel candidate markers for these symptoms, and improving patient outcomes through integrated and personalized healthcare approaches. The initiative emphasizes collaboration among stakeholders, including healthcare professionals and individuals with lived experience, to foster innovation in diagnostics and treatment frameworks.

title: Support to the International HPC Summer School
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing European participation in the International HPC Summer School (IHPCSS) by providing financial support for early-career researchers in high-performance computing (HPC) and quantum technologies. Key research topics include the organization of multidisciplinary training programs, fostering international collaboration, promoting diversity and inclusion within the HPC community, and developing structured evaluation mechanisms to improve training outcomes. The initiative aims to create a balanced and geographically diverse cohort of participants while ensuring high-quality mentorship and networking opportunities with leading experts in the field.

title: Low power Edge AI Chips
summary_text: The key research topics focus on the development of AI chip prototypes that integrate advanced technologies such as non-volatile memories, neuromorphic computing, and photonic connectivity, aiming for technology readiness levels (TRL) of 6-7. The prototypes should demonstrate robust AI capabilities, including real-time inference and on-device learning, while achieving ultra-low power consumption for energy-efficient operations in edge environments. Applications are expected in mobile communication networks, autonomous systems, industrial automation, and healthcare, contributing to Europe's digital transformation and sustainability goals.

title: HORIZON-JU-CHIPS-2025-CSA-JPN
summary_text: The key research topics focus on life cycle assessment (LCA) of semiconductor manufacturing processes, enhancing collaboration between the EU and Japan in semiconductor research and innovation (R&I), and improving the stability of the semiconductor supply chain. The initiative aims to facilitate researcher exchanges, develop a reference database for LCA and greenhouse gas emissions, and foster networking among stakeholders to address current and future needs in the semiconductor sector.

title: ERC STARTING GRANTS
summary_text: The ERC Starting Grant focuses on supporting innovative research led by early-career Principal Investigators who have demonstrated potential for research independence. Key scientific areas include the development of independent research teams and programs across various disciplines, with an emphasis on producing significant publications and advancing original research ideas. The grant aims to facilitate groundbreaking projects that may require substantial resources for experimental work, equipment, and access to large facilities.

title: ERC SYNERGY GRANTS
summary_text: The grant call focuses on supporting collaborative research projects led by small groups of Principal Investigators to tackle ambitious and complex scientific problems that require interdisciplinary approaches. Key research topics include the cross-fertilization of scientific fields, the exploration of new lines of inquiry, and the application of innovative methods and techniques at the intersection of established disciplines. The aim is to produce transformative research that has the potential to set global benchmarks in knowledge advancement.

title: Research Project Grant (Parent R01 Clinical Trial Required)
summary_text: The NIH Research Project Grant focuses on discrete research projects that include at least one clinical trial. The projects must align with the scientific missions of participating NIH Institutes and Centers, with an emphasis on mechanistic studies that qualify as clinical trials.

title: Research Project Grant (Parent R01 Basic Experimental Studies with Humans Required)
summary_text: The NIH Research Project Grant focuses on basic science experimental studies involving human participants, specifically those that prospectively assign individuals to conditions to manipulate independent variables and assess biomedical or behavioral outcomes. The aim is to understand fundamental phenomena without immediate application towards processes or products. Research proposals must align with the scientific missions of the participating NIH Institutes and Centers.

title: NIH Research Project Grant (Parent R01 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: The NIH Research Project Grant focuses on discrete research projects aligned with the specific interests and competencies of the investigators. Proposed projects should relate to the scientific missions of participating NIH Institutes and Centers, excluding clinical trial applications.

title: NIH Exploratory/Developmental Research Grant Program (Parent R21 Basic Experimental Studies with Humans Required)
summary_text: The NIH Exploratory/Developmental Grant focuses on supporting innovative research projects in the early stages that may involve significant risk but have the potential for breakthroughs in biomedical, behavioral, or clinical research. Key research topics include basic science experimental studies involving human participants, particularly those that prospectively assign participants to conditions to assess biomedical or behavioral outcomes, aimed at understanding fundamental phenomena without immediate application in mind.

title: NIH Exploratory/Developmental Research Grant Program (Parent R21 Clinical Trial Required)
summary_text: The NIH Exploratory/Developmental Grant focuses on supporting high-risk, innovative research projects that aim to develop novel techniques, methodologies, or applications in biomedical, behavioral, or clinical research. Proposals must include at least one clinical trial and align with the scientific missions of participating NIH Institutes and Centers, particularly those emphasizing mechanistic studies.

title: NIH Exploratory/Developmental Research Grant Program (Parent R21 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: The NIH Exploratory/Developmental Grant focuses on supporting innovative and high-risk research projects in biomedical, behavioral, and clinical fields. Key areas of interest include the development of novel techniques, methodologies, agents, and models that have the potential to lead to significant breakthroughs in research.

title: NIH Small Research Grant Program (Parent R03 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: The NIH Small Research Grant Program focuses on supporting small-scale research projects, including pilot and feasibility studies, secondary data analysis, and the development of research methodologies and technologies. It emphasizes projects that can be completed quickly and with limited resources, while excluding clinical trial proposals.

title: NIDCR Small Grant Program for New Investigators (R03 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: The NIDCR Small Grant Program for New Investigators focuses on supporting basic and clinical research in oral, dental, and craniofacial fields. It aims to facilitate pilot studies and developmental projects that generate preliminary data for future research grant applications.

title: Understanding and Modifying Temporal Dynamics of Coordinated Neural Activity (R01 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This grant call focuses on research that investigates the impact of modifying electrophysiological patterns on cognitive, affective, and social processing in both animal and human subjects. It encourages studies that explore how specific patterns of coordinated neural activity can enhance these processes, emphasizing the importance of understanding neural activity rhythms and their role in information routing and local processing coherence.

title: Understanding and Modifying Temporal Dynamics of Coordinated Neural Activity (R21 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This grant call focuses on research that investigates the impact of modifying electrophysiological patterns on cognitive, affective, and social processing in both animal and human subjects. It encourages studies that explore how specific patterns of coordinated neural activity can enhance these processes, emphasizing the importance of understanding neural activity rhythms and their role in information routing and local processing coherence.

title: Research on Autism Spectrum Disorders (R01 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on research aimed at understanding the causes and spread of Autism Spectrum Disorders (ASD), improving diagnostic methods, and identifying effective service delivery strategies. Key research topics include the etiology and epidemiology of ASD, as well as advancements in diagnosis and treatment approaches.

title: NICHD Small Research Grant Program (R03 Clinical Trial Required)
summary_text: The NICHD Small Research Grant Program focuses on supporting clinical trials that align with the mission of the National Institute of Child Health and Human Development (NICHD). Key research topics include child health, human development, and related clinical interventions.

title: NICHD Small Research Grant Program (R03 Basic Experimental Studies with Humans Required)
summary_text: The NICHD Small Research Grant Program supports clinical trials focused on basic science experimental studies involving human participants. Key research topics include prospective studies that manipulate independent variables to assess biomedical or behavioral outcomes, aimed at understanding fundamental phenomena without immediate application towards specific processes or products.

title: NIMH Exploratory/Developmental Research Grant (R21 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: The NIMH Exploratory/Developmental Grant program focuses on high-risk, exploratory research projects that align with the NIMH mission. Key areas of interest include the development of novel techniques, methods, and strategies in biomedical, behavioral, and clinical mental health research, as well as the generation of pilot or feasibility data that could significantly impact mental health care delivery.

title: Development and Testing of Novel Interventions to improve HIV Prevention, Treatment, and Program Implementation for People Who Use Drugs (R34 Clinical Trial Required)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on formative research and the development and pilot-testing of interventions aimed at HIV prevention and treatment for people who use drugs. Key research topics include the feasibility, tolerability, acceptability, and safety of novel or adapted interventions, which may encompass behavioral, social, structural, and combination biomedical approaches to enhance clinical outcomes and prevent HIV transmission.

title: Joint NINDS/NIMH Exploratory Neuroscience Research Grant (R21 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: The Joint NINDS/NIMH Exploratory Neuroscience Research Grant program focuses on innovative and exploratory research in neuroscience, particularly in understanding neurological and mental health disorders. Key areas of interest include the feasibility of novel investigative approaches, the development of new techniques and methodologies, and mechanistic clinical trials or basic experimental studies involving human subjects.

title: Pilot Health Services and Economic Research on the Treatment of Drug, Alcohol, and Tobacco Use Disorders (R34 - Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on pilot and preliminary research aimed at optimizing access to and the effectiveness of treatments for drug, tobacco, and alcohol use disorders, as well as related services for comorbid medical and mental health conditions. It encourages the exploration of both novel and commonly used interventions, practices, and policies that lack an evidence base, with an emphasis on assessing their feasibility, acceptability, and utility.

title: Effectiveness of School-Based Health Centers to Advance Health Equity (R01 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This grant call focuses on researching the effectiveness of school-based health centers (SBHCs) in delivering health services to school-aged children, particularly those from underserved populations facing health disparities. The aim is to evaluate how well these centers meet the health needs of these youth.

title: Integration of Imaging and Fluid-Based Tumor Monitoring in Cancer Therapy (R01 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: The National Cancer Institute (NCI) is seeking research projects that focus on integrating imaging techniques with fluid-based tumor monitoring, specifically liquid biopsy assays, during cancer therapy. The aim is to enhance the understanding of therapy response and the development of resistance in cancer patients.

title: Investigator Initiated Research in Computational Genomics and Data Science (R01 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on research in computational genomics, data science, statistics, and bioinformatics, aimed at advancing both basic and clinical genomic science with implications for human health and disease. It encourages the development of innovative analytical methodologies, early-stage tools, and the enhancement of existing software to support the biomedical genomics community, with an emphasis on scalability to handle larger datasets across various diseases and biological systems.

title: Investigator Initiated Research in Computational Genomics and Data Science (R21 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on research in computational genomics, data science, statistics, and bioinformatics, aimed at advancing both basic and clinical genomic science with implications for human health and disease. It supports the development of innovative analytical methodologies, early-stage tools and software, and enhancements of existing high-value tools for the biomedical genomics community, emphasizing scalability to handle larger datasets across various diseases and biological systems.

title: Imaging - Science Track Award for Research Transition (I/START) (R03- Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on advancing neuroimaging research by supporting small "proof of concept" studies. It aims to facilitate both new and established investigators in adopting neuroimaging methodologies within their research programs.

title: Imaging - Science Track Award for Research Transition (I/START) (R03- Basic Experimental Studies with Humans Required)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on advancing neuroimaging research by supporting small "proof of concept" studies. It aims to facilitate both new and established investigators in adopting neuroimaging methodologies within their research programs.

title: Time-Sensitive Obesity Policy and Program Evaluation (R01 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on time-sensitive research aimed at evaluating new policies or programs that influence obesity-related behaviors, such as dietary intake, physical activity, and sedentary behavior, as well as weight outcomes. The goal is to support empirical studies that can only be conducted through expedited review and funding, emphasizing the urgency and scientific significance of the research.

title: Small Grants for New Investigators to Promote Diversity in Health-Related Research (R21 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This funding opportunity supports small research projects in the areas of diabetes, digestive diseases, and kidney diseases, as outlined by the National Institute of Diabetes and Digestive and Kidney Diseases (NIDDK). It encourages new investigators, particularly those from underrepresented backgrounds, to conduct pilot studies, feasibility studies, secondary data analyses, and the development of research methodologies and technologies.

title: Mechanism for Time-Sensitive Drug Abuse Research (R21 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on pilot and exploratory research in substance use epidemiology and health services, specifically addressing: 1) responses to sudden increases in drug use, particularly opioids and synthetic cannabinoids; 2) emerging trends in marijuana use and related policy changes; 3) timely research opportunities regarding prescription drug abuse; 4) evolving issues in addiction services within the healthcare system; and 5) changes in the criminal or juvenile justice systems related to drug abuse and healthcare access. The emphasis is on the urgency of these topics due to imminent policy changes or emerging challenges.

title: AIDS-Science Track Award for Research Transition (R03 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: The funding opportunity focuses on research related to drug use, substance use disorders (SUD), and HIV/AIDS. It encourages early career investigators to explore these topics, particularly through projects that can be conducted quickly and with limited resources, integrating substance use and HIV/AIDS across various research areas supported by NIDA.

title: Neuromodulation/Neurostimulation Device Development for Mental Health Applications (R01 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on the development of next-generation brain stimulation devices aimed at treating mental health disorders. Key research topics include the creation of novel stimulation techniques that surpass current electrical and magnetic methods, as well as significant enhancements to existing FDA-approved devices in terms of spatial resolution, depth of delivery, and precision. The emphasis is on innovative approaches that enable increased spatiotemporal precision and multi-focal, closed-loop stimulation.

title: Neuromodulation/Neurostimulation Device Development for Mental Health Applications (R21 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on the development of next-generation brain stimulation devices aimed at treating mental health disorders. Key research topics include the creation of novel stimulation techniques that surpass current electrical/magnetic methods, as well as significant enhancements to existing FDA-approved devices, emphasizing improvements in spatial resolution, depth of delivery, and precision. Collaborative applications from multidisciplinary teams with expertise in systems neuroscience, engineering, clinical, and regulatory affairs are encouraged.

title: Modulating Human Microbiome Function to Enhance Immune Responses Against Cancer  (R21 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on basic research exploring how the human microbiome influences anti-tumor immune responses, aiming to identify novel molecular targets for cancer prevention. Key topics include the interactions between specific microbes or their metabolites and host immune responses, as well as the effects of concentration, timing, and duration of beneficial microbes on inflammation-related and sporadic tumor formation.

title: Modulating Human Microbiome Function to Enhance Immune Responses Against Cancer (R01 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This grant call focuses on basic research investigating how the human microbiome influences anti-tumor immune responses, aiming to identify novel molecular targets for cancer prevention. Key topics include the interactions between specific microbes or their metabolites and host immune responses, as well as the effects of concentration, timing, and duration of beneficial microbes on inflammation-related and sporadic tumor formation.

title: Patient-Clinician Relationship: Improving Health Outcomes in Populations that Experience Health Care Disparities (R01 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: NIMHD seeks to fund innovative multi-disciplinary research that explores the impact of optimizing patient-clinician relationships and communication on healthcare outcomes. The focus is on populations experiencing health disparities, incorporating behavioral, biological, environmental, social, and cultural factors at various levels, including individual, interpersonal, and community.

title: Basic Neurodevelopmental Biology of Circuits and Behavior (R01 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on research examining the connections between brain circuit maturation and behavioral development in rodents and non-human primates. It aims to understand how interactions within and between brain regions evolve during pre- and post-natal development, influencing cognitive, affective, and social behaviors. Projects should utilize in vivo neural measures in awake, behaving animals to explore neurodevelopmental trajectories.

title: Drug Discovery For Nervous System Disorders (R21 Clinical Trials Not Allowed)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on the discovery of novel compounds for preventing and treating nervous system disorders. Key research topics include the identification and synthesis of candidate therapeutics, hit-to-lead chemistry for enhancing compound activity, lead optimization for improved efficacy and pharmacokinetics, and initial drug metabolism and pharmacokinetics (DMPK) studies. Emphasis is placed on innovative approaches to identify potential therapeutic agents.

title: Basic Neurodevelopmental Biology of Circuits and Behavior (R21 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on research examining the connections between brain circuit maturation and behavioral development in rodents and non-human primates. It aims to understand how interactions within and between brain regions evolve during pre- and post-natal development, influencing cognitive, affective, and social behaviors, using in vivo neural measures in awake, behaving animals.

title: Drug Discovery For Nervous System Disorders (R01 Clinical Trials Not Allowed)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on the discovery of novel compounds for preventing and treating nervous system disorders. Key research topics include the identification and synthesis of candidate therapeutics, hit-to-lead chemistry for enhancing compound activity, lead optimization for improved efficacy and pharmacokinetics, and initial drug metabolism and pharmacokinetics (DMPK) studies. Emphasis is placed on innovative approaches to identify potential therapeutic agents.

title: Early-Stage Preclinical Validation of Therapeutic Leads for Diseases of Interest to the NIDDK (R01 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on translational research aimed at advancing therapeutics related to health outcomes in obesity, diabetes, endocrinology, metabolism, digestive diseases, liver diseases, nutrition, kidney and urological diseases, and hematology. Researchers are encouraged to align their projects with the priorities of the National Institute of Diabetes and Digestive and Kidney Diseases (NIDDK).

title: NEI Clinical Research Study Planning Grant Program (R34 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: The National Eye Institute (NEI) is focused on supporting large-scale clinical vision research, specifically in the areas of randomized clinical trials and epidemiologic studies. Key research topics include the refinement of study protocols and procedures, development of detailed Manuals of Procedures (MOP), and conducting preliminary studies to enhance recruitment potential, without generating data on intervention effects.

title: Accelerating the Pace of Child Health Research Using Existing Data from the Adolescent Brain Cognitive Development (ABCD) Study (R21-Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: The ABCD Study focuses on adolescent health and development by collecting data on mental health, cognitive function, substance use, and brain structure and function from youth aged 9-10 over a decade. This funding opportunity encourages research proposals that analyze the publicly available dataset to enhance understanding of these key areas in adolescent development.

title: Accelerating the Pace of Child Health Research Using Existing Data from the Adolescent Brain Cognitive Development (ABCD) Study (R01-Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: The ABCD Study focuses on understanding adolescent health and development by collecting data on mental health, cognitive function, substance use, and brain structure and function from youth aged 9-10 over a decade. Researchers are encouraged to analyze this dataset to enhance knowledge in these key areas.

title: NEI Research Grant for Vision-Related Secondary Data Analysis (R21 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on vision-related research projects that utilize secondary data analyses from existing databases. It also encourages the development of statistical methodologies aimed at enhancing the analysis of vision health data.

title: NIDCR Small Research Grants for Oral Health Data Analysis and Statistical Methodology Development (R03 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on supporting research that conducts secondary statistical analyses of existing dental, oral, or craniofacial databases. It also encourages the development of new statistical methodologies for analyzing these types of data.

title: Dissemination and Implementation Research in Health (R03 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on research aimed at identifying and testing strategies to enhance the adoption and sustainability of evidence-based interventions, particularly in underrepresented communities. It also encourages studies that explore the de-implementation of ineffective or harmful practices, as well as the advancement of methods and measures in dissemination and implementation research.

title: Dissemination and Implementation Research in Health (R21 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on research aimed at identifying and testing strategies to enhance the adoption and sustainability of evidence-based interventions, particularly in underrepresented communities. It also encourages studies that explore the de-implementation of ineffective or harmful practices, as well as the advancement of methods and measures in dissemination and implementation research.

title: Dissemination and Implementation Research in Health (R01 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on research aimed at identifying and testing strategies to enhance the adoption and sustainability of evidence-based interventions, particularly in underrepresented communities. It also encourages studies that explore the de-implementation of ineffective or harmful practices, as well as the advancement of methods and measures in dissemination and implementation research.

title: Research Opportunities for New and "At-Risk" Investigators to Promote Workforce Diversity (R01 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This grant call invites R01 applications for independent research projects aligned with the scientific missions of participating NIH Institutes or Centers. It emphasizes support for New Investigators and At-Risk Investigators, particularly those from diverse and underrepresented backgrounds in health-related sciences.

title: Single-Site Investigator-Initiated Clinical Trials (R61/R33 Clinical Trial Required)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on developing and implementing investigator-initiated single-site clinical trials, including efficacy, comparative effectiveness, pragmatic, and implementation research. The trials may explore various therapeutic, behavioral, and prevention strategies relevant to the NHLBI's research mission. Applicants are expected to provide a scientific rationale and a detailed operational plan for the trial, addressing aspects such as project management and subject recruitment.

title: Limited Competition: Small Grant Program for NIDDK K01/K08/K23/K25 Recipients (R03 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: The NIDDK is focusing on enhancing the research capabilities of K01, K08, K23, and K25 award recipients through Small Grant (R03) support. Key research topics include pilot and feasibility studies, secondary data analysis, small self-contained projects, and the development of research methodologies and technologies, all aimed at facilitating the transition to independent investigator status.

title: NLM Research Grants in Biomedical Informatics and Data Science (R01 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: The National Library of Medicine (NLM) is focused on supporting innovative research in biomedical informatics and data science, particularly in areas that enhance biomedical discovery and data-driven health. Key topics include the development of new methods for integrating complex research outputs, improving clinical care and public health practices, and creating scalable and reusable approaches for the curation, analysis, and management of health-related data.

title: Limited Competition: Small Grant Program for NHLBI K01/K08/K23/K25 Recipients (R03 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on supporting research projects that expand on the objectives of NHLBI K01, K08, K23, and K25 awardees, allowing them to conduct pilot studies, proof of concept research, secondary data analyses, and develop new methodologies or experimental models. The aim is to generate preliminary data that can lead to future R01 applications, with an emphasis on projects that can be completed within two years. Additionally, the research may include patient-oriented studies, particularly for K23 awardees.

title: Trailblazer Award for New and Early Stage Investigators (R21 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: The Trailblazer Award focuses on research that integrates engineering and physical sciences with life and biomedical sciences. It encourages exploratory, developmental, and high-risk projects that may be technology design-directed, discovery-driven, or hypothesis-driven, with an emphasis on innovative approaches that require minimal or no preliminary data.

title: Secondary Analysis of Existing Datasets in Heart, Lung, and Blood Diseases and Sleep Disorders (R21 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on utilizing existing human datasets for secondary analyses to explore innovative scientific concepts or develop new models, systems, tools, methods, or technologies. The aim is to enhance biomedical or biobehavioral research in alignment with the NHLBI mission.

title: NCI Small Grants Program for Cancer Research for Years 2023, 2024, and 2025 (NCI Omnibus) (R03 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on small-scale cancer research projects, including pilot studies, feasibility studies, and secondary data analysis. It also supports the development of research methodologies and new research technologies related to cancer.

title: Clinical Studies of Mental Illness (Collaborative R01) (Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on collaborative clinical studies in mental health, specifically targeting mental health genetics, biomarker research, and the study of mental illnesses, including their association with HIV/AIDS. The emphasis is on studies that require multiple sites to enhance sample size, recruitment, and diversity, while adhering to a shared protocol across these sites.

title: Laboratories to Optimize Digital Health (R01 Clinical Trial Required)
summary_text: NIMH is seeking innovative research projects focused on enhancing digital mental health interventions. Key areas of interest include the development of digital health test beds, optimization of existing evidence-based interventions, and conducting statistically powered clinical trials to assess the effectiveness of these digital mental health solutions.

title: Building in vivo Preclinical Assays of Circuit Engagement for Application in Therapeutic Development (R01 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on developing in vivo neurophysiological and behavioral assays in animal models for early screening in treatment development for mental illnesses. It aims to optimize measures that serve as surrogate markers of neural processes, enhancing the scientific value of preclinical data by linking therapeutic targets and treatment candidates to relevant neurobiological mechanisms.

title: Utilizing Invasive Recording and Stimulating Opportunities in Humans to Advance Neural Circuitry Understanding of Mental Health Disorders (R01 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on invasive neural recording studies aimed at understanding the neural circuitry and dynamics associated with mental health disorders. Researchers are encouraged to investigate specific questions related to moods, emotions, cognitive functions, and behaviors, utilizing the high spatial and temporal resolution of invasive techniques to explore neural circuit functions. The emphasis is on addressing gaps in knowledge rather than developing new technologies or therapies.

title: Utilizing Invasive Recording and Stimulating Opportunities in Humans to Advance Neural Circuitry Understanding of Mental Health Disorders (R21 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on invasive neural recording studies aimed at understanding the neural circuitry and dynamics associated with mental health disorders. Researchers are encouraged to investigate specific questions related to moods, emotions, cognitive functions, and behaviors, utilizing high-resolution techniques to explore neural circuit functions. The emphasis is on addressing gaps in knowledge rather than developing new technologies or therapies.

title: Small R01s for Clinical Trials Targeting Diseases within the Mission of NIDDK (R01 Clinical Trial Required)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on pilot and feasibility clinical trials in humans aimed at the prevention and treatment of diseases under the NIDDK's mission. It supports small, short-term trials to gather preliminary data on intervention effects, recruitment, retention, and study conduct, with the goal of paving the way for larger, hypothesis-driven trials that can enhance understanding and improve clinical practice or public health.

title: Advancing HIV/AIDS Research within the Mission of the NIDCD (R01 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on stimulating HIV/AIDS research related to the scientific areas of hearing, balance, taste, smell, voice, speech, and language. It encourages applications that align with the high-priority research topics identified by the NIH Office of AIDS Research, particularly those that may involve low-risk clinical trials.

title: Advancing HIV/AIDS Research within the Mission of the NIDCD (R21 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on stimulating HIV/AIDS research related to hearing, balance, taste, smell, voice, speech, and language. It encourages applications that align with the high-priority research areas identified by the NIH Office of AIDS Research, specifically targeting the intersection of HIV/AIDS and communication disorders.

title: Limited Competition: Small Grant Program for ORIP Special Emphasis Research Career Award (SERCA) K01 Recipients (R03 Clinical Trials Not Allowed)
summary_text: The key research topics supported by this grant include pilot and feasibility studies, secondary analysis of existing data, small self-contained research projects, development of research methodology, and the creation of new research technology. The focus is on projects that can be completed within two years and do not involve clinical trials.

title: NIDCR Small Research Grants for Analyses of Existing Genomics Data (R03 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This grant call focuses on research related to human dental, oral, and craniofacial diseases and conditions. It emphasizes the use of data science approaches to analyze existing and publicly available genomics data to address relevant research questions in these areas.

title: NIDCR Research Grants for Analyses of Existing Genomics Data (R01) (Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This grant call focuses on research related to human dental, oral, and craniofacial diseases and conditions. It emphasizes the use of data science approaches to analyze existing and publicly available genomics data to address relevant research questions in these areas.

title: Development and Application of PET and SPECT Imaging Ligands as Biomarkers for Drug Discovery and for Pathophysiological Studies of CNS Disorders (R01 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This grant call focuses on the preclinical development of innovative radioligands for PET and SPECT imaging in rodent and nonhuman primate brains. It encourages the incorporation of pilot or clinical feasibility evaluations in preclinical studies and the development of suitable models for these imaging techniques.

title: Development and Application of PET and SPECT Imaging Ligands as Biomarkers for Drug Discovery and for Pathophysiological Studies of CNS Disorders (R01 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This grant call focuses on the development and evaluation of novel radioligands for PET and SPECT imaging in the human brain. It emphasizes the incorporation of pilot or clinical feasibility evaluations based on previously collected pre-clinical data to advance promising PET ligands for clinical research applications.

title: Catalytic Tool and Technology Development in Kidney, Urologic, and Hematologic Diseases (R21 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This grant call focuses on the development of innovative tools and technologies aimed at addressing kidney, urologic, and hematologic diseases. Key research topics include advancements in diagnostics, treatment methods, and management strategies for these specific health conditions.

title: Assay Development and Screening for Discovery of Validated Chemical Hits for Brain Disorders (R01 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on two key research areas: the discovery and development of novel small molecules for potential treatment of psychiatric disorders, and the exploration of biological processes and diseases that may serve as new drug targets. The aim is to enhance understanding of these conditions and facilitate the advancement of therapeutic options.

title: Research on Bioethical Issues Related to Bionic and Robotic Device Development and Translation (R21 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This grant call focuses on the ethical considerations related to the design, testing, and implementation of bionic and robotic devices. Researchers are invited to explore the ethical questions that arise throughout these stages of development.

title: Novel Mechanism Research on Neuropsychiatric Symptoms (NPS) in Alzheimer's Dementia (R21 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on research aimed at understanding the mechanisms underlying neuropsychiatric symptoms (NPS) in Alzheimer's disease (AD) and Alzheimer’s disease-related dementias (ADRD). Key areas of interest include exploring biobehavioral and neurobiological pathways associated with NPS, as well as identifying potential therapeutic targets for interventions to treat and prevent these symptoms.

title: Novel Mechanism Research on Neuropsychiatric Symptoms (NPS) in Alzheimer's Dementia (R01 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on research aimed at understanding the mechanisms underlying neuropsychiatric symptoms in individuals with Alzheimer's disease and related dementias. It emphasizes the exploration of both biobehavioral and neurobiological pathways, with the goal of identifying novel therapeutic targets for interventions to treat and prevent these symptoms.

title: NEI Translational Research Program for Therapeutics (R61/R33 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on the translation of innovative laboratory research into therapeutics for visual system diseases or disorders. Key research topics include the development of biological, pharmacological, medical device, and combination product interventions, with an emphasis on generating preclinical data that supports the progression towards Investigational New Drug (IND) or Investigational Device Exception (IDE) applications. The program encourages multidisciplinary collaboration and outlines a milestone-driven approach to facilitate the transition from research to clinical application.

title: NEI Translational Research Program for Therapeutics (R33 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This grant call emphasizes the translation of innovative laboratory research into therapeutics for visual system diseases, focusing on the development of biological, pharmacological, and medical device interventions. It encourages multidisciplinary teams to generate preclinical data that supports the advancement of a therapeutic candidate through FDA IND/IDE-enabling studies and the design of clinical trials. Key research topics include the creation of new technological and pharmacological resources aimed at improving clinical outcomes for patients with visual disorders.

title: Schizophrenia and related disorders during mid- to late-life (R21 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This initiative focuses on advancing translational research to understand the emergence and progression of schizophrenia and related disorders in individuals aged 35 and older. It aims to identify underlying mechanisms and potential targets for future prevention and treatment strategies for these conditions as they manifest and evolve in mid to late life.

title: Cellular and Molecular Biology of Complex Brain Disorders (R01 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
