summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on researching the biology of high-confidence risk factors linked to complex brain disorders, emphasizing intracellular, transcellular, and circuit mechanisms of neural function. It encourages studies that explore the neurobiological impacts of individual or combined risk factors, including their molecular and cellular components, while promoting the dissemination of findings to enhance data resources related to disease mechanisms and therapeutic targets.

title: Cellular and Molecular Biology of Complex Brain Disorders (R21 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on researching the biology of high-confidence risk factors linked to complex brain disorders, emphasizing intracellular, transcellular, and circuit mechanisms of neural function. It encourages studies that explore the neurobiological impacts of individual or combined risk factors, aiming to elucidate molecular and cellular components and their interactions within biological processes. The research should contribute to data resources that connect disease risk factors with biological mechanisms and potential therapeutic targets.

title: Intervention Research to Improve Native American Health (R01 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on research interventions aimed at improving health in Native American populations. Key areas of interest include etiologic research to inform intervention development, the efficacy and effectiveness of health promotion and disease prevention strategies, culturally informed treatment and recovery interventions, and dissemination and implementation research to enhance the adoption and sustainability of effective solutions. The initiative emphasizes leveraging community strengths and resilience to create culturally appropriate, science-based interventions that address health disparities and improve overall health outcomes.

title: Intervention Research to Improve Native American Health (R34 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on research interventions aimed at improving health in Native American populations. Key areas of interest include etiologic research to inform intervention development, the efficacy and effectiveness of health promotion and disease prevention strategies, culturally informed treatment interventions, and dissemination and implementation research to enhance the adoption and sustainability of effective solutions. The initiative emphasizes leveraging community strengths and resilience to create culturally appropriate, science-based interventions that address health disparities and improve overall health outcomes.

title: NIAID and NIDDK Research Opportunities for New and "At-Risk" Investigators to Promote Workforce Diversity (R01 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This funding opportunity aims to support research projects aligned with the missions of the National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases (NIAID) and the National Institute of Diabetes and Digestive and Kidney Diseases (NIDDK). Key research topics include infectious diseases, immune system responses, diabetes, and kidney health, with a focus on fostering new and at-risk investigators from diverse backgrounds in the health-related sciences.

title: Interventions on Health and Healthcare Disparities on Non-Communicable and Chronic Diseases in Latin America: Improving Health Outcomes Across the Hemisphere (R01 - Clinical Trial Required)
summary_text: This funding opportunity aims to support interdisciplinary research teams investigating clinical, health services, and community-based interventions targeting health and healthcare disparities associated with non-communicable and chronic diseases in Latin America and among U.S. Hispanics/Latinos. The focus is on addressing the highest burden and mortality rates of these diseases through meaningful collaboration with partners from Latin American institutions.

title: Unveiling Health and Healthcare Disparities in Non-Communicable and Chronic Diseases in Latin America: Setting the Stage for Better Health Outcomes Across the Hemisphere (R01 - Clinical Trials Not Allowed)
summary_text: The key research topics for this funding opportunity include clinical epidemiology, evaluation of public and health care policies, and validation of measurements related to health disparities. The focus is on non-communicable and chronic diseases with significant impact in Latin America and among U.S. Hispanics/Latinos, emphasizing collaborative, multi-disciplinary approaches.

title: Ethical, Legal and Social Implications (ELSI) Research (R01 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This grant call invites research proposals focused on the ethical, legal, and social implications (ELSI) of human genetics and genomics. It encourages the use of various research methods, including qualitative and quantitative approaches, as well as conceptual and legal analyses, with an emphasis on stakeholder involvement.

title: Ethical, Legal and Social Implications (ELSI) Exploratory/Developmental Research Grant (R21 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This grant call invites research proposals focused on the ethical, legal, and social implications (ELSI) of human genetics and genomics. Key areas of interest include the study of new or emerging genomic technologies and novel applications of genomic information, utilizing various research methods and involving relevant stakeholders.

title: Ethical, Legal and Social Implications (ELSI) Small Research Grant (R03 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This funding opportunity invites research proposals that investigate the ethical, legal, and social implications (ELSI) of human genetics and genomics. Key focus areas include normative and conceptual analyses across various disciplines such as law, economics, philosophy, anthropology, and history, particularly concerning new or emerging issues in the field. Additionally, projects may involve preliminary data collection or secondary analysis of existing data.

title: NHLBI Clinical Trial Pilot Studies (R34 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on research that informs the planning of Phase II-IV clinical trials related to heart, lung, blood, and sleep disorders. It aims to support studies that provide necessary and sufficient data to design or plan these trials, specifically targeting the efficacy, safety, clinical management, or implementation of interventions for these conditions. The research should address scientific or operational questions that will aid in the final development of the subsequent clinical trials.

title: Phased Research to Support Substance Use Epidemiology, Prevention, and Services Studies (R61/R33 Clinical Trials Optional)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on translational research in the fields of epidemiology, services, and prevention related to substance use and its impact on public health. It aims to support projects that can effectively transition from initial planning and hypothesis testing to practical interventions, with an emphasis on innovative approaches that could lead to significant advancements in the field.

title: In Vivo High-Resolution Imaging for Inner Ear Visualization (R01 Clinical Trial optional)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on advancing in vivo high-resolution imaging technologies for the human inner ear, emphasizing the development of techniques that enhance the visualization of inner ear structures with greater detail and accuracy. Key research topics include improving existing imaging methods, creating new imaging probes or contrast agents, and visualizing both structural and functional elements of the inner ear, such as hair cells and vasculature, in awake patients. Collaborative, multi-disciplinary approaches are encouraged, with studies permitted in humans and relevant animal models.

title: Multidisciplinary Studies of HIV/AIDS and Aging (R01 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This grant call focuses on research that explores the intersection of HIV and aging, specifically aiming to enhance understanding of the biological, clinical, and socio-behavioral aspects of aging in the context of HIV infection and treatment. Additionally, it seeks to improve strategies for testing, preventing, and treating HIV, as well as managing related comorbidities and complications across diverse populations and cultural settings, utilizing current aging science methodologies.

title: Multidisciplinary Studies of HIV/AIDS and Aging (R21 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This grant call focuses on research that explores the intersection of HIV and aging, specifically aiming to enhance understanding of the biological, clinical, and socio-behavioral aspects of aging in the context of HIV infection and treatment. Additionally, it seeks to improve strategies for testing, preventing, and treating HIV, as well as managing related comorbidities and complications across diverse populations and cultural settings, utilizing current aging science methodologies.

title: National Cancer Institute's Investigator-Initiated Early Phase Clinical Trials for Cancer Treatment and Diagnosis (R01 Clinical Trial Required)
summary_text: This grant call seeks research projects that focus on early phase clinical trials (Phase 0, I, and II) targeting cancer diagnostics and therapeutics. Key scientific areas include cancer therapy evaluation, cancer imaging, cancer diagnosis, radiation research, complementary and alternative medicine, and HIV/AIDS malignancies. Projects must align with the research mission of the DCTD and OHAM.

title: Cancer Prevention and Control Clinical Trials Grant Program (R01 Clinical Trial Required)
summary_text: The National Cancer Institute (NCI) is seeking applications for investigator-initiated clinical trials focused on reducing cancer burden through advancements in early detection, screening, prevention, healthcare delivery, quality of life, and survivorship. The trials should aim to enhance clinical practice and public health, while specifically excluding studies related to cancer diagnosis or oncologic therapy. Proposed projects should align with the interests of the NCI Division of Cancer Prevention and the Division of Cancer Control and Population Sciences.

title: Pilot and Feasibility Studies in Preparation for Substance Use Prevention Trials (R34 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on pilot and feasibility research aimed at developing and testing interventions to prevent or delay substance use and its progression to misuse or disorder. It also emphasizes the pre-trial feasibility and acceptability of services related to substance use prevention, with additional interest in reducing negative outcomes such as impaired driving fatalities, suicidal behavior, and the transmission of HIV and viral hepatitis among diverse populations.

title: Priority HIV/AIDS Research within the Mission of NIDDK (R01 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on stimulating research related to HIV/AIDS within the scope of the National Institute of Diabetes and Digestive and Kidney Diseases (NIDDK). It emphasizes alignment with the HIV/AIDS research priorities set by the NIH Office of AIDS Research, as outlined in the latest guidelines.

title: Lethal Means Safety Suicide Prevention Research in Healthcare and Community Settings (R34 Clinical Trial Required)
summary_text: The NIMH grant call focuses on evaluating the effectiveness of therapeutic and service delivery interventions that incorporate lethal means safety strategies to reduce suicide risk in healthcare and community settings. Key research topics include the optimization of these interventions, understanding therapeutic change mechanisms, and assessing feasibility, acceptability, and preliminary effectiveness in improving safety and lowering suicide risk. The goal is to gather data that will inform larger-scale effectiveness trials.

title: Pilot Studies of Biological, Behavioral and Social Mechanisms Contributing to HIV Pathogenesis Within the Mission of NIDDK (R21 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on innovative basic and translational research related to HIV/AIDS, particularly in understanding the pathophysiological mechanisms of HIV comorbidities, coinfections, and complications affecting various organs and tissues. It also emphasizes the investigation of biological mechanisms behind HIV reservoirs in NIDDK-relevant tissues to inform strategies for viral suppression or eradication, as well as the impact of social determinants of health on these issues.

title: NHLBI Early Phase Clinical Trials for Therapeutics and/or Diagnostics for HLBS Disorders (R33 CT Required)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on supporting phase I clinical trials aimed at developing diagnostic and therapeutic interventions for heart, lung, blood, and sleep (HLBS) disorders in both adults and children. The trials can be conducted at single or multiple sites, and applicants must be prepared to initiate the trials promptly after receiving funding.

title: NHLBI Early Phase Clinical Trials for Therapeutics and/or Diagnostics for HLBS Disorders (R61/R33 Clinical Trial Required)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on supporting Phase I clinical trials for diagnostic and therapeutic interventions targeting heart, lung, blood, and sleep disorders in both adults and children. It emphasizes the need for final stage preclinical activities that are directly related to the proposed trials, which can be conducted at single or multiple sites.

title: Understanding the Intersection of Social Inequities to Optimize Health and Reduce Health Disparities: The Axes Initiative (R01 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: It seems there is no grant call description provided. Please share the details of the grant call, and I will help you extract and summarize the key research topics and scientific focus areas.

title: HEAL Initiative: JCOIN Phase II Innovation Hubs (R01 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: The key research topics of the JCOIN initiative include the implementation and delivery of medication for opioid use disorder (MOUD) within the US criminal justice system, addressing barriers to access for justice-involved individuals. The focus is on conducting hybrid effectiveness-implementation trials to improve treatment outcomes and reduce overdose risks for those with substance use disorders (SUD) and opioid use disorders (OUD) during and after incarceration.

title: Research Opportunities in Crisis Response Services for Suicide Prevention (R01 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: The key research topics focus on the impact of state and local policies on crisis response services, particularly in relation to the 988 rollout. The scientific focus areas include examining real-world settings that consider various clinical presentations, psychosocial factors, age groups, geographic locations, cultural contexts, and health disparities, with an emphasis on the continuum of crisis service systems and services for children and under-resourced populations.

title: Standardizing Data and Metadata from Wearable Devices (R01 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This grant call focuses on the development of standards for data accessibility from personal tracking devices, aiming to facilitate collaboration between researchers and device manufacturers. The initiative seeks to establish data standards similar to existing formats like DICOM and NIfTI, which are used for medical imaging, to enhance the usability of personal tracking device data in research.

title: D-START: Data Science Track Award for Research Transition (D/START) (R03-Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing addiction-related data science by encouraging both new and established researchers to apply innovative data science methodologies to critical questions in addiction research. It emphasizes the use of existing datasets, adherence to FAIR principles, and ethical considerations in research involving human subjects. The goal is to develop robust research programs that integrate cutting-edge data science techniques with addiction studies, starting with small-scale projects that can lead to larger initiatives.

title: BRAIN Initiative: Brain Behavior Quantification and Synchronization (R61/R33 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This grant call focuses on the development and validation of advanced platforms and analytical methods for accurately quantifying human behaviors and linking them to brain activity. Key research topics include the creation of multi-modal tools that offer high accuracy, specificity, and temporal resolution, as well as the synchronization of these tools for comprehensive measurement of behavior and brain function.

title: High Priority HIV and Substance Use Research (R01 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on innovative research at the intersection of HIV and substance use, aiming to explore new avenues for prevention, treatment, and potential cures for HIV among people who use drugs (PWUD). It encourages projects across a spectrum of research areas, including basic science, clinical, and implementation research, with a requirement for a detailed research plan and preliminary data. All studies must align with NIH HIV/AIDS Research Priorities.

title: Functional Validation and/or Characterization of Genes or Variants Implicated in Substance Use Disorders (R21/R33 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This initiative focuses on utilizing genome or epigenome editing to validate and characterize genes or variants associated with substance use disorder-related traits. The aim is to enhance understanding of the neurobiological mechanisms involved, ultimately contributing to the development of prevention, diagnostic, and therapeutic strategies.

title: Single Cell Opioid Responses in the Context of HIV (SCORCH) Program: Data Mining and Functional Validation (R21 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on data mining of single cell datasets to identify key biological components such as cell types, transcripts, enhancers, and transcriptional networks related to HIV/antiretroviral therapy (ART) and Substance Use Disorder (SUD). It also supports functional validation studies to confirm the biological roles of these identified components in the context of HIV/ART and SUD molecular responses.

title: Single Cell Opioid Responses in the Context of HIV (SCORCH) Program:  Data Mining and Functional Validation (R01 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on data mining of single cell datasets to identify key biological components such as cell types, transcripts, enhancers, and transcriptional networks related to HIV/antiretroviral therapy (ART) and Substance Use Disorder (SUD). It also supports functional validation studies to confirm the biological roles of these identified components in the context of HIV/ART and SUD molecular responses.

title: Microglial Pathophysiology in Comorbid Substance Use Disorder (SUD) and HIV (R61/R33 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on generating microglial protein profiles specific to brain regions and cell types in the context of HIV and substance use disorders (SUD). The aim is to understand the mechanisms by which HIV-infected microglia contribute to neuropathologies associated with the comorbidity of HIV and SUD.

title: Advancing Healthcare for Older Adults from Populations that Experience Health Disparities (R01 - Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This initiative focuses on advancing health care research for older adults facing health disparities, specifically targeting three key areas: improving screening, diagnostic, and clinical care guidelines in primary care; enhancing shared decision-making between clinicians, older adults, and their caregivers; and identifying effective strategies for care coordination.

title: Mechanisms that Impact Cancer Risk after Bariatric Surgery (R01 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: The National Cancer Institute (NCI) is seeking research proposals that explore the mechanisms by which bariatric surgery influences cancer risk. The focus is on understanding the long-term effects of bariatric surgery on cancer, rather than its immediate outcomes like weight loss and diabetes management.

title: Mechanisms that Impact Cancer Risk after Bariatric Surgery (R21 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: The National Cancer Institute (NCI) is seeking applications for research focused on the mechanisms by which bariatric surgery influences cancer risk. The emphasis is on proof of concept studies that explore the long-term effects of bariatric surgery on cancer, rather than short-term outcomes like weight loss and diabetes. Researchers are encouraged to investigate novel aspects of this relationship, with a requirement that feasibility studies have not been previously developed in the literature.

title: Exploratory Studies to Investigate Mechanisms of HIV infection, Replication, Latency, and/or Pathogenesis in the Context of Substance Use Disorders (R01 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on exploratory studies that investigate the mechanisms of HIV infection, replication, latency, and pathogenesis, particularly in relation to substance use disorders (SUDs). Key research topics include understanding the interactions between HIV and SUDs, as well as the implications for HIV-associated neurocognitive disorders (HAND).

title: Imaging - Science Track Award for Research Transition (I/START) (R03 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on advancing brain imaging research, particularly in the context of substance use disorders and addiction. It aims to support both new and established investigators in developing neuroimaging tools and conducting small proof-of-concept studies.

title: HEAL Initiative: Studies to Enable Analgesic Discovery (R61/R33 - Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on the development of safe, effective, and non-addictive therapeutics for pain management. Key research topics include the creation of assays for drug discovery, screening to identify potential therapeutic agents, and the initial characterization of small molecules, biologics, and natural products.

title: Mechanism for Time-Sensitive Substance Use Research (R21 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: The key research topics in this funding opportunity focus on substance use epidemiology and health services, specifically addressing sudden and severe drug issues, emerging marijuana trends, time-sensitive prescription drug abuse, evolving addiction services in healthcare, and urgent criminal or juvenile justice issues related to drug abuse. The emphasis is on conducting pilot or exploratory research that responds rapidly to these emerging challenges and opportunities in the field.

title: Discovery and Development of Novel Therapeutics for Select Fungal Pathogens (R21/R33 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This funding opportunity aims to support early-stage translational research in drug discovery and the development of novel therapeutics targeting specific fungal pathogens, including Candida species (notably Candida auris), Aspergillus fumigatus, Coccidioides, and Mucorales. The research will follow a milestone-driven approach, with progression contingent on the successful achievement of defined milestones.

title: BRAIN Initiative: New Technologies and Novel Approaches for Recording and Modulation in the Nervous System (R01 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on the development and proof-of-concept testing of innovative technologies for recording and modulating neural cells and circuits, aimed at enhancing the understanding of dynamic signaling in the central nervous system. Key research topics include the creation of instrumentation, devices, and molecular constructs that utilize various modalities (optical, electrical, magnetic, acoustic) to manipulate neural activity and address challenges in neurobiological experimentation. The initiative encourages interdisciplinary approaches and validation of technologies through in vivo experiments to demonstrate their capabilities and potential impact on neuroscience research.

title: Mitochondrial-associated Mechanisms of Neuropathological and Immunodeficient Aging in the Context of HIV and SUD (R21 Clinical Trials Not Allowed)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on research exploring the interplay between mitochondrial function, aging, and HIV infection, particularly in relation to the effects of addictive substances. It aims to uncover both protective and pathogenic mechanisms to inform the development of targeted therapies for individuals aging with HIV and substance use issues.

title: Mitochondrial-associated Mechanisms of Neuropathological and Immunodeficient Aging in the Context of HIV and SUD (R01 Clinical Trials Not Allowed)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on research exploring the interplay between mitochondrial function, aging, and HIV infection, particularly in relation to the effects of addictive substances. It aims to uncover both protective and pathogenic mechanisms to inform the development of targeted therapies for individuals aging with HIV and substance use issues.

title: Limited Competition: CCRP Initiative: Promoting a Basic Understanding of Chemical Threats to Skin (R34 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: The key research topics of this funding opportunity focus on understanding skin injuries caused by harmful chemicals, emphasizing the investigation of commonalities in these injuries. The scientific focus areas include identifying shared signaling pathways and potential therapeutic targets for developing medical countermeasures.

title: Revision Applications for Validation of Biomarker Assays Developed Through NIH-Supported Research Grants (R01 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on the adaptation and clinical validation of molecular, cellular, and imaging biomarkers for cancer detection, diagnosis, prognosis, treatment response prediction, and cancer control and prevention. It encourages multidisciplinary collaboration among researchers, assay developers, clinicians, and statisticians to facilitate the integration of validated assays into clinical practice. The emphasis is on utilizing well-annotated specimens for clinical validation rather than early-stage technology development or conducting clinical trials.

title: Interventions to expand cancer screening and preventive services to ADVANCE health in populations that experience health disparities (R01, Clinical Trial Required)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on researching barriers and facilitators to cancer screening and preventive services in populations facing health disparities. It encourages the development of interventions that improve the uptake of these services, including timely follow-up and referrals, while addressing factors at multiple levels: patient, clinician, healthcare setting, and community. Collaborative projects with community partners and service providers are also emphasized.

title: Towards a Better Understanding of the Neurological Effects of Infection-Associated Chronic Illnesses (R21 - Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This funding opportunity seeks research applications focused on the neurological and mental health aspects of infection-associated chronic illnesses, particularly the post-acute sequelae of COVID-19 (Neuro-PASC) and other conditions like post-treatment Lyme Disease and ME/CFS. Emphasis is placed on investigating common mechanisms across these illnesses, as well as conducting clinical and preclinical studies that explore pathways contributing to their development, all within a post-infectious context.

title: Towards a Better Understanding of the Neurological Effects of Infection-Associated Chronic Illnesses (R01 - Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This funding opportunity seeks research applications focused on the neurological and mental health aspects of infection-associated chronic illnesses, particularly the post-acute sequelae of COVID-19 (Neuro-PASC) and other conditions like post-treatment Lyme Disease and ME/CFS. Key areas of interest include investigating common mechanisms across these illnesses, as well as conducting clinical and preclinical studies that explore pathways contributing to their development, all within a post-infectious context.

title: NCI Small Grants Program for Cancer Research (NCI Omnibus) (R03 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: The funding opportunity focuses on small-scale cancer research projects that can be completed quickly and with limited resources. Key areas of interest include pilot and feasibility studies, secondary data analysis, self-contained research projects, research methodology development, and the creation of new research technologies.

title: NIDCD Early Career Research(ECR) Award (R21 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: The NIDCD Early Career Research Award focuses on basic and clinical research in the areas of hearing, balance, smell, taste, voice, speech, and language. It supports various project types, including secondary data analysis, small research projects, methodology development, translational and outcomes research, and new technology development, with the goal of generating preliminary data for future R01 applications.

title: Innovation Grants to Nurture Initial Translational Efforts (IGNITE): Assay Development and Neurotherapeutic Agent Identification (R61/R33 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on developing in vitro and ex vivo assays to identify and characterize potential therapeutic agents for neurological and neuromuscular disorders. It aims to support iterative screening efforts that advance projects towards meeting the entry criteria for translational programs like the Blueprint Neurotherapeutics Network.

title: Innovation Grants to Nurture Initial Translational Efforts (IGNITE):  Development and Validation of Model Systems to Facilitate Neurotherapeutic Discovery (R61/R33 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on the development and validation of animal models and ex vivo systems that accurately represent neurological and neuromuscular disorders. The aim is to enhance the translational relevance of these models for assessing the efficacy of neurotherapeutics in both preclinical and clinical settings, thereby supporting early-stage drug discovery efforts.

title: Implementation Research for Multi-morbidity Management in the Context of Non-communicable Diseases in Low- and Middle-Income Countries and US Tribal Populations  (R01 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: The NIH and GACD are seeking implementation research proposals focused on noncommunicable diseases (NCDs) specifically in low- and middle-income countries (LMICs) and American Indian/Alaskan Native (AI/AN) Tribal Nation populations in the U.S. The emphasis is on developing effective strategies to address NCDs in these underserved communities.

title: Implementation Research for Multi-morbidity Management in the Context of Non-communicable Diseases in Low- and Middle-Income Countries and US Tribal Populations  (R61/R33 Clinical Trial Required)
summary_text: The NIH and GACD are seeking research proposals focused on implementation strategies for noncommunicable diseases (NCDs) specifically in low- and middle-income countries (LMICs) and American Indian/Alaskan Native populations in the U.S. The emphasis is on addressing the challenges and improving health outcomes related to NCDs in these communities.

title: Development of Resources and Technologies for Enhancing Rigor, Reproducibility, and Translatability of Animal Models in Biomedical Research (R01 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on developing and implementing technologies, tools, and resources that enhance the rigor, reproducibility, and translatability of animal research. It encourages projects that are hypothesis-driven and applicable across multiple organ systems or diseases, aligning with the interests of various NIH Institutes and Centers. The aim is to validate animal models and improve the overall quality and impact of research using these models.

title: Pilot Projects Investigating Understudied Proteins Associated with Rare Diseases (R03 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on pilot projects aimed at investigating the roles of understudied proteins linked to rare diseases. The goal is to generate preliminary data and tools for these proteins, which belong to druggable protein families associated with specific rare diseases, thereby advancing basic biochemical and biological research in this area.

title: Development of Biomarkers or Composite Biomarkers for Neurological and Neuromuscular Disorders (R61/R33 - Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on the discovery and early evaluation of candidate biomarkers and biomarker signatures for neurological and neuromuscular disorders. It emphasizes the need for both biological and clinical evaluation, including preliminary studies with standardized human samples or datasets, to advance the development of neurotherapeutics. The ultimate goal is to produce biomarkers that are prepared for further validation studies.

title: Dissemination and Implementation Research in Health (R01 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on research aimed at identifying and testing strategies to enhance the adoption, integration, and sustainability of evidence-based interventions in health. It also encourages studies that explore the de-implementation of ineffective or harmful practices, as well as the advancement of dissemination and implementation research methods. Additionally, applications addressing the re-implementation of health services disrupted by disasters, such as pandemics, are encouraged.

title: Computational Approaches to Curation at Scale for Biomedical Research Assets (R01 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: The key research topics focus on developing innovative computational approaches to enhance the curation processes of biomedical datasets and models. The aim is to facilitate data mining and knowledge discovery from the increasing volumes of biomedical data generated by advancements in data science.

title: Translational Neural Devices (R61/R33 - Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on advancing the development of therapeutic and diagnostic devices for nervous and neuromuscular disorders. Key research topics include the implementation of clinical prototype devices, non-clinical safety and efficacy testing, and conducting small clinical studies to gather essential data on device function and design.

title: Screening and Functional Validation of Genomic Variants Associated with Human Congenital Anomalies (R01 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This initiative focuses on the screening, functional validation, and characterization of genetic variants associated with congenital anomalies, intellectual developmental disabilities, and inborn errors of metabolism. It aims to bridge the gap between the identification of genetic variants through advanced sequencing technologies and the understanding of their functional impacts on phenotypes, utilizing in-silico tools, animal models, and in vitro systems.

title: Bidirectional Influences Between Adolescent Social Media Use and Mental Health (R21 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This funding opportunity emphasizes research on the bidirectional relationships between social media use and adolescent mental health, including psychiatric symptoms and factors influencing resilience or risk for psychopathology. It specifically targets adolescents aged 10-20, exploring how their increasing access to and autonomy in using social media impacts their mental health.

title: Bidirectional Influences Between Adolescent Social Media Use and Mental Health (R01 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This funding opportunity emphasizes research on the bidirectional relationships between social media use and adolescent mental health, including psychiatric symptoms and factors influencing resilience or risk for psychopathology. It specifically targets adolescents aged 10-20, exploring how their increasing access to and autonomy in using social media impacts their mental health outcomes.

title: Dissemination and Implementation Research in Health (R03 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on research aimed at identifying and developing strategies to enhance the adoption and sustainability of evidence-based interventions and practices. It also encourages studies that explore the de-implementation of ineffective or harmful practices, as well as advancements in dissemination and implementation research methods and measures.

title: Enhancing Mechanistic Research on Precision Probiotic Therapies (R61/R33 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on innovative mechanistic research to enhance precision probiotic interventions by identifying person-specific factors that influence probiotic responses. Key research topics include characterizing host biological patterns such as microbiome composition, immune response, and lifestyle factors that contribute to variability in probiotic effectiveness. The initiative aims to develop strategies to improve clinical outcomes for probiotics by addressing the heterogeneity in human responses through a phased research approach.

title: Effectiveness Trials for Post-Acute Interventions and Services to Optimize Longer-term Outcomes (R01 Clinical Trial Required)
summary_text: The NIMH is seeking research projects focused on evaluating the effectiveness of therapeutic and service delivery interventions for managing mental health conditions in youth, adults, and older adults during the post-acute phase. Key areas of interest include clinical trials that assess the effectiveness of interventions tailored to the stage of illness, addressing aspects such as symptom management, relapse prevention, and service adherence, as well as exploring moderators, mediators, and mechanisms of action related to these interventions. Additionally, there is support for pilot trials to assess the feasibility and preliminary effectiveness of these approaches.

title: Enhancing Mechanistic Research on Precision Probiotic Therapies (R33 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on innovative mechanistic research aimed at enhancing precision probiotic interventions by characterizing individual-specific factors that influence probiotic responses. Key research topics include identifying subgroups of probiotic responders based on host biology patterns such as microbiome composition, immune system characteristics, and lifestyle factors, as well as developing strategies to overcome barriers to effective probiotic therapies. The initiative encourages rigorous studies using animal models or human subjects to explore the causality and predictability of these host biological patterns in relation to probiotic efficacy.

title: Dissemination and Implementation Research in Health (R21 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on research aimed at identifying and developing strategies to enhance the adoption and sustainability of evidence-based interventions and practices. It also encourages studies that explore the de-implementation of ineffective or harmful practices, as well as advancements in dissemination and implementation research methods.

title: Pilot Effectiveness Trials for Post-Acute Interventions and Services to Optimize Longer-term Outcomes (R01 Clinical Trial Required)
summary_text: The NIMH is seeking pilot effectiveness research projects that evaluate therapeutic and service delivery interventions for the post-acute management of mental health conditions. Key focus areas include assessing the feasibility, tolerability, acceptability, safety, and preliminary effectiveness of interventions aimed at consolidating treatment gains, managing residual symptoms, preventing relapse, and promoting adherence to services. The goal is to gather preliminary data to inform larger-scale effectiveness trials.

title: CCRP Initiative: NIH Countermeasures Against Chemical Threats (CounterACT) Basic Research on Chemical Threats that Affect the Nervous System (R01 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This grant call focuses on basic research related to chemical warfare agents, toxic industrial chemicals, and pesticides that impact the nervous system. It aims to generate data on the mechanisms of toxicity, new manifestations of toxic exposures, and potential therapeutic targets for these chemical threats.

title: NCI Clinical and Translational Exploratory/Developmental Studies (R21 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: The National Cancer Institute (NCI) is focusing on exploratory research in cancer diagnosis, treatment, imaging, symptom management, and prevention through clinical trials and correlative studies. Key areas include the development of novel cancer therapeutics, radiotherapy, innovative preclinical studies using new models and imaging technologies, and mechanism-driven combinations that could lead to first-in-human clinical trials. The initiative aims to support high-risk, high-reward projects that may result in significant advancements in cancer research methodologies and applications.

title: Innovation Grants to Nurture Initial Translational Efforts (IGNITE): Neurotherapeutic Agent Characterization and In vivo Efficacy Studies (R61/R33 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This grant call focuses on conducting pharmacodynamic, pharmacokinetic, and in vivo efficacy studies for therapeutic agents aimed at treating neurological or neuromuscular disorders. It supports the development of small molecules, biologics, or biotechnology-derived products, with the goal of advancing projects to meet entry criteria for translational programs like the Blueprint Neurotherapeutics Network.

title: Cancer Prevention and Control Clinical Trials Planning Grant Program (R34 Clinical Trials Optional)
summary_text: This grant call focuses on facilitating clinical trials in cancer prevention and control, specifically targeting areas such as cancer prevention, health behaviors, screening, early detection, treatment management, supportive care, and outcomes for cancer survivors. It emphasizes the need for preparatory studies to address information gaps related to study populations, intervention feasibility, and trial design, ultimately aiming to enhance trial efficiency and reduce costs.

title: Research Projects to Enhance Applicability of Mammalian Models for Translational Research (R01 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: The National Cancer Institute (NCI) is seeking projects that enhance the utility of mammalian cancer and tumor models for translational research. Key research topics include improving the representation of human biology in these models, addressing translational deficiencies, exploring new applications of mammalian models, and establishing standard practices for their use in clinical research. The focus is on ensuring these models provide reliable information that benefits patients.

title: Stimulating Hematology Investigation: New Endeavors (SHINE) (R01 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: The SHINE program focuses on promoting innovative research in nonmalignant hematology, particularly in basic and early translational studies. It encourages investigator-initiated projects that align with the missions of the NIDDK, NIA, and NHLBI, emphasizing emerging topics in the field that will be updated annually.

title: Development and Application of PET and SPECT Imaging Ligands as Biomarkers for Drug Discovery and for Pathophysiological Studies of CNS Disorders (R01 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This grant opportunity focuses on the development and evaluation of novel radioligands for PET and SPECT imaging in the human brain. It emphasizes the incorporation of pilot or clinical feasibility evaluations based on previously collected pre-clinical data to advance promising PET ligands for clinical research applications.

title: NIA Multi-site Clinical Trial Implementation Grant (R01 Clinical Trial Required)
summary_text: This funding opportunity seeks applications for multi-site interventional clinical trials that are investigator-initiated and hypothesis-driven. The focus is on trials that align with the National Institute on Aging's (NIA) research mission, emphasizing the importance of defined milestones throughout the research process.

title: Integration of Imaging and Fluid-Based Tumor Monitoring in Cancer Therapy (R01 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: The National Cancer Institute (NCI) is seeking research projects that focus on integrating imaging techniques with fluid-based tumor monitoring, specifically liquid biopsy assays, during cancer therapy. The aim is to enhance the understanding of therapy response and the development of resistance in cancer patients.

title: Molecular Imaging of Inflammation in Cancer (R01 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This grant call focuses on the development and application of molecular imaging methods to investigate the role of inflammation in cancer in vivo. It encourages research that integrates imaging techniques with cancer biology to enhance understanding of the dynamic interactions between cancer and inflammation, particularly through collaborative efforts between basic cancer researchers and imaging scientists.

title: Clinical Characterization of Cancer Therapy-induced Adverse Sequelae and Mechanism-based Interventional Strategies (R01 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on collaborative research aimed at understanding and addressing the long-term adverse effects of cancer therapies, including chronic comorbidities and delayed post-treatment effects. Key research topics include identifying the mechanisms behind therapy-induced sequelae, clinically characterizing these effects, and developing therapeutic strategies to prevent or mitigate them. The emphasis is on mechanistic studies with translational endpoints and the validation of clinical biomarkers and outcomes for future clinical trials.

title: Assay development and screening for discovery of chemical probes, drugs or immunomodulators (R01 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: The National Cancer Institute (NCI) is seeking research applications focused on the identification of small molecules that serve as chemical probes or therapeutic agents for disease targets. Key research topics include assay development for biological targets, high-throughput screening for small molecule compounds, hit validation through secondary assays and cheminformatics, and optimization of lead compounds to enhance target engagement and therapeutic efficacy.

title: In-Depth Phenotyping and Research Using IMPC-Generated Knockout Mouse Strains Exhibiting Embryonic or Perinatal Lethality or Subviability (R01 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on the phenotyping and research of embryonic lethal knockout mouse strains generated by the International Mouse Phenotyping Consortium (IMPC). The aim is to create a comprehensive catalogue of mammalian gene function, particularly investigating the phenotypes of both homozygous lethal mutations and viable heterozygous phenotypes to enhance understanding of human genetic variation.

title: Advancing Research to Understand Congenital Malformations (R01 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This grant call focuses on innovative research aimed at understanding the mechanisms behind structural birth defects, utilizing animal models alongside human clinical approaches. Key research topics include the application of genetics, omics methods, synthetic biology, and developmental biology to identify genetic, epigenetic, and environmental factors, as well as gene/environment interactions that contribute to the formation and variability of these defects in human populations.

title: Natural History of Disorders Screenable in the Newborn Period (R01 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: The key research topics focus on expanding knowledge of the natural history of disorders included in newborn screening programs. This includes characterizing symptom development, establishing genotype-phenotype correlations, and identifying genetic, epigenetic, or environmental factors that influence clinical outcomes. The aim is to improve diagnostic accuracy, facilitate clinical trials, and enhance treatment and management strategies for affected infants.

title: Population Approaches to Reducing Alcohol-related Cancer Risk (R01 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: The key research topics for this funding opportunity include interdisciplinary approaches to raise awareness of the link between alcohol consumption and cancer risk, strategies to change social norms regarding alcohol use, and the development and evaluation of alcohol policy interventions. Additionally, there is a focus on creating and implementing population-level interventions aimed at reducing alcohol-related cancer risk, particularly concerning various levels of alcohol consumption and alcohol use disorder (AUD) in the context of cancer prevention and control.

title: Assay Development and Screening for Discovery of Validated Chemical Hits for Brain Disorders (R01 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: The key research topics of this funding opportunity focus on the discovery and development of novel small molecules for potential use in treating psychiatric disorders. Additionally, it aims to generate new insights into the biology of diseases and processes that may serve as important drug targets but have not yet been validated.

title: Engineering Next-Generation Human Nervous System Microphysiological Systems (R01 Clinical Trials Not Allowed)
summary_text: This grant call focuses on the development of next-generation human cell-derived microphysiological systems (MPS) that accurately replicate complex nervous system architectures and physiology. The research aims to enhance the understanding of nervous system development, function, and aging in both healthy and diseased states.

title: Engineering Next-Generation Human Nervous System Microphysiological Systems (R21 Clinical Trials Not Allowed)
summary_text: This grant opportunity focuses on the development of next-generation human cell-derived microphysiological systems (MPS) that accurately replicate complex nervous system architectures and physiology. The research aims to enhance the understanding of nervous system development, function, and aging in both healthy and diseased states.

title: Academic-Industrial Partnerships (AIP) to Translate and Validate In Vivo Imaging Systems (R01 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: The National Cancer Institute (NCI) is seeking research proposals that focus on the translation of scientific discoveries and engineering advancements in imaging, data science, and spectroscopic technologies. The aim is to develop methods or tools that enhance the understanding of cancer biology, assess disease risk, improve diagnosis, treatment, and monitor disease status.

title: Research Infrastructure Development for Interdisciplinary Aging Studies (R61/R33 - Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on developing innovative research infrastructure to advance the science of aging, emphasizing interdisciplinary partnerships and collaborations. Key research topics include addressing critical aging research questions through sustainable infrastructure that supports both initial developmental and expanded activities.

title: Modular R01s in Cancer Control and Population Sciences (R01 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on advancing cancer research through innovative scientific ideas in several key areas, including statistical and analytic methods, epidemiology, cancer survivorship, cancer-related behaviors and interventions, healthcare delivery, digital health, data science, and implementation science. The aim is to enhance cancer control and population sciences.

title: Advanced-Stage Development and Utilization of Research Infrastructure for Interdisciplinary Aging Studies (R33 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on developing innovative research infrastructure to enhance the science of aging. It emphasizes the need for interdisciplinary partnerships and collaborations in this field. Key research topics include advancing methodologies and technologies that address aging-related challenges.

title: Laboratories to Optimize Digital Health (R01 Clinical Trial Required)
summary_text: NIMH is seeking innovative research projects focused on enhancing digital mental health interventions. Key areas of interest include the development of digital health test beds, optimization of evidence-based interventions, and conducting statistically powered clinical trials to evaluate the effectiveness of these digital mental health strategies.

title: Exploratory Grants in Cancer Control (R21 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on exploratory research in cancer control, emphasizing behavior modification, screening methods, and the understanding of factors that contribute to cancer development. It aims to support innovative scientific ideas and methodologies that could significantly advance population-based cancer research across various fields, including epidemiology, biomedical research, behavioral studies, health care delivery, and clinical applications.

title: National Cancer Institute's Investigator-Initiated Early Phase Clinical Trials for Cancer Treatment and Diagnosis (R01 Clinical Trial Required)
summary_text: The National Cancer Institute (NCI) is seeking research projects that focus on early phase clinical trials (Phase 0, I, and II) for cancer-targeted diagnostic and therapeutic interventions. Key research topics include cancer therapy evaluation, cancer imaging, cancer diagnosis, radiation research, complementary and alternative medicine, and HIV and AIDS malignancies. Projects must involve at least one clinical trial aligned with these scientific focus areas.

title: Cancer Prevention and Control Clinical Trials Grant Program (R01 Clinical Trial Required)
summary_text: The National Cancer Institute (NCI) is seeking applications for investigator-initiated clinical trials focused on reducing cancer burden through advancements in early detection, screening, prevention, healthcare delivery, quality of life, and survivorship. The trials should aim to enhance clinical practice and public health, while aligning with the interests of the NCI Division of Cancer Prevention and the Division of Cancer Control and Population Sciences. Notably, the funding does not support trials related to cancer diagnosis or oncologic therapy.

title: Exploratory/Developmental Research on Guillain Barre Syndrome (GBS) and Chronic Inflammatory Demyelinating Polyneuropathy (CIDP) (R21 - Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This initiative focuses on advancing research related to Guillain Barre Syndrome (GBS) and Chronic Inflammatory Demyelinating Polyneuropathy (CIDP). Key research topics include the immunological mechanisms of nerve damage, genetic and epigenetic factors, development of novel animal and cellular models, identification of new diagnostic or treatment response biomarkers, and exploration of innovative treatments or mechanisms of existing therapies.

title: Technology Development Research for Establishing Feasibility and Proof of Concept (R21 - Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on exploratory research aimed at developing innovative technologies that align with the NIGMS mission. It emphasizes projects characterized by high risk and novelty, with the potential for significant future impact in the field of biomedical research.

title: Focused Technology Research and Development (R01 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This funding opportunity emphasizes the development of innovative technologies aimed at enhancing the acquisition of biomedical knowledge. Projects should demonstrate significant technical innovation and utility, with the potential to advance the current state of the art in biomedical research and address a wide array of research questions.

title: Developing novel theory and methods for understanding the genetic architecture of complex human traits (R01 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This grant call focuses on the development of innovative theories and methods to enhance the understanding of genetic and non-genetic influences on complex trait variation among individuals, families, and populations. It encourages interdisciplinary approaches that integrate insights from natural and social sciences, while emphasizing the importance of modeling, validation, and the use of large-scale datasets.

title: Early Stage Investigator HIV/AIDS Research Using Nonhuman Primate (NHP) Models (R21 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on preclinical HIV/AIDS research utilizing non-human primate (NHP) models, specifically aimed at Early Stage Investigators. Key research topics include reducing HIV incidence, developing next-generation therapies, investigating potential cures, and addressing HIV-related comorbidities and complications, in alignment with the NIH Strategic Plan for HIV research.

title: BRAIN Initiative: Development and Validation of Novel Tools to Probe Cell-Specific and Circuit-Specific Processes in the Brain (R01 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: The BRAIN Initiative seeks applications focused on developing and validating innovative tools for analyzing complex neural circuits and cellular interactions in the brain. Key research topics include the creation of genetic and non-genetic methods for precise delivery of genes, proteins, and chemicals to specific cell types or circuits, as well as tools applicable across multiple species. Proposals that address and overcome current technical limitations to enhance research capabilities are particularly encouraged.

title: Developing novel theory and methods for understanding the genetic architecture of complex human traits (R21 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This NOFO focuses on the development of innovative theories and methods to understand the contributions of genetic and non-genetic factors to complex trait variation in individuals, families, and populations. It encourages interdisciplinary approaches that integrate natural and social sciences, consider interdependencies across various biological, social, and ecological scales, and utilize theory, simulations, and large-scale dataset validation.

title: Development of Animal Models and Related Biological Materials for Research (R21 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on innovative research to develop and enhance animal models and related biological materials for studies pertinent to human health and disease. It emphasizes projects that improve disease diagnosis and control affecting animal use in biomedical research, with a requirement for broad applicability across multiple NIH Institutes or Centers and exploration of various body systems or disease categories.

title: NICHD Small Research Grant Program (R03 Clinical Trial Required)
summary_text: The NICHD Small Research Grant Program focuses on supporting clinical trials that align with the mission of the National Institute of Child Health and Human Development (NICHD). Key research topics include child health, human development, and related clinical interventions.

title: NICHD Small Research Grant Program (R03 Basic Experimental Studies with Humans Required)
summary_text: The NICHD Small Research Grant Program (R03) focuses on basic experimental studies involving human participants, particularly those that prospectively assign individuals to conditions to experimentally manipulate independent variables. The program supports clinical trials aimed at understanding fundamental biomedical or behavioral phenomena without immediate application towards specific processes or products.

title: Small Research Grant Program for the Next Generation of Researchers in AD/ADRD Research (R03 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This grant call focuses on supporting research projects aimed at enhancing the prevention, diagnosis, treatment, and care for individuals with Alzheimer's disease and related dementias (AD/ADRD). It encourages both emerging and established researchers to explore innovative approaches and pilot studies in the field of AD/ADRD, fostering the development of new research programs.

title: Enhancing Reuse of NHGRI Data Assets (R03 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: The key research topics focus on secondary analysis of AnVIL datasets to enhance their utilization for small research projects. The scientific emphasis is on demonstrating the value of NHGRI datasets for secondary research and evaluating the effectiveness of the AnVIL platform in facilitating further discoveries.

title: Schizophrenia and related disorders during mid- to late-life (R01 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This initiative focuses on advancing translational research to understand the emergence and progression of schizophrenia and related disorders in individuals aged 35 and older. It aims to identify underlying mechanisms and potential targets for future prevention and treatment strategies.

title: Cellular and Molecular Biology of Complex Brain Disorders (R21 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on researching the biology of high-confidence risk factors associated with complex brain disorders, emphasizing the intracellular, transcellular, and circuit mechanisms underlying neural function. It encourages studies that explore the neurobiological impacts of individual or combined risk factors, aiming to elucidate the molecular and cellular components involved in these processes. The research should contribute to data resources that enhance understanding of the relationship between disease risk factors, biological mechanisms, and potential therapeutic targets.

title: Schizophrenia and related disorders during mid- to late-life (R21 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This initiative focuses on advancing translational research to understand the emergence and progression of schizophrenia and related disorders in individuals aged 35 and older. It aims to identify underlying mechanisms and potential targets for future prevention and treatment strategies.

title: Cellular and Molecular Biology of Complex Brain Disorders (R01 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on researching the biology of high-confidence risk factors linked to complex brain disorders, emphasizing the intracellular, transcellular, and circuit mechanisms of neural function. It encourages studies that explore the neurobiological impacts of individual or combined risk factors, aiming to elucidate the molecular and cellular components involved in these processes. The research should contribute to data resources that enhance understanding of the relationship between disease risk factors, biological mechanisms, and potential therapeutic targets.

title: Archiving and Documenting Child Health and Human Development Data Sets (R03 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on archiving and documenting existing data sets to facilitate secondary analysis by the scientific community. The program prioritizes data sets that align with the scientific mission of the NICHD, particularly those collected with NICHD support.

title: Small Research Grants for Analyses of Gabriella Miller Kids First Pediatric Research Data (R03 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: The Gabriella Miller Kids First Pediatric Research Program focuses on developing a comprehensive pediatric research data resource that includes genomic and phenotypic data related to childhood cancers and structural birth defects. Key research topics include the analysis of genomic datasets, the development of tools and algorithms for data analysis, and enhancing diagnostic capabilities and targeted therapies for these conditions.

title: Limited Competition: Small Grant Program for ORIP Special Emphasis Research Career Award (SERCA) K01 Recipients (R03 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on supporting research projects for ORIP-supported Special Emphasis Research Career Award (SERCA) K01 recipients transitioning to independent investigator status. Key research topics include pilot and feasibility studies, secondary data analysis, small self-contained research projects, development of research methodologies, and new research technologies, with an emphasis on projects that can be completed within two years and do not involve clinical trials.

title: Translational Research in Maternal and Pediatric Pharmacology and Therapeutics (R21 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: The key research topics focus on advancing precision medicine for pregnant and lactating women, neonates, and children by developing novel tools and technologies. The scientific focus areas include understanding drug action mechanisms, particularly in relation to pediatric development and physiological changes during pregnancy and lactation, as well as discovering new therapeutics and improving existing medications for safer use in these populations.

title: Translational Research in Maternal and Pediatric Pharmacology and Therapeutics (R01 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: The key research topics focus on advancing precision medicine for pregnant and lactating women, neonates, and children by developing novel tools and technologies. The scientific focus areas include understanding drug action mechanisms, particularly in relation to pediatric development and physiological changes during pregnancy and lactation, as well as discovering new therapeutics and improving existing medications for safer use in these populations.

title: Advancement and Innovation in Measurement of Language Development and Predictors (R21 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on community-engaged research aimed at enhancing the understanding of environmental factors that support language development in children. It emphasizes the development of innovative, culturally responsive measures to assess children's language development and impairment, as well as identifying predictors of these outcomes.

title: Advancement and Innovation in Measurement of Language Development and Predictors (R01 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on community-engaged research aimed at enhancing the understanding of environmental factors that support language development in children. It emphasizes the development of innovative, culturally and linguistically responsive measures to assess children's language development and impairment, as well as the predictors of these outcomes.

title: Social disconnection and Suicide Risk in Late Life (R01 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This initiative focuses on research exploring the relationship between social disconnection, including both objective social isolation and perceived loneliness, and suicide risk in late-life. Key areas of interest include identifying neurobiological and environmental mechanisms that contribute to this risk, employing experimental therapeutics to develop and test interventions, and enhancing service delivery models to improve social connections and prevent late-life suicide.

title: Novel Mechanism Research on Neuropsychiatric Symptoms (NPS) in Alzheimer's Dementia (R01 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on research aimed at understanding the mechanisms underlying neuropsychiatric symptoms in individuals with Alzheimer's disease and related dementias. It emphasizes the exploration of both biobehavioral and neurobiological pathways, with the goal of identifying novel therapeutic targets for interventions to treat and prevent these symptoms.

title: Social disconnection and Suicide Risk in Late Life (R21 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This initiative focuses on research exploring the relationship between social disconnection, including both objective social isolation and perceived loneliness, and suicide risk in late-life. Key areas of interest include identifying neurobiological and environmental mechanisms that contribute to this risk, employing experimental therapeutics to develop and test interventions, and enhancing service delivery models to improve social connections and prevent late-life suicide.

title: Basic Research in Cancer Health Disparities (R21 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This grant opportunity focuses on basic, mechanistic research into the biological and genetic causes of cancer health disparities. Key research topics include investigating biological factors related to cancer disparities, developing new methodologies and models, and conducting secondary data analyses. The initiative aims to foster a nationwide cohort of scientists with expertise in this area to enhance resources and tools for cancer health disparities research.

title: Basic Research in Cancer Health Disparities (R01 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on basic, mechanistic research into the biological and genetic causes of cancer health disparities. Key research topics include investigating biological factors associated with cancer disparities, developing new methodologies and models, and conducting secondary data analyses. The initiative aims to foster a nationwide cohort of scientists with expertise in cancer health disparities research, enhancing resources and tools for this field.

title: Investigator Initiated Innovation in Computational Genomics and Data Science (R21 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on research in computational genomics, data science, statistics, and bioinformatics, aimed at advancing both basic and clinical genomic science with implications for human health and disease. It supports the development of innovative analytical methodologies, tools, and software that are broadly applicable across various diseases and biological systems, emphasizing scalability to handle larger data sets.

title: Investigator Initiated Innovation in Computational Genomics and Data Science (R01 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on research in computational genomics, data science, statistics, and bioinformatics, aimed at advancing both basic and clinical genomic science with implications for human health and disease. Key areas include the development of innovative analytical methodologies, early-stage tools and software, and enhancements to existing high-value tools for the biomedical genomics community, with an emphasis on scalability for larger data sets.

title: Secondary Analysis and Integration of Existing Data to Elucidate Cancer Risk and Related Outcomes (R21 Clinical Trials Not Allowed)
summary_text: The key research topics for this funding opportunity focus on secondary data analysis and integration of existing datasets related to cancer. This includes exploring cancer risk, survival outcomes, treatment responses, and utilizing diverse data sources such as clinical, genomic, and behavioral profiles. Innovative analytical methods and novel combinations of datasets are encouraged to address significant scientific questions in cancer research.

title: Secondary Analysis and Integration of Existing Data to Elucidate Cancer Risk and Related Outcomes (R01 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: The key research topics for this funding opportunity focus on secondary data analysis and integration of existing datasets related to cancer. This includes exploring cancer risk, survival outcomes, treatment responses, and utilizing diverse data sources such as clinical, environmental, genomic, and behavioral profiles. Innovative analytical methods and novel combinations of datasets are encouraged to address significant scientific questions in cancer research.

title: NCMRR Early Career Research Award (R03 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: The NCMRR Early Career Research Award focuses on supporting basic and clinical research in rehabilitation science. Key research topics include secondary data analysis, small-scale research projects, development of research methodologies, translational research, outcomes research, and the creation of new technologies aimed at enhancing rehabilitation practices.

title: NIDCR Small Grant Program for New Investigators (R03 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: The NIDCR Small Grant Program for New Investigators focuses on supporting basic and clinical research in oral, dental, and craniofacial fields. It aims to facilitate pilot studies and developmental projects that generate preliminary data for future research grant applications.

title: Novel Mechanism Research on Neuropsychiatric Symptoms (NPS) in Alzheimer's Dementia (R21 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on research aimed at understanding the mechanisms underlying neuropsychiatric symptoms (NPS) in Alzheimer's disease (AD) and Alzheimer’s disease-related dementias (ADRD). The emphasis is on exploring both biobehavioral and neurobiological pathways, with the goal of identifying novel therapeutic targets for interventions to treat and prevent NPS in these conditions.

title: Mechanisms that Impact Cancer Risk with Use of Incretin Mimetics (R21 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: The key research topics focus on the mechanisms by which incretin mimetics, including GLP-1 and GIP-1 agonists or antagonists, influence cancer risk. The emphasis is on preclinical and patient-based studies that explore the long-term effects of these agents on obesity-related cancers, rather than their short-term outcomes like weight loss and diabetes management.

title: Mechanisms that Impact Cancer Risk with Use of Incretin Mimetics (R01 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: The key research topics focus on the mechanisms by which incretin mimetics, including GLP-1 and GIP-1 agonists or antagonists, influence cancer risk. The emphasis is on preclinical and patient-based studies that explore the long-term effects of these agents on obesity-related cancers, rather than their short-term outcomes like weight loss and diabetes management.

title: NIDCR Research Grants for Analyses of Existing Genomics Data (R01) (Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This grant call focuses on research projects that utilize genomic data to explore human dental, oral, and craniofacial biology, as well as related diseases and conditions. Key areas of interest include the development and application of statistical, computational, and AI/ML methods for data analysis, validation of results through experimental or in silico work, and investigations into oral health disparities and biological pathways to identify intervention targets.

title: NIDCR Small Research Grants for Analyses of Existing Genomics Data (R03 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This grant call focuses on research projects that utilize genomic data to explore human dental, oral, and craniofacial biology, as well as related diseases and conditions. Key areas of interest include the development and application of statistical, computational, and AI/ML methods for data analysis, validation of results, and understanding oral health disparities. Additionally, projects aimed at characterizing biological pathways and identifying intervention targets related to genetic variants are encouraged.

title: Leveraging Extant Data to Understand Developmental Trajectories of Late Talking Children (R21 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on research aimed at understanding the developmental trajectories of late talking children. Key areas of interest include identifying patterns and predictors of developmental outcomes, as well as exploring underlying mechanisms, risk factors, and sequelae associated with late talking.

title: Biology of Bladder Cancer (R01 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This funding opportunity seeks research applications focused on the biology and mechanisms of bladder cancer, emphasizing the need for a deeper understanding of its initiation, progression, and malignancy. It encourages studies that explore the molecular and cellular alterations in bladder cancer compared to normal bladder processes, particularly through the use of clinical specimens and multidisciplinary approaches.

title: Information and Practice Needs Relevant to Late Talking Children (R21 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: The NIH TALK initiative focuses on understanding early language learning and delays in children, particularly the needs of caregivers and professionals supporting late talking children. It emphasizes community-engaged and qualitative research to improve the dissemination of effective information and practices for addressing language acquisition challenges.

title: Biology of Bladder Cancer (R21 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: The National Cancer Institute (NCI) is seeking research applications focused on the biology and mechanisms of bladder cancer, emphasizing the need to understand the molecular processes involved in its initiation, progression, and malignancy. The call encourages studies that explore both normal bladder biology and cancerous changes, particularly through the use of clinical specimens and multidisciplinary approaches.

title: Chemical Countermeasures Research Program (CCRP) Initiative: Basic Research on The Deleterious Effects of Acute Exposure to Ultra-Potent Synthetic (UPS) Opioids (R01 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on research aimed at understanding and mitigating the harmful effects of acute exposure to Ultra-Potent Synthetic (UPS) opioids, including fentanyl, carfentanil, and nitazenes, as well as their combinations with substances like xylazine. Additionally, it supports investigations into the persistent and delayed pathophysiological effects following such acute exposures.

title: Co-infection and Cancer (R21 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on mechanistic and epidemiologic research into the roles of co-infection in cancer development, particularly regarding infection-related cancers. It emphasizes the investigation of co-infections involving known oncogenic agents, excluding HIV, and aims to uncover new pathways in carcinogenesis that could lead to innovative prevention and treatment strategies.

title: Co-infection and Cancer (R01 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
