summary_text: This initiative focuses on advancing the understanding of infection-related cancers, particularly the role of co-infections in cancer etiology. It emphasizes the need for research on co-infections (excluding HIV) that present new opportunities for prevention and treatment, especially in understudied populations, and encompasses various infectious agents, including viruses, bacteria, and parasites.

title: Personal Health Informatics for Delivering Actionable Insights to Individuals (R01 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on advancing personal health informatics through innovative data collection, integration, analysis, and personalized risk assessments. Key research topics include the development of tools and systems that provide actionable health insights, the effective presentation of personalized assessment results, and the incorporation of user engagement and real-world evaluations to create scalable health informatics solutions.

title: Innovative Research in Cancer Nanotechnology (IRCN; R01 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: The National Cancer Institute (NCI) is seeking research proposals that leverage nanotechnology to address significant challenges in cancer biology and oncology. Key focus areas include mechanistic studies of nanomaterial and nanodevice interactions with biological systems, as well as the delivery of nanoparticles to cancer targets in vivo and the characterization of diagnostic devices in vitro. The goal is to generate fundamental knowledge that will inform the development of nanotechnology-based cancer interventions.

title: Building in vivo Preclinical Assays of Circuit Engagement for Application in Therapeutic Development (R01 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: The key research topics of this funding opportunity focus on identifying and optimizing in vivo neurophysiological and behavioral measures in animals for early screening in treatment development for mental illnesses. The aim is to develop assays that serve as surrogate markers of neural processes, enhancing the scientific value of preclinical data by linking therapeutic targets and treatment candidates to relevant neurobiological mechanisms.

title: Screening, Brief Intervention and Referral to Treatment or Prevention (SBIRT/P) for alcohol, tobacco, and other drugs (ATOD) use and misuse in adult populations that experience health disparities (R01, Clinical Trial Required)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on innovative approaches to implementing Screening, Brief Intervention, and Referral to Treatment/Prevention (SBIRT/P) for addressing alcohol, tobacco, and other drug (ATOD) use and misuse among adult populations facing health disparities. Research proposals should involve prospective testing of SBIRT/P methodologies and emphasize collaboration with healthcare and community partners.

title: NCCIH Multi-Site Feasibility Clinical Trials of Mind and Body Interventions (R01 Clinical Trial Required)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on investigator-initiated clinical trials of complementary and integrative health approaches, particularly mind and body interventions. Key research topics include assessing the feasibility of multisite trials, participant recruitment and retention, adherence to interventions, and the fidelity of delivery across sites, all aimed at informing future efficacy or effectiveness studies. The goal is to gather data that addresses gaps in scientific knowledge to support the design of larger, impactful clinical trials.

title: Investigator Initiated Clinical Trials of Complementary and Integrative Interventions Delivered Remotely or via mHealth (R01 Clinical Trial Required)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on investigator-initiated clinical trials that assess the efficacy or effectiveness of complementary and integrative health interventions delivered entirely remotely, without in-person contact. Key research topics include the use of mHealth tools and technologies, as well as the feasibility, safety, and potential clinical benefits of these interventions in areas prioritized by the NCCIH.

title: Neuromodulation/Neurostimulation Device Development for Mental Health Applications (R01 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on the development of next-generation brain stimulation devices aimed at treating mental health disorders. Key research topics include the creation of novel stimulation techniques that surpass current electrical and magnetic methods, as well as significant enhancements to existing FDA-approved devices in terms of spatial resolution, depth of delivery, and precision. The emphasis is on innovative approaches that enable increased spatiotemporal precision and multi-focal, closed-loop systems.

title: Neuromodulation/Neurostimulation Device Development for Mental Health Applications (R21 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on the development of next-generation brain stimulation devices aimed at treating mental health disorders. Key research topics include the creation of novel stimulation techniques that surpass current electrical/magnetic methods, as well as significant enhancements to existing FDA-approved devices in terms of spatial resolution, depth of delivery, and precision. Collaborative applications from multidisciplinary teams with expertise in systems neuroscience, engineering, clinical, and regulatory affairs are encouraged.

title: Feasibility Clinical Trials of Mind and Body Interventions for NCCIH High Priority Research Topics (R34 Clinical Trial Required)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on supporting feasibility trials of complementary and integrative health approaches, particularly mind and body interventions, for high-priority conditions identified by NCCIH. Key research topics include assessing the feasibility and acceptability of interventions, tailoring interventions for specific populations, refining intervention protocols, and evaluating recruitment and retention strategies, all aimed at informing future full-scale clinical trials that could significantly impact public health.

title: Understanding Expectancies in Cancer Symptom Management (R01 Clinical Trial Required)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on researching expectancy-generating factors and their impact on cancer symptom management outcomes. It aims to explore the mechanisms behind expectancy effects in cancer contexts, identify moderators of these effects, and understand how beliefs about future outcomes can be influenced by various social, psychological, and environmental factors to improve cancer care.

title: Innovative Approaches to Studying Cancer Communication in the New Information Ecosystem (R21 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: The National Cancer Institute (NCI) is seeking research projects focused on three key areas of cancer communication: the use of new surveillance approaches for cancer communication, the creation and evaluation of rapid pilot interventions utilizing innovative methods, and the development of multilevel communication models that highlight bidirectional influences. Researchers are encouraged to apply communication science methodologies to explore behavioral targets and health outcomes in cancer prevention and control.

title: Innovative Approaches to Studying Cancer Communication in the New Information Ecosystem (R01 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: The National Cancer Institute (NCI) is seeking research projects focused on three key areas of cancer communication: the application of new surveillance approaches for cancer communication, the development and testing of rapid interventions using innovative methods, and the creation of multilevel communication models that highlight bidirectional influences. Researchers are encouraged to apply communication science methodologies to explore behavioral targets and health outcomes in cancer prevention and control.

title: Advancing Learning Health Care Research in Outpatient Mental Health Treatment Settings (R34 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This grant call focuses on pilot studies that enhance data-driven learning in behavioral health treatment, specifically targeting the implementation and sustainability of evidence-based mental health services in community settings. Key research topics include the effectiveness of these practices, data science applications, and the optimization of high-quality, equitable care for individuals with mental illness.

title: Catalyze: Product Definition for Small Molecules, Biologics and Combination Products - Target Identification and Validation, and Preliminary Product/Lead Series Identification (R61/R33  Clinical Trials Not Allowed)
summary_text: The NHLBI Catalyze Program focuses on transitioning basic science discoveries into viable diagnostic and therapeutic candidates for human testing, particularly targeting heart, lung, blood, and sleep (HLBS) diseases and disorders. The Catalyze Product Definition initiative emphasizes early-stage translational support for identifying and characterizing potential therapeutic candidates and combination products, alongside a companion initiative for developing devices and diagnostics.

title: BRAIN Initiative: Promoting Health for All Through BRAIN Technology Partnerships (R34 - Clinical Trials Not Allowed)
summary_text: The key research topics focus on the dissemination and integration of BRAIN Initiative tools in resource-limited institutions (RLIs) to enhance participation in neuroscience research. The initiative emphasizes training and collaboration between principal investigators (PIs) at RLIs and BRAIN technologists to facilitate knowledge transfer and adoption of advanced technologies in their laboratories.

title: Catalyze: Enabling Technologies and Transformative Platforms for HLBS Research (R33 - Clinical Trials Not Allowed)
summary_text: The NHLBI Catalyze Program focuses on advancing basic science discoveries into diagnostic and therapeutic candidates for human testing, emphasizing the development of translational researchers skilled in product development. The initiative specifically supports the validation of transformative technologies that can enhance early detection, screening, clinical diagnosis, treatment, prevention, and epidemiology related to heart, lung, blood, and sleep (HLBS) diseases.

title: Mood and Psychosis Symptoms during the Menopause Transition (R01 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on advancing translational research to understand mood and psychotic disorders, such as perimenopausal depression, generalized anxiety disorder, bipolar disorder, and schizophrenia, during the menopause transition. Key research topics include the neurobiological and behavioral mechanisms of these disorders, the impact of reproductive steroids, the interplay between menopausal and psychiatric symptoms, and the role of psychosocial factors in midlife. The initiative encourages interdisciplinary collaboration to identify novel treatment targets and improve diagnosis and understanding of these conditions.

title: Catalyze: Product Definition  Medical Device Prototype Optimization (R33 - Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: The NHLBI Catalyze Program focuses on facilitating the transition of basic science discoveries into viable diagnostics and therapeutics for heart, lung, blood, and sleep (HLBS) diseases. Key research topics include prototype testing and design modification, assay development for diagnostic targets, and the creation of research tools aimed at treating HLBS disorders. The initiative aims to prepare products for in vivo testing and supports the development of therapeutics and combination products.

title: Mood and Psychosis Symptoms during the Menopause Transition (R21 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on advancing translational research to understand mood and psychotic disorders, such as perimenopausal depression, generalized anxiety disorder, bipolar disorder, and schizophrenia, during the menopause transition. Key research topics include the neurobiological and behavioral mechanisms of these disorders, the impact of reproductive steroids, the interplay between menopausal and psychiatric symptoms, and the role of psychosocial factors in midlife. The initiative encourages interdisciplinary collaboration to identify novel treatment targets and improve diagnosis and understanding of these conditions.

title: Catalyze: Product Definition for Small Molecules, Biologics, and Combination Products - Preliminary Product/Lead Series Identification and Combination Product Prototype (R33 - Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: The NHLBI Catalyze Program focuses on transitioning basic science discoveries into viable diagnostic and therapeutic candidates for human testing, particularly targeting heart, lung, blood, and sleep (HLBS) diseases and disorders. The Catalyze Product Definition initiative emphasizes early-stage translational support for identifying and characterizing potential therapeutic candidates and combination products, alongside a companion initiative for developing devices and diagnostics.

title: Catalyze Product Definition  Medical Device prototype design/testing and disease target identification and assay development (R61/R33 - Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: The NHLBI Catalyze Program focuses on the transition of basic science discoveries into viable diagnostic and therapeutic candidates for human testing, particularly in the context of heart, lung, blood, and sleep (HLBS) diseases. Key research topics include the development and testing of device prototypes, identification of diagnostic disease targets and assays, and the creation of research tools aimed at treating HLBS disorders. The initiative is structured in phases to support early-stage translational research, prototype development, and preparation for in vivo testing.

title: Utilizing Invasive Recording and Stimulating Opportunities in Humans to Advance Neural Circuitry Understanding of Mental Health Disorders (R21 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on invasive neural recording studies aimed at understanding the neural circuitry and dynamics associated with mental health disorders. Researchers are encouraged to investigate specific questions related to moods, emotions, cognitive functions, and behaviors, utilizing high-resolution recording techniques to explore neural circuit functions. The emphasis is on addressing gaps in knowledge rather than developing new technologies or therapies.

title: Utilizing Invasive Recording and Stimulating Opportunities in Humans to Advance Neural Circuitry Understanding of Mental Health Disorders (R01 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on invasive neural recording studies aimed at understanding the neural circuitry and dynamics associated with mental health disorders. Researchers are encouraged to investigate specific mental health-related questions using high-resolution invasive techniques, with an emphasis on elucidating neural circuit functions and their implications for mood, emotion, cognition, and behavior. The initiative seeks to fill knowledge gaps in the field, while excluding the development of new technologies and therapies.

title: Prevention and Intervention Approaches for Fetal Alcohol Spectrum Disorders (R61/R33 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This funding opportunity emphasizes research on prevention and intervention strategies for fetal alcohol spectrum disorders (FASD) across the lifespan. Key focus areas include developing approaches to reduce prenatal alcohol exposure and implementing interventions for individuals affected by FASD, with a particular priority on clinical trials.

title: NLM Research Grants in Biomedical Informatics and Data Science (R01 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: The National Library of Medicine (NLM) is focused on supporting research in biomedical informatics and data science, particularly in areas that enhance biomedical discovery and data-driven health. Key topics include innovative methods for integrating complex research outputs, improving clinical care and public health practices, and developing scalable and reproducible approaches for the curation, analysis, and management of health-related data.

title: Navigator Emergency Department Diversion Models for Non-Urgent Mental Health Concerns (R01 Clinical Trial Required)
summary_text: This grant call focuses on researching the effectiveness and implementation of family navigation models aimed at diverting non-urgent mental health cases from emergency departments. Key areas of interest include the use of triage tools for assessing mental health acuity, enhancing family engagement in mental health services, and addressing barriers to help-seeking through support and knowledge dissemination.

title: New Approaches for Measuring Brain Changes Across Longer Timespans (R21 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on innovative research approaches to measure brain activity, connectivity, and genomics across the lifespan, with an emphasis on understanding brain development and aging. Key areas of interest include the neurodevelopmental origins of health and disease, longitudinal studies of neuroanatomical and functional changes, and the exploration of cognitive, motor, and affective regulation challenges in both human and animal models. The initiative aims to foster technological and conceptual advancements in these domains through high-risk, high-reward projects.

title: Prevention and Intervention Approaches for Fetal Alcohol Spectrum Disorders (R34 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on research aimed at developing prevention strategies to reduce prenatal alcohol exposure and the incidence of fetal alcohol spectrum disorders (FASD), as well as interventions for individuals affected by FASD. The goal is to support preliminary studies that will lay the groundwork for larger-scale research in these areas.

title: The Role of Work in Health Disparities in the U.S. (R01 Clinical Trials Optional)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on innovative population-based research aimed at understanding how work and occupation impact health outcomes and health status, particularly among populations experiencing health and healthcare disparities. Key research topics include identifying and characterizing the pathways and mechanisms linking occupational factors to health disparities.

title: New Approaches for Measuring Brain Changes Across Longer Timespans (R01 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on multidisciplinary research aimed at measuring brain activity, connectivity, and genomics throughout the lifespan, with an emphasis on understanding brain development and aging. Key areas of interest include the neurodevelopmental origins of health and disease, longitudinal changes in neuroanatomy and function, and innovative approaches to improve repeated measures over time. Research may involve healthy individuals, clinical populations with cognitive or motor challenges, and animal models.

title: Development of Animal Models and Related Biological Materials for Down Syndrome Research (R21 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: The INCLUDE Project focuses on developing and improving animal models and biological materials for Down syndrome research. Key research topics include the creation of various animal models, genetic resources, single-cell atlases, and the application of advanced informatics technologies such as artificial intelligence and machine learning to enhance preclinical research rigor and reproducibility.

title: HIV Prevention and Alcohol (R01 Clinical Trials Optional)
summary_text: The NOFO focuses on expanding HIV/AIDS prevention strategies among alcohol-impacted populations, emphasizing the integration of effective prevention and treatment interventions. Key research topics include PrEP utilization, Treatment as Prevention (TasP), integration of preventive strategies, cross-cutting research related to prevention, syndemic approaches, and implementation and operations research. The goal is to develop and test new interventions while enhancing existing ones to reduce new HIV infections.

title: HIV Prevention and Alcohol (R34 Clinical Trials Optional)
summary_text: The NOFO focuses on expanding HIV/AIDS prevention strategies specifically for alcohol-impacted populations, addressing both episodic and long-term alcohol use and its associated risks for HIV acquisition. It emphasizes the integration of effective prevention and treatment interventions, aiming to inform the design of clinical trials that test the efficacy, safety, and implementation of these interventions in preventing HIV. Additionally, the research should provide sufficient insights to guide future trials without the need for further studies.

title: Navigator Emergency Department Diversion Models for Non-Urgent Mental Health Concerns (R34 Clinical Trial Required)
summary_text: This grant call focuses on researching the effectiveness and implementation of family navigation models aimed at diverting non-urgent mental health cases from emergency departments. Key areas of interest include the use of triage tools for assessing mental health acuity, enhancing family engagement in mental health services, and addressing barriers to help-seeking through support and knowledge dissemination.

title: Full-Scale Hybrid Effectiveness-Implementation Trials for Mental Health Interventions (R01 - Clinical Trial Required)
summary_text: This grant call focuses on clinical trials aimed at testing the effectiveness of therapeutic and preventive interventions in mental health, as well as evaluating services interventions that enhance access, quality, and equity in mental health care. It emphasizes the need for trials to address significant issues, be adequately powered, and explore mediators and moderators of intervention effects, while also aligning with the NIMH's experimental therapeutics approach to understand the mechanisms underlying these effects. Additionally, it supports multisite trials to enhance sample diversity and representation.

title: Confirmatory Efficacy Clinical Trials of Non-Pharmacological and Pharmacological Interventions for Mental Disorders (R01 Clinical Trial Required)
summary_text: This grant call focuses on confirmatory efficacy clinical trials for non-pharmacological interventions aimed at treating mental disorders in both adults and children. It emphasizes the need for research that addresses unmet therapeutic needs and aligns with the experimental therapeutics approach, which seeks to enhance understanding of the relationship between disease processes and the mechanisms of action of therapeutic interventions.

title: Pilot Hybrid Effectiveness-Implementation Trials for Mental Health Interventions (R01  Clinical Trial Required)
summary_text: This grant call focuses on pilot effectiveness studies aimed at optimizing preventive and therapeutic interventions for broader populations and community settings, as well as developing and testing innovative service interventions. It emphasizes the need for studies that investigate the mechanisms underlying intervention effects, including clinical outcomes, provider behavior, and service access and continuity.

title: Early Stage Testing of Pharmacologic or Neuromodulatory Device-based Interventions for the Treatment of Mental Disorders (R33- Clinical Trial Required)
summary_text: The NIMH grant call focuses on experimental therapeutics for developing and testing therapeutic interventions, emphasizing the evaluation of clinical effects alongside the investigation of underlying mechanisms of disorders or responses to interventions. It encourages early-stage testing of pharmacologic interventions with novel mechanisms and device-based interventions, requiring studies to adequately test the presumed mechanisms of action and demonstrate dose-dependent effects on neurophysiological, clinical, or behavioral outcomes.

title: Development of Psychosocial Therapeutic and Preventive Interventions for Mental Disorders (R61/R33 Clinical Trial Required)
summary_text: This grant call focuses on the development and testing of novel psychosocial therapeutic and preventive interventions for mental disorders. It emphasizes the translation of research from basic, behavioral, cognitive, affective, and neuropsychological sciences into effective interventions, with a specific interest in evaluating target engagement and clinical outcomes.

title: Development of Psychosocial Therapeutic and Preventive Interventions for Mental Disorders (R33 Clinical Trial Required)
summary_text: This grant call focuses on the development and testing of novel psychosocial therapeutic and preventive interventions for mental disorders. It emphasizes the translation of research from basic, behavioral, cognitive, affective, and neuropsychological sciences into effective interventions, aiming to replicate target engagement from previous studies and assess its impact on clinical outcomes.

title: Alcohol Health Services Research (R34 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: The grant call emphasizes research on improving alcohol health services, specifically targeting the treatment gap for individuals with alcohol use disorder (AUD). Key focus areas include enhancing access to treatment, increasing the appeal of treatment options, analyzing cost structures and insurance systems, studying the dissemination and implementation of evidence-based treatment approaches, and addressing health disparities among affected populations.

title: Early Stage Testing of Pharmacologic or Neuromodulatory Device-based Interventions for the Treatment of Mental Disorders (R61/R33 Clinical Trial Required)
summary_text: The NIMH grant call focuses on experimental therapeutics for developing and testing therapeutic interventions, emphasizing the evaluation of clinical effects alongside the investigation of underlying mechanisms of disorders or responses to interventions. It encourages early-stage testing of pharmacologic interventions with novel mechanisms and device-based interventions, requiring studies to adequately test the presumed mechanisms of action and demonstrate dose-dependent effects on neurophysiological, clinical, or behavioral outcomes.

title: Effectiveness Trials to Test Mental Health System Interventions (R61/R33 Clinical Trial Required)
summary_text: The key research topics focus on developing and testing system interventions aimed at improving the organization, delivery, and outcomes of mental health services. This includes exploring structural, policy, organizational, and interpersonal strategies to enhance access, equity, engagement, and quality of care across various settings such as health systems, community clinics, schools, and juvenile justice systems. The goal is to conduct well-powered clinical trials that evaluate the effectiveness of these interventions in achieving better clinical and functional outcomes.

title: Alcohol Treatment, Pharmacotherapy, and Recovery Research (R34 Clinical Trial required)
summary_text: The grant call emphasizes research on improving alcohol health services, specifically targeting the treatment gap for individuals with alcohol use disorder (AUD). Key focus areas include enhancing access to treatment, increasing the appeal of treatment options, analyzing cost structures and insurance systems, studying the dissemination and implementation of evidence-based treatment approaches, and addressing health disparities among affected populations.

title: Alcohol Health Services Research (R01 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: The National Institute on Alcohol Abuse and Alcoholism is seeking research proposals that address alcohol health services, specifically targeting the treatment gap for individuals with alcohol use disorder (AUD). Key focus areas include enhancing access to AUD treatment, improving the appeal of treatment options, analyzing cost and insurance frameworks, studying the dissemination and implementation of evidence-based treatment methods, and reducing health disparities among affected populations.

title: Alcohol Treatment, Pharmacotherapy, and Recovery Research (R01 Clinical Trial Required)
summary_text: The National Institute on Alcohol Abuse and Alcoholism is seeking research proposals that focus on the treatment and recovery from alcohol use disorder (AUD). Key areas of interest include medication development, precision medicine, behavioral therapies, mechanisms of behavioral change, recovery processes, translational research, and innovative methods and technologies for AUD treatment.

title: Time-Sensitive Research Opportunities in Environmental Health Sciences (R21 Clinical Trials Not Allowed)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on environmental health research related to the impacts of unpredictable events or policy changes, particularly in the context of natural and human-made disasters and emerging public health threats. It aims to facilitate the rapid collection of human biological samples and environmental exposure data to better understand these consequences. The initiative emphasizes a quick review and funding process to enable timely research implementation.

title: Innovative Screening Approaches and Therapies for Screenable Disorders in Newborns (R01 - Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This grant call focuses on developing innovative screening methods and therapeutic interventions for serious conditions identified through newborn screening, as well as for high-priority genetic conditions that may soon be eligible for screening. Key areas of research include improving the accuracy of screening tests and demonstrating the benefits of early intervention or treatment for these conditions.

title: Innovative Screening Approaches and Therapies for Screenable Disorders in Newborns (R21 - Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This grant call focuses on developing innovative screening methods and therapeutic interventions for serious conditions identified through newborn screening, as well as for high-priority genetic conditions that may soon be eligible for screening. Key research topics include the creation of accurate screening tests and the demonstration of the benefits of early intervention or treatment for these conditions.

title: NCCIH Natural Product Mid Phase Clinical Trial (R01 Clinical Trial Required)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on mid-phase clinical trials of natural products, including botanicals, dietary supplements, and probiotics, with a strong scientific basis for further testing. Key research topics include optimizing doses or formulations of these products and identifying patient phenotypes that respond to them, supported by preliminary data on bioavailability and measurable impacts on target engagement. The trials must be hypothesis-driven and aligned with the research priorities of the NCCIH, excluding cancer-related studies.

title: NCCIH Natural Product Early Phase Clinical Trial Award (R33 Clinical Trial Required)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on early phase clinical trials of natural products, including botanicals, dietary supplements, and probiotics, with a strong scientific basis for further testing. Key research topics include the standardization of nutritional compounds, optimization of delivery methods, and the exploration of combinations with other treatments to enhance target engagement and clinical outcomes. The aim is to translate basic science findings into clinical applications, providing valuable insights for future research directions.

title: Targeting Cell Surface HIV Envelope for Cell Elimination (R01 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on researching the cell surface expression of HIV-1 Envelope (Env), understanding the structural mechanisms behind biologic-mediated cell killing, and creating innovative strategies to improve the detection and destruction of Env-expressing, HIV-1 infected cells. The goal is to advance the development of immunotherapies and targeted vaccines aimed at preventing and curing HIV-1.

title: NCCIH Natural Product Early Phase Clinical Trial Phased Innovation Award (R61/R33 Clinical Trial Required)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on early phase clinical trials of natural products, including botanicals, probiotics, and dietary supplements, with a strong scientific basis for further testing. Key research topics include pharmacokinetics, bioavailability, and the mechanisms of action of these natural products, as well as optimizing their delivery and assessing their impact on specific target measures and clinical outcomes in human populations. Applications may also explore combinations of natural products with other treatments to enhance efficacy.

title: Accelerating Solutions to Improve Access and Quality of Empirically-Supported Practices for Youth Mental Health (R01 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This grant call focuses on research aimed at improving access to evidence-based mental health interventions for youth, particularly in underserved areas such as rural communities and inner cities. Key topics include optimizing assessment and intervention strategies, addressing workforce shortages, integrating mental health services into various settings (like schools and social services), and tackling systemic barriers to mental health care access and quality.

title: Mobile Health: Technology and Outcomes in Low and Middle Income Countries (R21/R33 - Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on exploratory research into innovative mobile health (mHealth) interventions tailored for low- and middle-income countries (LMICs). Key areas of interest include the development, validation, and effectiveness of mHealth tools that leverage new technologies and analytics to enhance clinical and public health outcomes, while also building research capacity in LMICs through collaborative partnerships.

title: NHLBI Early Phase Clinical Trials for Therapeutics and/or Diagnostics for HLBS Disorders (R61/R33 Clinical Trial Required)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on supporting Phase I clinical trials for diagnostic and therapeutic interventions targeting heart, lung, blood, and sleep (HLBS) disorders in both adults and children. It emphasizes the need for final stage preclinical activities that are directly related to the proposed trials, which can be conducted at single or multiple sites.

title: NHLBI Early Phase Clinical Trials for Therapeutics and/or Diagnostics for HLBS Disorders (R33 CT Required)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on supporting phase I clinical trials aimed at developing diagnostic and therapeutic interventions for heart, lung, blood, and sleep (HLBS) disorders in both adults and children. The trials can be conducted at single or multiple sites, and applicants must be prepared to initiate the trials promptly after receiving funding.

title: Interventions to Address Disparities in Liver Diseases and Liver Cancer (R01 - Clinical Trials Optional)
summary_text: This initiative focuses on multi-level and multi-domain intervention research aimed at reducing disparities in liver diseases and liver cancer among populations in the U.S. that experience health disparities. The research should address the underlying factors contributing to these disparities and promote equitable health outcomes.

title: Accelerating the Pace of Substance Use Research Using Existing Data (R21 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on the innovative analysis of existing social science, behavioral, administrative, and neuroimaging data to investigate the etiology and epidemiology of drug use behaviors, including alcohol, tobacco, and prescription drugs. Key research topics include the prevention of drug use and HIV, health service utilization, and the development of effective strategies for the prevention and treatment of drug abuse and related disorders. The aim is to enhance understanding of the trajectories of drug use behaviors, their consequences, and the factors influencing risk and resilience in psychopathology.

title: Accelerating the Pace of Substance Use Research Using Existing Data (R01 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This grant call focuses on the innovative analysis of existing social science, behavioral, administrative, and neuroimaging data to investigate the etiology and epidemiology of drug use behaviors, including alcohol, tobacco, and prescription drugs. It aims to enhance understanding of the consequences of these behaviors, such as morbidity and mortality, and to develop effective prevention and treatment strategies for drug abuse and HIV. Researchers are encouraged to utilize public and community-based datasets to explore risk, resilience, and health service utilization related to these issues.

title: Pilot Health Services and Economic Research on the Treatment of Drug, Alcohol, and Tobacco Use Disorders (R34 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on pilot and preliminary research aimed at enhancing the effectiveness of treatments for drug, tobacco, and alcohol use disorders, as well as related services for comorbid medical and mental health conditions. It encourages the exploration of both innovative and commonly used interventions, practices, and policies to improve access, quality, affordability, and utilization of these treatments, while also assessing their feasibility and acceptability.

title: Interventions to Reduce Sleep Health Disparities (R01 - Clinical Trials Optional)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on non-pharmacological interventions aimed at promoting sleep health and addressing sleep health disparities. It encourages research on sleep as a modifiable factor that can help reduce health disparities in various health outcomes among affected populations.

title: Preclinical Proof of Concept Studies for Rare Diseases (R21 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: The key research topics focus on conducting efficacy studies in established preclinical models for rare diseases, evaluating therapeutic agents such as small molecules and biologics. The scientific focus areas include pharmacodynamic and pharmacokinetic studies to support the development of these agents, with the ultimate goal of advancing projects towards full Investigational New Drug (IND) application or clinical trials.

title: Ancillary Studies to Ongoing Clinical Projects (R21 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: The key research topics for the Ancillary Studies to Ongoing Clinical Projects (R21) focus on supporting ancillary studies that complement existing clinical trials. The scientific emphasis is on enhancing understanding of clinical outcomes, mechanisms of disease, and treatment effects through additional research that aligns with ongoing projects.

title: Role of Defective Proviruses in HIV Persistence (R01 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on research aimed at understanding the role of defective HIV proviruses in HIV persistence and pathogenesis during antiretroviral treatment. It seeks to explore how these defective proviruses may negatively affect HIV cure strategies and interfere with HIV-specific molecular assays.

title: Ancillary Studies to Ongoing Clinical Projects (R01 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: The key research topics for this grant call focus on ancillary studies related to ongoing clinical projects. The scientific emphasis is on enhancing understanding and outcomes of existing clinical trials through supplementary research efforts.

title: Clinical Observational (CO) Studies in Musculoskeletal, Rheumatic, and Skin Diseases (R01 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: The key research topics for this grant focus on clinical observational studies related to musculoskeletal, rheumatic, and skin diseases. The scientific emphasis is on understanding these conditions through observational research methodologies.

title: BRAIN Initiative: New Concepts and Early-Stage Research for Recording and Modulation in the Nervous System (R21) (Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: The BRAIN Initiative aims to advance understanding of how neural circuits encode information through electrical and chemical signals, influencing sensations, thoughts, emotions, and actions. This grant call focuses on developing innovative technologies in the early stages of conceptualization for large-scale recording or manipulation of neural activity, as well as supporting computational models and experimental approaches to validate theoretical assumptions. Key research topics include novel measurement technologies, mathematical techniques, and the creation of prototypes or models for future testing in animal models.

title: NIDCR Small Research Grants for Oral Health Data Analysis and Statistical Methodology Development (R03 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on supporting research projects that utilize secondary data analyses of existing oral or craniofacial databases. It also encourages the development of statistical methodologies for analyzing these dental, oral, or craniofacial data resources.

title: Awards Supporting Cutting-Edge Technologies for Translational Science (ASCETTS) (R21 Clinical Trials Not Allowed)
summary_text: The NCATS is seeking applications for innovative technology development aimed at overcoming challenges in translational science, particularly in therapeutic development. The focus is on early-stage, high-risk studies that explore new technologies or novel applications to enhance the efficiency of the therapeutic development pipeline.

title: Exploratory/Developmental Bioengineering Research Grants (EBRG) (R21 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: The National Cancer Institute (NCI) is seeking exploratory and developmental research proposals in bioengineering that focus on enhancing the quality, speed, efficacy, operability, cost-effectiveness, and accessibility of solutions in biomedical research, clinical care delivery, and related areas. Key research topics include the development of new capabilities and improvements in existing technologies to address challenges in basic, pre-clinical, and clinical settings.

title: HEAL Initiative-Early-Stage Discovery of New Pain Targets Within the Understudied Druggable Proteome (R03 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on identifying new druggable targets for pain by exploring understudied proteins within the druggable proteome. It aims to support preliminary research and the development of tools related to these proteins, contributing to advancements in pain management and the broader context of opioid addiction treatment.

title: Exploratory/Developmental Bioengineering Research Grants (EBRG) (R21 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: The National Cancer Institute (NCI) is seeking exploratory and developmental research proposals in bioengineering that focus on enhancing the quality, speed, efficacy, operability, cost-effectiveness, and accessibility of solutions in biomedical research, clinical care delivery, and related areas. Key research topics include the development of new capabilities and improvements in existing technologies to address challenges in basic, pre-clinical, and clinical settings.

title: Single-Site Investigator-Initiated Clinical Trials (R61/R33 Clinical Trial Required)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on developing and implementing investigator-initiated single site clinical trials, including efficacy, comparative effectiveness, pragmatic, and implementation research. The trials may explore various therapeutic, behavioral, and prevention strategies relevant to the NHLBI's research mission. Applicants are expected to provide a scientific rationale and a detailed operational plan for the trial, addressing aspects such as project management and subject recruitment.

title: Limited Competition: Small Grant Program for the NCATS Clinical and Translational Science Award (CTSA) Program (R03 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: The key research topics for this grant call include clinical and translational science projects, pilot and feasibility studies, secondary data analysis, small-scale research projects, and the development of research methodologies and technologies. The focus is on supporting short-term, self-contained research that may involve patient-oriented studies and aims to generate preliminary data for future larger grant applications.

title: Risk and Protective Factors of Family Health and Family Level Interventions (R01 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This initiative focuses on advancing the science of minority health and health disparities, specifically through research on family health, well-being, and resilience. It aims to explore these areas as essential components in reducing disparities and promoting equity in health outcomes.

title: D-START: Data Science Track Award for Research Transition (D/START) (R03-Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing addiction-related data science by encouraging both new and established researchers to apply innovative data science methodologies to critical questions in addiction research. It emphasizes the use of existing datasets, adherence to FAIR principles, and ethical considerations in research involving human subjects. The goal is to develop robust research programs that integrate cutting-edge data science techniques with addiction studies, starting with small-scale projects that can lead to larger initiatives.

title: Limited Competition: Small Grant Program for NHLBI K01/K08/K23/K25 Recipients (R03 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This funding opportunity invites NHLBI K01, K08, K23, and K25 awardees to apply for small grants to expand their research or pursue new studies stemming from their K award research. Key research topics include pilot or feasibility studies, proof of concept studies, secondary data analysis, small self-contained projects, and the development of new methodologies or experimental models. The focus is on generating preliminary data to support future R01 applications, with an emphasis on projects that can be completed within two years.

title: NIDCD Research Grants for Translating Basic Research into Clinical Practice (R01 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on translational research projects that bridge basic scientific findings with clinical applications to improve human health, specifically targeting communication disorders. Key research topics include the diagnosis, treatment, and prevention of these disorders, with an emphasis on establishing clear connections to clinical conditions and achieving practical clinical outcomes.

title: Advanced Development and Validation of Emerging Biospecimen Science Technologies for Basic and Clinical Cancer Research (R33 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: The National Cancer Institute (NCI) is seeking exploratory research projects that focus on the development and validation of innovative technologies aimed at improving the quality and handling of cancer-related biospecimens. Key research topics include the creation of tools and methods for the collection, processing, preservation, and storage of these samples, with an emphasis on maintaining sample integrity and addressing pre-analytical degradation. The goal is to enhance cancer research, early detection, clinical diagnosis, treatment, and to tackle cancer health disparities.

title: Advanced Development and Validation of Emerging Molecular and Cellular Analysis Technologies for Basic and Clinical Cancer Research (R33 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: The National Cancer Institute (NCI) is seeking exploratory research projects that focus on the development and validation of innovative technologies for targeting and assessing molecular and cellular features of cancer biology. Key research topics include enhancing cancer biology understanding, improving early detection and screening methods, advancing clinical diagnosis and treatment, and addressing cancer health disparities. Proposed technologies should aim to improve molecular and cellular characterizations of cancer, with a strong emphasis on overcoming feasibility gaps and demonstrating preliminary data.

title: Toward Translation of Nanotechnology Cancer Interventions (TTNCI; R01 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: The key research topics for the "Toward Translation of Nanotechnology Cancer Interventions" (TTNCI) include advanced pre-clinical research focused on the development of nanotechnology-based cancer diagnostics and therapeutics. The scientific focus areas emphasize the maturation of experimental nanomedicines utilizing nanoparticles and nano-devices to enhance cancer treatment effectiveness through innovative structural designs and therapeutic or diagnostic cargo delivery.

title: Supporting Talented Early Career Researchers in Genomics (R01 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on supporting innovative research in genomics, specifically in areas such as genomic sciences, genomic medicine, genomic data science, and the ethical, legal, and social implications of genomics. It aims to foster the careers of Early Stage Investigators committed to advancing these fields.

title: Addressing Barriers to Healthcare Transitions for Survivors of Childhood and Adolescent Cancers (R01 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: The key research topics focus on multi-level intervention studies aimed at overcoming barriers to the transition from pediatric to adult care for survivors of childhood and adolescent cancers. The scientific emphasis is on developing and testing strategies that enhance transitional care and ensure ongoing engagement and appropriate surveillance for these survivors as they move into adulthood.

title: NIH Small Research Grant Program (Parent R03 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: The NIH Small Research Grant Program focuses on supporting small-scale research projects, including pilot and feasibility studies, secondary data analysis, and the development of research methodologies and technologies. It specifically excludes applications for clinical trials.

title: NIH Exploratory/Developmental Research Project Grant (Parent R21 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: The NIH Exploratory/Developmental Grant focuses on supporting innovative research projects in their early stages, particularly those that involve high-risk, high-reward concepts. Key areas of interest include the development of novel techniques, methodologies, agents, and models that could significantly advance biomedical, behavioral, or clinical research.

title: NHLBI Clinical Trial Pilot Studies (R34 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on research that informs the planning of Phase II-IV clinical trials related to heart, lung, blood, and sleep disorders. It aims to support studies that provide necessary and sufficient data to design or plan these trials, specifically targeting the efficacy, safety, clinical management, or implementation of interventions for these conditions. The research should address scientific or operational questions that will aid in the final development of the subsequent clinical trials.

title: NIH Research Project Grant (Parent R01 Clinical Trial Required)
summary_text: The NIH Research Project Grant focuses on supporting discrete research projects that align with the specific interests and competencies of the investigators. Key research topics must include at least one clinical trial and should relate to the scientific missions of the participating NIH Institutes and Centers.

title: NIH Research Project Grant (Parent R01 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: The NIH Research Project Grant focuses on discrete research projects aligned with the specific interests and competencies of the investigators. Proposed projects should relate to the scientific missions of participating NIH Institutes and Centers, excluding clinical trial applications.

title: NIH Research Project Grant (Parent R01 Basic Experimental Studies with Humans Required)
summary_text: The NIH Research Project Grant focuses on basic science experimental studies involving human participants, specifically those that prospectively assign individuals to conditions to manipulate independent variables and assess biomedical or behavioral outcomes. The aim is to understand fundamental phenomena without immediate application towards processes or products. Research proposals must align with the scientific missions of participating NIH Institutes and Centers.

title: NIH Exploratory/Developmental Research Project Grant (Parent R21 Clinical Trial Required)
summary_text: The NIH Exploratory/Developmental Grant focuses on supporting innovative research projects in the early stages that may involve high risk but have the potential for significant breakthroughs in biomedical, behavioral, or clinical research. Key areas of interest include the development of novel techniques, methodologies, and applications, with a requirement for at least one clinical trial to be included in the proposed project.

title: NIH Exploratory/Developmental Research Project Grant (Parent R21 Basic Experimental Studies with Humans Required)
summary_text: The NIH Exploratory/Developmental Grant focuses on supporting innovative research projects in the early stages that involve human participants. Key research topics include basic science experimental studies that prospectively assign participants to conditions to assess biomedical or behavioral outcomes, aiming to understand fundamental phenomena without immediate application in mind. The initiative encourages high-risk studies that could lead to significant breakthroughs or the development of novel methodologies in biomedical, behavioral, or clinical research.

title: Elucidating Immunometabolic Responses to HIV Infection that Increase TB or HBV Risk (R01 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on researching the immunometabolic changes induced by HIV in individuals on combination antiretroviral therapy and how these changes affect immune responses. Key areas of interest include the impact of HIV-driven immunometabolic alterations on immune cell regulation, interactions, treatment responses, and the progression of secondary infections such as tuberculosis and hepatitis B virus.

title: Elucidating Immunometabolic Responses to HIV Infection that Increase TB or HBV Risk (R21 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on research investigating the immunometabolic changes induced by HIV in individuals on combination antiretroviral therapy (cART). It aims to understand how these alterations affect immune responses, cell regulation, and interactions, particularly in relation to the risk of poor outcomes from secondary infections like Mycobacterium tuberculosis (Mtb) and Hepatitis B Virus (HBV).

title: Research on Current Topics in Alzheimer's Disease and Its Related Dementias (R01 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This funding opportunity invites research proposals focused on Alzheimer's disease (AD) and related dementias (ADRD). Key research topics will be detailed in future announcements, emphasizing current and high-priority areas of interest in the field.

title: Cutting-Edge Basic Research Awards (CEBRA) (R21 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: The NIDA Cutting-Edge Basic Research Award (CEBRA) focuses on innovative research related to the etiology, pathophysiology, prevention, and treatment of substance use disorders (SUDs). It encourages the development of revolutionary techniques and methods for addiction research, as well as the testing of significant hypotheses that could transform current understanding and approaches to SUDs.

title: Translational Bioinformatics and Experimental Approaches to Advance Drug Repositioning and Combination Therapy Development for Alzheimers Disease and Related Dementias (R01 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on using mouse models for preclinical testing of existing and investigational drugs aimed at treating Alzheimer's Disease (AD) and Alzheimer's Disease Related Dementias (ADRD). It emphasizes the evaluation of drug combinations and the integration of non-pharmacologic interventions to enhance translational outcomes, with the ultimate goal of establishing proof of concept for drug repurposing and combination therapy development.

title: Early Immune System Development and Ontogeny (R01 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on understanding the mechanisms of early immune development in neonates, infants, and children, particularly in relation to in-utero exposure to HIV or Anti-Retroviral Therapeutics (ART). Key research topics include the maternal-fetal immune interface, T and B cell development and maturation, and the interplay between local and systemic immune responses during early life stages.

title: Research on Current Topics in Alzheimer's Disease and Its Related Dementias (R21 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This funding opportunity invites applications for innovative tests, animal models, and techniques aimed at advancing research on Alzheimer's disease (AD) and related dementias (ADRD). The focus is on developing approaches that require preliminary data and can be widely disseminated for broader application in the field.

title: Ex Vivo Models for Studies at the Intersection of HIV and Addictive Substance Use (R01 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This grant call focuses on researching the neuroimmune and neuronal-glial mechanisms underlying HIV-associated neurological disorders (HAND) using human induced pluripotent stem cell (hiPSC) models. Key areas of interest include the analysis of genetics and epigenetics, neuroglial interactions, and neuroimmune cell activities, with an emphasis on unbiased and reproducible methodologies at both the single cell and neural circuit levels.

title: Secondary Analysis of Existing Datasets in Heart, Lung, and Blood Diseases and Sleep Disorders (R21 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on utilizing existing human datasets for secondary analyses to explore innovative scientific concepts or develop new models, systems, tools, methods, or technologies. The aim is to enhance biomedical or biobehavioral research in alignment with the NHLBI mission.

title: Planning for Product Development Strategy (R34 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on developing next-generation treatments for HIV, including strategies for managing HIV-associated comorbidities, coinfections, and complications. It aims to facilitate the translation of research findings into drug products suitable for FDA Investigational New Drug (IND) applications.

title: Innovative Pilot Mental Health Services Research Not Involving Clinical Trials (R34 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This funding announcement encourages pilot research in services that align with NIMH priorities, focusing on areas of services research that do not necessarily lead to clinical trials. The emphasis is on innovative approaches that contribute to understanding and improving mental health services without being directly tied to intervention testing.

title: Innovative Mental Health Services Research Not Involving Clinical Trials (R01 Clinical Trials Not Allowed)
summary_text: This funding announcement focuses on innovative research aimed at enhancing the delivery of high-quality mental health services for individuals with or at risk of mental illness. It specifically invites non-clinical trial R01-level projects that align with the NIMH's strategic priorities in mental health services research.

title: Revision Applications for Incorporation of Novel NCI-Supported Technology to Accelerate Cancer Research (R01 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on expanding existing NCI R01 research projects by incorporating new technical approaches or devices developed through the NCI Innovative Molecular Analysis Technologies (IMAT) program. Key research topics include the independent validation of emerging technologies and the promotion of interdisciplinary collaboration to develop innovative tools and methods that enhance cancer research and accelerate scientific discovery.

title: Academic-Industrial Partnerships for Translation of Technologies for Diagnosis and Treatment (R01 - Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: The key research topics focus on translating scientific discoveries and engineering advancements into practical methods or tools for understanding and managing diseases. This includes addressing challenges in basic and applied research related to risk assessment, detection, prevention, diagnosis, treatment, and management of various health conditions. The aim is to enhance technologies and methodologies that support research and healthcare delivery across different settings.

title: Academic-Industrial Partnerships for Translation of Technologies for Diagnosis and Treatment (R01 - Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: The key research topics focus on translating scientific discoveries and engineering advancements into practical methods or tools for understanding diseases and improving applied research. This includes developing technologies for risk assessment, detection, prevention, diagnosis, treatment, and management of diseases in various research and clinical settings.

title: NEI Research Grant for Vision-Related Secondary Data Analysis (R21 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on vision-related research projects that utilize secondary data analyses from existing databases. It also encourages the development of statistical methodologies aimed at enhancing the analysis of vision health data.

title: In Vivo High-Resolution Imaging for Inner Ear Visualization (R01 Clinical Trial optional)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on advancing in vivo high-resolution imaging technologies for the human inner ear, emphasizing the development of techniques that enhance the visualization of inner ear structures with greater detail and accuracy. Key research topics include improving existing imaging methods, creating new imaging probes or contrast agents, and visualizing both structural and functional elements of the inner ear, such as hair cells and vasculature, in awake patients. Collaborative, multi-disciplinary approaches are encouraged, with studies permitted in humans and relevant animal models.

title: Multidisciplinary Studies of HIV/AIDS and Aging (R01 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This grant call focuses on research that explores the intersection of HIV and aging, specifically aiming to enhance understanding of the biological, clinical, and socio-behavioral aspects of aging in the context of HIV infection and treatment. Additionally, it seeks to improve strategies for testing, preventing, and treating HIV, as well as managing related comorbidities and complications across diverse populations and cultural settings, utilizing current aging science methodologies.

title: Advancing HIV/AIDS Research within the Mission of the NIDCD (R01 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on stimulating HIV/AIDS research related to the areas of hearing, balance, taste, smell, voice, speech, and language. It encourages applications that align with the high-priority research topics identified by the NIH Office of AIDS Research, specifically targeting the intersection of HIV/AIDS and communication disorders.

title: Multidisciplinary Studies of HIV/AIDS and Aging (R21 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This grant call focuses on research that explores the intersection of HIV and aging, specifically aiming to enhance understanding of the biological, clinical, and socio-behavioral aspects of aging in the context of HIV infection and treatment. Additionally, it seeks to improve strategies for testing, preventing, and treating HIV, as well as managing related comorbidities and complications across diverse populations and cultural settings, utilizing current aging science methodologies.

title: Trailblazer Award for New and Early Stage Investigators (R21 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: The Trailblazer Award focuses on research that integrates engineering and physical sciences with life and biomedical sciences. It encourages exploratory, developmental, and high-risk projects that may be technology design-directed, discovery-driven, or hypothesis-driven, with an emphasis on innovative approaches that do not require preliminary data.

title: Joint NINDS/NIMH Exploratory Neuroscience Research Grant (R21 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: The Joint NINDS/NIMH Exploratory Neuroscience Research Grant program focuses on innovative and exploratory research in neuroscience, particularly in understanding neurological and mental health disorders. Key areas of interest include the feasibility of novel investigative approaches, the development of new techniques and methodologies, and mechanistic clinical trials or basic experimental studies involving human subjects.

title: Unveiling Health and Healthcare Disparities in Non-Communicable and Chronic Diseases in Latin America: Setting the Stage for Better Health Outcomes Across the Hemisphere (R01 - Clinical Trials Not Allowed)
summary_text: The key research topics for this funding opportunity include clinical epidemiology, evaluation of public and health care policies, and validation of measurements related to health disparities. The focus is on non-communicable and chronic diseases with significant impact in Latin America and among U.S. Hispanics/Latinos, emphasizing collaborative, multi-disciplinary approaches.

title: Priority HIV/AIDS Research within the Mission of NIDDK (R01 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on stimulating research related to HIV/AIDS within the scope of the National Institute of Diabetes and Digestive and Kidney Diseases (NIDDK). It emphasizes alignment with the HIV/AIDS research priorities set by the NIH Office of AIDS Research, as outlined in the latest guidelines.

title: Advancing HIV/AIDS Research within the Mission of the NIDCD (R21 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on stimulating HIV/AIDS research related to the scientific areas of hearing, balance, taste, smell, voice, speech, and language. It encourages applications that align with the high-priority research topics identified by the NIH Office of AIDS Research, particularly those that may involve low-risk clinical trials.

title: Pilot Studies of Biological, Behavioral and Social Mechanisms Contributing to HIV Pathogenesis Within the Mission of NIDDK (R21 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on innovative basic and translational research related to HIV/AIDS, particularly in understanding the pathophysiological mechanisms of HIV comorbidities, coinfections, and complications affecting various organs and tissues. It also emphasizes the investigation of biological mechanisms behind HIV reservoirs in NIDDK-relevant tissues to inform strategies for viral suppression or eradication, as well as the impact of social determinants of health on these issues.

title: Development and Testing of Novel Interventions to Improve HIV Prevention, Treatment, and Program Implementation for People Who Use Substances (R34 Clinical Trial Required)
summary_text: The key research topics for this funding opportunity include formative research and intervention development aimed at HIV prevention and treatment for people who use drugs. The focus areas encompass the feasibility, tolerability, acceptability, and safety of novel or adapted interventions, which may involve behavioral, social, structural, or combination biomedical and behavioral approaches.

title: Small R01s for Clinical Trials Targeting Diseases within the Mission of NIDDK (R01 Clinical Trial Required)
summary_text: This funding announcement focuses on pilot and feasibility clinical trials in humans aimed at the prevention and treatment of diseases under the NIDDK's mission. It seeks to support small, short-term trials that gather preliminary data on intervention effects, recruitment, retention, and study conduct, with the goal of paving the way for larger, more definitive trials that can enhance understanding and improve clinical practice or public health.

title: Limited Competition: Small Grant Program for NIDDK K01/K08/K23/K25 Recipients (R03 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: The NIDDK is focusing on enhancing the research capabilities of K01, K08, K23, and K25 award recipients through Small Grant (R03) support. Key research topics include pilot and feasibility studies, secondary data analysis, small self-contained projects, and the development of research methodologies and technologies, all aimed at facilitating the transition to independent investigator status.

title: NEI Clinical Research Study Planning Grant Program (R34 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: The NEI grant call focuses on supporting large-scale clinical vision research projects, specifically randomized clinical trials and epidemiologic studies related to eye and vision conditions. Key research topics include the development of study protocols and Manuals of Procedures (MOP), as well as conducting preliminary studies to refine procedures and assess recruitment potential, without generating data on intervention effects.

title: Interventions on Health and Healthcare Disparities on Non-Communicable and Chronic Diseases in Latin America: Improving Health Outcomes Across the Hemisphere (R01 - Clinical Trial Required)
summary_text: This funding opportunity aims to support interdisciplinary research teams investigating clinical, health services, and community-based interventions targeting health and healthcare disparities associated with non-communicable and chronic diseases in Latin America and among U.S. Hispanics/Latinos. The focus is on addressing the highest burden and mortality rates of these diseases through meaningful collaboration with partners from Latin American institutions.

title: Ethical, Legal and Social Implications (ELSI) Research (R01 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This grant call invites research proposals focused on the ethical, legal, and social implications (ELSI) of human genetics and genomics. It encourages the use of various research methods, including qualitative and quantitative approaches, as well as conceptual and legal analyses, with an emphasis on stakeholder involvement.

title: Ethical, Legal and Social Implications (ELSI) Exploratory/Developmental Research Grant (R21 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This grant call focuses on exploratory and developmental research into the ethical, legal, and social implications (ELSI) of human genetics and genomics. Key research topics include the study of new or emerging genomic technologies and novel uses of genomic information, utilizing a variety of methods such as qualitative and quantitative analyses, as well as conceptual and legal frameworks. Involvement of relevant stakeholders in the research process is encouraged.

title: Ethical, Legal and Social Implications (ELSI) Small Research Grant (R03 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This funding opportunity invites research proposals that investigate the ethical, legal, and social implications (ELSI) of human genetics and genomics. Key focus areas include normative and conceptual analyses across various disciplines such as law, economics, philosophy, anthropology, and history, particularly concerning new or emerging issues in the field. Additionally, projects may involve preliminary data collection or secondary analysis of existing data.

title: Collaborative Research Using Biosamples and/or Data from Type 1 Diabetes Clinical Studies (R01 - Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on research into the etiology and pathogenesis of type 1 diabetes, utilizing data and samples from clinical trials and studies. It aims to support collaborative investigative teams in exploring disease mechanisms to enhance prevention strategies for type 1 diabetes.

title: Intervention Research to Improve Native American Health (R34 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on research interventions aimed at improving health in Native American populations. Key areas of interest include etiologic research to inform intervention development, the efficacy and effectiveness of health promotion and disease prevention strategies, culturally informed treatment interventions, and dissemination and implementation research to enhance the adoption and sustainability of effective solutions. The initiative emphasizes leveraging community strengths and resilience to address health inequities and develop culturally appropriate interventions.

title: Intervention Research to Improve Native American Health (R01 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: It seems there is no grant call description provided. Please share the details of the grant call, and I will help you extract and summarize the key research topics and scientific focus areas.

title: New Investigator Gateway Awards for Collaborative T1D Research (R03 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: The New Investigator Gateway Award in T1D Research focuses on supporting innovative projects and new investigators in Type 1 Diabetes (T1D) research. Key research topics include preliminary studies on T1D, fostering collaboration within established scientific consortia, and addressing critical questions in the field to enhance understanding and networking opportunities for early-stage researchers.

title: NIH Directors Transformative Research Awards (R01 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: The NIH Directors Transformative Research Award Program focuses on supporting innovative and unconventional research that has the potential to create new scientific paradigms and improve clinical approaches or technologies. It welcomes applications across a wide range of topics relevant to the NIH mission, including behavioral, social, biomedical, and formal sciences, as well as basic, translational, and clinical research. The program emphasizes projects that demonstrate a compelling potential for significant impact in their respective fields.

title: Tobacco Regulatory Science Small Grant Program for New Investigators (R03 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on supporting early-career researchers in tobacco regulatory research, emphasizing projects that can inform FDA regulations on tobacco product manufacturing, distribution, and marketing. Key research topics include pilot studies, secondary data analysis, and the development of research methodologies and technologies related to tobacco control as mandated by the Family Smoking Prevention and Tobacco Control Act. The goal is to generate findings that directly impact public health through effective tobacco regulation.

title: Expanding the Target Landscape by Drugging the Undruggable (R21 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This funding opportunity seeks exploratory and early-stage research projects aimed at addressing undruggable target classes associated with challenging human diseases. The focus is on developing innovative methods or agents that selectively target these undruggable classes, advancing strategies that go beyond conventional therapeutic approaches.

title: Physical Oceanography
summary_text: The Physical Oceanography Program focuses on research related to the ocean's structure and movement, including its transport mechanisms. It also examines the interactions between the ocean's physical properties and biological and chemical processes, as well as the relationships between the ocean and the atmosphere, solid earth, and ice.

title: Chemical Oceanography
summary_text: The Chemical Oceanography Program focuses on the chemistry of oceans and their role in global geochemical cycles. Key research topics include the chemical composition and transformation of oceanic substances, chemical exchanges between oceans and the Earth system, internal cycling within marine environments, and the use of chemical distributions to indicate various physical, biological, and geological processes.

title: Computational Mathematics
summary_text: The grant call focuses on mathematical research that emphasizes the role of computation, particularly in the analysis, development, and implementation of efficient algorithms. It encourages proposals that create and analyze new computational mathematics techniques, as well as their application to significant problems, while also promoting the training of junior computational mathematicians through research involvement.

title: Foundations
summary_text: The Foundations program supports research in mathematical logic and the foundations of mathematics, focusing on areas such as proof theory, recursion theory, model theory, set theory, and infinitary combinatorics. It also encourages the organization of conferences, workshops, and educational activities related to these topics.

title: Statistics
summary_text: The Statistics Program focuses on research in statistical theory and methods applicable across various scientific and engineering domains. Key areas include stochastic modeling, data collection, analysis, interpretation, and characterizing uncertainty in data to advance knowledge in these fields. Proposals can range from individual projects to interdisciplinary collaborations.

title: Combinatorics
summary_text: The Combinatorics program focuses on research in discrete structures, encompassing various areas such as algebraic, enumerative, existential, extremal, geometric, and probabilistic combinatorics, with a particular emphasis on graph theory.

title: Ocean Technology and Interdisciplinary Coordination
summary_text: The OTIC Program focuses on research and technology development in ocean science, particularly in instrumentation that enhances observational, experimental, or analytical capabilities. It also invites proposals for improvements in facilities, communications, and equipment at biological field stations and marine laboratories, as well as projects under the National Ocean Partnership Program.

title: Perception, Action & Cognition
summary_text: The PAC program focuses on research related to human perceptual, motor, and cognitive processes, emphasizing their interactions and real-world applications. It encourages diverse methodologies, including computational modeling, and aims to produce knowledge that benefits society. Proposals should explore human behavior in realistic scenarios and involve varied subject populations, while avoiding purely neural or clinical studies without direct relevance to human cognition.

title: Science of Learning and Augmented Intelligence (SL)
