summary_text: The Science of Learning and Augmented Intelligence (SL) program focuses on transformative research into the principles and mechanisms of learning, both in individuals and groups, and how human cognitive functions can be enhanced through technology and social interactions. Key research topics include the mechanisms of learning transfer, the interplay between individual and collaborative learning processes, the impact of artificial intelligence on human task performance, and the integration of insights across various levels of analysis—from molecular mechanisms to cognitive and social processes. The program encourages interdisciplinary approaches and seeks to understand how technological advancements can improve learning and decision-making in diverse contexts.

title: Analysis
summary_text: The Analysis Program focuses on research in various areas of analysis, including complex, harmonic, and real analysis; dynamical systems and ergodic theory; functional analysis; mathematical physics; operator theory and operator algebras; as well as partial differential equations and calculus of variations.

title: Mathematical Sciences Infrastructure Program
summary_text: The Mathematical Sciences Infrastructure Program focuses on enhancing the research infrastructure within the mathematical sciences community, promoting interdisciplinary collaborations, and supporting core research initiatives. Key areas of interest include novel projects that strengthen research infrastructure, training initiatives that prepare individuals for careers in mathematical sciences, and support for conferences and workshops that have a national impact and span multiple sub-disciplines. The program emphasizes broadening participation, professional development, and engagement of students and early career researchers.

title: Algebra and Number Theory
summary_text: The key research topics supported by the Algebra and Number Theory program include algebra, algebraic and arithmetic geometry, number theory, and representation theory. Additionally, the program encourages the organization of conferences, workshops, and educational activities related to these areas.

title: EDU Core Research
summary_text: The EDU Core Research (ECR) program focuses on fundamental research in STEM education across three key areas: STEM Learning and Learning Environments, Broadening Participation in STEM fields, and STEM Workforce Development. The program supports a variety of research activities aimed at enhancing foundational knowledge in STEM education for diverse learners in both formal and informal settings. Proposals should aim to generate insights that may have long-term implications for improving STEM education practices.

title: Geospace Environment Modeling
summary_text: The Geospace Environment Modeling (GEM) program focuses on understanding the physics of the Earth's magnetosphere and its interactions with the atmosphere and solar wind. Key research topics include the large-scale organization and dynamics of the geospace environment, with an emphasis on developing accurate predictive models through observations and theoretical frameworks.

title: Solar, Heliospheric, and INterplanetary Environment
summary_text: The SHINE program focuses on understanding the processes by which the Sun produces and accelerates magnetic fields and particles, as well as the mechanisms of their transport through the inner heliosphere to Earth. Research proposals are sought that address these scientific questions, particularly those discussed in community workshops organized by SHINE.

title: Algorithms for Modern Power Systems
summary_text: The Algorithms for Modern Power Systems (AMPS) program focuses on advancing mathematical and statistical algorithms aimed at enhancing the security, reliability, and efficiency of modern power grids. It encourages research that addresses the challenges faced by power systems in the context of evolving energy demands and technologies.

title: Geometric Analysis
summary_text: The Geometric Analysis program focuses on research in differential geometry, its connections to partial differential equations and variational principles, and global analysis, particularly the geometry of complex manifolds and geometric Lie group theory. It also emphasizes geometric methods in modern mathematical physics and the geometry of convex sets and integral geometry.

title: Topology
summary_text: The Topology program focuses on research in algebraic topology, encompassing areas such as homotopy theory, homology and cohomology theories, cobordism theory, and K-theory. It also includes studies on topological manifolds, cell complexes, fiberings, knots, links, differential topology, group actions, and geometric group theory.

title: Joint DMS/NIGMS Initiative to Support Research at the Interface of the Biological and Mathematical Sciences
summary_text: The grant call focuses on fundamental research in mathematics and statistics that addresses questions in the biological and biomedical sciences. It aims to promote collaborations at the interface of mathematical and life sciences, encouraging both new partnerships and innovative activities among existing research teams.

title: Mathematical Biology
summary_text: The Mathematical Biology Program focuses on research that integrates mathematical sciences with biological sciences, emphasizing mathematical innovation and biological significance. Key areas of interest include the development of mathematical theories, methodologies, and tools that can enhance understanding and applications in biological contexts. Proposals that demonstrate strong collaboration between mathematics and biology are particularly encouraged.

title: Astronomy and Astrophysics Research Grants
summary_text: The Astronomy and Astrophysics Research Grants (AAG) Program focuses on supporting research in the astronomical sciences, including observational, theoretical, laboratory, and archival data studies. It encourages proposals that may involve multiple disciplines and techniques, as well as projects and tools that enhance astronomical research.

title: Advanced Technologies and Instrumentation for the Astronomical Sciences
summary_text: The ATI program focuses on the development of innovative technologies and instrumentation for ground-based astronomy and astrophysics. Key research topics include advanced technology development, concept feasibility studies, and specialized instrumentation aimed at enabling new astronomical observations that are currently challenging or unachievable with existing methods. Proposals may involve hardware, software development, or analytical approaches to facilitate these new observational capabilities.

title: Biological Oceanography
summary_text: The Biological Oceanography Program focuses on fundamental research in biological oceanography and marine ecology across various environments, including estuarine, coastal, open ocean, deep sea, and Great Lakes ecosystems. Key research topics include population, community, and ecosystem ecology, with an emphasis on interdisciplinary approaches that enhance the understanding of marine and Great Lakes ecosystems.

title: A Science of Science Approach to Analyzing and Innovating the Biomedical Research Enterprise
summary_text: The NSF and NIH are seeking proposals that enhance understanding of the biomedical research enterprise through the lens of science policy research. Key focus areas include the dynamics of human behavior and social organizations, the impact of various forces on individuals throughout their lives, and the scientific basis of science and innovation policy. Additionally, the partnership aims to foster a diverse and efficient scientific workforce, contributing to advancements in biomedical research and innovation.

title: Decision, Risk and Management Sciences
summary_text: The Decision, Risk and Management Sciences Program (DRMS) focuses on enhancing the understanding and effectiveness of decision-making processes across various levels, including individuals, groups, organizations, and society. Key research topics include judgment and decision making, decision analysis and aids, risk analysis and communication, societal and public-policy decision making, and management science and organizational design. The program encourages both disciplinary and interdisciplinary research that is theoretically grounded and addresses significant scientific and societal challenges.

title: Human Networks and Data Science
summary_text: The Human Networks and Data Science program (HNDS) focuses on enhancing the understanding of human behavior through data and network science across various topics. It emphasizes the development of data resources and analytic techniques to support Social, Behavioral, and Economic (SBE) research, as well as advancing theoretical frameworks in SBE disciplines using large, diverse data sets and network analysis methods. The program aims to generate insights that can lead to improved health, prosperity, and security by leveraging human networks and data science.

title: Discovery Research PreK-12
summary_text: The Discovery Research PreK-12 program (DRK-12) focuses on enhancing STEM education for preK-12 teachers and students through research and development. Key research topics include improving STEM content knowledge and teaching practices, fostering collaborative partnerships among educators and researchers, and developing effective assessment methods for learning outcomes. Proposals may address either learning or teaching within STEM fields, emphasizing innovative approaches to understanding and improving educational contexts and processes.

title: WINDOWS ON THE UNIVERSE: THE ERA OF MULTI-MESSENGER ASTROPHYSICS
summary_text: The "Windows on the Universe" Multi-Messenger Astrophysics (WoU-MMA) program focuses on the integration of observations and theories related to three categories of messengers: electromagnetic waves, high-energy particles (including neutrinos and cosmic rays), and gravitational waves. Key research topics include coordinating multi-messenger observations, studying astrophysical sources that emit multiple types of messengers, and developing theoretical frameworks and simulations to interpret these observations. The program aims to enhance collaboration across research communities and foster a skilled workforce in multi-messenger astrophysics.

title: Plasma Physics
summary_text: The Plasma Physics program invites research proposals focused on the fundamental principles governing plasma behavior, particularly through collective interactions of charged particles. Key areas of interest include magnetized plasmas, high energy density plasmas, low temperature plasmas, and intense field-matter interactions, with applications spanning space physics, astrophysics, materials science, and engineering. Additionally, the program encourages efforts to enhance diversity in the plasma physics community and the development of educational curricula related to plasma science.

title: Cognitive Neuroscience
summary_text: The Cognitive Neuroscience (CogNeuro) program focuses on advancing the understanding of neural mechanisms related to human cognition and behavior. Key research topics include perception, memory (implicit and explicit), attention, language, decision-making, and social reasoning, utilizing a variety of physiological methods such as neuroimaging, non-invasive stimulation, and computational modeling. Proposals should aim for convergence across multiple techniques and must establish a clear link between behavior and physiology, while also addressing broader impacts through outreach and mentoring initiatives.

title: SPURRING PROJECTS TO ADVANCE ENERGY RESEARCH AND KNOWLEDGE SWIFTLY (SPARKS)
summary_text: The ARPA-E Funding Opportunity Announcement focuses on transformative research and development in energy technologies aimed at enhancing U.S. economic and energy security. Key research topics include reducing energy imports, minimizing energy-related emissions, improving energy efficiency across sectors, and developing innovative solutions for radioactive waste management. The agency seeks projects that can create new learning curves in energy technology, demonstrating potential for disruptive market impact and scalable manufacturing capabilities.

title: ECosystem for Leading Innovation in Plasma Science and Engineering
summary_text: The ECLIPSE program focuses on advancing plasma science through interdisciplinary research that addresses societal and technological challenges. Key research topics include plasma surface interactions, atmospheric pressure and microplasmas, dusty plasmas, novel sensor and computational modeling development, studies of plasmons in nano-photonics, and chemical measurement science related to plasmas. The program aims to foster collaboration across multiple NSF Directorates and enhance workforce development in STEM fields related to plasma science and engineering.

title: NRL Long Range Broad Agency Announcement (BAA) for Basic and Applied Research
summary_text: The Naval Research Laboratory is seeking innovative research proposals in various technical topic areas, emphasizing advancements and improvements in these fields. The focus is on scientific merit and the potential benefits of the proposed research, with an interest in submissions from educational institutions, small businesses, and minority-serving institutions. Proposals will be evaluated based on their technical approach, cost realism, and overall value to the Government.

title: Probability
summary_text: The Probability Program focuses on research in the theory and applications of probability, encompassing areas such as discrete probability, stochastic processes, limit theory, interacting particle systems, and Markov processes. It particularly encourages studies that apply probability concepts to other scientific and engineering fields.

provider: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention - ERA
title: Occupational Safety and Health Education and Research Centers (T42)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on establishing Education and Research Centers (ERCs) dedicated to training in occupational safety and health, emphasizing interdisciplinary graduate and post-graduate education in fields such as industrial hygiene, occupational health nursing, occupational medicine, and occupational safety. Key research topics include addressing issues outlined in the NIOSH National Occupational Research Agenda (NORA) and exploring emerging challenges in occupational safety and health to enhance workforce health and safety. ERCs also aim to promote diversity within the profession and collaborate with various organizations to improve worker well-being.

provider: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention - ERA
title: Occupational Safety and Health Training Project Grants (T03)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on training projects aimed at enhancing occupational safety and health (OSH) education and workforce capacity. It emphasizes the development of high-quality academic training programs in OSH and related fields, as well as specialized training for specific target audiences to support the goals of the Occupational Safety and Health Act.

title: Expanding the National Capacity for Person-Centered, Trauma-Informed (PCTI) Care: Services and Supports for Holocaust Survivors and Other Older Adults with a History of Trauma and Their Family Caregivers
summary_text: The key research topics and scientific focus areas of this grant call include the development and implementation of person-centered, trauma-informed supportive services specifically for Holocaust survivors and other older adults with trauma histories. Additionally, it emphasizes improving service delivery for these populations and establishing a national resource center to share best practices and provide training to aging services network agencies.

title: Clinical Trials Addressing Unmet Needs of Rare Neurodegenerative Diseases (R01) Clinical Trials Required
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on supporting clinical trials that evaluate the efficacy and safety of products aimed at addressing unmet needs in rare neurodegenerative diseases in both children and adults. The goal is to facilitate the development of new treatments and improve labeling for existing products, thereby enhancing the overall landscape of drug development for rare diseases.

title: Elder Justice Innovation Grants FY2025
summary_text: The EJIG program focuses on advancing research and initiatives related to elder justice, specifically in the areas of elder abuse prevention and intervention. Key topics include the development of widely disseminable materials and programs, as well as the establishment of a robust evidence base to support these efforts.

title: Notice of Intent (NOI) related to "HARMONY: Human-Centric Analytics for Resilient & Modernized Power sYstems”
summary_text: The key research topics for the upcoming funding opportunity focus on enhancing grid reliability and resilience through human-centric analytics. The scientific areas of interest include quantifying and communicating risks and uncertainties in power systems, as well as developing methods to predict and mitigate cascading failures in the context of modern digital information systems and networks.

title: U.S.-Danish Floating Offshore Wind Energy Mooring and Anchoring Research and Development
summary_text: The key research topics of this funding opportunity focus on advancing floating offshore wind energy mooring technologies and methods to promote cost-effective commercialization and industry growth. It emphasizes bilateral collaboration between the U.S. and Denmark to enhance research impact, as well as supporting research initiatives at U.S. minority-serving colleges and universities to foster new partnerships among researchers and industry stakeholders.

title: SEEDING CRITICAL ADVANCES FOR LEADING ENERGY TECHNOLOGIES WITH UNTAPPED POTENTIAL (SCALEUP) READY
summary_text: The ARPA-E SCALEUP Ready program focuses on supporting innovative energy research and development (R&D) that aims to scale promising technologies previously funded by ARPA-E. Key research topics include the development of transformative energy technologies that enhance economic and energy security, reduce energy-related emissions, improve energy efficiency, and address the management of radioactive waste. The program emphasizes the importance of pre-commercial scaling projects to validate performance, manufacturability, and reliability, ensuring that these technologies can be deployed at a commercial scale.

title: Energy Improvements in Rural or Remote Areas – Fiscal Year 2025 Release
summary_text: The key research topics focus on enhancing energy systems in rural and remote areas with populations of 10,000 or fewer. Eligible projects may include improving cost-effectiveness of energy systems, upgrading transmission and distribution infrastructure, reducing greenhouse gas emissions, modernizing electric generation facilities, developing microgrids, and increasing energy efficiency. The emphasis is on utilizing commercially available technologies to address these challenges.

title: Carbon Storage Assurance Facility Enterprise (CarbonSAFE): A Mid-Course Evaluation
summary_text: The key research topics focus on the CarbonSAFE initiative and its objectives related to carbon capture, transport, and storage. The initiative aims to support the rapid deployment of carbon storage technologies to facilitate the decarbonization of the U.S. economy, with an emphasis on gathering insights for potential improvements to enhance its effectiveness.

title: 2025 Human Exploration Research Opportunities (HERO) NOFO
summary_text: The NASA Human Exploration Research Opportunities (HERO) NOFO focuses on applied research to support NASA's Human Research Program (HRP) across five key areas: Space Radiation, Human Health Countermeasures, Exploration Medical Capability, Human Factors and Behavioral Performance, and Research Operations and Integration. The aim is to develop knowledge, technologies, and tools that ensure safe and effective human space exploration by addressing human health and performance challenges.

title: NOI to Issue Notice of Funding Opportunity DE-FOA-0003495 titled Accelerating CO2 Conversion Technology Development and Deployment – Biological, Catalytic, and Mineralization Pathways.
summary_text: The key research topics focus on advancing carbon conversion technologies with a high technology readiness level (TRL > 5) aimed at significant carbon mitigation. The scientific focus areas include biological, catalytic, and mineralization pathways for CO2 conversion.

title: National Center for Benefits Outreach & Enrollment
summary_text: The key research topics and scientific focus areas of the NCBOE include the development of web-based decision support and enrollment tools for older individuals, strategies for identifying and enrolling economically disadvantaged seniors in federal and state benefit programs, and the establishment of Aging and Disability Resource Centers as benefit enrollment hubs. Additionally, the NCBOE emphasizes the creation of an information clearinghouse on best practices for outreach and enrollment, as well as providing training on effective strategies for engaging and assisting older adults in accessing benefits.

title: State Health Insurance Assistance Program Technical Assistance Center (SHIP TAC)
summary_text: The key research topics and scientific focus areas for this grant call include the empowerment and education of Medicare-eligible individuals, their families, and caregivers regarding health insurance decisions. The emphasis is on outreach, counseling, and training to enhance access to care and benefits, as well as providing technical assistance and expertise to support SHIP grantee projects.

title: Senior Medicare Patrol (SMP) Resource Center
summary_text: The key research topics and scientific focus areas of the ACL's Senior Medicare Patrol (SMP) program include the prevention, detection, and reporting of health care fraud, errors, and abuse affecting Medicare beneficiaries. The program emphasizes outreach, counseling, and education to enhance beneficiaries' awareness and understanding of health care programs, thereby protecting them from the negative impacts of fraud and abuse. Additionally, the establishment of the Senior Medicare Patrol Resource Center (SMPRC) aims to provide training and technical assistance to support these initiatives across various state-based projects.

title: EERE Wide Joint NOI for Field Validation FOAs
summary_text: The key research topics and scientific focus areas include advancements in solar energy technologies, energy efficiency improvements, and renewable energy integration. The collaboration involves various offices focusing on solar energy, vehicle technologies, building technologies, and electricity systems.

title: The Circular Supply Chains Accelerator
summary_text: The key research topics and scientific focus areas include the transition from a linear to a circular economy, emphasizing the reuse, repair, remanufacture, and recycling of products and materials to enhance supply chain security and reduce environmental impacts. The initiative aims to advance clean energy technologies through circularity, addressing challenges and opportunities in securing supply chains, decarbonization, and community benefits. Additionally, it highlights the need for a holistic approach that integrates technology, policy, and business models to maximize the impact of circular economy innovations.

title: Applied Mathematics
summary_text: The Applied Mathematics program focuses on research that addresses problems in science and engineering through innovative mathematical approaches. It encourages projects that not only advance mathematical knowledge but also have significant practical applications, while promoting the training of junior applied mathematicians through research involvement. Proposals can be submitted by individuals or interdisciplinary teams, with a particular emphasis on the quality and breadth of impact.

title: Fire Science Innovations through Research and Education
summary_text: The FIRE program focuses on advancing research and education in wildland fire through innovative, multidisciplinary approaches. Key research topics include the development of next-generation fire models to improve predictive capabilities, enhancing resilience in the wildland-urban interface through community adaptation and infrastructure strategies, and fostering collaborative networks to synthesize knowledge and address gaps in wildland fire science. Emphasis is placed on integrating diverse perspectives and methodologies, including data collection, modeling, and community engagement, to better understand and manage the complexities of wildland fire dynamics.

title: Staff Sergeant Fox Suicide Prevention Grant Program Funding Opportunity
summary_text: The SSG Fox Suicide Prevention Grant Program focuses on reducing Veteran suicide through community-based, non-clinical suicide prevention services. Key research topics include improving mental health, well-being, financial stability, and social support for Veterans and their families, while enhancing outreach and linkage to both VA and community resources. The program aims to integrate public health approaches with clinical care to effectively address and mitigate suicide risk among Veterans.

title: FY25 Naval Air Warfare Center Aircraft Division Office-Wide Broad Agency Announcement
summary_text: The NAWCAD is seeking white papers for Research and Development projects that focus on advancing and improving operational capabilities within the division. Key research topics may include innovative technologies, operational efficiencies, and enhancements to aircraft systems and support processes.

title: Request for Information: Energy Critical Materials Assessment
summary_text: The U.S. Department of Energy is seeking input on energy technologies and materials relevant to the 2026 Energy Critical Materials Assessment. Key focus areas include supply chain dynamics, market challenges for domestic industries, and methodologies related to critical materials and minerals. Stakeholder feedback will help shape the assessment's direction and priorities.
